text: When I failed my grade 7 exam at the first attempt in 1975.Myfather and the entire family thought that I was finished in life. I really felt like hiding.
At primary school I was accused by some boys of being in lovewith a certain girl in their class so they had to shout and beatthe girl and the matter was reported to the headmaster.
One of my friends kept criticizing me about everything I did. Ithought she was kidding, but later I found out that she wasserious.
I feel this emotion very often when I try to express my feelingsin public, because other people do not understand my reactionsand think that I am silly.
One of my best friends accused me of giving up to early onproblems. It was only a casual remark on her side, but I wasangry and hurt.
It was a complex situation concerning a relationship with aboyfriend, I had broken the relationship for some reasons.Meanwhile, as I felt it, I had most sorrow.
A drunken man forced me to kiss him.
Saw some girls dressed up like Americans
Guilt at having pressed another person to expose/explore hispersonal weaknesses/faults, to the extent that the other personwas made to feel terrible/defensive.
When I drove to Stockholm for the first time and drove off theStora Hissingen road at the wrong exit.
When I was in Form 4, at Secondary School, I was elected as aschool Library Assistant and also the leader of CatholicStudents, so I felt very joyous.
I helped someone to do something and was found out.
I had stolen a bottle of rum from a person who knows me well. Hethreatened to call the police if I did not pay 500 Shillings.

A friend of mine uses butter instead of oil when he is cooking. Iam always angry about that, because it is an unnecessary luxury.Recently we both were cooking and he wanted to use butter again.When I had already put the oil into the pan, he poured it outagain and put the butter into the pan.
The day my teacher of Latin and French died.
After my girl and I talked things over our relationship changedand became positive.A diificult time turned into pleasant one.
Nearly caught masturbating.
I cut a friend's hair in anger, without any consideration.
When I am out in the dark and a suspicious looking charactercomes towards me.

I was coming back home with my mother when the purse I wascarrying got stolen.It was done so swifty that I did notrealize what had happened till much later.A lot of money and thekeys of the house were lost.I was guilt ridden at mycarelessness.I felt terrible as I do not normally loose thingsand this was quite important, especially the keys.
I had asked the teacher to write a recommendation letter for me,but I had not provided enough information and had run short oftime.
I had something wrong, saying wrong things and being impolite tosomeone, and this had embarrassed the this person.And Istill meet the person.
When my neighbour's house was broken into and shots could beheard.
I arrived an hour late for an important meeting ( I hadmisunderstood the time).
When a friend tried to back bite me on false grounds.This mademe wonder if he was a really a good friend.
I bet that I would jump down from a window. I was sure that Iwould jump but before I did it I rather felt fear.
Bad temper of the serving lady in the students' dining hall.
I have done the teachers training course (B.Ed).During ourtraining I was asked to handle the ninth standard class in a boysschool.I was scared to face the class the first day.
A friend breaking up with her boyfriend.

During lunch with some classmates, a priest was also there.Hewas eating desperately as if someone was going to take his plateaway.He did it with gluttony.He wiped his hands on his suitseveral times and it was full of crumbs.
I felt disgusted about a teacher who had rejected all that washuman in her. She refused to accept the flowers we gave her forthe eighth of March and asked for a foreign parfume instead.
Not having good marks like other people for homeworks.
[ When excuses are necessary and I get out of doing it myself.]
My roommate talking and shaking her bed at night.
When I realized that it was impossible for me to be as free as Ihad imagined and that I could not do anythong about it.
I didn't do very well on a midterm and I'm disgusted with myselfbecause I was prepared and thought I did well.
Overhear people talking about me and saying that I am stupid.
Forgetting an important appointment.
I took Pharmacology books from my friend's desk withoutpermission and I was found guilty.
When I learnt that my brother-in-law had been poisoned by hisfriends and that he was dead.
I was on my way home when suddenly Gule Wamkulu came from thebush and blocked the road. I was in fear and didn't know what todo.
A condition in which I was disgusted followed when I lost moneyon my way home from the college.
Brother provoked anger. It was when mother and father were awayand we had to look after ourselves. He accused me of beingselfish and a snob.
I was at home alone and my mother had asked me to heat the house.I put too much fuel into the stove. It began to glow and therewas a noise in the whole house as if it was going to explode.
When I was on holiday someone vomited in front of me.
I had too much homework and examinations and I did not know howto organize my work.
Once while studying for my exam I found so many complicated wordsthat it disgusted me.
A person with whom I had been on bad terms, gave me a present. Webecame reconciled.
Finding out that I was deceived by a friend.
My girlfriend one day went out and promised to be back at 6.00 pmhowever she first arrived at 10.00 pm, without a message (we hadto go out that evening).
[ When my performance (homework or other work) is better than others.]
When I flew out to my mother and made rude remarks because I feltso tense (studied too hard for an examination).
When I heard what mark I had got at the entrance examination andI realized my admittance to the University was almost certain.
When a girl that I liked didn't accept my curting.
When I realized that I was pregnant.I thought about what myrelatives and friends would think about me and I felt a lot ofself pity.
When I made a fool at an examination.
When I have to go in for an exam and the examinor is a personwith a whimsical character and unsteady requirements.
I asked my friend to come with me to a disco because I wanted tobe with a person I know well. But when I amused myself withothers I let my friend sit alone, although I had asked her tocome.
When I was accepted for further education, here at theuniversity.

Last week, my organization summoned an executive meeting and oneof the executive member's pointed out a loop hole in thecommittee's administration.He could not suggest anyimprovements, so I quarrelled with him.
I wanted to go to Bhopal for relief work (gas tragedy).My bosssimply refused to let me go, I was so angry that the only thoughtthat came to my mind was to quit the job.
I had to call someone and make an appointment for a conversation.I was very afraid to fail.
Failing an examn.
Fear came towards the end of May when the P.T.S. results were outafter hearing the failure of my fellow three friends.
The surname of my brother was different from ours.He oftengrinned at home and provoked others for the pleasure of it.Thismade me angry.
My notes were not returned to me, it kept on beingprocrastinated.
Winning the local soccer championships this year was a great joy.
I had gone camping with my old classmates and there was a storm. We were in a flurry but at that time I felt the love and concernof my friends.
I felt joy when I red my name in the list of the approved in theentrance college examination.
When I had my four children.
When I crashed my car.
When quarreling with friends.
When I was ill and had to stay at the hospital for a period oftime.
When I heard a rumour that the 1st year exam results were out. Ihad fear that I might be one of the failures.
When my brother was selected to the University of Malawi (thePolythecnic). I was very excited and I rejoiced due to one of ourfamily members qualifying for University level at long last.
Friends calling me fat - pear shaped in front of a nice girl.
A kitten had wandered into our office, and I was told to take itback across the street. When I crossed back, the kitten followedme and was run over and killed by a car.
When at times unconscienciously I speak to my mother in a hightome but after that I am sorry and I feel guilty.
When I heard that a good friend had committed suicide.
When my basket ball team lost the qualification at a final.
When I went out with a friend of mine to meet her ex-boyfriendwho didn't know that she was engaged to be married.
A close acquaintance of the family died of lung cancer. Although it was expected, I still felt depressed.
I was cold to my sister without meaning it, just because I wasupset and frustated.
When my grandmother died.
At the age of 12 (or so) I stole from a Ranger's fruit tree anapple. (And eventually was compelled to confess - Dostoerskywould like this).
Not handing in homeworks in time.
It was at the time of my M.Sc exam, when I was not in a positionto take the exam after having studied seriously.
[ A chat on the telephone with a friend.]
Cooks refused to give me food.
When I learnt that I had been betrayed by my friend.
I felt joy when I passed the worst phase in my life anddiscovered how many people considered me important to them.
I had high-heeled shoes one time, but a certain girl who saw theshoes told me that they were out of fashion and I looked as anold man when I was in those shoes.
I arrived in Vienna in the middle of the night. I asked for somesilly information - as I realized myself afterwards - and the inquiry clerk reacted in a very arrogant manner.

I'm very disgusted when I see people abusing their body withdrugs and alcohol. They take advantage of these things usuallyfor an excuse for the fantasies which they like and so they dothings stupidly and unjustly.
When I almost drowned myself in the municipal swimming pool thatI use to go almost not excaping.
I saw a neighbour, from the same appartment block as me, lying on the road.He could have been injured or ill.I kept 20metres away and did not go to help him.
I felt joy when I passed my Malawi School Certificate ofEducation.
Article published.
When the result of a project work was treated nonchalantlyintead of being criticized by the teacher.
Social situation - at the pub - a close friend of 2 years toldthe group around us of advances I had made.
I was angry at my brother over an argument we had together.Wedo have a few fights from time to time, and also at times I takeout my anger on him.

One night I could not practise my violin as my family waswatching T.V with the lights off, so I wanted to listen to sometapes.It was dark so I asked my brother to bring me a torch,however he scolded me.I was so angry that I slammed my violinon the floor.
I had an intimate relation with my boyfriend, but unfortunatelywe had sexual problems; therefore I deceived him, but I wasashamed when I told my friend about it.
The breaking up of a relationship.We decided that therelationship could not carry on, so it was no surprise to me.And anyhow, I had known it would happen sooner or later.
When I passed my form three exams.
When my gradmother died.I felt very sad then ... The feelingstarted to be worse after a while.
When I see all the putridness of people. The fact is the catarrhand spits that whash the streets of S.Paulo.
Getting a low grade on my physics midterm.
During my Highschool time I was chairman of the student'scomitee. In this function I once had to make a speech to a largeaudience and I was very nervous. After three sentences I forgotmy text.
I went out with my sister, her boyfriend and his friend. I didnot like this young man. But suddenly he overcame me and kissedme. He was very strong so that I could not defend myself.
Being insulted by my roommate (she is in the English Class).

I had always been first in my class and in the preliminary boardexams I scored the highest marks.Then the exams werepostponed and I neglected my studies as I was confident.Howeverwhen the final results came out I felt ashamed as I had scoredless than 60% marks and my rank in the class was fifth or sixth.
When I passed my driving test, as it was the fifth time that Ihad taken this test.
When the contract about my shop was signed.
I had met someone and we became good friends. Our relationshipgrew closer and now he is my boyfriend. I felt joy when I foundout how he felt about me.
When I was told that a boy did not want to be my friend withoutany apparent reason.
When my wife gave birth to a baby boy - my only son to date.
It was my mother's birthday. My father and I used to buy apresent together. However, now I had bought something togetherwith my girlfriend and I forgot to ask my father.
When my boyfriend came form Rumphi to Lilongwe for a visit I wasvery happy to see him and couldn't believe it was him with me.
When I left my boyfriend. I found another girl at his home but hedid nothing to relieve the situation.
A grenade blew out next to me.

Sitting in a bus, I heard behind, the voice of a girl I wasfriendly with. After her talking for some time with another girlI decided it wasn't her in fact that someone miming her, which itwas when I finally looked. I was talking to a friend at the time.
When I found out that I can travel with my best friend.
During the funeral of my grandmother, when I saw my mother andother family members crying.

I remember my religious experience.Duringa gospel camp, a fewfriends of mine decided to believe in God.The joy that I feltat that time was more than words can express.I blessed them andpraised God in my heart.

While walking in town I noticed how the police harrassed a manwho was under the influence of alcohol.They terrified him withthe thought of arrest by driving close behind him on a pedestrianstreet.My disgust was directed at the gestures and the facialexpressions of the policemen; they seemed to be enjoyingthemselves.

I had the window open and the door was shut so that the kittenwould not go out.My partner came in and started talking aboutsomething and I forgot about the window and suddenly I saw thekitten hanging from the window frame. I was rigid with frighttill I got hold of her.
I went to fetch my girl-friend at the station. When the trainarrived and I saw her descending and running up to me, I feltglad.
When I came to know that a girl I was fond of already had aboyfriend.
When I was about to clean the draining board and saw it lookedunderneath the sink (I live in a students hostel).
When my grandfather died. When I heard about his death, I had abad feeling in my stomach and I felt as if I had lost somethingvery precious.
When I saw a documentary film about World War II (about Hitlerand his adepts).
I got a job right after school was over.

When I come home in the evening, the first thing I do is to sitdown and smoke a cigarette. One day I found the flat in a totallydesolate state. My girl-friend had wanted to tidy up but had notfinished.
When I went to my boyfriend's house for lunch and saw hisparents, I felt that they were watching me all the time.
We were just about to go into the Exam room and I didn't see allmy writing materials plus the identification card from the placewhere I left them.
The time when I cleaned the house and everything was tidy,then my cousin, who is 4 years old, came with a muddy pot and madea mess of the whole thing.
When someone is accused or punished instead of me.
When I got the loan for my studies.
When my friend got very low marks in field work even though hehad worked throughout the year, I had this feeling.
When I received a letter from my girlfriend telling me that shewas engaged to an another man.
Guy I cared for went back to Canada to live.
One night a friend found out that I dumped one girl for anotherand he proceded to lecture me.
While travelling in a bus with an invalid ticket, I got caught.
I was in a sanatorium. In front of me a boy fell down from hisinvalid's chair. I could help him but I didn't. I felt like beingparalysed.
When my little brother passed away mysteriously, at least fromwhat I was told about it.

The curriculum of the year ! The English course was very heavy. I had not prepared and the teacher asked several questionsduring class.The students were not ready to answer thequestions and the teacher was frustated.
This was at secondary school, a prefect framed up some case andtook it to the deputy head-master.I was called by thehead-master and he threatened to suspend me.
I put my head into the pullover of a girl to see her breasts. Thegirl looked at me so that I felt ashamed.
The loss of my mother.

When I told a girl that I could not take her out that night as Iwas entertaining my mother who had come from home.However, Ilater met this girl with another girlfriend at a hostel where Ihad taken out another girlfriend of mine.
Marriage crises.Boredom.
Winning a rowing race at a Karapiro regatta. With 7 otherfriends.
When I first failed my standard 8 exams for the first attempt forForm I selection.
I was rushing home from school because there was a 49er game thatnight. I got into a non-injury accident, which was all my fault,but destroyed the front of my car. The truck I hit was undamaged.
[ I speak harshly to my parents though they only mean my owngood.]

I had taken the responsibility to do something and I hadprepared for it.However I failed because of my timidity.Afterthree attempts I still could not adapt to the atmosphere andfailed as before.I felt imcompetent and felt that the otherswould think that I had not prepared for it.
Saw a very arrogant girl walking like a queen.
I was angry about several drivers who showed an aggressive anddangerous driving habit.
My illness a few years back.I was sevely down with malaria andasthma, I had lost my health, charm and cheerfulness completely.
Somebody wanted to beat my brother at a wedding ceremony and Iwas trying to protect my brother but the other man was callingnames to both of us.
As a child, when I was at home alone, I felt in an indefinatemanner afraid of the death of my father and mother.
Nothing.
A certain colleague of mine sent me to buy a bag of flour for him,he gave me K20. Unfortunately I lost it.

Tutorial again !A fearful feeling came to me when I sat on thechair and looked at my fellow students all around.I was reallyscared that they would ask me some questions or challenge theideas that I had presented.
Before going to the dentist.

I was living at home during the Summer vacations and towards theend decided to take some of my clothes and other belongings tothe appartment in Guttenburg.When I had finished I went to myex-boyfriend's (relationship uncertain) home and stayed theretill 5 A.M.I had to leave then as my parents needed the car forwork in the morning.My parents do not like my boyfriend.
Several years ago I was caught riding the train without a ticket.The station-mistress treated me like a criminal almost.
When my grandfather died.

A few days back a friend of mine had asked me to call on him onSunday.I had accepted it but later did not go for no specificreason.I just slept in my room.The next day this friend called me up and told me that he had been expecting me the day before andhis wife had prepared a very good lunch for me, which had gonewaste.I felt very bad about this incident and it has beengrowing in my heart ever since.
When I had to sleep in a bed at a hostel, which was full of dirt.
I feel disgust at my neighbour, because she comes to our house withher child, who spoils our furniture.
When I whatched a horror film on a Friday 13th.
Heard that my girl-friend was chosen for the English lectures andI was not. I lost my temper and she is very upset now.
When my mother treats me as a 10-year old boy.
While preparing my master's thesis, I was scared that I would notaccomplish anything as the subject was rather difficult.
Someone frightened me in the dark.
I came out of the house at 7:20 am Monday morning getting ready tgo to school and fight for a parking when I saw my car had a flattire.

When I read the newspaper that morning I found my candidaturenumber on the admission list of the Chinese university.I wassatisfied and happy and the cumulative anxiety disappeared.Ionly wanted to cry out that I had succeeded.
I saw a terrible accident happen and I laughed a lot of thefright and because I was nervous.
Felt joy a few years ago when I was away on holiday. And sat veryclose to my best friend looking straight into the eyes.
The day I left my first girlfriend.
When my beloved uncle was shot dead by relatives.
I hadn't been at my parent's place for a long time. When I went tovisit them I had high expectations, but when I was there it wasvery different from what I expected.
I felt guilt towards my mother when I went to live on rooms inNijmegen where I study.

New Year's Eve party in the country, I hardly knew a person; mypartner spent most of the time at the bar. I had littleopportunity to get to know people because our table was separatedand my boyfriend's parents were present.
I made a comment that at the moment didn't fit.
A teacher at my former secondary school forced my darling tomarry him.The girl tried to refuse but her parents would notleave her alone.
I awoke at night and did not remember dreaming about antthing inparticular.I just felt oppressing fear, it was dark and all theothers were sleeping.
When I dived among sharks and the brightly coloured fish on theouter reef of Tvavni, Fidgi.
I heard of the death of a closefriend of mine.I had gone camping with him shortly before his death and the whole thing seemed very sudden to me.
Brother took my money to use for his own purposes.
I was at home alone, and heard noises on the roof, and doorknobs,and drawers.
I was really shameful when my mother beat me in the presence ofmy friends because I didn't cook lunch up until 2 o'clock.
When I was accepted as a student of Psychology here atGutttenburg.
One night I had a very good conversation with two friends. I thenrealized how worthy they were for me and how happy I was tohave them as friends.
When I found out my cousin had been killed. I was angry at theworld, and her murderer who was her ex-boyfriend. It was the worstand most hateful day of my life.
Doctors ignored relative who complained about pain, and is nowdying of cancer.
Fear from the unknown. I felt fear when I sat for the entranceexaminations.
When I am not able to fulfill any request of my son - can't takehim out to ride his byke, because I am tired.
When I achieved my first 6 at University after a long string of3's, 4's and 5's (7 is the highest mark awarded, 3 is a concededpass).
When I stole something.
My mother always evokes feelings of guilt in me. For instancewhen I miss the last bus I know she will be concerned for me andstay awake till I arrive.
A friend of mine remembered me when she needed me and did noteven think about me when she did not need me.
I was of the opinion that 12.00 pm was too early to be back athome after going out, so I stayed away longer, knowing that mymother would be worried.
Once as a child I dreamed of a fire. Since that time I hadn'twanted to sleep in that bed and had feared the night darkness(and so it is now).
Achieving my goal at a swim meet. I worked toward the goal for 9yrs. I was capable of achieving it, but I didn't know when.
Every time I see a spider or a snake.
During 7th grade our class mobbed a famale teacher so badly thatshe had a breackdown and was hospitalized.
A brother from one of the Christian fellowship often phoned meand talked to me for half an hour or more.However there wasnothing important in the conversation and I found the person verydisgusting.
I learned that my girlfriend had been unjustly missed from work.
When I entered the dissecting room for the first time. I think Ifelt disgusted mainly because of the bad smell of formaline.
When I came again in contact with a girl I liked very much. Andmost important she also liked me.
I had failed some subjects in mathematics.
When colliding with my car. I myself was to blame.
In 1972 I failed my Examination because of my own crookybehaviour of dodging from Examinations.
When I beat up my brother in order to control him and make himobey my parents orders.
I felt it when I felt that I was being observed as an object ofpleasure (sexual) when I opened and took off a shirt in aclassroom at P.V.C.
My room-mate was drunk, he vomited on the floor and fell facedown on the vomit nearly choking himself to death.Then hefainted and so I called the first aid.
When my grandfather died.

After a long trip in my dad's van without incident I stopped tofill the tank with gas and dented the side of the van against thepole. Then my cars electrical system would not work when I triedto drive home from his house.
Can't remember any such feelings now.
I slammed my little brother into a wall because he was botheringme.
Given duty by the leaders which I do not like to do.
About not helping my sister when she asked me to help her on herchemistry class. I pretended to be busy.
When I met again a great friend and talked a little while withhim. When I see again another I miss.
A friend of mine goes out with this guy. She sleeps with him butis quite happy for him to play around - as well as herself.
Last year I passed the B.A exams in Psychology in which I stood firstin my class.Thus I got the first prize from the college.I wasmost happy to tell all this to my parents and friends.
I had parked in a corner, and when I was going out I didn't watchif another car was coming and went out. The car that was comingwas obliged to stop suddenly. It didn't crash but for a little.
I was talking badly about a person to some friends, anddiscovered that his daughter was listening.
When my father shouted at me for going to a party with my sister.
I found out that someone that I knew had someone else takingtests for her.
Quarreling with classmates.
Sleeping alone in a tent, while hearing several noises such asrustling etc, I am afraid that there are people who are up to nogood.
Passing an exam I did not expect to pass.
I felt it when I saw our headmaster blushed ingratiating himselfwith high ranking officials.
While in the army, I was treated unfairly by my superiors.I washeld responsible for a deed of which I was innocent.
I took french leave to do my homework.
When the student union leaders were expelled from the universityand we continued to study.
When abroad, while driving a car along a dark, winding road.
A much older man took advantage of me during my childhood (fourto eight years of age).
When I went to see the doctor and had to take my clothes off sothat he could examine me.
[ No response.]
The day my boyfriend saw and touched my breasts when I waswithout my shirt, only with my pants.
After yelling at my girlfriend, I felt bad because she was ?crying and upset.
[ This emotion has never been an intense one, that makes itdifficult to recall it.]
When I got associated with a boy one year ago, I neglected mybest friend. When the relation with this boy finished she behavedvery easy-going towards me. I felt guilty then.
When cleaning up a pile of junk under our house, a huge spider (a\Jungle Spider\") ran out near me. (I do not like even smallspiders)."
I was to meet a girl in a discotheque.She was very pretty and Iwas very happy.But she did not turn up.Thank God, there weresome other friends there and I was able to have a more or lessgood time.

Several years ago I stayed with friends in the mountains for oneweek. We lived in a hut and had to cook for ourselves. One day myfriend did not succeed in preparing spaghetti. That dinner wasterrible - nevertheless we all ate rather much and had animproper and unsavoury conversation.
A sense of guilt before my parents when I had to discountinue mystudies in the first year because of unpassed exams.
When I was walking along a road alone on my way to go shopping.
I was angry when my friends said that I should not receiveNursing Science books because there was a rumour that I wasintending to leave the college.
After being depressed because of a very bad relationship, myfirst love called me and told me that he would always care for meno matter what I did.
When I told a person something that had happened to my friend,and this person went and told my friend.
When my sister took something that belonged to me without mypermission.
I was supposed to do something and didn't. The person was reallydependiong on me.
I said nasty things which I did not mean to a friend.
Not succeeding in a cross-country skiing competition, which Iintended to win.
When I did not concentrate on my studies despite my mother's helpand cooperation.
[ Sometimes I have by accident said to another person somethingin which it is easy to read a negative attitude.]
I was ashamed at myself when I saw that the other boys and girlsof my age earn a lot of money by doing very good and hard work.
When a pet died. The pet was the closest friend I had for 15years.
A person close to me mistook my good intentions for bad, andtherefore associated unpleasant traits to me.

I have a very close friend who lives in another city and we havebeen writing to each other for a long time.The last time I wentto her city, just to see her, I was disappointed to see how greatthe distance between us was.

I separated with the one I liked most.She refused all my datesand told me that she had dated another one.My heart seemed tocease beating.I was silent for some time and then I whisperedgoodbye and left without turning back.
When someone I know was caught in an \adultery\" situation."
I live with my boyfriend, we have a close relationship, I fell inlove with another man.
When I was touring Asia with my present football team, I saw oldEuropeans with young asiatic prostitutes.
Getting to know that my uncle in America had a brain tumor.
When I had to walk over three kms through a field which had wild bulls,because my car had broken down.
[ I would classify subjectively, a certain gesture or the way oftalking of a person as disgusting or inacceptable.]
A teacher wanted to instill a certain opinion and a certainbehaviour into myself, what I refused. I was afraid when I sawhim.
I was seriously injured in a road accident. The very first stepsI took with only one crutch to support me I felt so good. I enjoybeing alive.
I was not prepared for the exam but I wanted to sleep the nightbefore the exam.
When I realized that I loved someone of the opposite sex.
The behaviour of a fellow towards me and some others in the armywas really mean.I detested this.

The day I got to know that I would get a shared dwelling with myboyfriend.My parents place was getting a little crowded withmy growing bother wanting a room to himself.I first felt doubt,then joy, but also sadness.The feeling of joy was thestrongest.
When I was mistakenly accused of being a thief when I accidentlygave a fake coin at a counter.I realized this before I handedover the coin, but the man called me a thief and called awitness.
I had a quarrell with my boyfriend and decided to finish with himand and my Easter holidays.
People not cueing in the college dining room.
I get angry with my brothers and sisters when they do somethingthat I do not like.They know this and still do it so as totease me.
Once I was caught by thugs aged between 20-35, they asked me tosurrender all the property I had and I remember feeling very scared.
A girlfriend ended our relationship in an abrupt and unexpectedmanner.

I experienced joy at a friend's 22nd birthday party. We had goodfood, good liquid, good company, good music, and an overall warmatmosphere. The birthday girl and I communicate incredibly well.I felt very content, warm and inspired just talking with hergiving her a neck massage.

In a school parting we agreed to go to a restaurant.We met at school and we separated us in several cars. My carbroke and we arrived late. All those who already had arrivedstand up and applauded us when we entered two hours late.All the restaurant attention was turned on us.

My parents thought that I didn't do my best to pass the finalexamination (secondary school). When I achieved a good grade theysaid nothing, but if I had had a bad grade they would have becomevery angry.
My father died last year after an 8-week severe illness.
Reading a nice book and talking about it to my friend.
At a certain situation I felt myself neglected and undeservedlyharmed.
I discovered some pornographic literature in a workmates drawers.The literature featured pictures of naked women defecating on oneanother.
When my parents drove me to a nearby place and went homeimmediately instead of waiting a few hours.They could haveeasily waited.
My grandmother has been in a hospital for a week and I stillhaven't had time to see her.
Was nearly knocked down by a car.
I lost my self-control and raised my voice at a child.
When my first child was born.
I felt guilty one day when I was accused of running away fromclasses and I was caught.
My behaviour at a recent party.I passed out early, luckily.
I was complaining about calling people whom I didn't know. Iforgot that the purpose is to invite people for dinner and get toknow them.
I broke up with my boyfriend of seven months, but it was a very\indepth\" relationship and so after feelings of grief and losswere over I felt an immense sadness."
One Saturday morning I had got ready to go out swimming with myfriends.Unfortunately the weather did not permit it, so westayed indoors.
When the Americans set their nucleaar missiles in Europe.
When my sister (really my niece) died of cancer at the age of 2yrs after I took her to the doctor at the age of 1 and hediagnosed it.
At a success of mine, at a real achievement.
My mother was stuck by an apoplectic fit, was hemi-paralyzed andsuffered an aphasia.
I had just seen my pseudo-girlfriend and our conversation angeredme greatly.
Guilt after fighting with my sister (for) telling her how bad shewas.
For the sheer pleasure of it, I quarelled with my boyfriend who was trying to be especially kind to me.
I had a short lasting sexual relationship with someone I didn'tlove.

I am disgusted with the fact that bad singers play at the opera(and not only there) only because they are protegTs or lovers ofan important felow while at the same time some young and ablesingers work in a quite different field of life.
I felt it when I sat for my exam in anatomy.
I was in a train when a woman started talking loudly andattracting everybody's attention.The worst thing was that shewas discussing something, about which she knew nothing, with another person.
When burglars with guns forced themselves into my house andordered me to give them money or face death.
I felt guilty when one of my secondary teacher left me while Iwas in Form three, he was the only one who showed love to me.
When someone accuses me without reason and is not willing tolisten to me.
My girlfriend does practice and therefore leaves me alone atnight and in the weekend. In addition, she is very busy doingseveral things. So we don't see each other often.
A very good friend of mine had been away for three months. Whenwe met again, we ran up to each other and embraced.
When I drove partially across the country with my father. Westopped in a few towns and stayed overnight in motels. The joy Igot was from the feedom I felt and the real beauty of thecountry.
When I saw a lot of rubbish and animal waste on the floor.
When I failed to answer a simple question.
When some seniors tried to scold and insult some juniors onaccount of what the juniors were supposed to have said atsecondary school.
I was driving very fast on a small road and I met an oncoming carin a right handed bend.The other driver was on his own side ofthe road and I had to skid out of it to avoid a collision.Itwas dark.
Swearing in public.
When the robbers broke in, at night.

I remember that when I was in school I saw a case of partiality -one of the teachers gave private coaching classes to some girlsand she would give these girls extra attention in class and wouldignore the others.
Physically fighting with my girlfriend because she just walkedout of a room of my friends and had pushed and cursed at me whenI went to find her.
When I was selected at TISS X.
I felt ashamed of my body in spite of knowing that it is more orless beautiful and also knowing that my boyfriend considers mebeautiful, but this was only in the beginning.
When I noticed that I do many things to the pregiudice of myself.
I saw a septic, smelling wound.
I once drank too much alcohol and became very ill. This was in thepresence of my friends.
My mother treated me unjustly as if I was a little child. I saidmean things. I was unable to defend myself adequately.
When my sister died, she was only sixteen when she was put torest.
When I purposely locked my babysitter out of the house at age 4because I DIDN'T LIKE HER.

When it suddenly appeared that our dog was dangerously ill andprobably would die. We had not expected this because hewas always very healthy. Fortunately he survived because we, in turn,gave him medicines during the night.
We were in the country and I walked away from the others onenight.Suddenly something moved sharply in front of me and I wasnot able to see what it was.

My close friend and I applied to TISS for admission last year,unfortunately he failed to get admission.We had done our graduationtogether and are quite involved with each other, so we had wantedto do our Masters degree together.However, it did not work outas we had expected it to and this saddened me.
When one learns through the mass media all the wars and killinggoing on in the world.

With a group of handicapped people we went to a party. When wewanted to leave we were not able to find one of these people. Ihad told his mother that we would leave at 4.30 p.m., actually itwas planned for 3.30 p.m. Therefore there was a delay.
Passing by a good friend's home without coming in to visit him.
As I was in a ward one man died and I was instructed to watch thelast offices. But this was my first time to see a dead person -fear came.
When I had to prepare and read a paper to my fellow students butI didn't cope with the task.
I had been watching a triller a dark night in the country and Ihad to go the outside toilet on my own.
When I became angry at my boyfriend without any reason. I know hecannot bear me being angry at him and that he can't study anymorethen.
I felt very happy when I won the football pools.
I felt very guilty when a student, sitting in front of me in theexam, asked me a few questions and I did not show him the answers, though I knew them.
When friends try to put me down or hurt me.
I was emotionally happy when I was in love with the girl I hadlonged for.
Cueing for a bus and the drivers having long dinner.
When my application for studying the masters degree was accepted.
When my girlfriend was afraid and anxious the day before takingher exam.
I failed to keep a promise and this had a serious effet on someone'sproblem.
They had returned much less of my taxes than I had expected.
When I missed the tram after having run for it.
When I have been overhastingly offending or hurting.
Every time I do not write something well in English.
I came across a friend with whom I had lost touch for a longtime.
I felt sad when my father was sick.
My mother misunderstood me and prevented me from doing something. In return I did not talk to her for a few days, only later on Irealized that what she had done had been for my good.
Hearing of a filthy situation over the phone.
Once at a camp a classmate criticized me in front of others.NowI find that this classmate is very disgusting.
When climbing up the stairs to the top of a ski-jumping hill.
When I had to give a speech about some historical event, to anaudiece of about 200 people my own age whom I did not know.
I started a new branch of studies after having failed a formerone.When I got back my exam papers I was very happy to knowthat I almost had full marks.
Going to Chico to visit a friend.
I got a letter from my best friend, whom I had not heard from fora long time (a good letter).
My grandmother died.
Not acting on my promise.
My young brother took my wristwatch in my abscence and sold it tohis friend at a cheaper price.
When the university withdrew the accomodation that it had givenme.
The day when my son said for the first time \mummy\"."
One of my friends and I had breakfast in a restaurant. It wasspontaneous and lots of fun.
When I succeed in writing something I felt and doing it I feltwell and very happy for being able to express to myself somethingthat was suffocating me.
My boss on the job failed to keep his promise about something heknew was extremely important to me.
Lately I've felt guilty because I'm folling behind in my classesand not studying much.
My cat died painfully and slowly.
I met my girlfriend on the way and she joyfully welcomed me onthe way home.
When I got a low grade in an administration course.

When I was in lower six class during the Summer I joined aresearch group of the Chinese university student union.I knewa lot of CV students there.A year later one of them wastravelling in mainland China and he got T.B.He died a few weeksafter coming back to H.K.We all got together for the funeraland when I looked at the body for the last time I felt extremelysad.
Going out alone in the dark.
When I talked to another student about the notes she got lastsemester, not knowing that she got a lot of bad grades.
I caught a \peeping tom\" at my window when I was getting undressed."
When I learned I was admitted to study what I wanted most -floriculture (this is a narrow specialization from the generalone).

It was the time when everybody spoke about and discussedHainburg. I was also asked for my opinion. I was ashamed becauseI had no firm view of the whole thing and therefor was not ableto join the conversation.
I preached to a F.3 students in a gospel camp.They thus knewmore about God and made up their minds to believe in Jesus.
I was walking in the countryside alone when I came across twodogs who began barking at me.I did not know whether they weretied up or loose, but I was afraid of them approaching me.
My academic result was poor and I had to repeat the second year. I felt sad about the coming several years.
I arrived late at a seminar concerning my major subject atuniversity, although I had been appointed to formally oppose thepaper which was being presented.

I went to study in a public library but I didn't know it well. Igot a book and wanted to study hearing music. Then I went to aplace were I could do it, but when I passed by a door a bell rangand a man came saying that I couldn't leave with the book.
When I was a child, I fell into a cellar (when playing) and couldbe freed only with big difficulties.
I had made an appointment with a girl to go to the movies, butactually I had no mind when we arrived at the cinema, it was afull house. I then went back and she went to the movie alone.

I am not especially good at English, and after the high schoolgraduation exam in English I tensely waited for the result thewhole day.In the evening, when I heard that I had doneexcellently, I became very happy and the anxiety vanished.Myfamily was at home.
Not doing well in the examn.
When a patient had died soon after I had told the guardian towait outside the ward.

When I encountered not only with my father's lack ofunderstanding but also with his unwillingness to understand me asa parent, as far as things for which I (not he) have proves to beright are concerned.
Being put down by the class leaders.
I was selected to come here (University, College) when I was leastexpecting it.
I received a letter and a Christmas present from a person I hadnot seen for two years.
Always when I get separated from my friends and relatives from myhome town.
When I left all my friends at school (break up) knowing we wouldprobably all go our separate ways, and none see one another for along time.
When a man spoke very sexistly in the company of some friends ofmine.
I made a major mistake while learning how to use a computer programmeand the teacher criticized me.
Not being able to help my friend.
When an alcoholic stood dribbling over a food counter.

During the exam period I studied in the library alone.A closefriend of mine, who is also a classmate, told me that myapplication for a Japanese inter-cultural exchange programme hadbeen accepted.I was not very sure as I did not know that thelist had been declared.I ran to the board and saw that I wasreally included in the list.I was so excited that I smiled allday long.When I met my classmates and friends I told them thegood news.I was so happy that I could not concentrate on mystudies.
This is a kind of confession - my mum found me stealing meat fromthe pot.
Going to a concert.
When my friend promised that she would come to my place, and didnot turn up - I was annoyed at her.

Our tutorial group was soon to be divided, and we got a list ofnames of freshmen, out of which five were to be in my group.Weread the names and then each group went its own way to a seminarroom.I wondered how I would cope with the new situation and ifI would succeed as a group leader.

When I was a child I used to play with my cousin gushing watherto each other in front of the door of my house. One day wedecided to gush with on a passing car. The driver stopped andwent to discuss with my mother and my aunt that were there.
On the TV news I heard that Nicaragua had complained about theincreasing threat of war with the USA.

During the Christmas holidays, I went to see my parents andstayed with them for two weeks. After two or three days, we hadthe same conflicts we had had ten years before when I had livedwith them. They were glad when I left.
[ I have never felt this emotion.]

The day I was happiest was the day when I received a phone callfrom Eve's Weekly to inform me that I had won the first prize ofthe All India Essay competition.I had won this prize when I wasan under-graduate when even post graduates had participated.Ihad been judged by eminent judges and political scientists.
Quarrel in the family.
My inability to assert myself positively in a group.
When my father's car got stolen from me. (A 1966 Ford Mustang -very hard to replace).
Got through first semester University.
A man asked me: \May I sleep in your stairway?\"and I answered\"No\"."
The possibility of having failed the examination.
Last Summer in Italy I was attacked by a dog.It was terrible tofeel that untidy dirty dog against my naked skin.
My brother lost his temper and started smashing things in thehouse.I was quite scared, that something terrible might happen,till the situation was brought under control.

I had made an error in planning a programme and had publiclyaccepted the mistake, despite repeated requests not to bring thematter for discussion a professor kept constantly passing remarks.I reacted angrily.
Held under water by a large wave and thought I was drowning.
When I was an auxiliary nurse at the hospital and I had to changethe nappies, for the first time, of a very old and sick woman.
When they told me that I had got a study grant.
I felt guilty when I was given a prize which belonged to someoneelse.
A friend who was 22 years old died.
A very, very close friend of mine used to come to my room to see me and I naver bothered to pay him a visit.One day he askedme the reason behind this and I gave him a shirt.
At a certain person's lack of cleanliness, at home andpersonally.
When my father died.
Someone I know and respect sexually assulted a girl.

It was a week before the higher level results were announced.Ihad tried and failed many times and this was the last time thatI was taking the exam.I knew that if i failed again I woulldhave to enter the society.I imagined things during this period- I dreamt that I had entered university and it was a niceexperience.When I thought about the future, an unexplainablefear rose in me.I feared being a worker and not having a brightprospect, I also feared the criticism of my relatives as mybrother had gone to university.Whenevr I thought of this issueI could not eat or concentrate, and my heart beat increased.
When we were going to Nkhoma last Saturday the vehicle was movingvery fast, so I feared we might crash since the road was toorough.
Passing my pharmacy exams which meant my tertiary education forpharmacy completed.
When my father managed to begin a \new life\" after the divorcefrom my mother; resulting in a new little sister for me."
On my second plane trip, we ran into unexpected turbulence.
My brother gave me a beating because he could not beat meverbally.
When a thunder belt hit the roof top of the building I was in.
When someone chased me from his house.
When I was in primary 6, my father died.I was very young thenand did not know what had happened.The weeping of my relativesand my tears made me sad.

I couldn't sleep, and began to remind of my childhood. We are manysisters and at that time we were spanked a lot and I don't knowwhy I started to remind of the spanks they and I had had, theirshouts when this happened.
After having told an authority figure a very large lie I was toldshe believed me, because she believed I had never lied to her.
When my friend, after a beer spree vomitted in my sitting room.
I met a certain lady at the bus depot who was using a badlanguage but was a very smart looking lady.
Got ill.
I saw a program on T.V where they had to saw a skull for an operation.
I was travelling in a bus from school going home for holiday. Inthe bus unfortunately I stepped on a bag in which there weredelicate things.

When I was a child I was playing on the upper deck of the bedwith my brother.My parents slept on the lower deck.My fatherfelt disgusted and beat me up.I felt very sad as my father hadnever beaten me or scolded me before.
I was ashamed at myself for having shouted at my daughter becauseof my marital break-up and the unfair way I was treated.

In contact with a poor family of northeast it was offered to me acrab to eat at my request. But the fact that this crab wasprepared antihygienically and his appearence was alsoantihygienically it caused me disgust but I ate it anyway.
It was my birthday and all the members of the group made me asurprise in a public place at 10 p.m. giving me flowers and suvenirs.
When I saw a good male friend unexpectedly after a year, as I'vejust returned from overseas. I was feeling tired, looking a mess,and nervous.
When our school was raided by the pupils of the boys secondaryschool who beat us up.
I saved up money for a good purpose. As I also have to organise aparty I am afraid there will rest only a little money for thegood purpose I feel guilty about this.
My room-mate locked up our room without specifying where I wouldfind the keys.I had to spend several hours in my other friend'sroom.
When I worked at the life-saving service I was disgusted by apatient whose outward appearance was distasteful.
When I unexpectedly received birthday greetings from a person Ilike.
When my grandmother died; I had a stronger relation to her thanto my mother.
When a friend of mine discussed with me, I felt fear of losingher. This occurred because we had a missunderstanding betweenmutual colleagues.

A drunk man attacked his wife and wanted to humiliate her byinsulting her. Then he turned violent and started to beat her infront of her child. She left it happen without saying a word inorder not to make things worse. I watched the scene and tried tocalm the man, but without success. Just because he was strongerwe had to comply. From that day I detested him.
When my little sister was born.

A boyfriend with whom I split up with came over to a friend'shouse where I was visiting with a male friend. In a confrontationin another room he tried to find out if I was aroused by myfriend by feeling my parts.
Recently, I left my bag in the car of someone who picked me upwhile hitch-hiking. I spent some effort to find out where helived (I succeeded).
I was walking home from a place on southside and I live onNorthside and I was followed. I headed my most direct route.
When after an overwhelming anxiety and enquiry, I understoodsomething about why I exist and what my task in life is.
When I passed my Primary school leaving certificate and selectedto go to a Boarding secondary school.
When I received the results from my final examination - HigherSchool Certificate - and received a mark that was beyond mywildest expectations.
When people around me did not understand me the right way.
China winning the Asian Olympic.
When I feel lonely, perhaps because I have to study a lot and Iam shut up in my appartment.Nothing happens in particularbecause there is no time for anything else.
[ No response.]
One of these people who sell meat in town used a knife to stabhis friend and later carried on using the same knife to cut meat.
In broad daylight I saw an untidy old man pissing and playingwith his penis in the middle of the town.
I felt very sad when I left home because I could not stand it anylonger. I do not regret it, but I missed my little sister verymuch (and she missed me). These feelings wear off over time.
When they threw my holder down on the floor, with all my notes foran exam inside it and they got all mixed up.

My examination results were not satisfactory even though I hadtried my best.Then I started wondering about my abilities forthe major subject.However I did not know how to choose my majorsubject if I were to change it.

My younger brother and I had been fighting over the TV/Video. Hekept on turning it on and off every 2 seconds and was notlistening to my authority and was being cheeky. We fought and Iended up in tears - he'd won.
Doing a group assignment and being left to do all the work andtake the blame for any mistakes.
I slipped and fell in to a puddle and people started looking atme.
Defying my parents and staying out all night when I wasn'tsupposed to.
When I was nearly attackad by a man who had been chasing me.
I felt sad and depressed when I heard that our cat had died.
When I stayed on a nudism beach, a man was watching me in adisagreeable way. I had the feeling that he was examining mybody.
A bad smelling cucumber.
When my father had a serious fight with my sister, because of me.
A friend of mine travelled very far. I miss her but feel joy toobecause fer life is taking the right direction as she wants. So Ifeel joy for her mainly.
When my brother was very late in arriving home from work.
I had borrowed some money and I exceeded the time-limit.
My father died after two very painful weeks in bed. I feltrelieved, and was ashamed of that.
When I knew about my first job.
When I heard of the assassination of the Indian prime-minister,Indira Gandhi.

Quite unconsciously I offended a girlfriend of mine. It wasreally worthy to pass this fact over in silence, but I acted so,because I believed I was right. In fact it often happens to me tofeel guilt, after I have already done the deed.
When my sister came home late one day and thus disobeyed myparents.
Mentioning a book to the person who borrowed it.
At one occasion I was ashamed of being refused after a proposalfor a friendship with a certain girl. I was ashamed because sherefused publically in the presence of my fellow friends.
I remember being sad whe my aunt's child died (2 days old).
I beat up a female friend after I heard the defamatory stories thatshe had been telling.I was later called to explain mybehaviour.
When I made the same mistake that I had accused someone else of, andthis was obvious to a third pereson.
On meeting an old friend of mine.
When I saw someone eating live worms.
Bus driver driving roughly - old man fell off seat into aisle -driver wouldn't stop - disgusted with her behaviour.
Friends who torture animals.
I felt very sad when I had to give up something that by right wasmine and although I didn't get it, a kind of suvenir that peopledon't give you the right to have.
[ The previous incident holds good here also.]
Grovelling people.
I felt disgusted when we (family) avoided a problem which couldbe solved readily.
One evening I stayed at home all alone. As we lived on the groundfloor, I was often afraid of burglers.
Realizing that a friend had been talked into signing a certaincontract.
When during a social evening with my father, brother, sister,close friend and my father's 2nd wife - I had an argument with myfather, who abused my friend who was sticking up for me.
When I was fined for speeding.
There was joy in me when I heard that I was to take a course as aMedical Assistant.
I had a dream in which I was an African elephant.
When I caused problems for somebody because he could not keep theappointed time and this led to various consequences.
This happened when one of my uncles died just whan I wasplanning to go and visit him during the next holidays.
One evening a friend of mine was telling a fearful story, nobodytook it seriously but I got frightened.
I had fear of my father (parents) when I first became pregnant. Iwas afraid of delivery itself and whether I would give birth to astiiborn or a baby.
Not being able to do well to be chosen for the English lecture.
I get irritated with my son when he screams or is sick all overhis clean clothes.
Hearing Norman Jones get hysterical in Parliament about lawreform (on the radio - listening with 2 others).
I made friends with a classmate whose behaviour I did not like -he tried to flatter other people and did not respect me.
My friends aren't working for the same common goal we all need toaccomplish.
While trying to board a train I missed the footsteps and felldown on the platform.
When I got the positive result of my examination to achieve theBachelor Degree in Plychology.
When a person whom I had invited did not come on the appointedday and time.
Meeting other friends who got in the good universities.
When my parents did not let me go on a study tour.
Felt ashamed when in a group conversation and could notunderstand words or comprehend the topic of discussion.
I hated you for not letting me go and found out that it was notyour decision.
A close friend first said he accepted an agreement, but laterused that agreement as a reason for attacking me.
When the Real Madrid football team lost against the inter in theU.E.F.A cup.
Once I had some homework to do and I did not do it.

I found a baby opposum on the road and took it home and cared forit for a week. It had to be force-fed and carried in a fur pouchunder my jersey. My father had the vet put it to sleep as he saidthey carried diseases.
Whenever I read or think about the way people treat animals andnature.
Loneliness, being uncertain of myself in the Autumn.
When I study my butt off for a midterm and still get an averagegrade.
I was stood up for a date function by someone who I really caredfor.
When I get something that seemed very hard like getting a job, aboyfriend, etc. A specific sutuations, was when I started to datea boy whom I liked for a long time.
Finding out that I have misunderstood other people.
I am thinking about death, the eternal of it, the unknown, thesense of being here. Often, laying in bed in the dark and quiet,the fear makes me feel dizzy.
I get angry when someone imputes on me things I never can do,naturally negative. Servility, \connections\", impudence, traits that get me mad."
Losing my job that I had for 4 summers. I took it personally andcried for 6 hours off and on. I wanted to hide away and did for afew days.
A female friend was violently ill on the return journey from awedding reception we attended. Getting her out of the car whenhome took quite a while.
I was terrified during an axcursion in Italy. I was lost and leftalone in this unfamiliar country.
Getting my accentance letter from CAL.

My father had a heart attack when I was not at home (I was stillliving with them).He recovered relatively well although he hadto retire (which implied relief from the stress of a small scaleenterprise).
Receiving personal criticisms early in the morning.
One morning after breakfast I was still not satisfied.My nephew(a small boy of 2) had not eaten his breakfast and just when Iwas taking a bit of his share someone walked in.

In a restaurant, I made the acquaintance of a boy who always toldthe same things in a very loud voice. I laughed and said to himthat he always repeated the same things. Some time later I heardthat he had undergone a complicated brain operation.
When I was put into a tennis team below my standard.
When I had not understood anything after a lecture.
I won a car in a prize-competition. The moment I was informedabout it, I felt joy.
China can not even give you good sound systems for an openlecture.
As a young girl in form I, I wet my bed one day at the boardingschool and many girls came to see the person who had done it as Ihad to take my mattress out that day.

I forgot that the course instructor had directed us to go forspecial classes after the usual class hours.I missed this thefirst day and when he asked me about it the next day I said thatI had forgotten.
I was badly beaten up by one of my friends during a weddingparty.
Did well in an examn just before my father's birthday: the bestpresent I can give to my father.
When I passed my B.A exams.
At school, a couple of years ago, a so-called acquaintance told liesabout me to a teacher I was told about it by friends who overheardthe conversation.
When my mother told things to my sister, which I told my motherin confindence.
Being rude to somebody who was impolite to me.
I allowed my then boyfriend to touch me, if only briefly.
When I had to walk home from the bus-stop in a skirt that I hadsoiled.It drew a lot of attention and they all seemed to wantto see the blood stains.
I asked someone to bring some present to my father and found outthat he is not a reliable person. I was afraid if my father wouldnot get the presents he would be angry with me.
On boat trip - saw mother giving young child (aprox 6-7 years)cigarettes.
When I was in form 3, my aunts lied to my daddy telling him thatI had told them that I was pregnant.My daddytold my motherand she asked me if it was true.I was very angry with my aunts.
My grandmother was about to die, and it had the effect that atnight, after having read a book, and once in bed, in perfectdarkness, the fear arose that I too may suddenly die.
My friend promised to take me out for a movie but he didn't turnup.

In a Christian gathering's lucky draw I mistook a girl's name formine (a boy's name).I realized my mistake only when I went upto the stage for the prize.I did not know what to do aseveryone was looking at me.I blushed and went back to my seat.
When I heard about the way a parent of a friend had mistreatedhim, and caused a great instability.
One day my room-mate started imitating me, doing what I had donea few hours back.I got very angry and started beating him up.
On Reberbahn, I was in a \restaurant\" where drinks wereoverpriced.I did not ask for the prices beforehand, and whenthe bill came I could not pay the bill."
Being looked at by someone I do not like.
On the way home one Friday night in the heavy rain the caracquaplanned.I lost contact with the road surface for a fewseconds.
I had worked long and hard on a project when a friendinadvertantly destroyed it. I could not forgive him for a longtime. And at times still get angry at him.
I feel shame when sometimes, (unconsciously) I behave unethicallyand without understanding the problems of the man I love.
A car came very close to hitting me whilst I was crossing thestreet.
My parents inherited an appartment and this made them behave in apeculiar manner.
When I blurted out an answer in class without having been askedto do so.The teacher told me that it was bad manners to do so.
At a cross-country race I wanted to take a short-cut (which isnot allowed). I was caught and disqualified. All my friends hadobserved that.

When a close friend failed to live up to the expectations I hadof him - thereby causing pain to his spouse. I believe that myanger was probably a reaction of fear that I wouldn't be able tolive up to my own expectations.
When my mother and father were on an excursion in Chechoslovakiaand I was at a student camp and I heard over the radio about theevents that were taking place there.
Towards wife's laziness in not performing her usual dutiesbecause of television watching.
I failed a subject despite the fact that I had studied quite alot for it.
When I get a hug from someone I love.
I felt guilty when I had refused to lend money to my friend whoneeded it immediately.
When my grandmother passed away.
When I tried to explain to my child as to why there weremagazines wiith naked girls on them at the kiosk.
A man was unfair to a girlfriend of mine.
At the underground station, a drunkard came to speak to me.Hetried to ask me something but I did not answer so he began tospeak about me with his companion.I detested this dirtygrowling man.
Failing in the English language exam.
A party with no worries (i.e. no tests homework etc.) manyfriends were present and good music.
Talking about snakes.
When I arranged our holiday in Paris, and my girlfriend raisedcriticisms all the time.
Once at midnight, I was working alone at office and the phonesuddenly rang.
After a difficult exam. When I had not hoped to take it and hadgot a high mark. When you present someone with something and hefeels glad.
I am scared when I stroll alone on the Chung Chi college campus.
A professor was going to read aloud in class a composition ofmine in which I had criticized some political attitudes and alsosome class-mates. I was ashamed at having written that.
I had to unscrew something on my car. I didn't succeed after twoafternoons of trying. A feeling of anger built up itself.
During an argument between friends, one of them accused me oftaking advantage of some other friends who usually come to theuniversity in my car, saying that I ask them too much money forthe petrol.
At a discussion a friend took a \faschistic view\", what I had notexpected."
A friend had promised to get me a book which was very importantfor my work, but she forgot it.
I had been watching a TV-program on paranormal phenomena.Atnight I could not fall off to sleep as I feared that humanoidswere on the move.
English papers are due on Friday. They are returned on Tuesday.This Tuesday I was afraid to go to class and get my paper becauseI knew it was bad.
When I dream of anything terrifying I used to have fear for therest of the day that the dream might come true e.g., being beaten(or eaten ?) by a snake.

This happened when it was finally confirmed that I had stoodfirst in the university for the M.A exams.A few days before theofficial results were declared a clerk had brought the resultsunofficially.So I had been expecting the results but theconfirmation allowed me to legitimately feel happy at mysuccess.
When I decided to take a week s holiday without consulting thefamily first.
When I offend somebody unfairly.
During a lecture six students (including me) were asked to leavethe class as we had not prepared for the lesson.I felt ashamedand angry.

When I was an evening school teacher it was my job to make thecoffee but I was not able to get the coffee ready on time and Ithus arrived half an hour late to the class.On top of this thecoffee was undrinkable.
At primary school, when I vomited in front of others in the middle of a lesson.
When I heard the news of the death of my father.It was in theevening and I was alone all night in my room trying to rememberthe face of my father.
When I heard that one of my good friends, when at a party, hadgot herself involved with some very undesirable characters andwas experimenting with drugs.
When I realized that I could not communicate properly with myclosest friend.

When we were at home, my husband and I, he made a remark aboutsomething I had done, in a perfectly friendly manner.My deedhad been unjust and I knew that my husband was right, therefore mysense of shame.
When, after a long time of searching I got my first job.
Several days after my final examination at school, I was sittingin an airplane on my way to Greece. I enjoyed that moment verymuch.
A friend which I hadn't seen for years, sent me a small present.
When I heard of the death of a friend who had just finished hertraining I felt very sad for she was young.
When a girl I wanted very much, said \yes\" and fell in love withme."
When I talked with a teacher yesterday who, to say the least, wasrude and unwise and had irrelevant opinions about a friend.
When I let a person assume a fault that I committed.
A borrowed car broke down while I was using it.It was not myfault, nevertheless I felt guilty.

I was studying in class at night. I was in Form II by then. Therewere rumours about an earthquake. That night dogs were chasingone another and passed through the window outside the classroom.Those who saw the dogs thought it was a lion and were terrified.Trying to run away the desks were dragged and there was a shakingmovement. I thought it was an earthquake and jumped out of thewindow.
When my fiancee travelled 2000 Km to visit me, and I hadn't seenher for 4 months.
[ Cycling in the spring sunshine gives me such delight. Happiness is to be healthy, my wonderful finance.Simply beinghere on earth.]
A friend was going to come stay the weekend with me, butsomething came up and I cancelled out on him.
Some foreign students playing loud music late at night.
Breaking up with a girl.
My parents were having a typical family argument.I came in andsaw the scene and became angry.
When I missed crashing, by a hair's breadth, into a man who cameout 20 metres ahead of me when I was driving at 110km/h.
A fellow student who seemed very nice later on proved to be aslimy fellow towards a professor.
Walking in the dark I saw something strange.
There was a cup final match between Limbe Leaf Wanderers andSilver Strikers and someone promised to give me some money foradmission fee to watch this game. Unfortunately he did not giveme.
When I received the mark well above requirements for the course Iwanted to enter, yet I was not accepted - anger at the injusticeof it, because I didn't receive early release of H.S.C. marks.
Having gone to school without learning anything, as usual.
During a meeting I said something wrong and the others laughed atme.
I was at a friend's place for lunch and she fell ill andvomited.

Someone told me that he would stay at my home for one night.Therefore I made big efforts to make everything ok (food). One daybefore he cancelled the appointment because he had to go tochurch with his parents.
After a terrible quarrel with my family, I withdrew in my room. Ifelt guilty because I had caused this scene by my aggressivebehavior.
When I was at S.Y.Bajaj I wanted to get admission in anothercollege and this was not easy and I felt angry.
I read a story in the newspaper about butchers treating theiranimals very badly. They disgusted me.
When I asked a friend to return the money that I had loaned herand then remembered that she had repayed me in several ways.
After blowing up and saying all the wrong things, I realized whatI had done and hurt that person and myself.
When a friend who comes visiting me unexpectedly asks for coffeeand I refuse to give him this.
Girls dressed like foreigners in the university.
They wanted something to happen but I didn't.
When a lady I was flirting with told all my class-mates that shewas in second year while I was in first year, everyone laughedand started looking at me.
When I received a message that my brother was seriously ill andwas in hospital.
Talking about someone behind their back.
I made an appointment with a friend to drink coffee togehter.However, for the third time in that week she arrived an hour toolate.
My parents did not approve my choice of a boyfriend (now anex-boyfriend).He happened to be 13 years older than me and hewas considered completely unsuitable for me.IDIOT.
[ No response.]
I passed successfully the preliminary exam for a participation inthe children Assembly.
When I went to visit a friend in the hospital. She had to undergoan operation for rupture. I was glad to hear that the operationsucceeded and that she was relieved of her pain.
When a kid dropped my father's radio cassette player, which hehad just repaired.
Being hooted at when I was learning to drive.
On my birthday when several good friends came to visit me.
When I betrayed my former girlfriend.
A letter from my boyfriend began in such a way that I thought hewas going to end our relationship. I was afraid of reading therest.
I was at the cinema with my sister and her boyfriend.A mansitting beside me started to stroke my leg for a while, he left inthe middle of the film.
When my mother threatened me with thrushing me of the stairs, whenI once more should make a comment.
Insulted by classmate in public.
When I was taken to the place where my uncle had defecated in hispants after having drunk beer.
When I found our my mother didn't have cancer.
When I was not in a position to control myself.I had said toomuch and had been cruel with no other than my mother.
When I read a newspaper article on a young girl who had beenraped and assaulted one night by several men when she was unconscious.
I thought of myself as being clumsy when I made love for thefirst time with a girl.
After listening to ghost stories with my classmates I had to backalone to the hostel at night.I had to walk through a long andquiet road and I was scared of meeting a ghost.
I was ashamed when my classmates discovered that I fell in lovewith an uneducated girl.
I watched the news at the TV, it was a commentary about\Hainburg\". I felt disgusted when I heard members of the unionspeak about the situation."
I was in the library of medical psychology and walked into thewrong direction. A man who came out of a room threated me verydenigrating and I became very angry in a resisting manner.
Once I was very frightened at night as I had a very fearful andterrifying dream, I could not go back to sleep for a long time.
I was so angry with a patient who refused to take drugs.
Getting the top price in the football pools.
Promising to do a task for a friend and just forgetting about it.
When I saw that my bed at the hostel was a mess I guessed thatsomeone else had used my daily necessities.I felt that mypersonalsanity had been affected.
One saturday night I did some meaningless work and went to bedvery late.Next morning I had was very sleepy so I continuedsleeping even though I had work to do and I missed the Sundayservice.
Now that the 49ers are winners, the fans are coming out of thewoodwork and jumping on the bandwagon and that disgusts me.
Some foreign students playing loud music before the biologyexamn.
A friend had a quarrel with the mother of her boyfriend becauseshe and her friend decided to go and live together. She neededmoney for removal, then she made a great effort to reconcile.
It was in a tramway-carriage: A stranger insulted a girl justbecause she blew her nose. I detested his behaviour.
Being treated unfairly and being hurt by someone I love.
When I was convinced that someonne had broken into my flat and Iwoke up and heard sounds that frightened me.
When I found out that someone close to me was flirting around.
[ No response.]
My mother and her friends were speaking badly about my fatherwhen they were separated, and my brothers and sisters and myselfwere allowed to listen.
A very close friend of mine was refused entrance to the medicalschool.Her grades were very good and she should not have beenleft out.Biased judgment !
When in my childhood we were forced to take cod-liver oil.
A nightmare.I was dreaming about bloodsuckers, which I tried toshake off from my body, they are everywhere, they get glued, theysuck.And there are a lot of them.I panic.
Not being able to answer question in a seminar.
I planned to travel a distance of 20 kilometres on my bike. Iplanned this when I was working in the hospital. When I went tothe house I found that a friend had taken my bike without myconsent.
Not being able to help my friend to study English.
When I saw my 16 year old sister at home after having waited forher all night, not knowing where she was.
At church camp when I accepted Christ into my life and so did myfriend.

I had a friend who was very kind to me.I tried my best to likehim and understand him but when I was with him I could not helprejecting, criticizing and blaming him.I wanted to get awayfrom him as soon as possible.
Misunderstood by a close friend for the wrong reason.
[ No response.]
A typical family argument.

Being reunited with my family after not having seen them for 5years, at the airport. Sheer elation at getting through the\paper work\" collecting bags and the anticipation of coming through the customs gate."
I felt shame when I discontinued my education for eight months.
I was with a girl one night and then did not call her again,although she had asked me to do so.
Reading a letter from a close friend who said he missed me andcared for me.
I felt joy when my two twin sisters were born.
Someone, who was sitting very close to me, was smoknig in thecompartment of an air conditioned mini-bus.
Observation of people lost in the profit motive - i.e. businessmanagers to their actions esp.
The sense of joy comes to me always after a period of depression,as an organic feeling for an upsurge. I don't exclude thesituative feeling but in this case the reason is not in me, it'sout of me.
I wrote an Exam and happened to have not done as well as Ithought I would. I was angry to myself for not having done sowell.
I felt disgusted when somebody told me that my previous boyfriendwas her boyfriend.
Being refused to attend the neuropsychology lecture in themedical university.
Saw people spitting in public.
My parents put pressure on me to buy clothes, when I would nothave liked to do so.
My girlfriend and I slept in a lonely hut (we had drunk alcool).Suddenly some soil fell on us, then some water. Although we triedhard, we could not find out the cause.

I am always sad when my boyfriend goes away. He lives and studiesin an other city. We have gone steady for 2 and 1/2 years andeverything is going very well, but sometime this situation makesme feel bad and very lonely.
When I see someone vomitting.
When I took drugs.
[ Never experienced.]
When I first sat for an entrance examination.
I got a fairly large amount of my taxes back.
I was going home by car late one night when it was cold, dark andwindy.I became rather panicky on the way to my house.
A tiresome person held me up all day long.I was very busy then(I can not remember what the problem was).He continously triedto make me talk to him and disturbed me.
I was taking a shower in a cubicle in France. Then I discoveredthat a few children were loking at me from the adjacent cubicle.
One day I was walking with my boyfriend. We met my ex-boyfriendand out of jealousy he started calling me names.
I am disgusted with liers, hypocrites, slanderers, flunkeys.
Once I failed seven subjects at school and I was terrified togive my report card to my father.I left it on the table and went tobed very early in order to avoid him seeing me.
When I had sufficient amount of money, I brought more clothes formyself than for the children - Ifelt bad about it.
When I was pressing figures on the curtain cloth. I had boughtthe cloth after months of hindrances.
After much trouble getting together in the first place myboyfriend and I celebrated our first anniversary.
