I was travelling, we were 15 person, one of them I met at thetravel and didn't like her. One night I was asleep while she andher friends were talking too loud in the kitchen. I got up to ask forsilence and since that day I felt constant disgust for her.
The only guilt I considered reasonable was my reproval at the endof the semester at the University.
When we got a young dog.
Leaving University in 1982 following exclusion and lying toparents/friends about reasons for leaving, i.e. lying about thefact of having been excluded.
My best friend had failed Exams. She had to leave and so we gotseparated.
Haven't been frightened for ages.
I was in the living room at home with an ex-boyfriend, it wasnearly a year that we had separated, during the talk he began toremember our courting and gave me a long kiss.
[ Ther are many instances which are all equally irritating.]
In the morning just before going to the dentist.
I was \best man\" at my brother's wedding a year ago."
When I behaved improperly - fought in a public place. Afterwards, I felt guilty about my conduct.
It happened that I was alone - with no contacts with friends.
When I discovered that I and my friend would be licensed at thefirst call. This emotion was accompanied by a great relief. Itwas the coronation of a year of sacrifice and extrene discipline.
Getting a friend an open container ticket because I got caughtspeeding.
I had been guilty of gossiping and blaming others, and one of mysuperiors at the workplace made a formal reprimand.
I was unfaithful to my partner once when he was working abroadfor a long period.
When I passed the TOEFEL with very good marks.

One evening I went fishing with some friends but we could notfish as a fisherman had already put his net there.We pulledout the net to find only crabs in it so we threw the net away. The net was large and may have cost $1000.The fisherman usedthe net to earn a living and we had had thrown it.
When my girlfriend became pregnant.
When, for the first time I realized the meaning of death.

When I was 6 or 7 years old, I pulled down the trousers of afriend because I wanted to know what she looked like. My motherwatched that and (as a punishment) sent me into the house. Wenever spoke about that; I think it was as embarassing for her asit was for me.
In college, I started a discussion with the teacher referring toa question I posed. I felt very unsure and I was afraid to fail.
When some of my close friends and colleagues talk about me andmy work and say that I am the brightest student of the college.
I was walking on the pavement when a white car rolled on it anddirected towards me. I was quite near the house wall when itrolled by and hit me.
When five of my friends at the secondary school found out the badthings that I had been saying about them.
When my parents insisted that I take up a teaching career.

When I was a kid, I always opened the door to greet my fatherwhen he came back from work.One day it so happened that hishair was scattered due to over-crowding in the train, and when Iopened the door as usual I saw something else.I was so scaredthat I could not talk.
When I complained about a colleague to the manager and he toldher that someone had complained; this colleague came to mebelieving that I liked her.
When an uncle of mine, who was close to me, passed away afterhaving had a stroke, before his first daughter could be named.
I saw a friend's husband with another woman.
I met my best friend's husband with a prostitute.

[ When I break someone's things out of carelessness, or do something to make others feel unhappyor hurt the self-esteem / self-confidence of others, especially if they happen to be friends or family members.]
When I failed the M.S.C exam.
When a girlfriend left me.
When the summer holiday job was almost over.
Sometime back I came across a certain man who was badly beaten bysome people because he was found raping the wife of the villageheadman.
A very drunk person.
I spied on my fiancT and was terribly jealous. Later I saw thatthere was no reason for that.
I was very happy when I got the message that I had been acceptedas a student in medicine.
My brother wanted me to buy a flute with him but I didn't acceptafterwards I regretted it because he became sad.
On own reading book. Recall came to mind of slight sexualexploitation of a female (years ago) i.e. had her on even forsexual motives.
Saw some young people fighting for seats on a bus.
I was disgusted at the behavior of these boys I work with in thescouting program. They showed a lack of interest, unrest, and attimes just plain rude behavior.
I destroyed my step-brother's bedsheets by mistake, they were theonly ones he had.
I would have liked to go out to chat with some acquaintances, butI realized that I was not wanted.I felt hurt, disappointed,lonely and deserted.
When I was just to be divorced.

I was sitting in a station-hall and watching a lavatoryattendant. She was very dirty. She started to eat something outof a dirty cup - it must have been something like lard. Then shetook some breadcrumbs out of the pockets of her apron and atethem. I had to leave - I felt like vomitting.
In the recent lightning storm, bolts of lightning were hittingclose by (1/8 mile). I was in bed at the time and was afraid Imight be struck.

I was talking to my mom on the phone and she told me that she hadjust gotten an award that day in front of all these people andshe asked me if I wanted her to send me the article in the templenewsletter to me. I said no very quickly and felt guilty for notbeing more interested and hurting her feelings.
Not handing in homework in time.
Good news about a sick relative.
I got into a tight pair of trousers and examined myself in themirror.My back looked unpresentable and I felt ashamed at mywanting to wear those clothes that day.I quickly changed intoanother dress.
A time when I was very afraid of something was when I broke myfather's antique lamp.
When I was selected to start Form I at Malosa Secondary school.
Each time the professor asks me a question in class.
When I was still a child I was told off in face of other personsfor having touched an object that didn't belong to me.
When I came to know that my grandmother had died.She was veryclose to me.
[ Never felt the emotion.]
[ It irritates me when people talk about me behind my back.I prefer people to tell me what they have to, on my face insteadof talking behind my back.]

I turned the knob of my granny's two band radio and did not hearany broadcast,\ What ! Have I broken the knob ? How much does it cost ? What if the spare part is not available ? \"--I did not know how to tune a radio."
I was in a car accident on the way back from a weekend rowingregatta we'd won. 5 others were in the car. I thought I'd neverbe able to row again.

I was in love with a girl but had to separate from her because ofdifferent commitments concerning life and career.I loved her asa person but could not agree with the life the future woulddemand.Parting from her was very sad.
I felt sad when I heard that my cousin had passed away justsuddenly.
Death of my grnadfather after having been in hospital for so longwith cancer of the Oesophagus.
Ever since I have been a child, the sight of any kind of wound.
When I saw a good friend again after not having seen her for along time.
I lied, to be precise I cancelled a meeting with a good friend.
The trick was really intolerable.They hid it, and I was worriedand restless all day.When I saw them I really wanted to slapeach one of them.
Someone in my family (my brother I suspected) ate a bun which Ihad made for myself. It was during a long telephone call after Ihad just made it and put it in the oven warming drawer.
A friend came to tell me that her father invited me to go onholiday with them in Benidorm otherwise I could not afford to goon holiday.
I was very scared at the time of the Ty.B.Sc examination as I haddecided to get 1st class results.I was afraid thinking of howthe papers would be.
When my elder sister died.
Being disloyal with persons I loved.
I was afraid when I learnt that my father was seriously ill inhospital.
The emotion came when I misbehaved at school and the Principalthreatened me that I was going to be expelled.
When I got to know the details if the famine in East Africa.
I had an argument with my boyfriend.It was my fault but mypride would not let me admit it.
When our dog died.
When I needed another job and tought that a good and known person(my employer) could help me. He simply said that he couldn't helpme.
I had not punched a ticket in the bus because I had a card. Butwhen the ticket-collector came it turned out that I had forgottenit. The shame I felt was great though it was not done on purpose.

Two summers ago my best friend and I drove into unknown mountainsat midnight to pick up my broken car. We told one anotherhorrifically scary ghost/murder stories and succeeded in scaringeachother pretty well - even though somewhere in our heads weknew the fears were unjustified.
In the bus I was sitting next to a colleage who was drunk andbehaved in keeping with his state.
[ No response.]
When I won some coins in a small competion.
Last Summer I was walking along the beach in a bikini and anawful man came cycling after me.He was shouting and I ran asfast as my legs could carry me.
Deliberately provoked by someone close. Angered by thedeliberation not the provocation.
When I saw the movie \Poltergist\"."
When I was jumped by three men in a deserted area.
I was trying to have sex with my best friend's girl but she didnot agree to it.
I feel ashamed when I am praised.
As a little girl, I was sick in the middle of a school day and Ivomitted in the basin of the classroom.
My sister and brother in law returned from Sri Lanka where theyadopted a child. I went to pick them up at the airport.
Recent break-up of seriors long-term relationship, helped alongby would-bein-laws.
I watched a very terrfying film in LT2.This film really pushedmy heart out of my body and I was forced to go out before thesecond reel ended.
I remember about an unpleasant event in relation to my mother. Ifelt guilty before her.
When the person I'm having the affair with won't talk to me inpublic.
After the death of a girl who I disliked.
When I spanked a child in anger and later regretted it terribly.
By fun I had a tussle with my sister. Suddenly I obviously hurther unintentionally - and she ran out of the room, crying.
I feel it when I see that somebody is traying to made a stupid ofme.
When someone I was close to became a paranoid schizophrenic and Iwas unable to see this person because of the situation.
I could have passed the last exam of the public competition, butI failed as I had not studied.
I had to give up my love, because it did not work out well.
When I woke up one morning and went to the kitchen I discoveredthat our dog had diarrhoea.There were small \piles\" all overthe floor and the smell was choking."
The physical appearance of a meal.
Being very close to having an auto accident, almost driving offthe road.
I was alone in my room at the boarding house when at 12 o'clocksomeone knocked violently on the door.
Overeating a traditional type of food - blood pudding.
When I didn't get a certain job at Lillehammer which I wantedvery much.
Saw a dirty street.
When my grandfathers died and I realized how much I would missthem.
When I received the best actor award at the inter-college dramacompetition.It gave me tremendous joy and satisfaction whichlasted for several days.
Getting back with my boyfriend after a year away - apart.
When working in a chemical laundry, I saw rats and maggots in thewashing.

This issue worried me rather than saddening me.In mid SeptemberI went to Guanggho alone.I was looking for an accomodation inthe evening and after having walked 2 or 3 miles I still could notfind anything.What could I do?I was not worried aboutsleeping on the streets but because of some procedural problems. I finally found a place to sleep at 8 o'clock.
When I was with a girl who seemed to love me, while I was withher just to go to bed with her.
When we got lost in Florence and the coach did not turn up untilmidnight.I had no place to go to and there were strange reportsat the police station.
When for the first time I rode on a motorcycle with my brother. He was going so fast that I felt that I would fall off without mybrother realizing it.
Found out my wife (girl-friend?) pregnant.
Walking around the University at night by myself, having beenpreviously warned of rapes, etc.
When my co-resident opened the bathroom door while I was bathinginside.

A girlfriend of mine behaves in a very childish way - she doesnot like my going to see a friend who has been introduced to meby this same friend of mine.I would like to be friends withboth of them, but she does not like this as she is possessive andwould like me to be close only to her.
I lived in a flat with a couple. The woman was so jealous of me,that she sometimes had crying fits. Eventually her husband couldnot stand that any more and wanted to kill me.
When the others did not do their bit of work on a groupassignment task, and I had to do all the work.
[ I can positively say that I have never done anything that mademe feel guilty.]
When I attended school, our class visited an institution formentally and physically handicapped persons. Although I tried tocontrol my feelings, I was disgusted.
Misunderstood deliberately by a close friend.
A friend of mine came to see me when he was quite drunk.
When we could not land our plane and we knew that the fuel wasrunning out.Bad weather had already frightened us.
I felt guilty when I read an advertisement for a job as a chemistin the newspaper and when my friend asked me if I had applied forthat job, I told him that I had not even seen the paper of thatday.
[ For example, unfair pushing in a bus.]
My brother in law was dying of cancer. To see him wasting awaywas very sad.
In a party of friends I got completely drunk.
I unexpectedly met a girl with whom I have always got along well.( I had not seen her for several months.)

I suddenly found that those whom I considerered to be my goodfriends did not care for me.Although I could still be with themI felt unimportant.I deeply thought about the reason behindthis so as to see who was responsible for this.Finally I madeup my mind and decided not to expect too much from them.I wassad when I decided that they were no longer my good friends.
I felt this when I was copying homework for one of my classes.
A holiday at a whitesand deserted beach. A cool evening near theend of summer and we had a fire in the sand - toastedmarshmellows, cuddled and drank champagne.
I have a very big family. At my grandmother's funeral we all metand everybody pretended mourning. In reality it was like afashion-show: everybody wanted to show himself.
Canoeing across harbour in winds - 20 knots and rising seas.
I borrowed a friend's books and forgot I had them, she asked forthem back and I told her I didn't have them. I duly found andreturned them.
My girlfriend who had been very far away from me came to myplace. She saw me and ran after me. I didn't know that she hadcome. I couldn't see her. She held my shoulders standing behindme.
I was very sad when my first boyfriend finished our relationship.
A good friend of mine died. During the funeral I felt an intensefeeling of sadness.

I had planned to study for my mid-term exams on a certain day and my room-mate called me to ask me to go out for a stroll.I triedto make an excuse so as not to go out but she refused to listento me and insisted that I go out with her.I find it unnecessary to talk to her anymore.

My boyfriend and I were getting dressed up and putting make-upon to go to a Halloween Party. We were dressing up to be twomimes. It was very enjoyable and I thought we looked really good,it was an accomplishment. We were alone in his house.
After I had lived with my boyfriend in a foreign country for halfa year, I saw that it was impossible for me to stay with him (foreconomic reasons). We separated although I loved him.
My Uncle was beaten by his troublesome son. He fell unconsciousand gained consciousness after some time. That time I was atschool; this news reached me through someone.
My admittance to the University.
Recently a good friend only called me when he needed something.He never said \please\" or \"thank you\" or any other kind word."
Some people were sitting outside and saying things which were notreally true.
I was going around with a foreigner's wife and my entire familygot to know about it, this was just when I had become aChristian.
When I was getting so fat.
My bicycle was demolished.
I slept with a man purely because I found him physicallyattractive and was under the influence of alcohol.
When I got admission in M.Sc (I) Organic Chemistry, I was veryhappy.
One day I found an incontinent man in the ward. This patient had aguardian who couldn't give him a bath. So I just left him like thatbut felt guilty until I went back to give him a bath.
On my birthday, an old friend of mine sent me a card. I had notmet him for a year and I was very glad that he had thought of me.
I am one of four directors of a company. We inherited land heldby our family - ours is the 5th generation. A \democratic\" decision was made to stap-bank an area of mangroves."
When I won a trip to Greece in a competition.
As a child - stepping on a rusty nail - being told that I mightget tetanus.
I did not do my homework and went to see a film.
I was afraid before I went to the doctor's.

I became disgusted with the man on whom I had counted, who I hadtrusted, the man who should have been my mainstay - my father.I could hardly make myself (and the others) believe in thisemotion. It has cumulated after events and deeds. Everything canhappen in this world.
When I told my sister I had slept with my boyfriend, and she atfirst was mad at me I then felt shame for this act, but notguilt.
Many years ago I saw the film \Psycho\" by Hitchcock for the firsttime. When I saw the film I was alone and afterwards I hardlydared to go to bed and hardly was able to sleep."
Before important sports events.
I lead a rather secure life.The only thing I can remember is asong from the nineteenth century which is against alcohol.Boththe melody and the word (although naive) effected my emotions.
One time I set up my journey at night going to a certain bar. Onthe way I met my friends and they told me that two people haddied because of heavy fighting. I proceeded on but with fear.
Someone talking about me at my back.
When my last year's second semester results came through - I wasecstatic.
A gigantic spider climbed over my face and what is more - in myown flat.
When I got low marks in the final year B.Sc exams, I felt guiltyas I had not worked hard because I had been roaming around with my friends.
I went to a fair where a guy who was drunk kept bothering me andin the end I got really angry.
I met again a very good friend after a year and realized thatthere had grown a certain distance between us.
Next door nieghbour ran over his cat in driveway, he tried tofinish it off with a flat shovel. I would have taken cat toveterinary to either kill humanely or cure.
I insulted two of my friends because I thought that had beengossiping about me right under my nose, however I later found outthat they were not doing so.
Someone messing up the room we share.
When a teacher though pretending to be a highly cultivatedteacher and a man, slapped a classmate of mine in the face quiteundeservedly.
I was sitting for an exam in biochemistry, I was very excitedbecause it was a supplementary examination. I passed the examvery well and was glad because I recovered my selfconfidence.
A relative not acting on her promise.
Boyfriend \chatting up\" another girl."
I was angry when my abilities of a singer were underestimated.
The 2nd time someone I had met cared for came over to my house Iwas absolutely inebriated and was sick into a bucket.
When people are eating unsavoury (smacking, belching, speakingwith food in their mouth, etc.).
Treatment to become pregnant with a negative result.
At the hairdresser's, I got two stains of dyestuff on my newtrousers. These stains are not removable, so I cannot put on thetrousers again.
I was angry about how the government acted concerning Hainburg,especially when I saw a discussion about it on TV.
When I boxed my child's ears.

When I did not defend my close friend when my father degradedhim. I felt guilty for allowing my father to get away with hisactions and for the hurt my friend felt. I cleared the matter upwith my father a few weeks later.
When I was young I got lost on the street and the police found meafter a day.
I experienced it once when we were on a drive. Our car passed bythe one comming from the opposite direction at an incrediblysmall distance.
In a Mathematics class, the professor asked me a question and Igave the wrong answer.
My father told me in the letter that my mother is ill.
With the girl whom I may be loved truly. When she refused to comewith me to an occasion (she was from another town).
It happens sometimes in connection with certain persons with whomI have frequent relationships but nothing special.
I was happy when I understood that the girl I liked was in lovewith me.
When I had to lie to my boyfriend so that he wouldn't suspect I'dbought him a xmas present as expensive as I had.
When I was admitted to the Chinese universiity.
When my partner was attacked and lost three teeth.
A good friend deceived me. Because of that little quarrel ourrelationship finished, mainly because she was not honest. I wasvery angry about that.
When I heard that my friend had started drinking beer.
When my parents got divorced.
One day I did not feel very well and I wanted to talk tosomebody. A friend invited me for dinner and I was very glad.

I was walking on a street alone in the afternoon when there werenot too many people on the street.A couple of guys werefollowing me and I was ignoring them.Suddenly one of them camein front of me and started using dirty language and harrassingme.I got very angry and wanted to strike back at them.
When I was a child I hid under the sheets out of fear ofdarkness.
My father is someone I disgust. So when he comes close to mea feeling of disgust overwhelms me. When I stay a week-end at myparent's place I will remember it for long time.
Passed an exam by 2 points.

I was feeling really low - had been a series of fights with mysiblings, been under pressure at school and wasn't going to theparty I wanted to go - instead I was going out with my family. Aguy called and said, in effect, that I was \nice\" and he liked me. Hence the emotional joy."
I didn't give back in time some money that I had borrowed. Myfriend relied on them.

One night during dinner my nephew was naughty, so I quarrelled with my parents. I regreted this as my nephew was only two years old and I had to tolerate him !The quarrel made my father think that his children may not take care of him in the future (it was a slip of the tongue and this made me realize that my father keeps his thoughts to himself).I was still very angry so I dropped my bowl and chopsticks and went to the kitchen to drink tea and then ran to the other side of the house.
After my final examination at school I was glad that theexamination was over and that I had passed it.
When my best friend got a boyfriend. Because of this arelationship of ten years was finished abruptely.
I had been telling lies and people discovered instantly that Iwas telling lies. I felt very shameful and I felt likedisappearing from people.
[ Not applicable.]
When my friend told me that he would come and meet me in amoment.
My roommate leaving my drawers in a mess after plowing thourghthem looking for something.
Guilt at often being unable to visit a close relative in hospitalafter her death I felt very guilty and wished I had done more.
When I decided to move away from my parent's home, my mother toldme that it was as if a part of her had been torn out of her.

On our way to France, my girlfriend and I went to Verona. Bychance we met an Italian couple - they gave us two tickets forthe dress-rehearsal of \Aida\". It was a different world for usfull of fascination. After the representation we ate a phantasticpizza in a restaurant near the \"Arena\"."
A drunk man bumped into me and wanted to grip me. Fortunately Iwas able to break loose.
Got in touch with earlier friends after a long absence.
Sometime back I used to stay with my mum alone then time camewhen dad joined the family from his working place I found myselfhaving fear for him for no cause at all.
I was very sad when I did not get admission in the Englishcollege, as I had 1% less marks than they wanted.
My first public appearance in front of a rathe big audience.
When I heard about the death of my aunt.
I work at a commercial house from 7 to 10 a.m. On a very cold dayin winter I was late - and let a fellow worker stand in the coldfor half an hour.
After I said something that my boyfriend disagreed with, hewalked away from me without discussing what bothered him. Ibecame very angry with him for treating me this way. Yesterday,November 14.
I reachad home to find that my baby had not been bathed and fed.
A boy who shot dead a squirrel.
I was nailed. I lied in connection with a book which I took fromthe library, because I had to keep it for a longer time.
I felt very sad when I saw the first list from the names of thepeople who entered at the University and my name wasn't there.
At the age of 12 years I always had to take care of my littlebrother and sister I never could sleep then. I always imaginedcreepy men sneaking into our house.
When my cousin passed away.
When my new jeans split while I was with the youth group.
When my tennis match was interrupted because a kid cycled rightinto the court.
I was watching a procession during the Holy week, and a penitentapproached me.
I spent all weekend with a friend instead of studying for myexams.
Before an examn.
[ No response.]

I am disgusted with my sister's husband. On an early Sundaymorning after having knocked at my door, he suddenly rushed inand finching me still in bed he began quarrelling aboutsomething. I could not understand. I heard his last words: \Don't stare at me so because I'll beat you in your bed\" I got up terrified and a thrashing followed."
One night, while I was sleeping, I woke up suddenly with thesensation that there was someone in my room.

A day I was with my boyfriend and a couple of friends in a bar,and he said something that I didn't like (I don't remember what).Without thinking I slept him in his back, getting ashamed andsorry just after.
Bad food in the students' dining hall.
When I was about 17 years old and I stole some pens from astationery store because I didn't have enough money.
When a good friend with whom I had an intimate relationship madeclear that he didn't want to continue in the same way. He choosehis girlfriend (also a friend of mine).
[ In an aeroplane.]
I \picked up\" a girl and I thought that I had misused myposition and authority over her as there did not seem to be anyrealistic possibility of continuing the relationship."
Unfair and unjust attitude toward a person close to me, what Iwas the witness of, caused anger in me.
The loss of a person I loved very much.
When my dog died.
I was very happy when I passed and went to form I.It was agreat relief for me as I had been very worried considering thelarge number of pupils who fail.
I feel guilty when I should have done something at any rate but Ihaven't done it.

I am filled with gloom and sadness at the death of a person. More specifically, I felt sad after hearing the news of adeath of a person who was hale and hearty and full of life, with vigour and plans for the next day but had no next day to cherish it.
I had promised to say goodbye to a person who was going on atrip, and I did not turn up.
In a fit of temper I told things that were unjust and theygreatly hurt my mother though she didn't show it.
One time I felt guilty when I told one of my previous boyfriendswe were through just because I never felt like having one at thatparticular time.

At the tender age of eleven a friend and I left a party andproceeded to walk through dark and secluded streets of a badneighborhood to find a telephone (recent spate of Horror Moviewatching had occurred).
The day I was told that I had been accepted as a student ofeconomics.
When my term paper was evaluated.
I've always defended my sister when needed, at the expense of mybrother. This has led to feelings of guilt towards him.

My life-partner is going through a crisis (way of life, old-fashioned values)and can only get out of it by talking bold decisions.I havenoticed his cowardice and attempts to escape his problems bydrinking.I detest his drinking and his being full of self-pity.
When caught shop-lifting as for shame.
When my boyfriend revealed that he knew that I had discoveredthings of an important nature about him, I felt ashamed as I hadnot mentioned it earlier.
I felt it when I was at home and saw a discussion without sensebetween my parents.
One night I had a sexual intercourse with another man.My sexualdesire and my curiosity had made me jump into bed with him.I amashamed of myself now.
When you are unjustly assessed at something you are sure to havebeen right.

Three weeks ago a friend of mine bid me good-bye before goingabroad.I felt happy for her as she was achieving something bymaking the trip, but I also felt sad as I would not be seeing herfor a long time.

It was on 9th January 1983 when I received a message from hometelling me that my father passed away on the previous day with ahistory of cancer of the oesophagus. This time I was doing mythird year of my Secondary School.
A colleague of mine asked a lecturer to put him a higher mark inorder to keep his good mards and thus to continue getting ascholarship for an excellent grade.
At one point in a relationship, my boyfriend was seeing an oldflame more than me. At our confrontation tears were shed.
At school, when the only thing people my age could think of was gettingrolling drunk. They couldn't have a good time without firstlygetting drunk.
Incomprehension and repression towards a child's behaviour,commonly not accepted, and making the child cry.
When I saw a wino by some cans with Food Stamps and use thechange to buy wine.
When I told my uncle a false story - that people had stolen thebooks from my room and I demanded money from him.When he foundout the truth I was in trouble.
At my Summer job, nobody looked after me in particular and I hadto learn all on my own.
When my cousin passed away unexpectedly and tragically (amurder).
When my room-mate locked up the keys of my room in our room afterI had told her that I wasonly in the bathroom having a shower. She left and I had to do without supper.
I was saying bad things about a man I had never seen.I waswith a friend and did not know that she was related to this man. My friend did not tell me about it and I discovered this myself.
Some boys deliberately played tricks on me in the experiments.
I had this experience of fear when few people were fighting at asocial one night, which one of my relative was involved. My fearwas greatly for him because he was being assaulted badly.
When I forgot the lines of the play during an orientation camp.
It was last September when I felt very sad. It was when I heardthat I was not selected to study in the University of Malawi.
When the time came for me to see dead bodies and to operate onthem.
When I see rotten meat.

Hearing that I had been successful in getting a position wherebymy financial, physical, spiritual and emotional needs will bewell catered for. This position fulfils a lot of my aims for thelast five years of my life.
After hearing the news about the death of my sister, I felt verysad.
A friend of mine who was driving a car ahead of me died in acar accident.
I entered the hostel this year.My mother was ill and could notmove and needed people to look after her.Every week I left hometo go back to school, I felt guilty.

My roommate liked to listen to some meaningless songs which hadmelody but had no content.We lived together so when he playedthe recorder I was forced to listen to them.I could not tellhim that I did not like to listen to the songs, as I had no rightto disturb the freedom of others.So I would find a pretext toleave the room and go somewhere else.
Whenever I see an alcoholic.
When I was young, I stole some money from my mother's purse. Itwasn't very much, but I can remember when she found it gone Ifelt very guilty.
I feared that I would not be able to hand in the book-report ontime as I had started working very late.The book was difficultto read and my teacher did not accept my work as it was handed inlate.
When I was selected to this university despite my havingstudyied in difficulty throughout my secondary school days.
When my first boyfriend left me. I tried not to let himunderstand I felt miserable.
I had cared for a horse for 2 years. One day it was sold and Icried for several days because I was so sad.
Class leader getting me to do things he did not want to do.
I received an assignment back, and got an A+ grading.
When I was involved in a traffic accident.
When I had to walk home in the dark for the first time.
A certain night during initiation.
When my roommate's boyfriend assaulted me. He was threatening me,calling me names and pushing me around.
[ I felt guilt when I was not co-operative with my mother for myexam.]
Was caught stealing apples in a neighbor's garden.
My sister borrowed some LP records for a party. She had left themin the car on curatao. Due to the heat they were crooked, so Icouldn't play them again.
Every time I went home with my school report.
A piece of work was marked as bad by the teachers I and somefellow students didn't agree with their vague criticism. I feltmyself taken in by the teachers and felt disgust.
Some students whose English is worse than mine can go to yourlectures (English lectures).
When I saw a spider.
Having a good trip on a boat with good friends.
When a girl left me.
[ Do not know.]

When my husband talked about the restrictions he will have toaccept in his life to make our marriage work.I felt that it wasdirected at me as it was me who had demanded the changes.Wewere with a marriage counsellor then.
When they told me that my grandfather was rather ill.
Spots on the seat covers of my husband's car.
When I met my new girlfriend with another man in the street.
I was in grade seven and my class was planning a protest againsta rude and immoral teacher.I sneaked out and told theheadmaster about it and so the plan was foiled.
My boat didn't win a race which we were favored to win.
My fear appeared in the form of jealousy. I was afraid that mygirl-friend had fallen in love with another man, I was afraid tolose her.
When I met an elephant in the bush.
When I learned that a friend of mine had not been speaking to herboyfriend for a week after an argument because of unfoundedjealousy.

My current lover and I had been very busy with work and study andhad not had time alone together for almost a month until oneafternoon recently when we made love for hours and then showeredand ate together.
When something unpleasant happens to a friend or relative ofyours and you are at the bottom of it.
I was making very strong statements about infidelity in couples.Then I discovered that one of my best friends, who had just been througha very sad case of mutual infidelity, was listening.
When I began to date a boy with whom I am till now. This was 16months ago.
Confession to my parents about my involvement in a moped theft.
I did not like it when a little girl was crying for her deadmother and was calling her by her name.I was sad.
I tried to pass an examination particularly well, but I did itworse than ever. I felt ashamed.
When, for example, I was not approved to continue my studies atthe Moscow University, no matter that I had the highest marks andin general the best records of all the candidates.
When I met my boyfriend with another girl.
Saw someone acting in a false manner in public.
I was studying in the library and a class-mate told me that shehad obtained a grant to work in the library.
I saw a friend of mine who had suffered a very heavy contusionafter an accident.
The serving lady in the students' dining hall shouting atstudennts.
When a group of friends began to make critics about me.
I had been away from home for a long time and when I came home Iwas delighted.It was wonderful to see familiar, dear people andI was rejoycing in advance.I had been feeling very lonely.
I made an unkind remark about the ethnicity of some friendswithout realizing it.
Finding out from this lecture that China is backward inpsychology.
When I went home alone early in the morning, I had to go througha wood.
When I got to know about the reaction of a friend of mine in acertain situation.I had not expected him to react that way.
When inadvertantly I found myself in the ladies room.
Telling a lie.
Being made to look like a fool by a girl.
When I felt I had let my parents down, especially my mother, byhaving sexual intercourse for the first time, and a few timesafter that. Also, when I went on the Pill.
I felt it on the same occasion when I felt sadness which finallygrew into anger.

On a mountain tour, my girlfriend and I passed by an inn. Nearthe house there was a big dog which began to follow us. As mygirlfriend is afraid of dogs, I had to draw his attention to me.He jumped towards my shoulders and wanted to play with me but Ireally did not like that.
Receiving a postcard form my sweetheart who was abroad onvacation, not being at all sure if he would write me or not.
When my grandmother passed away.
When my friend did not pass the high school graduationexaminations.
I was very fat, and was ashamed of my body.
When my brother died.
After intercourse.

I had a very good friend in secondary school.The year after ourgraduation I prepared to celebrate her birthday and I called offall my appointments.I got together the other friends and wewere ready to give the entire day to her.However this frienddisappeared on her birthday.When I phoned another friend Ididcovered thay she was busy, I did not call her anymore.
Acting in a play at the orientation camp made me feel timid.
Failing university entrance examn.
Each time I am confronted with reports about repression andtorture.
My sister was afraid of her husband.
When my son was born.
When I read about Reagan's tactical decision concerning theSouth African boycott.
I went to a doctor with a complaint. The doctor told me that Iwas completely healthy.
On New Year's Eve, when I went to the house of my girlfriend'sparents to meet them.
[ No response.]
During military service a superior reproached me unjustly. Thisled to friction in a lot of situations.
My schoolmates were teasing a pupil who was not able to defendhimself very well; I should have taken his part.
When I received my promotion letter.
Once, during a performance I did not sing the way I had to.
I had to take care of my little brother. When I met a friend Idid not pay attention to him for a certain time and he was hurtwhile he was playing.
I wanted to finish a relationship after 3 months. Unfortunatelymy friend had a different opinion. I could not answer hisfeelings this made him unhappy, and me feel guilty.
When I lose on my bets on anything - baseball, football,basketball, track, craps, poker, or arcade - whether its 5dollars or 200 I feel that I should never have done it in thefirst place.
When my grandmother died.
After a hard day at the university I also had to make dinner thatevening. It failed because of a frying pan which broke.
When I was young I was told to to the shop to buy a dozen eggs. I went and asked for one egg and the people in the shop laughedat me and so did my family when I told them what had happened.
When my friends and I were caught with our girlfriends outsidethe school grounds when I was at the secondary school.We werecaught by the headmaster.

When my friends and I were camping in a weekend, and with littlefood, we met a middle age couple from a small town that invitedus to eat in their house. Their house was small, badly built withold and dirty forniture and utensils. The problem was with pans,and dishes, and even the food.
I felt very happy when I heard I had passed the examination tomove up to the second year course.
When I met a friend of mine after several months.
Once a person in authority (school teacher) was telling blatantlies about me and the headmistress would not let me defendmyself. She was also telling lies about other members of myfamily.
When my father bought me a suit.
When my room-mates were watching video-tapes and prevented mefrom watching the news.The first feeling I had was that I wasbeing treated unfairly and then came the feeling of anger.
My boy-friend had promised me to come home at about 10 p.m. Hedid not return until midnight and had consumed a lot of alcohol.
Renewed contact with an earlier friend.
A friend came for dinner with me at home. His parents areordinary people. My mother, however, used the very expensiveporcelain dinner-service and the silver cutlery. I felt veryashamed.
[ No response.]

When I heard my name being announced on the radio that I had beensuccessful in an interview for admittance for a medical Assistanttraining course. I was really happy and I enjoyed myself bydancing to music from the Radio cassette.
Unexpected visit by a close friend, whom I hadn't seen for half ayear.
When I cheated my trusting girlfriend by telling her that I was aqualified doctor and later she found out that I was only amedical student at the preclinical level.
Finding out that the person I love understands me.
On the road there was a dead animal with its entrails showing andits skull crushed.

There was a sofa in my flat which belonged to the old tenants whowere acquaintances.It should have been picked up a year ago butthey had postponed it.Eventually they decided on one date and Istayed at home despite the fact that I had other things to do. They did not come, nor did they call and they still have not gotin touch with me.
This also happened when I was very small.I was beaten up by my mother for no fault of mine, I had just beaten up my youngerbrother for what I thought was his fault.I was very angry withmy mother.
My mother wrote me and said that I would not writ enough lettershome.
At my grandmother's detestable and selfish conduct towards myelder sister, although her behavior was due to senility and lack ofunderstanding.
My mom told me not to gamble, but I did anyway. Sometimes I wouldeven take some money from my parents and brother. She found outand yelled at me.
When I was taking my girlfriend out, she seemed to have takenher time.

At noon one Sunday I received a phone call telling me that mymother had been knocked down by a car at the street crossing andthat her husband should go and see her.I could not believe thisas my father and my mother had gone out together to buy lunchboxes.However I immediately ran to the scene of the accident.
Noticing my flat had maggotts !
I unexpectedly got a present from my father.
I had to go to the dentist's. When he touched my tooth with hisdrill, I was terribly aftaid of the pain I would feel any moment.
My father had a complicated operation. A long time before andalso a long time after that, we did not know how he would getover it. During all that time I felt very sad.
A shop-assistant behaved rather roughly with me though she hadn'tthe slightest grounds for it.
Inventing a fictitious series of events, as a result of which Iended up in a conflict with my two closest friends.
I was walking down a road and suddenly a few dogs appeared at a fenceand started barking angrily.They were jumping and it seemedthat they would come for me any time.
When I heard that I was not to be provided with another pair ofmedical uniform.
My mother revealed personal details about me and thenegative aspects of my character to other people when I waspresent but unable to defend myself.
My first real experience with a boy. We were alone. I was quiteyoung and pretty naive and he was pretty crude and real, sort of,macho. It was dark, at night during the summer and we weretalking.
I experienced this feeling when the doctors found a nodule in oneof my mother's breasts. It turned out to be an occlusionresulting from continious sucking but for a few days I was not in myreason.
I wrote a letter to my boyfriend but he couldn't answer it intime so as a defence mechanism I just found that I felt so sadabout it and couldn't talk to anyone.
In a lift a drunken, fat and untidy man tried to make advances atme.
The death of my father.
When I inadvertantly made some close friends and relatives feelbad.
When a friend of me came for an unexpected visit.
When they changed my office to another room without my agreement.
I had obviously done the work badly but my class-mates of thestudent's association did not blame me, they helped me do thework.
My friend still trusts me as a friend.
During a fight with my best friend.
This emotion happened when I passed my primary school examinationand was selected for Secondary School.

One day, when I was sitting on the bus, there was an old womanstanding beside me.I was very tired and sleepy and did notthink of giving her my seat.A 50 year old woman who was sittingbeside me got up and gave her seat to the old woman and said, \ Old woman, please take my seat, the youngstters these days are not used to giving their seats to others.\"When I heard these words I was very ashamed of myself and wanted to get off the bus at once."
I received the message that I'd been accepted at the school where Ireally wanted to go.
Death of grandfather (unexpected).
One evening I went out with some friends of mine, although I wassupposed to stay at home with my little sister who is 11.
Some boys told me your nickname is \Little Girl Doctor\", I did not tell them off and laughed with them."
Before the declaration of the S.S.C results.
I received a letter from a distant friend.
I felt joy when I heard that I was accepted for the FreeUniversity in Driebergen.
In certain occasion I have a fight with my boyfriend. During thefight I closed the door at his face. He went away but came backnext day.
A friend gave me a lift and we met a road-block.He triedtoturn back when an officer shouted at us to stop.My friend took aturn suddenly and the officer raised his gun but by the time wewere gone.
The emotion came to me when a certain girl who was not polite toher mother hit her sister severely.
I found a problem in homework which would not get solved althoughI tried my best.
When I was caught stealing mangoes in a certain compound.
When, after a long time, I saw a girl with whom I was in love.
I received a letter from my college telling me that I would notbe allowed to sit for the exams because of my low attendance inclass and the bad experience in the terminal exams.
I bought something and the shopkeeper gave me more change, Irealized this after I had left the shop and was on the bus-stop -and I then needed the money.
Saw in the TV South Korea cheating in the Asian Olympic games.
I passed my MCE Examination. at first I was worried but when Iheard my name I had joy in my heart and I arranged for a trip toattend a wedding ceremony.
Last Summer I achieved someting that I had been wanting for along time.
When in a difficult moment I couldn't express myself correctlyand my thought came out with distortions bringing about highlynegative and distorted results.
I had an appointment with a colleague of mine to give her mylecture notes. I couldn't go and I didn't send them, and so thegirl missed a day for the preparation of her term exams.
Discovering a good friend had lied to me, resulting in adetrimental relationship with another person.

This occurred when my girlfriend and I have to finish ourrelationship due to some circumstances between her and herfamily. I was really sad, hurt and couldn't really find anyreason why am I still living. Is this life is all about ? Thiswas one of few question which crept up vividly every time Ithought about what had happened.
Once when I said bad things concerning a friend.
When I deny something to my sister and after a while I feel sorryand try to bypass the situation.
Afraid I wouldn't catch the train when I was going to see mysweetheart.
At a gathering I found myself involuntarily sitting next to twopeople who expressed opinions that I considered very low anddiscriminating.
Getting a terrible exam mark, which I couldn't understand thereason for, and trying to see a lecturer or tutor, but beinggiven the runaround.
In the traffic with a car, I nearly got crushed between a bus anda tram.The attention of other drivers saved me at the last moment.
This happened when I went to visit my friend in Chelston andfound him screwing my girlfriend.
When I heard that I had passed my final examination at school(with success).
My mother told me that the enveloppes that I had been tearing (Ihad torn the stamps away) in good faith had been the first-dayenveloppes which my father had collected as a young man.
My boyfriend was playing with my cat. He was playing games with herand telling nice things to her.
Talking to a very good friend who had just had a very badexperience which was changing his whole way of looking at lifeetc.
In 1983, my results at the university entrance exam were verypoor - far from what I had expected. I thought that I would notbe accepted at the university.
Emotional reassurances by spouse.
I was so sick that my relatives thought that I was bewitched.Ifelt like dying.
When a mistake occurred at work which I was not responsible for. This was disclosed later.
I am ashamed when I am not prepared in a subject and I have toanswer in the presence of the patients.
I didn't visit a very close friend at the hospital and some dayslater he died.

Once I bought my sister a pair of sports shoes as she was goingto join an athletic meet.However the shoes were a little bigand had a few flaws.She muttered all the way and blamed me forhaving wasted her money anf I felt guilty.
When someone in my family died.
Somebody went around spreading news that I like people withmoney.
When Kanishka was blown up, I really felt disgusted at peoplekilling each other.
I had a summer job in Sweden, and my boyfriend came to meet me onmy birthday.

I worked with several classmates on a project.I was veryanxious about the project while my partners showed no concern and when we had meetings on the project my classmatesdid notpay any attention.Some of them read books while the othersargued on irrelevant questions.The meeting would go on for twohours without the main theme being discussed.We wasted time andcould not reach a compromise.My classmates avoided doing thework and the responsibilities, they seemed to value otherprojects more than this one.
When my boyfriend and I made up.
It was during the beginning of the term. I had K100 and kept itin my handbag. I left the handbag in the wardrobe but didn'tlock it. Next time I found that K30 were stolen.
The shooting started and we all lay down to protect ourselvesfrom the flying bullets.This incident occured on our way toFeira, during the Zambia army patrols in the Rhodesia war.
After my little sister's Graduation from High School mygrandmother became very sick. She passed away a few months later.
Before going to school I usually take something to eat right atschool and this time I took Father's money without him knowingit. I felt guilty and I returned the money.
When I had promised to do some washing for my mother and I didnot do it.She did it herself despite her being ill.I feltvery guilty.
When I heard that I had got the best result in school and wouldbe definately selected to the university of Zambia.
At Christmas night there was a good movie on television which Iwanted to see for years. I was whining about it till someone toldme it was very childish. Then I felt shame.
Saw something stupid and ignorant happening in the countryside.
Recently in the tram, a man ran his fingers over my girlfriendthen over me.
The government's announcement of the withdrawal of the studentallowances in 1984.
Alone I am coming back home in the night after the serial\explanation\"."
A girl who also hires a room in the house where I live alwaystries to make a quarrel with everyone available she disgusts me.
Since I've been here I haven't written to any of my relatives. I gota letter from my mom telling me how upset my grandparents arefrom not hearing from me.
When I saw a ghost.
On a holiday in France I made a walk in the woods all alone andvery relaxed. Then a motorbike took me over and I saw the manwatching all the time. Suddenly the man stood behing me and I ranaway fast.
I felt ashamed when I was confronted by a teaching assistant thata close friend and I were accused of cheating on a math exam.
When anybody wants to make me feel guilty. For example: I shoulddo something for my mother, but things didn't go as she hoped.Then she threatens: I'll do it myself.
After my father's death.
When my girlfriend left me.
In a cottage in a large forest, I was alone for a while in thedark.
When I was reprimanded by the manager of the hotel where Iworked during Autumn 1984.
Insulted by some stupid people.
I felt very sad when a friend of mine failed the final exam andshe could not be accepted at the institution of learning.
When I was unable to respond to a welcome in my indigenouslanguage of Maori at an important function where I was the onlywoman in the group and it was expected of me.
When one of my relatives went out at night leaving me and myfriend alone, I cheated my parents that she didn't go out, afterthey had heard that she was out, I was afraid that she might havebeaten me.

My younger sister wanted to take classes to learn a musicalinstrument.One Saturday morning my mother asked me to go with her for the registration.I did not want to goso I said thatthere might be many bad people at the club.As a resullt mysister was scolded by my mother.

It was mid May 1985, When we had a Test on Nursing. My classmatehad an answer sheet, so he tried to peep. The Nursing Tutorcaught him. During this time I was turning my question paper andit made noise. This friend blamed me of causing the whole matterfor him to be caught.
Adultery with the girlfriend of a friend of mine, of which helearned.
When I was at school, no one thought I could pass my MCE so atthe end of the year my name was announced on the radio that I hadpassed. I was the happiest person.
When my uncle comes (3 times a year) for the traditionalChristmas dinner with my grandparents and other relatives and isvery drunk.

My nephew is a deaf and also \hyperactive\" boy. I had beenresponsible for looking after him for a full day, and was verytired. Then he suddenly grabbed a knife and stabbed me in theleg. I got so angry that I didn't feel any pain."
[ During a certain period, I felt successful and extremely satisfied.When I found that any tasks or decisions that I had made were better than expected.]
I was for the first time on a brigade this year. At that time mysister was to bear a child. I was mad with joy when I opened thetelegram from my parents and learned I had a nephew.

A friend (female) and I were on holiday on Great Barrier Islandby ourselves. One night we were nearly raped by about 20 locals -they came to our bach and tried to break the doors down. All ofthem were stoned or drunk and we hid under the bunks and weretotally terrified. Eventually these guys gave up and went lookingfor us on the beach. We escaped and slept in the bush for 2nights.

When my roommate and I had dinner together we decided as to whowould clean the bowls.One day when I came back from school Ifound that she had not cleaned up.Since I had to cook dinner Icleaned them myself and felt unhappy and disgusted.
When I did not inform my friends of my forthcoming birthday.
My girlfriend wanted to breakup for an indefinite amt. of time.She said that she couldn't commit herself fully to therelationship without going out with other people. I was her firstboyfriend.

When I was a student at the Institute doing my M.Phil degree, oneof my professors called me before the convocation and told me\You have got the gold-medal (first rank) in the university and tomorrow you will be on T.V\"."
I was ashamed when my boyfriend went to sit with another girlwhen he invited me to come to watch Drama festival.
I was in a dark cellar and saw a glowing red point. I thoughtthat it was a person with a cigarette - but it was only the redswitch.
I felt very angry after one driver had run over my beloved niece.

I was worried by a task related to my studies which had to bedone in groups of two.I was talking about it to my friends whenI said something negative, in too abrupt a manner, concerning mywork partner.I did not quite mean what I said and I feltashamed at having been mean enough to criticize him as he is alsoa friend of mine.
I was filled with joy when I heard that I had passed my Secondaryschool leaving certificate exam.
I feel joy usually after each taken exam, the last one was inFebruary.
When my son was born.

Dad had just married his second wife (my step-mother) and I didnot like her so I went to the wardrobe and set fire to herdresses.Eveyone suspected my brother and he had to bear theconsequences.Nobody ever got to know that it was me who haddone it.
I do not recall being scared in the near past.
When I went in a clinical hospital and saw in what conditionspeople are attended there.

I had a dream : I had a very close friend who had several stonehouses in the New Territories (villages) but they did not havemuch furniture.He took me to see his fields (I had never seenthem before) and there were several inches of clear water onwhich the sunshine was reflected.I wanted to sit among theshort green plants in the fields but was afraid of treading theplants to death.My friend said \They will not die\" and I sat down happily and my trousers did not get wet."
When I didn't bring my girlfriend home one night. Later she toldme that a cardriver solicited her.
[ No response.]
Riding through a bush fire on an island of Australia - on apushbike as a little boy - all alone, lost and surrounded bysmouldering wood and flame.
Waiting for my marks in a difficult subject.
I got separated from the man I loved.
When I read a lot and did not remember anything.
At one time while at primary school I lost a pencil case of afriend and I didn't mention it to her until after a fortnight.
When it appeared that I was not pregnant when I was several weeksovertime.

I was in love with a very beautiful girl and when I went back formy holidays I found her wth another guy who she said was just afriend.Later I found them together and was convinced that therewas something fishy.
When my father phoned me to come home from my vacation, since heno longer had the time to look after my garden and animals.
Love problems.
I felt disgusted when I was not given money for lunch at schoolby my father as a punishment for beating my little brother.
I was double crossing Mercy and Maria. They one day came to knoweach other. I was found by Mercy red-haded when I was with Maria.
After my boyfriend and I had separated.
We were driving a car of a friend of mine when we turned in thewrong direction towards an unknown district, and nearly drovedown a precipice.
One night a very dear person said: \I hate you\". Of course it was an impulse and this person didn't feel that about me. The person expressed regret, and everything was settled, but I can't forget."
I felt guilty at not having practised the piano.I waste myteacher's time and guidance.
It happens to me quite often. I can't describe a particular case.
When I learnt that I had been admitted to the university.
When I just took a shower with a girl down the hall. I felt thatI had let my devotion to God go out the window. Although nothighappened I felt ashamed.
When I fell head on in a fountain.
When someone I love told me that she did not love me anymore andthat she wanted all the snaps that she had given me in exchangefor the ones I had given her.
I encouraged my brother to play football and he was hurt whileplaying the game.
One day I took a packet of sweets from a certain Grocery atNathenje. Then later on I started to feel guilty and realisedthat I had done a wrong thing to him.
[ I feel shame when I do not arrive on time and others have towait for me for a long time.]

In September 1984, I was forced to live with someone I did not like.The first week we were at loggerheads and our conversationwas like a debate.The atmosphere was very bad.When he learnt that I had got 95 marks in a test he told me \ A failure, You lost 5 marks.\" I was very angry, not because my marks were lower than his, but because I could not tolerate his pride.I did not show my discontentment and carried on doing my work."
A few weeks back I received a Christmas card from a friend inEngland.She had not written to me in a very long time but itshowed that she still remembered me.
I was forced to stay in the canteen and eat the food that I hadnot asked for but got it anyway.

During a holiday in East-Germany I got aquainted with a boy wholived there. We started writing, but I only wrote once. I feltashamed because I probably was one of his sparse contacts withwestern Europe.

This is an incident that many of us witness in our everyday lifein a city like Bombay.One day I was travelling by bus, threemen dragged two fellows out of the bus.Once outside they werebeaten into pulp.These two fellows, who got beaten, were pick-pocketsand they were being beaten by all and sundry.I thought tomyself -\what is life?\".It is one hell of a place where everyone is after someone else.One waits to cut the throat of the other one just for a living, (money).When I think about such things - the purpose of life, etc, I feel very disgusted and dejected."
When my girlfriend told me that she was no longer interested inme.
I was to take a test and I had not made the necessary preparationsuntil it was too late.There were two days to go and I still hadnot done much.
I'd just got the top mark in an exam.

Once when I was babysitting for some neighbors children I foundroaches in ther bathroom. I had never seen a roach before but Icalled my mother to make sure that's what they were. And she cameover and checked.
Telling my parents that I did not well in an examn.
Close friend leave to go overseas for an indefinite period.Farewell scene at airport.
I watched a football match with my old friend.The performanceof the team was very good and the team members were full ofspirit.The match was excellent and every time a goal was scoredI felt excited.
The first time I slept at my boyfriends house and had to walkdown the hall to the shower in front of his housemates. I feltthey were judging me.
My elder sister whom I love very much was leaving for the West Indies for two years and I was staying behind.
For example, when I have promised something but I haven'tfulfilled it.
The death of a relative, friend, or someone I esteem.

Death of a pet rabbit. We had to give it away because my brotherbecame allergic to it. We gave it to a man who kept animals andlots of other animals for children to watch. We went to visit ourrabbit. It was badly beaten by the other rabbits and eventuallydied.
I had a small argument with a relative and some other people gotimplicated.It resulted in a proper row.
When I got through the examination for my driver licence, andwhen I finished I knew I had passed it.
When I copy someone else's problem set.

My mother kicked my surrogate father out and he in turn did notcare for the dog, Afthur, he bought for the family. His lack ofconcern lead tho Arthur's death on the freeway. I loved Arthurlike a brother. He was easy to talk to.
I was very ashamed when I was neglected by a certain friend whomI was thinking loved me very much.
My car skidded on the wet street.
An unjust calumny concerning me.
Every time I was around this one person I would stick my foot inmy mouth by being nasty. One time I accidently said somethingfairly cruel that was totally inappropriate.
Participating in a theft several years ago.
[ Same as above - friends who torture animals.]
Comments from other children on my alcoholic father
I was with a friend in a stationed car when, suddenly a manappeared on my side and an other with a gun on his side thehold-up lasted a few minutes but it was terrible. I had neverseen a gun so close.
When a close classmate failed a year.
It was when I was allowed to take my wife away from her parentsafter being refused for three times on grounds that she shouldfirst write her examination.
In an exam I answered the questions rather carelessly andafterwards I thought that the exam would have been better had Ianswered more carefully.
Not helping parents enough at home and at the farm - this hashappened many times.
When a cousin of mine was discharged from the hospital aftera long illness.I had thought that this illness would never end.

Our teacher had invited us to lunch and once at the canteen westarted introducing ourselves.Two of the boys showed a lot ofinterest in knowing personal details and then they startedtalking about some activities held in the college.I had littleinterest in those activities so I talked to another studentsitting next to me as I was afraid that they would ask mequestions on those activities.
When we had swimming instruction, we had to take a header fromthe springboard. I usually refused to do that, but at least I wasforced to.

One day in the TYBA class the teacher asked me a very simplequestion which I could not answer.Finally the teacher himselfgave us the answer and my friends started laughing at me as I hadnot been able to answer a simple question.I knew the answer butfeared that my response may be wrong.All this made me feelashamed of myself.

A ex-boyfriend tried to prejudice me before my fiancT and hisfamily saying things about me that let his family worried. We hadto postpone our wedding and we were already using our weddingrings. To be honest I didn't feel just anger, I felt hate.
At the begining of a new course one is afraid of encounteringproblems one can not manage.Thoughts revolve around failingthe subject and the consequences it would have for the future.
When I was acceptted as a student of psychology.
At my temporary job, I have to restrictothers' actions and makethem obey me, and this very often gives mea feeling of guilt.Iwish there could be some other way of acting.
At a meeting with over one hundred people, they decided who had to speakfrom the stand by drawing lots.
On seeing a scene of an accident in a magazine.
When I learned that my dad had cancer. I knew he was going to thehospital for some tests. My mom told me when she picked me up oneweekend from CAL to take me home.
When I failed the grade seven exams.
[ No response.]
I felt sad when a thief stole all the clothes from my friend'scupboard at school (boarding).
A too eager approach by a dirty drunken person in a bus.
When I passed the B.A exams with 1st class.I was the first inthe family to have got a 1st class, so all the family memberswere very happy and they gave me the opportunity to studyfurther.
It was when my father caught me with a girl in dark corners andasked me what I was doing there.
When I am dirty because I have not had a shower for a few days.

My guinea-pig had been ill for a couple of days.One evening,when I came home I enquired as to how it was doing.My mother'sexpression told me that it had died.My knees refused to supportme and I began to weep convulsively.
I felt guilt because on account of my ambitions I nearly turnedmy sister out of my parents home.
When I see that some people remain cold and egoistic with regardto close friends, even in situations that those friends needthem.
On holidays - just driving along a road beautiful scenery. Justwith my boyfriend - not really talking but just feelingoverwhelmed.
Receiving a nice present from my parents.
When I impregnated a certain girl, I thought that I would beforced to marry her or go to court.
While I was waiting for them to give me the marks of the mostdifficult subject this year.
Some men were talking about me and my sister.
My son was born.

I told my pesent boyfriend that I was an Australian as are myparents. As the relationship developed I found it harder andharder to confess and became sure it would end our relationship.He eventually found out when told in front of me by my mother.
When I was punished in school for no serious mistake of mine.

One night we, all the family members, were sitting in the frontcorridor of the house when a gentleman looking person came in. He was my father's client and he had come to bribe my father inconnection with the proceeding case.At my father's refusal heabused my father, my brother and I could not control our temperand we rushed at him.
I was angry when my boyfriend did not turn up as promised.
When I saw a film in which the man suffered from an illness and his skin came peeling off.
Once I was alone at home. I suddenly felt unwell and there was noone to help me and call First Aid.
Power cut made me unable to listen to the songs sung by myfavourite pop star.
The day before the university results came out I was both excitedand scared.If I failed I did not know what I would do as I didnot want to work, my family was ambivalent.
When my husband stays late at a meeting and I have to be alone.
I was at home and I heard a loud sound of spitting outside thedoor.I thought that one of my family members would step on the spitand bring the germs in the house.
I was terribly upset when my kitten got hit by a car. He didn'tdie, but for several weeks we thought he might have to be putdown.
I feel anger when things don't come out as I wish.
One day I felt dizzy during a lecture.When the lecturer askedus as to who had heard the fairy tale - I was the only one whoput up his hand and this surprised the whole class.
When someone pointed out that I was proud, yet I didn't dress upproperly. This was when I and my friend went for a dnce oneSaturday.

One day I lent my tennis I just had washed to my sister becauseshe asked it. I asked her not to soil it as I had just washed it.Next day I looked at the tennis, and it was dirty with wax. Shecould not have soiled it. It was lack of consideration. I feltvery angry.
Once when I was in the cell group (religious activity) I foundthat almost everyone in the group read the bible daily and I feltguilty in my heart.
I bumped my dad's car in a lamp post.He was not at home then,neither was he home when I left for the campus.I did not tellhim about the accident and I will never tell him.
The day some friends of mine and I decided to go to Galicia onholiday.
When my father addressed me directly and maliciously, thusincluding me in the \family war\"."
When my grandmother died - at her funeral.
When having a relationship, I made love with another girl.
I felt anger when at the end of a telephone call, a good friendtold me that she would go to travel next year with another goodfriend. We couldn't talk this out.
Having agreed to share the taxi expenses, three people in theback of the car just ran off, leaving the person up front withthe entire bill.
I couldn't fulfill a promise.
When I was very young, one day, I kicked my grandmother andcaused her an injury which took a long time to heal.
When I realized that I had been wrong about a person close to me,because of pre-set ideas and prejudices.
This happens to me when I am not prepared in a given subject.

When I was 9 years old, I got a cat, but after 3 days he died. Iwas very sad, because I had nursed him and taken him to theveterinary's - but in vain. Although I had had him only for ashort time I had liked him very much.
A young man was insulting and humiliating a drunken man.
Came back from surfing to find car broken into and gear and moneystolen.
When we were able to afford a new sofa - a leather one which costSEK 20000.I had waited for it for 2-3 years.
[ I feel a sense of joy whenever I complete a piece of writingwhich is part of my work.Intense reading also brings me joy.Ialso feel happy when I reminiscent about them.]
Caught lying to my father about a speeding ticket I had received.
When I tried to hide a fact from a person for irrelevant reasonsand considered such an attitude childish.
I was 4-5 years old when I hid the bicycle keys of a not verygood friend.After a few hours I pretended that I had foundit.
A teacher giving a test was called by a student by his firstname. He (the teacher) said that he didn't give him this liberty.
A colleague asked me to study with her. I could not explainthings as perfectly as she had expected. So she reacted in anaggressive manner.
I had promised to do a task for someone that was close to me, andfrom the outset I knew it was important that I do it, but when itcame to it, I let them down.
As a child I suffered of nightmares. Even since than, I havenever been so anxious and fearful.
When I entered a brothel and saw two sailors with a youngprostitute who was not older than 18.
An ex-colleague asked me if I was interested in working in theiraccounts bureau.They needed \clever people\" and he had\"immediately thought of me.\""
[ A successful lesson.]
When given responsibility to grade papers in elementary school, Icheated a little and graded my own higher.
A day when I was getting out of the shower I covered only thefront part of my body with a towel (I was 7 years old), and Ididn't see that my cousin was in the room.
In a dam lake, when the water was let flow to water the plantsand I and two other boys were near the water pit. We rescuedourselves only thanks to the flippers and the tyre that was withus.

I went to the prayer meeting at night and unfortunately the carbroke down, so my other sister said I had to walk alone fromNdirande to Chirimba at around midnight. So we reached home at1 am. I was afraid of robbers and dardness.
My boy-friend had promised me to come an 10 a.m. - he was 3 hourslate.
Talking to someone I disliked.
When I refused to fetch water for my aunty while she was busy.
Missing lectures and avoiding university work for no reason whenit had to be done.
Scoared a goal in a football match.
I experienced this emotion when my grandfather passed away.
The first time I saw a pornographic film, all that in practice isso beautiful but on the screen appered as something mechanical,irrational, disgusting and dehumanizing.

I was scared when I realized that I might miss the train which Iwas supposed to take.I was 1500 Kilometres away from home and when I heard the depart whistle I was still 150 feet away from thetrain.I finally made it.
The discovery that one has only thought of oneself.

My boyfriend and I did not have any contact with each other during the Summer holidays.I met him the day of the registration and looked through him.In the canteen he asked me if I wanted to have a drink and I said no as I did not want him to do me a favour.
When my nephew was taken to hospital with meningitis and we didnot know what would happen.
When my mum learnt that I had beaten up someone in a fight.
I talked with a man who stammered and without controlling myself,I started to talk imitating him.
Doesn't apply.
Before an important examn.

I joked with an unfamiliar friend in an obstinate tone.I wasafraid of his misunderstanding me and being hurt and angry at me. I felt sorry over my conduct and thought that I had to find anopportunity to apologize.
Before an examination: I had the fealing that I had not learnedenough.
When my father passed away.
I had quarelled with a friend of mine and I later realized thatit was also my fault.
When I heard that my father had passed away. I could not eat fora week and was only crying. I could not find the courage to go tobath.
The day my parents were involved in a car accident and had to beoperatedand before the operation the doctor said that it wasmater of life or death.
In cinema I saw a film which showed how a person was torn out hisguts when he was still alive.
When I was a child, one day, I was going home late at night and Idid not notice an uncovered man hole and fell in it.I was in there forseveral minutes.
A good report card (a scholarship) in primary school.
When my parents work very hard and get tired - while I go toschool and study instead of helping them. I feel that I'm lettingthem down, disappointing them.
When I made love with someone who I didn't really love. SometimesI even considered him unlikable.
[ During a summer holiday a French girl and I had becoe backhome, I felt very sad.]
I was carried away while talking about my visits abroad and Itended to boast a little, till I realized that the listener wasamused.
I had gone to the hospital for my research and got late inreaching home.I feared that when I reached home there would bea quarrel because of my being late.
Being insulted in public.
One day, I was alone on duty when a patient choked while eating. I ran to her and tried to make her breath, but it was too late.

I \cooked\" the engine in my father's car - it was actually his fault because he hadn't fixed the temperature gauge or told me. When I finally got home I was absolutely screamed at and the anger I experienced was over the injustice of it all plus the huge row which developed."
Sincerely I'm a very timid guy and so even in very simplesituations sometimes I am ashamed.

When I was misleaded by a person who assured that something wouldnot occur, that I had no reason to prepccupy myself, and suddenlyI saw myself implicated by the fact, because of the incompetence,and irresponsibility of that person.
When my boyfriend once again told me that he loved me after aperiod in which he felt very depressive.
I was angry when I watched a ski-race. All the Austrian skiersdropped out.
In 1982, I was annoyed at an uncle who was drunk and was beatingup his old father.He claimed that the father was responsiblefor his guardian's failure.
[ No response.]
When I was young I was playing football near my parent's houseand while playing I fell on the ground. At first I thought I wasnot seen by anybody, but when my mother laughed I felt veryashamed.
Watching Muldoon act as my P.M.
My best friend started moving out with my boyfriend. When I heardthis my heart sank because I didn't expect that my own goodfriend could do such a thing, so I got angry.
Arguing with my younger cousin.She is rather a nuisance but Ifelt sorry.
When the Cambridge results came out and I obtained a firstdivision.I had been thinking that I had not done very well.

I have been thinking of changing my major for a few months.Myoriginal major was Chinese language and it blocks my way.I haveto face many problems at the sametime and I do not know what isreal and virtuous.I do not know if I am not interested inChinese or if there are other factors which make me sad.I amnot very clear on what I can do for the study of Communicationand Journalism.I am not clear about what I can do.What arethe limitations ? I hesitate but I feel more adjusted now.
When I passed the driving test after three failures.
Someone stole my ski at Vitosha and of course I was the one to beblamed. I left them without supervision.
The assistant professor saw me cheat at the preliminaryexamination.
In the student's union there was someone who took the photocopiesof two large volumes.I asked him to let me take a few, he refusedit for an acceptable reason.
