I read a book about the sexual phantasies of women; I read abouta woman having sexual intercourse with a dog.

When I finished my exams after 12th Grade, I was worried aboutgetting a T.E. Score high enough for Physiotherapy. When I foundthat I had been accepted I was ecstatic, or more appropriately,could jump for joy.

An incident occurred to me when I was going home with mygirlfriend. On the way, a man named Banda grabbed my girlfriendin my presence. I was really angry with him and as a result Ithrew stones at him and he ran away.
I can't remember ever feeling shame.

I was travelling back home by boat with two friends of mine aftera lovely holiday trip.The night and the sea were dark, and thewind was blowing.I feared that death was there on the boat, Isomehow felt sure about it.I feared being left alone.
Every time I meet a certain dog that has once bitten me.
Insulting other people.
We are repainting rooms in my house. My mother started to enactplans to paint my room without consulting me.
Being insulted in front of my parents, and they believed otherpeople (those insulting me).
When I was watching a movie with many violent episodes.Theyaccurately showed the cutting of corpses, etc...
I feel fear quite often but this feeling was very strong lastyear when my husband was quite unexpectedly sent to the hospital.
Having quarreled with a boyfriend, he threatened to leave me.

When I could not pass my exams with good marks.My wedding wasto take place 15 days after the exams and I tried to convincemyself that this was the reason for my not having done well.However, I thought that had I really put my mind to doing well atthe exams I would have done well.
When I was ten years old a classmate laughed at me because I hadtold him that my father had retired.
I was swimming in the sea and a wave took the top part of mybikini away.
When ditched - divorced by husband.
When I was left by the person I loved without any reason.
I came across a group of people with the same basic ideas/beliefswho were all fighting and going against what they would say wasgood.
When my grandmother passed away.
My old friend visited me in the university.
I was looking at a one-man show on television. He told verydisgusting things so that I started to be disgusted with it.(Later on it proved that this was his intention).
A close friend of mine was to get married in a weeks time whenher father died of a heart-attack.I knew him well and felt badon hearing of his death.
Feeling helpless, not being able to accomplish what I reallywanted to do.
When I felt powerless to help the poor or when I don't know howto.
During the oral part of my final examination I made a mistake inspeaking so that all the teachers laughed at me.

I went shopping with my mother and sister (17 years old). Motheralways told my sister what she should buy. Instead of assistingmy sister in defending herself against mother's interference, Ijust behaved aggressively towards my sister.

I was spending the week-end with some friends.We were waitingfor another friend and we went to the meet him at the bus stop, a woman we met there told us that the coach had already left.Iwas afraid that I would not see my friend, but at last we foundhim.
When I was successful at my work I was full of joy.
I was beaten up at a private New Year's party once, through nofault of mine.
When I met a friend whom I had not seen for a long time andheard all about her troubles, I thought that I should have gotin touch with her earlier.
[ No response.]
When I considered writing a load of crap for this emotion.
A very close friend of mine died. I read it in the newspaper. Ididn't know what to do and thought about it the whole day.
I tried after months to begin talking to my boyfriend again. Heignored me. I felt I had lowered my pride and became his\doormat\"."
During lectures, I sensed an unexpressed understanding with a boyI did not know.We exchange glances ; I think he likes me, and Ilike him too.Perhaps he has fallen in love with me .........
First day back on the job.

Eating biscuits and drinking Milo (Chocolate energy drink madewith milk and usually drunk warm) with my friend at College. Weget on really well, don't withold any feelings about each other'sfriends and are pretty good at cheering each other up when we arehomesick.

We got news that my (almost) 21 years old brother died whilevisiting Europe of a cerebral hemorhage. It finally hit me anhour after we saw his corpse in the coffin. It felt like a doorbetween himself and everything had closed and locked forever.
When I walked to church with my roommate, a bum told us to callthe police and he started following us.

This is an event I will never forget.I am considered a goodmimic.This particular day we were waiting for a professorto take her class.Thisprofessor had a peculiar accent and avery horrible way of lecturing and to top it all we had thisclass at the fag end of the day.So this particular day I gotinto my element and started imitating the professor, and theprofessor entered the class right in the middle of it .I wasunaware of her presence, some of my friends tried to warn me butit was of no avail as I was too engrossed in mimicing.Then Isuddenly noticed the silence and turned around to see herentering the class.I do not know till today if she actually sawwhat I had been doing or she had completely ignored it.Through out that lecture I died of shame.All the more shameful was thefact that she gave me a character certificate.
Walking on the street passing by an air duct, my skirt went up.
At rejection / being ignored by a loved person held in greatesteem.
I was disgusted with my brother's behaviour when he kept throwingthings away because of his anger, after mum had shouted at him.
When once again I drank too much and felt very rotten the morningafter.
Nearby the end of the year my wife and I were having a car ride,when it appears another vehicle, driven by a drunk driver andprovokes an accident.
Returning to school and rejoining my girlfriend after 3 months ofseparation from summer.
Continous fear of a nuclear war.

I thought I would be able to use the mangle of the house, and soI did not want any help.However, I blocked it and I had to getthe janitor to help me out.He reproached me for not havingfollowed the instructions
My friend had organized a birthday party for me secretly, I wasvery happy not so much for the presents but because they seemedto care for me.
When I lied at home. I told them that I was going to aChristian meeting and I went to see my boyfriend instead.

[ On discovering the red-tapism and the bureaucratic, corrupt,decadent, degenerated infrastucture of every public utility,office and service; and the rampant corruption at every singlelevel of education and other institutions.]
My parents came to visit me.
Disgust with drunk people.
At my grandfather's funeral.I remembered that the thing heliked and respected most was earth, I thought that he hadattained what he wanted and was not separated from it any longer.
I prayed unfaithfully.
I met intoxicated people with dubious intentions in a back alleyone Wednesday night.
A lonely, neurotic, shy girl lives nearby. She has expressed awish to meet me, I have however avoided her (turned down aninvitation) as the crisis my partner is going through uses up allmy empathy.
When I was making music together with my friend. It sounded verygood and we were very satisfied.

One time I was injured when I was playing football at School inBlantyre. I was brought to the hospital while my leg was totallyswollen. The x-rays confirmed there was no fracture butcollection of blood n the muscles. I feared when they started toincise the swollen part with surgical blade.
When I pass an exam.

A neighbour complained about smoke from my backyard incineratorentering his house after a change of wind direction. I lit thefire after originally checking that the wind would not blow thesmoke in that direction.
I was severely reprimanded for a trivial offence in front ofmembers of my peer group while still at school.
There is a mad boy in our village. This boy hit me with a rawpaw-paw in the face.

My mother called me because she had read through the enveloppe a letteraddressed to me.She denied having read it intentionally andsaid \the words just popped out through the enveloppe as the sunwas shining on it\". Hah Hah."
There is a person whom I disgust. Evrey time I see her I get thisterrible feeling I disgust her whole appearance.
A shop in Downtown wouldn't accept my Visa Card - before Decemberlast year.
Before giving a seminar to a rather large audience.
When on a car journey a fellow student crossed our way with hisown car and we had to bump into a roadside trunk.
When I first heard \I like you !\" from my boyfriend."
When one of my best friends commited siucide during theseholidays.
When my father married a certain lady. The reception was held atKasungu town Hall.
When my boyfriend asked me to go out with him and I refusedbecause I wanted to go out with another guy.I did go out and myboyfriend found out.
When I think that I have been too stict or narrow minded towardsmy students.
Facing the possibility of having a child when it wasn't eitherdesired or permitted.
A man whom I like, was drunk and tried to molest me.
I am a \cantor\" - I sing psalms in church. Several weeks ago Ihad to sing too, but the organist did not tell me in time. As Idid not know the psalm, I was afraid and said that I could notsing."
Skiing down a very icy slope, very fast in white-out conditions.Out of control with no idea of what I was doing or where I washeading.
I went to practice in Sweden during summer, and I was afraid thatI would not do well.
A friend of mine had the sleeves of a leather coat stolen fromhis car.It was me who had left them there for everyone to see.

A friend prepared a soup with chicken heads and invited me to eatit. I saw the eyes staring at me and the tongues hanging out ofthe bills. I was so disgusted that I felt nausea and had to leavethe room.
It happened in a tram: some older people started to grumble aboutthe young people just because I had not immediately left my seatto them.
When one's studies seem hopelessly difficult and uninteresting.
Went to a movie with a date, walked on the beach (in Alameda)spent some time afterwards in her apt.
When I promised a male friend of mine to visit him, and did not.
I invited two friends. We should go out together. Those two girlskept talking about boys, chatting up etc. I bacame sick of it.
When my grandfather died.
At the weekend I wanted to be absent from school because of asports event, but my teacher refused to give me the day offbecause he didn't like me.
Being bored in school, not being able to marry and have children.
I assisted to a scene where the police attacked a person thatdidn't have his documents. The savagery was too much, and theattacked person bleeded to much.
A close friend died.
When I took my entrance exams successfully and also when I got myschool leaving certificate because the delivering ceremony wasextremely official.
I was talking with an aunt of mine that I adore and I foundcourage to say \I love you\" and just after that came the shame."
One day my friend told me that she had heard that I was movingabout with her boyfriend. I was disgusted with the news.
I misunderstood a girl and thought that she loved me.One daywhen I was talking to her, her boyfriend appeared and I feltashamed.
I passed on some gossip that was untrue and cause two friends tohave a fight who were already experiencing difficulties with eachother.

I was approaching my exam time and my books got stolen.I was ina panic as I thought that I would not do well enough to beconsidered for the economics quota.I cried a lot but that didnot help and as the exam day came near a strange fear gripped me.
Scuffle in a carriage of the underground in Vienna, three drunkmen thrashed a man in a wheel chair - I watched the scene fromanother carriage.
Seeing someone who has bleeding nose.
At primary school the teacher caught me cheating during adictation.
A friend I had missed very much came to see me unexpectedly.
When I passed the driving test (on the second try).
I scolded my sister without waiting for her explanation.
Death of grandmother.
I knew I had to take an exam very soon but yet I couldn't startstudying. I also knew it was very imprtant to succeed the examthis time.
Having told a certain lie.
After several days delay in my girlfriend's menstration I wasvery glad to see that the pregnancy test was negative.
When I married my wife and took her home for the first time.
While playing a ball game, I was just about to make a goal when Iwas thrown off my feet, and I failed to score the goal.
[ When mix was coming from column for several days.]
Talking about a person's unattractiveness, not realizing that theperson was listening.
When I saw a few people beating a man who seemed to be astranger.
I was told that I had passed the statistics exam.I had notexpected this so I was very happy.
This feeling occurred to me when my colleague entered in G.V.(University) and I didn't.
I was raped by a friend.
A few weeks ago I thought about an exam I had to take soon. Iremembered this just before I had to go to sleep. I felt guiltbecause at the beginning of the year I planned to succeed.
When I promised to help a friend over a weekend and did not keepthe promise.
Some days ago I had a car accident. It was quite slight butthrough my fault. I felt strong shame because I had the spiritsof a good driver.
Unjust punishment of a friend of mine.
When I talk to silly, petty-minded and unmanageable people.
When my boyfriend last told me he loved me after I gave him animpulsive kiss.
When taking part in the mobbing of one of my best friends inprimary school.
My friend will find out that I am in love with her.
I found a cockroach crushed between two folders in my bedroom, Icalled my mother.
When I dreamed that I was being attacked by a friend.

My friend and I worked for the community centre by holding a booth. One day my friend went off to another booth to play.Thismeant that I was very busy and could not maintain order.Hisbehaviour disgusted me.
Telling a lie to wife over phone about what I had been workingat.
Some boys talking about nicknames of the lecturers, and I was tooafraid of them to stop them.
When I had not prepared my contribution to the group asthoroughly as the other members, with the result that theoverall result was poor.
When I was found urinating, behind a toilet instead of inside it,by my class mates and the teachers.I was told to pick up my ownurine from the wet soil, I did it.
Maltreatment of children.
I felt guilty after hearing that my girlfriend with whom I hadspent most of my time was pregnant.

I felt guilty at being part of the successful people. Felt guiltyat being a student when other people were not. Guilt about beinga potential success in various areas of society. (So stupid thisemotion)
Crossing a street of several ways the cars began to move and Ithought that I was going to be trampled.
My boyfriend suffered form ill health for some months, this weekthe physician told him that he was restored to health.
In the last year of the high school we had a huge fight betweenmy group and the graduation commission (two students of myclassroom) because they accused us unjustly of a gossip aboutthem.
I was ashamed of being laughed at by my colleagues when I failedto answer a question in the classroom.
I had to terminate a training because I wasn't suited for it. Iwas very sad about this, because I very much wanted to finishthat training.
I had a picnic with old classmates, we chatted and played games.
The passing away of my mum.
The mother of a friend of mine passed by me and saw me sittingon a boy's lap.I tried to greet her but could not helpblushing.
In 1977, my grandfather, to whom I had a very close relationship,died.
I received the mid-term exam paper of one of my major subjectsand I found that I had failed it.
When I received the higher level exam results, I mistook thegrade E in mathematics for a grade F and I was shocked.
When I did something wrong in the past and denied having done itwhen asked about it later.
The holidays come to an end, and the next day we had to go backto University and to the exams.
When people remember us and shows interest about what we do.
[ There have been very few instances of disgust, as far as I canremember they are not important or worth mentioning.]
When I arrived late at the job and met the most troublesome boss.
When I inadvertantly entered the ladies room and met some girlson my way out.
When I nearly caused a traffic accident with my car.
When I got into an argument with someone and was very abusive,but they were a close friend and I later regretted it.
Being caught by parents in a compromising situation withgirlfriend.
I felt disgust when I saw a drunkard vomiting very offensivematter.
When I took the B.A exams,I was expecting a 1st class even thoughI had not done very well. When the results came out I felt sad asI had missed the 1st class by 12 marks.
When my daughter had problems with her friends and I could seeher predicament from the window.She was given a the coldshoulder.
When my grandmother died - having to see my mother weep.
Two-timing - going out with person other than guy I was inrelationship with.
When I was in the sauna bath.
The day I got married was the happiest day of my life.Both ofus felt that we were right for each other in every way and we hadno doubts about our compatibility right from the day we gotengaged.
Gave the wrong meal tickets to other people (my classmate).
When I was told that my uncle had passed away.
I had the unexpected possibility to see a friend I like verymuch.
Not attending school, whenam not sick - but in need of mentalrest. Staff on your return query your \sickness\" - it is easier in N.Z. to be sick, rather than confide other personal reasons etc."
I accused my husband of being late deliberately when he came topick me up from work.
I was very sad when I heard that my uncle had passed awayuntimely at home.
After a big fight with my parents.
On my birthday, when I was given my presents.
When I got first division in the exams before leaving school.
Earth crake.
When my gradmother died.
When I was operated on the knee and had to go through rehabilitation.
After buying a ticket, I lost it before I reached my destinationand the bus Inspector dropped me at a place I didn't know.
Estrangement from my best woman friend.We have been goingdifferent ways for quite some time now, but the break was totalwhen she got married as her husband is unreasonably jealous of me.
When as a child I stole, from a friend of mine, the ring she hadgot in an easter egg.
When I told my girlfriend a joke openly and frankly.
I found myself involved in a fight in which a person died and Ihad to intervene with some risk.

I was waiting behind a car which was going to leave the parkingplace, because I wanted to park my car there. Because of uncomingtraffic I had to wait for a short time - another driver placedhis car on the place.
When the N.Z. rugby union announced that they would proceed witha rugby tour of South Africa.
A good friend quitted me after he had behaved in a strangemanner.
I am chosen for the English lectures instead of my good friendand people told me that girls are more likely to be chosen.
My son was apprehended for shoplifting at the age of 14. BecauseI too had been apprehended at the same age I felt the shame ofnot having been able to prevent my son from acting in the sameway.
I had a girlfriend in the same class I was. I did not do well inmy Exams, but she did satisfactorily well and was taken intoanother class leaving me behind.
Going out for dinner, or during one ice-cream and four spoons.
It is very difficult to relate it to a certain event. I amfamiliar with the disgust of Sartre (la nausTe), a frequentlyoccurring cause may be described as \the self-assured dullness\"."
When I was about to be bitten by my friend's dog, later on it bitme.
Not beeing able to stay with my mother for the National Dayholiday.
I gave tutorial to a student and I found that he was lazy, he didnot pay attention to what I taught.He did some easy questionswrong deliberately.
During a party I overheard a conversation about china. When Iwanted to give my opinion one of the people came out to be Chineseand his opinion was right of course.
When I forced a close friend of mine to ask a girl things aboutherself.
I tried to date a girl, but she refused.
We had made an appointment to complete together a piece of work.It appeared that I was the only one who hadn't prepared anything.
When I left New York, and all my family and my friends behind me.
Last week a former school (secondary) mate of mine, who is now ina differentt school came to my room here at UNZA in my absence. He was drunk and he vomited in my room.I was unhappy.
Eating the last remains of dinner that someone else (unknown tome) had claimed.
When a friend of mine told me a horror story.
Not included on questionnaire.
When I passed the whole weekend with my boyfriend, coming backhome on Sunday afternoon he met my parents for the first time.
One of my good friends had to migrate to America.Our friendshiphad developed quite well and it was a pity as our friendship wouldfade.
At school when I had a shouting argument with a friend over myability to carry out a particular duty in the correct way withoutharming her.
I knew a girl so lovely that everyone would like her.But sherefused to accept my Christmas present and I tried to forgether.
When someone does something wrong which affects me negatively.
I am a school teacher.One of the classes does not obey me at all,keeps on talking, does no work.One afternoon, everything wentwrong, and I got exceedingly angry.
[ On days when I feel close to my partner and other friends. When I feel at peace with myself and also experience a closecontact with people whom I regard greatly.]
I was living in a flat where things did not go very well for me. Finally, they threw me out and this prejudiced people I esteem alot.
When I thought that I had failed the examination.
I went home all alone from a restaurant. It was dark, I went veryfast. Behind me, there were some drunk men who shouted at me. Bychance, I met some friends who accompanied me.
I was forced to leave an unforgettable friend.
That I didn't want my friend to leave on holiday for 10 daysbecause I thought I would miss him. I was constantly trying topersuade him.
I woke up at the house of someone I knew, not remembering verymuch about what had been said or done during the party on theprevious night.
The sight of vomit on the street.
When I received a letter from the university telling me that myapplication had been accepted.

I had a good relationship with two friends. Once without reason,they clearly showed that they thought I was naive, dull andunable to take care for myself, while I expostulated that I couldmanage things.
Confronted outside a party by some very nasty character -gesturing to a car full of mean-acting friends - felt in danger.
After seeing an \uncertain\" child work on a model for several hours, I watched a \"bully\" of the same age destroy it, telling the child that it was worthless."
To loose friends because of them over-estimating themselves.
I felt angry when my only pair of trousers was stolen and couldnot be able to find out who the thief was or anyone who knewabout the story.
Exchange of points of view with my sister on a family matter.
I felt anger at my last exam, I felt angry with our teacher,because he did not rate me objectively and I failed.
A teacher was very blunt in his relation to a child so that thechild was very upset when arriving at home.
Friend (male) hinted that my talking to other men at a pub wasimmoral. He implied that I should remain only with my boyfriendthe entire evening.

I was camping in an old broken hut which had no lights.I hadbrought along a lamp which was not working very well.The doormade strange sounds and I was sure that strange things werehappening.The most terrifying bit was that there were manywardrobes in the hut and everytime that I looked in the glass ofthe wardrobe I felt that there were \objects\" behind me. The whole night was spent in fear and restlessness."
My apartment has had three robberies in the last month. The guyupstairs just got robbed making it the fourth.
When I moved away from home.
When a boy, who was drunk, insulted me in front of a crowd.Iwas stopped from punching him for it.
Not noticing my roommates quietness or a sign of discomfort.
While dining with some accquaintances I was asked somethingwhich I should have known but I did not know.
When I heard about a murder of a 16-year-old girl.
At school a classmate who was a very good pupil had to helpanother boy who performed less well. He told him on purpose thewrong things so that he had to repeat a year.
My friend came to the concert for my sake as it was me who hadorganized it and the concert was unsuccessful.
When I came to know that my exams were on two successive days andthat there was very little time (about 9-10 hours) to study inbetween.
Felt it after I spoke terribly (got mad at) the person who is themost important in my life.
When I am at home alone.

I was alone at home, in bed reading a womens' magazine in whichthere were storiees of paranormal experiences.My leg wasitching and I stretched my hand to scratch and I felt anotherstrange hand. (later I realized that it was the corner of theblanket)
My little cat which I had raised all by myself, hanged itself whenplaying in the garden.
When I broke my leg I felt fear.
I had not eaten anything for 2 days to be able to pay the finefor my fiancT. But he stayed in another town and spent onethousand shillings in the restaurant during the same time.
When I argue with my boyfriend, I feel as though he feelssuperior to me.
When my mother scolded me and I argued with her.
When my brother hit his head and lost consciousness at the sportspractice.For some time he could not remember what had happenedbut he recovered later.
When I found that my coldness had hurt somebody's sincerity.
Two years ago my best friend died in an accident, just a daybefore my birthray.We were very close to each other and I feltvery sad at loosing a close friend.
I feel sadness when I only imagine that I could lose a closeperson. Some time ago I lost a man whom aI greatly respected.
A study visit to a chicken factory : the butchery, the smell,the environment and the noise.
I felt sad when a friend of mine died and I felt that somethinghad irrevocably gone away from me.
Our basketball team is undefeated in league play (4-0) currently.

When I did not get admission in M.Sc after my B.Sc, I felt reallybad.When I started my journey to Bombay, after having acceptedmy uncle's offer to come to Bombay, I was afraid, wondering if I would succeed or not.
When I had just moved into my new appartment I found a ventilatorin the kitchen.I was going to clean it when I found that thedrum was full of mud and slime.I felt disgusted.

One of my best friends was found lying flat on the road becausehe was drunk and was taken by the police and put in a cell. Iwent to see him the following morning, the place was really amess and was smelling badly. I didn't like it.
Getting a low grade on a midterm.

When I realized that I belonged to a country which is amongst thepoorest in the world and that inspite of having the resources wedo not utilize them.I was ashamed at myself and my country,shame at the lack of parity between the lifestyles of thecitizens.
After mischieviously ringing on the chemist's trade-entrancedoorbell and getting caught by him.

One day when I was a little boy, my friends asked me to playwith them outside and to catch some boys.However our parentsdid not know that we were out and when I got home it was verylate and I feared being scolded by my parents.
When my wife died in hospital, she was pregnant and had undergonean operation.

I felt guilty of revealing a secret to my in-law. I told her thatmy brother and I had gone to disconight which is a thing mybrother didn't want to let her know. Later my brother was accusedof spending a night out.
When my sister died in a fire accident at home.
My flatmate and close friend living and sleeping with anotherclose friend of mine.
When I failed an exam for which I knew that I had not studiedhard enough.
I cannot recall feeling guilty in the near past. REMARK - SUBJECT MAY NOT HAVE TAKEN THE EXERCISE VERY SERIOUSLY.
[ No response.]
When my husband got picked up in our new car for drunken driving.We had made a pact the other would not drink and so thereforewould be the driver for the evening etc. I was not present at thetime.
The outrageous conduct of a relative towards me and those closeto me.(blaming us and lying)
When I am walking on the streets and see a gang of thugs.
I had to take care of a neighbour's child. I did not look afterit all the time and the child fell down and was hurt. I feltguilty.
Made a wonderfull new friend.
I am ashamed at myself sometimes when I am working withhandicapped people and don't wish to be seen in public with them.

At a lack of love of my father for my mum, sadness for him morethan anyone else because he does not realise how much love andhappiness there could be between them, and is, and how much he isdamaging himself apart from mum.
Someone told me that I was chosen for English lectures becausethe class leader is going out with me (not true).
When my neighbours accused my brother of stealing theirrose-bush, I was very angry as he had not touched it at all.
When my son was diagnosed as having CEREBRAL PALSY, at age 5. Hewould have to endure so much labelling, stigma and discrimination,even though his case was relatively mild.

A couple of years ago during the summer holiday, I was fishing ata lake with my husband.Suddenly it started raining while thesun was still shining. I experienced a feeling of joy, happinessand fulfillment.the whole nature was full of music.
I felt guilt to have come back from home without seeing my father.When I went home he was at work.
At a friend's birthday party with some of my closest friends.Itwas all very pleasant and one could say that I was happy to havesuch good friends.

A new gas connection was to be installed and the mechanic who cameto do it was very rude to my mother and me.I rushed to thhedealer with my mother and had a fight with the dealer as heseemed to be unreasonable and was taking the mechanic's side. Ultimately the matter was resolved after my father went and spoketo him.The mechanic was asked to apologize.
I greeted and embraced the wrong person thinking that it was myfriend.

I had been searching for housing for Fall at UCB and I wasfinally offered a place - then an ordeal followed, first Iaccepted then refused - related to my parents judgment (they'repaying for me). Turns out that I was so upset at what my Dad saidto me that I hung up on him. He called back and threatened to cutme off financially and emotionally.
I was hitchhiking and was picked up by a stranger he drove intothe woods and wanted to make love with me, I refused and escapedfrom the car. When walking in the wood and hearing the car I wasafraid.
My sister was impolite to my father when the family was havinglunch together at a restaurant.She thought that our parents hadbeen prejudiced against her, this was an extreme thought.
When I heard that my sister had shouted at my friend's cousin attheir place.
As I was taking venous blood from another patient I introducedair into the place of puncturing and there was a swelling whichis dangerous to the patient hence I became afraid.
I was the last among the list of failures in my class of Biology.
I felt very ashamed at having got a book by force from a girl.
During a football game, another player who was perspiring verystrongly ran into me.
Sitting alone in a quiet room, concetrating on things happeningaround you. Thoughts come into my mind which make me afraid.
Coming home one night - my sister was home, and had been drinkingheavily and started picking arguments.
Flicking through a magazine showing pictures of homosexual mencommitting various acts.
The day I got a telegram telling me that I had been selected fora B.A at UNZA.I felt happy because I had not expected to beselected.
When I went to a disco with a friend I started behaving badlyembarrassing him without reason.
When they phoned me from Great-Britain to tell me that I could gothere, if I wished, in Summer.
After I had made my debut at Ullevi against IFK, Gottenburg andgot a good write up in the paper.
I phoned two friends and was not able to arrange a meeting witheither of them, so I had to change my plans.

During these Summer vacations a schoolmate who was not in myclass went to Britain.Before he left, his classmates and someof us who were accquainted with him had a B.B.Q on the beach. When I arrived I saw that some people , who were not closefriends of the departing person(person A), were playing mahjong. Some others were playing bridge and A had nothing to do, besidesit was A who had prepared the food.Later when we wanted to talkand his classmates did not even have the decency to listen to him. They only asked him a few questions half-heartedly and then theytalked on their own.Some of their conversation was against me and another classmate.
A girl I was with yelled something out to this group of guys Iknew. It sounded really childish.
When I think that I do not study enough.After the weekend Ithink that I should have been able to have accomplishedsomething during that time.
Disgust with a subordinate.
We were discussing a subject ( I knew very little about it) and Iwas holding my ground.They showed me that I was wrong.

One evening my father told me to go into the cellar and get him abeer. I was terribly frightened at the idea of a man sitting inthe cellar and assaulting me. For my defence I took an emptybottle with me.
When my parents-in-law scolded me, without any reason, in front of theother members of my family for the first time.They had calledme from my room where I had been studying for my exams.
Doing poorly on a midterm.
I was filled with joy when I heard that I had been selected tocome here at Kamuzu College of Nursing.
With a woman who had walked into my place of employment andurinated on the floor in front of everyone.
When I and the person mentioned above had a suspicion ofpregnancy.
Made a statement that other people did not believe.
I fell down in the bus when it braked suddenly and everybodystarted looking at me.
When a skunk invaded camp.
Watching a horror film.
The first time I left home.

A few days ago, I hitch-hiked to Arnhems with a friend.Everything went well: they picked us up very quickly, the sun wasshining, I was feeling free and, for the first time after longtime, happy. I really had the feeling that I was living at fullspeed.
Saying goodbye at the airport to my boyfriend who has to go toschool back East. We are very close and have been together 4years.
When a friend of mine died in a hiking accident.I was notpresent there and only got the news later.
I was disgusted with the behaviour of one of my fellow studentsduring my Secondary School life. He was a habitual noise-makerand caused great conflicts with the teachers.
After I had been away for a long time a friend told me that I hadpassed all my written examinations.
When a close friend did not write.
When I was young, I became very angry as I was not allowed tostay up all night for the fair in my town.
Felt I had not appreciated my parents enough. Regretted theproblems I'd caused.
When I see pornographic films.
I felt joy when I was admitted to the Higher AgriculturalInstitute.
I had a very close friend who went to Canada after her F.B, his departure was unavoidable.When he came back during the Summerholidays I was very happy as nothing had changed between us.
It is some years ago when my mother found me stealing relish inthe pot. It was fresh fish which was very appetising.

When one individual takes advantage of and/or injures anotherrelatively defenseless individual, consciously. I feel disgustmingled with anger. A person on my dorm floor verbally assaultedanother person for having a certain religious belief.
I feel ashamed at the fact that even after 35 years of independence70% of the Indian poulation is still below the poverty line.
Betraying someone's trust.
When I found out that the seat in the coach that I had booked hadbeen sold to somebody else.
When I discovered that my mother had been involved in adultery.
I went to a party with my boyfriend who got so drunk and startedvomiting. It was so disgusting.
When I was accepted as a student.
After having considered it for hours I was able to overcome myscruples and to call a friend with whom I had fallen in love. Irealized that my decision was right - and was very glad.
When I was 7-8 years old, I woke up one night and found myselfalone at home.My mother had gone out to buy cigarattes from amachine.
[ Being close to another person.]
People talking in an important lecture.
When I had lied to a friend/son about some things we haddiscussed and I had to be one better.

My friend had many female friends and I thought that they werehis lovers.I would scold him but he did not accept my advice. Later I learnt from his girlfriends that this was not true.Ifelt ashamed at having misunderstood him.
Talking with someone I admire a lot.
Sending pictures home when I'd put on so much weight.
When my wife told me that the refrigerator had stopped working.
The more than satisfactory result of a recently-completeduniversity subject was communicated to me by phone.
When I entered a bar looking for a friend.
An officer at the Dean of students office had promised me to giveme a room the next day, but he failed to keep his promise.

One evening I was watching the news on TV. Again they weretalking about the danger of war. Suddenly I imagined what itmight mean for me, for my friends, for the people close to me. Ifelt it a very near and possible event.
When my sister left home to go and live with her husband.
For a medical check-up, we - boys and girls - had to take off ourclothes with the exception of our underwear. Then we had to gointo another classroom where older pupils were sitting andstaring at us.
When I heard that I had been selected fot the first year at theuniversity of Zambia.This was after my form five at Chikolasecondary school.
When the man I loved decided to leave me forever.
Something was stolen.
After a party I spent the night with a friend. We both weredrunk, the morning was disillusioning. A friend was me leavingthe room and I felt shabby and immoral.

A friend of mine had said something about not liking to come tomy place just before coming to my place. In the meanwhile I gotto learn about this from another friend of mine and when shearrived at my place I really treated her badly.I was laterashamed of the way I had treated someone when the person was atmy place.
When I had had the possibility to act or to do certain activitybetter but I had not done it because of reluctance orcarelessness.
After my +2, when I did not get admission in B.E I felt disgusted.
I had received bad news informing me that grandmother andgrandfather had passed away. The first one to die was mygrandmother and after two days grandfather died too.
When junior doctors returned to work after bunking them.

We always made a lot of noise during a certain lecture.This mayhave been because we did not respect the lecturer. Finaly, thelecturer could not tolerate it and he scolded us angrily andpointed out our misbehaviour.
When I was very young and we moved as a family to Auckland fromWellington, this meant new school and friends (etc.).
When I failed my Primary school leaving Examinations. I neverthought I would fail. When I heard I had failed I really feltashamed of myself.
One of my relatives became seriously ill. I felt sad because Ididn't know if she will ever be the same again.
Being chased in the dark by someone I did not know.
When I got a small present form a person I like very much.
I phoned a friend of mine to ask her for news about the marks inan exam.She told me that I had passed.

Leaving home when my mother thought I had no reason to go andfelt that I was rejecting her. She is a constantly depressedperson (a bit of a worry-wort) and I felt guilty about havinggiven her this additonal problem.
I heard a broadcasting programme about parapsychology. The peoplein this programme used very difficult words which I couldn'tunderstand. They acted exaggerated without showing any feeling.
One evening I saw the old guard-man I knew, change into somethinginhuman for about 5-10 seconds, this really frightened me.
After 3 weeks I saw my girlfriend again.

I was learning judo and my instructor wanted me to assist him inteaching girls judo at a suburban college.I was just a beginer,and he made me a green belt so that I would be able to commandrespect.This was against my principles, and yet I allowed myselfto listen to him.I gave it up soon after, however I felt veryashamed at not sticking to my principles and at not having put myfoot down earlier.
When I was in a situation which seemed hopeless for me, I movedback to my parents. For my father it went without saying anything(normally he ofter grumbles at me).
I crashed my father's car.
I was disappointed and angry at the bad quality of a documentayprogram on TV.In my opinion, the topic was important and theprogram should have been made with seriousness and consideration.
Saw someone who picked up a cigarette from the floor and smokedit.
Fear of the loss of a close friend, of feeling the ground slippingfrom under my feet.

When I was a Sr. in HS. one of the class counselors died ofhepatitis. She was very sensitive. She knew my shyness and drewme out to improve myself image. I missed her funeral - so I couldnot publically grieve. My parents didn't understand.
I feel anger when somebody forbids me to do something.
Some time ago I took the driving test. I did answer thetheoretical questions very well, but I failed the practicaldriving test. It was my fault because I had not enough practice.
When my father's new fiancee treats me like a child.She doesnot trust me and constantly misunderstands me.I getparticularly angry when she says nasty things about my boyfriendwith whom she works.
I bought a possible answer to a homework problem which wascompletely inapplicable to the question due to my not having readabout the subject matter.
I was less than 10 years old when our neighbour's dog chased meto the roof of a small shed and there seemed to be no hope ofgetting away from there.
I felt disgust when I saw a dead animal on the roadway.
The quarrel between myparents.

My brother and I were at home watching a TV program when Istarted to teasehim and in this joke I hurt him withoutknowing the seriousness of it I went on. He got angry and gave itback to me. At this moment I felt anger at him but knowing thatit was my fault.
Some boys not cueing in the dining hall.

After attending a song contest proposed by a band called \Chyne\" we (6 of us) waited for the members of the band to greet us in front of the stage.We went out after a few minutes as it was time to close the hall.We had been waiting at the entrance hall for ten minutes when three of the band members came out.They were very excited to see us, one of them was so excited that he had tears in his eyes.We felt very warm and close to each other.They took us back into the hall and we talked freely.We were together for about an hour and during this time we felt that they were very sincere."
When I lost my grandmother.She had been my guardian after thedeath of my father.
I gave some personal information to a friend of mine, and he toldit to some others who were implicated in the affair.
I had an important amount of money with me and felt fear of beingassaulted.
When my roommate came home at 10 in the morning after sleepingwith a guy she did not know because she got drunk. (Se has aboyfriend too).
Being alone at night.
Was accused of having hidden intentions in a situation when Ibelieved I was acting honestly and fairly.
Not doing my share of the work for the house job.
When I received some good news : I obtained an amount of money Ineeded to buy something I had been planning to buy.
I felt guilty when I heard the results of my friend, who hadfailed.I wished that I had helped him.
The day that there was a black-out in the city, and I was in anexposition, I felt fear that something more serious washappening, like a revolution for example.
Losing my temper with my spouse.
I once felt that my last hour had come when I was unexpectedly foundin the hands of.
Sleeping through crew practice one Monday morning.
I promised to fulfill an errand. Later I understood it wasimpracticable. The explanation I gave was accompanied by a senseof guilt.
When I saw an accident where the man lost his head.
In Punjab, when in the name of religion people killed each otherduring the agitation.
I came home one day and discovered that my sister had borrowed mycar and had gotten into an accident with it. My entire frontbumper was destroyed.
I did not deliver a message on time.

I felt guilty when I had taken the car keys and I had an accidentbut as my parents did not know who was to blame, they punished mybrother because I had no driving licence and they thought itimpossible that had driven the car.
It was some years ago when one evening some people came home andtold us my father was badly injured in an accident.
I broke a window of a neighbouring house and I feared my mother'sjudgement and action on what I had done.

I felt a sense of shame when I compromised a colleague of mine. Igot an information from him which I quite out of place sharedwith another colleague of mine and it resulted in an unpleasantconsequence for him.
A friend of mine had a bicycle-accident because I pulled at hishandlebar.
This was the worst incident of my hostel life.I was insulted bya close friend of mine on the eve of the New year and it totallyspoiled my New year's night.
Was threatened with a knife ... in the military by soldiers formanother unit. The reason was girls.
My son passed grade 7 and was accepted for form I.
[ I have not felt this emotion.]
When my brothers were being cruel to my boyfriend, because hisflat-mate bent back one of my brother's fingers. It wasn't hisfault.
I was alone at home on New Year's Eve.
Some friends and I were having lunch.Someone said somethingfunny and one of the guys started laughing and spat his food in a girl'sface.
When I went for a picnic in Lonavala, I felt full of joy.
When I was accepted as a student at the college, not havingthought it possible.
When I was admitted to a Language school. On the day when I wasinformed by a message and my parents congratulated me.

Quite recently I realized that I had had some erroneous viewsabout life. For instance, I had always lived for other people,had forgotten my own person and suppressed my own feelings. I wasashamed because I had not been concious of that until I had aconversation about it with a person.
When I do not succeed in making myself clear to other people.When they do not understand what I say.
When I beat up a stupid boy who was fond of cracking jokes on me.
Talking with a nice girl.
One day I was angry with my friend who went into my drawer andtook a piece of paper on which I wanted to write a letter andused it for her business without my knowledge.
The day I came home drunk after having attended a disco party.
Shouting at my parents because I was angry about something else.
Thought had discovered true love.
After having taken an exam i feared having failed it.
When my parents quarelled over something I had done and which waswrong.
Very intoxicated men who incite each other to fight. I met avile smelling man on the tram who got closer and closer to metill I got up, then he got angry.
My cat was sick and I had to take him to the vet to be put down -no one else there to do it.
Fear of punishment for having broken an item of value to myparents.
I forgot to water the flowers in our flat and was rebuked by myfriends who share the flat with me.
When I proposed love to a girl and she turned me down.
When my aunt told me angrily that I was a good-for-nothing andshe was fed up with my behaviour.
As the only person in my family into academics, I ought to havelooked after my younger (and only) sister better, with respect toher education and life experiences.
I saw a sort of black worm being attacked by many ants.
In a course I thought that I deserved good marks but I only gotordinary marks with no justification as to why I was given thesemarks.
I hit my cousin badly after she threw away my dresses in apit-latrine that the little girl fainted.
Calling lecturers nicknames when talking to housemen (They toldne you are even younger than they are so you should not be givingpublic lectures).
I was afraid when my mother left me alone to live in our housefor one month.
I am afraid if I'll finish the term.
When I was accepted at UNZA.
I had this feeling before my graduation and never dared to speakto my relatives andfriends.Because of this feeling I wouldavoid situations, however I do not know the reason for this.
When I \passed out\" a female friend of mine for no apparent reason.I was under the influence of drugs and when I am like that I get mad at anyone, however small the provocation."
In my penultimate job I was responsible of a sections withseveral employers, after several years of dedication I wasdismissed by a new chef, saying that I was incompetent.
Saw a classmate knocked down by a motorcycle.
When my dog died.I had reared it for nearly three years.Ithad been ill for several days and had not eaten anything.Onemorning I found it dead.
When my pet dog,who was to us a family member, died.He had beenvomitting for the past three days and we had not found the timeto call a vet, finally when the vet came it was already too late.
Once I had dinner at an elegant restaurant and I did not haveenough money to pay the bill. There were a lot of people thereand I felt quite awkward.

One night I was lying in my bed awake but I had my eyes closed. Isaw figures with terrible faces and black frocks bending over meand touching me. I opened my eyes but I could still see them. Ihad the feeling that somebody was in the room. It was terrible.Only when I turned on the light I was able to go to sleep.
When thieves broke into my house at night and held my wife and meon gun-point for at least ten minutes and took away a lot ofproperty.
When I heard that a 14 years old girl had been raped by fourrikshaw drivers in our town.
I had prepared a special meal for my boyfriend but when mybrother came home he ate it all.I was really disgusted about it.
When I succeeded in achieving a scholarship for which I hadstrived hard during a period of financial, personal and physicalstress.
I was accused of a misdemeanour, unjustly.
Finding out that China is poor, so we cannot have good referencebooks.

It was last week on Sunday that I was walking with my girlfriendalong Kawale road going to town so I tried to stop a car for alift and the driver didn't stop and I felt shame because peoplewere looking at us.

A child told me she had been sexually abused by her step-father.I only knew the child and had not come into contact with eitherparent. I tried to do what was best for the child. The event andthe stepfather disgusted me.
When dropping a carton of boiling soup onto a co-worker's leg -causing great pain, and for me, severe embarassment at my ownineptitude, and shame that another person suffered as a result.
I fell off a bike in the presence of a lot of people.
Failing an examn.
This week I was phoned by an old friend with whom I lost contacta few years ago.
When I did something naughty and it lead to the embarrassment ofmy parents.
Finding out the great difference between China and the West inscience.
When my flute-teacher was replaced by a new one.
After the accident which I described in SHAME. I came to myselfand saw how terrible everything looked like. I disgusted myselfand everything I saw.
Cleaning the bathroom of my apt. and realizing my roommate whohad lived there all summer by himself had never cleaned theplace.
I was disgusted when I was told to dress a big rotten stinkywound which, coming closer, made me feel like vomitting.

I was coming home from a relative's place and it was about9.30/10 P.M.I felt slightly apprehensive when I got off the busand started walking towards my place.I was confident thatnothing would happen to me, yet there was this slight feeling offear.
I was visiting my parents in law when the house was invaded bythree strange men, and they committed an armed assault.
Outside a night club, a grown man was sitting on top of a youngerwoman, beating her up.
When I lied last week. I lied to someone to get info. for apaper I was writing. I told her that the info. was for anewspaper article. I was afraid if I told the truth she wouldn'thelp me.
Once I worked as a designer. A fitter was hard hit in a damagethat occurred at the building site I had designed.
As an evening class teacher I got positive feedback.When theatmosphere is good and a kind of relaxed understanding exists.
The elections of 1982 and 1985.The thought of what a socialdemocrat and communist majority could achieve, especially \workershare\" funds and its extension."
In an important situation for me, my father behaved inadequately.
My friend took me to Civo Stadium to watch and listen to themusic of the International singer Sam Mangwana. I had no hope ofgoing there since I had no money so he gave me the money foradmission.

While travelling in a bus, there were three people sitting behindme (two men and a woman).They were drunk and the conversationwas unbelievable (about fucking, fellatio, etc...).They triedto get others to take part in the conversation.I loathed it andfelt like crying.
When I secretly tried smoking for the first time, being 12 yearsold.
A parking fine.
While playing indoor-hockey, there always is an older man whofrequently and intentionally plays the ball out of the field. Inmy opinion this is very childish, because we play for fun only.
When I found out I got accepted to Berkeley.
When my present boyfriend asked me initially to go out with him Ihad waited a long time for this to occur.
I felt guilty when I tore a photograph I found at my boyfriend'splace only to realise that it was his sister who was on thephotograph.

While at school I had to write an essay for doing something wrongthat I didn't do. I wrote the essay about how I was mistreated andgot Saturday morning detention along with a few other kids, butthey didn't show up.
When I was feeding a premature baby (7 months), the baby chocked.This was when I was working in children's ward I thought I hadkilled the baby.
When I was walking down the street, some boys showed me a knifeand stole all my money.
[ A person close to me told me that his positive regard dependedon my conduct.]
When I saw a drunk man urinate upon himsellf and he seemed to bethoroughly content with it.
I hate hypocrisy. My friend (girl) tried to intrude into myaffairs with my future husband. After that she behaved as ifnothing had happened.
Once in my work it happened a fight between the person in charge and me. Igot so angry and spoke out everything I felt at the moment.
Finding out that China is backward in science.
Going to CAL not knowing anyone.
When a study tour got confirmed, I was happy all the time till the tour began.
One night I had a feeling that somebody was stealing my car,but I was too frightened to go and see.
When I heard the examination results and when I recovered afterhaving been sick for a week.
Being with a close friend, in the city, who was involved at thepresent point in time in outrageous activity.
When I heard that a woman of my community had aborted and got ridof the foetus by throwing it in the drain.
I was called racial slurs behind my back.
About my girlfriend's sister who is a viper as I discovered sometime ago.
This morning during my sleep I had a feeling that someboby wasattacking me.I started crying in my sleep and then my room-matewoke me up.
At night, I walk home past a forest.Once, somebody got stabbedin the forest.I imagine someone attacking me and I hurry up.
Joy at meeting a woman I love very much.
I was in the dark room, it's insecure and has holes covered withwooden sheets in the roof the establishment had already beenassaulted and could be assaulted again.
I wore a dirty dress a certain day I was going to town I met anold friend who made a comment about my dress so I felt ashamed.
Someone told a lie that I had stolen his money.
On my way through lonely streets I met with a huge stray dog. Itstopped at some distance and looked at me. I tried to ignore itbut I was very frightened.
Bought something bad from the shop and they refused to change it.
The same event described under \shame\"."
I felt something akin to shame after a heavy night of drinking,along with waking up with a woman I had just met whose husbandwas an epileptic. I was later to know that she knew my mother.

At about midnight I had to go by bike through Graz alone. On thewhole it was a distance of several kilometers. A car followed methrough the streets. Only when I went into a one-way street thecar disappeared. The rest of my way home I was very afraid.
Someone attacked me with a knife.
My son lives in the country. I feel sadness when I see mothershaving walks with their children.
Cheating to get the best grade on a test in 7th grade.
My father had been involved in a car accident two years ago.Iwas then very scared thinking that he would die as he layunconscious in hospital for two weeks.
When my sister was born.
When my red-cheeked, content child runs to meet me in the yard ofthe kindergarten and gives me a moist kiss on my cheek.
When I was going to take the practical exams.
When I went to my room-mate's drawer to see if she had an iron which I could use, she came in.I felt guilty as she may havethought that I had been stealing.
The girl I was seeing didn't want to have a serious relationship.
As a child (i.e. 5-7) hiking in reasonably rugged bush andbecoming lost for a duration of 5-7 hours.
After having quarelled unnecessarily and without any reason, andhaving been stupidly cross in every way.
Finding out some people had been talking about me at my back.
My best friend was not chosen for the English lectures.
Found out that I am not good at football.
On my birthday, when a very close friend sent me a huge bouquetof flowers.
When my car froze, and I could not start it.

A girl whom I trusted and with whom I had shared personal, confidentialmatters twisted the facts and told it to a common friend of ours. When this common friend told me the version my friend had toldher, I was angry.
Sitting alone in a quiet room concentrating on things happeningaround me which pleases me.
I received a letter which was too strong for me. It said I haddone something which I really didn't do.
I was walking along a subway when I saw a group of louts.I wasrather afraid because I was alone.
A reoccurring fear that something will happen to my relatives.
[ I have not felt this emotion yet.]
When I learnt that I had failed an exam,This not only influencedmy emotions but also other important tasks, it also made myrecord imperfect.

One day when I was sitting in a not very crowded bus, a middle aged woman was standing beside me.The person sitting next to megot up to get off and this woman pushed me and occupied the seat. Then she took off her shoes and put her feet on the seat.

There is one thing which makes me feel shameful,when I seefriends of my age group working and earning a lot, when I amstill studying.A friend I met a week ago after a period of 5years is earning more than Rs 3000/ month.

One day mother slaughtered a chicken for a brother who had comeback for holiday. In everybody's absence I opened the foodstoreand ate all internal organs of the chicken. When motherdiscovered, we were all called and I was found with hands stainedwith soup. I was ashamed being the eldest of all in the family.
When my friends were rude to a girl.
Whenever I spoke to a female classmate I felt disgusted.Shesaid meaningless things and seemed to indicate something to mebut I did not love/like her.
I felt very sad when my boyfriend wanted to break ourrelationship. Our relationship lasted two years, we sharedeverything and all this was finished.
When my aunt died.
My uncle died - I felt sad at the funeral.
One day, when I realized that I was alone, I felt fear ofloneliness.
I blew up at someone for being confused and because of hisirresponsibility and afterwards I felt guilty and that I had noright.
Not doing well in the examn.
When a teacher tells a story which isn't true. It only reflectshis way of interpreting reality.
A terrible cloud-burst started when we were camping in a tent ona great bald field.
When I knew that they would not give me a transfer from oneuniversity to another.I began to insult the educatioonauthorities and the government, I ended up at the door.
Having passed the exam required to be an authorized Radio/TVdealer.
[ No response.]
When we complained about the uncleanliness of the work place, theauthorities agreed to have the place cleaned.Even after 2-3days nothing had been done.I felt disgusted at the wholesituation.
A friend of mine was telling jokes which I felt to be verydisgusting, especially because I was eating.
Foreign students playing loud music in the night before thebiology examn.
We were in a disco and the evening was not at all pleasant. Despite my not knowing why, I was angry with my companion.I lethim feel my bad humour as I cannot hide my feelings.
I feared that I would have to describe my sexual life to anolder, strange woman.
I work at a petrol station. When there is a foreigner who wantspetrol my collegues treat him very impolite.
When you are far away from relatives and friends. I feel sad formy early years, for the freedom and the carefree years ofchildhood.
I went to the school library and asked for a book, but thelibrarian told me that there wasn't such. However when an othercolleague asked for it she gave it to him.
Every time I meet a certain person. We cannot get on welltogether, we dislike each other.
My mother was unwell and went for many cancer tests. She spenttime in hospital being opened and closed many times.
I really became sad when mother passed away while I was veryyoung.

During the lesson the teacher called me and asked me if I hadreported that I was late.I pretended that I had but looking ather eyes I knew that she knew that I was lying.I thought thatit was really bad luck that she had examined the list of thestudents who were late.
Someone smoking on Electric train (Electric trains arenon-smoking) with alcohol smell coming from person.
Reading about executions and massacres which happened duringWorld War II, I felt disgust towards those who did it.
The first time that I caressed a girl, I was about thirteen andshe was eighteen.I noticed that it did not affect her at all.
When I got the scholarship letter from Australia.
When my boyfriend and I went out for a dinner and subsequentlywent to his family. We had a very nice evening.
The day I learnt that I had been admitted to the university.

When an acquaintance of mine told me about the way his parentstreated their sons in an unequal manner.The most successful ofthem got continuous encouragement, and the youngest was notencouraged and was rejected.
I was to be given an audition to get a role. I had a competitressand I wasn't well prepared because I was ill.
During the Physics experiment session I did not understand thecontent of the experiment and did not know how to do it.
During a movie in which I saw the effect of white settlers inAfrica.
When I learnt of the death of a friend.
After receiving the grade on the paper mentioned in FEAR.
Can't remember exact example.
I felt guilty after I battered to death a classmate of mine.

When I saw a girl in my economics discussion section smiling andasking stupid questions to the TA. just to get attention. She wasobviously ass-kissing. It happens in every Econ. discussion heldweekly.
When I saw the film \Johnny got his gun\" which deals with the consequences of the Vietnam war."
I received a letter form home telling me that my sister was very sick.
During my first week in Graz I met a girl who I had got to knowin the train from Amsterdam to Graz. Although I had consideredher very sympathetic, we had seperated without changing ouradresses.
When I shout at a colleague in classroom.
In an exam when I answered the questions with very littleassurance due to insufficiet preparation.
When I had to lie about my age to be accepted as a member of agroup.
At school, I did not tell the teacher that it was me whohad laughed, and she punished the entire class by making themstay behind for one hour.
A girl dropped some stuff from her bag and when I tried to helpher I realized that she had used me and I was made to look like afool.
I gave a wrong answer at school.

I left my home in Melbourne to come to Q'land to study and beforeI hopped in the car I hugged my mother and shook hands with myfather. Sensing immediately my father's sadness, I also had aflood of the same emotion.
I was hunting, and was lost in the fog in the mountains.
I had been very weary all week - no letters, no phonecalls, novisitors and then my younger sister came with some cheese, a cardand some pocket money for me; and she told me that she wasworking now.

When I met my boyfriend and we discovered that we shared the sameideals and goals in life, and that we could share all ourfeelings and thoughts and felt that the world's not so bad whenyou have someone really close to share your life with.
Guilty when I hadn't walked my dog for quite a few days and hadgiven her no attention.
My father dying.
A truck (big one) nearly mowed me off the road (I was driving asmall Lazer).
When I went to a job interview, I met a person who was very nice,and his attitude made me glad.
My husband and I were invited at the house of our nieghbours thenwe got an invitation on the part of my parents which we had torefuse. A a result they called me by words that provoked myanger.
I was disgusted by my paranoid attitude towards myself, myhomework at university and disgusted about my lack of retention.Especially in learning another language.
When I used to tell Mum I was going somewhere else than where Iwas (going).
I can't give one description here. I often feel joyful when Ihave done things good in relation to other people especially whenmy friend says he loves me and I also tell him that I love him.
I was very hungry and just wanted to start eating when a friendcalled me who usually talks for a long time. I was angry becauseI was prevented from eating.
A class-mate answered (accidentally) the call of nature in theclass during a tough mathematics examination.
Fear to come and live in Nijmegen.
When I lost my driving license because I had been driving whileunder the influence of alcool.
Feeling unable to preserve one's ideas and ambitions as innocentas they are when you are young.
A friend of mine promised to come with me to the cinema but hedidn't come.
We were at secondary school and I was making a lot of noise.Theteacher came to ask us as to who was making all the noise.I didnot own up so thewhole class was punished.
My roommate's sister committed suicide.
In a very important basket-ball match where a lot was at stake, Iplayed very badly.
People hunting animals.
I received a poor grade on a midterm even though I got all theright answers and knew the material. I went to the TA to try toraise my grade and he wouldn't do it.
When the morning newspaper has not arrived.
I was in grade 7.We had an inter-house volley-ball competition. In Luapula I was the youngest member of the team and I scored the winning goal using my head.I jumped up with joy and felldown.
Stealing from my mother's purse when I was a little boy.
When I learned, after the ecography, that my mother was expecting ababy girl.That was what I wanted.
After learning on the news about this man who killed more than300 women and habitually copulated into their inert bodies.
I broke the gutar of a colleague but as it happened in a momentwhen nobody was present I could escape from the guilt.
I was waiting to receive the participation on the profits and didnot receive it.
When someone does not listen to me after having asked me torepeat what I said. This happened more than one time with thesame person.
[ I sometimes quarrel with my mother because she blames me,though I have not in any way been connected to some events.]
When I found out that the girl, with whom I was in love, loved metoo.
I went on a picnic to the country side park.The beautifulscenary made me feel relaxed and every worry disappeared , thusthe picnic was worthwhile.
My friend not allowed to go to the English lectures.
I felt sad when I was told to walk out of the classroom because Iwas within the row of students who were making noise.
During my holiday I met again a friend who had tried to commitsuicide. She had just left hospital, her lips were trembling, shelooked miserable.
Yelled at my parents for not buying me a car like other parents.
I had to leave Den Helder and all friends and acquaintences,after having spend two weeks there with my friends.

I was told quite unexpectedly that one wanted me to become thevice-chairman of our student organisation.I was reallysurprised and joy was the first emotion I felt, though behind itthere was worry - how shall I succeed ?
I felt disgust with a lady teacher who used to nag, to mock, tointerrupt everyone of my fellow students each time we had a classwith her in our first year.

When it became clear that a man had used many people sexuallyand psychologically, despite the fact that many people looked upto him.I understood that one could not trust him and I wasforced to hide this for a while.
I had a feeling of shame when I found myself unable to answersome questions from my tutor simply because of a lack ofpreparation.

A good friend of mine told me in comfidence that once he hadtried to commit suicide. To meet him you wouldn't think so. Itold another friend of mine about this when she was feelingdepressed about her twin brother's suicide. I broke a bond ofconfidentiality.
I am sad because some relations to friends are not very good.
I was living in rooms in a very lonely, quiet neigbourhood.During the night it was very silent and this frightened me. Thefact of being alone in that house frightened me.
When I masturbated in my room.
My sister was in coma for 3 months (due to a train accident). Nowher brainfunctions are disturbed. She will never be able to walkand she can hardly talk.
Receiving a much wanted letter from a very good friend who livesabroad.
The results of the mid term examinations were very poor.
Failed to keep an appointment.
I was jogging in the forest, in the central park area, when I sawa man hiding behind a tree.I got frigthened, turned around andran out of the forest.
Many years ago a friend wanted me to with her to southern Europeand I preferred to travel alone.I felt guilty because I wantedto go on my own.

After having slept for a short time I woke up - I had the feelingof someone standing beside me and was very frightened. I had toturn on the light turn on the light for several minutes before Iwas able to get to sleep again.
When I was ringing up a guy who was my teen idol, and was inAuckland. I was really scared, I didn't know what to say or do.
It was at a comsomol(??) meeting, the last one because we were tograduate. The way one of my fellow-students behaved made me feeldisgusted.
When I was 17, I told Mum I came in at midnight, when really itwas 3.30.

Upon moving away from home for the first time to a differentcity, I felt no longer \under the wing\" of my parents even though they would always be there to help me. I felt a sense of loss, I was now all alone in the world, responsible for my own actions."
This I experienced when going around with more than one girl.
When my aunt, whom I had loved very much, died. When I heardabout her death, I was not as touched as at the funeral. I reallybecame conscious of her death at that moment.
My favourite horse died. We had tried our best to save him, butit was hopeless, he had to be shot.
I met a friend in a discotheque. he was with a girl and he toldme that she was not his girlfriend.I, to say something,commented that she must be a viscious woman.He then told methat she was his girl.
Diagnosis that I have a stomache ulcer.
At a party I saw two persons having a fight. The aggressions andthe hate between these persons produced an unpleasant impressionon me.
[ I can not recall one.]
When I was selected to study here at UNZA.
One day my boyfriend put my hand on his penis and I felt well,but after I felt a guilty conscience because I hadn't thoughtabout the consequences that this could have brought if I had gonefarther.

When the teacher asked me to read my composition that was thehomework I stood up and invented one because I hadn't done it. Acolleague saw that in my copy book there was nothing written andhe accused me and so I was called in the director's room.
For example, to feel bad because of one's attire, to be amongpeople who do not belong to the same social class, to give awrong answer in class, to be surprised in particular situations.
I was sitting in a restaurant with friends and I knew that in themeantime my girl-friend must have come to my flat and found thedoor closed.
Someone played a trick on me.
Somebody took my wristwatch and promised to have it mended andlater was telling me that he couldn't give it back to me because I wasrude at a certain time.
The hero was chased by a terrible vampire in a suspense andhorror film shown on T.V.
A situation where I ignored my beliefs and principles for a tripof whimsy.
At school, I detested the spinach gruel which had lumps of flourin it.
I was driving and stopped at a stop light. I was planning to makea right turn as soon as it was clear. It was clear on the left soI started but a man was just in front of the car.
Not accepting hints of intimate relation from a girl.
During the period of falling in love, each time that we met andespecially when we had not met for a long time.
When someone took my things without having asked for mypermission.
Getting back my math midterm, I received a lower grade than Ithought I would get. After going through the questions I feltthat the grader had graded harshly and I had made only a few ?errors.
Due to laziness, I failed the term studies completely atUniversity.I also wanted, to some extent, to protest against myparents' expectations.
When I spoke to Jan-Erik Wikstr÷m on the telephone.
When my elder brother died.
When I saw that I had passed the university entrance exam.Itmade me forget all my problems.
My dog, whom I had had for eleven years, died. I watched hissoporification.
In Ward 1A was an epileptic patient who was burnt the whole bodyand was stinking very much such that the whole ward was affected.Few people could come near him.
My friend came to see me after she had stayed abroad. I waited atthe station.
When they stole my dark blue tennis.
I'm glad when I have good relations with my colleagues and mostof all when we are at a party.

Upon reading a story on a serial killer by the name of Henry LeeLucas who has been given the distinction of killing more peoplethat any other man. I began to wonder if I should take more carefor my safety.

There was a family fight in my house some time back.My unclehad given me a watch as a present and I lost it.During thefight he accused me of having sold the watch.I was disgusted athis false accusations.
A friend of mine got pregnant anf failed the first year atuniversity.The boyfriend refused his responsibility and theyended up in court.
When I was driving my motorbike I went into a bend incautiouslyand fell down. I was slightly hurt, the motorbike was slightlydamaged.
When I missed the chance of becoming a graduate in miningengineering, after having prayed one week in the church I wasnot even selected.
I did not do the homework that the teacher had asked us to do.Iwas scolded immediately.
When I was little and didn't own up to placing a lolly on thevarnish, this pulled it all off and I didn't admit my guilt.

My sweetheart left me, or rather we decided to break it off bymutual consent.The consequences were - unrestrained weeping,feelings of loneliness, hopelessness and disconsolation.I feltthat I should find a friend, to talk to joyfully and to forget.

I am a kindergarten teacher and I am thoroughly weary of my job. After having taken the university entrance exam I suffered fromanxiety for weeks as I did not want to carry on with my work - studieswere the only alternative.
After an argument with a friend of mine.

Housesitting and hearing the alarm go off. I knew someone had tobe breaking in. I called the police and was panicking while onthe phone. It was awful. It turns out that I stepped on thehidden alarm without prior knowledge of its existance.
When I discovered that the people I trusted most were talkingbehind my back.
When I met my mother after not having seen her for three years.
When a person saw that I was accused of something I had not doneand did not do anything to defend me.
I was drunk one night and I insulted three ladies.The followingmorning they approached me and asked me the reason behind mybahaviour, I apologized for my unruly behaviour.
I am ashamed of the horrible way I used to treat my littlesister.
When I learnt that my best friend had failed the exams.

When I saw my 18 year old son grab an oxygen mask as he hadbreathing difficulties.I had a bad conscience because I had notstopped smoking.Medication for the dilation of his breathingtubes also caused a sense of guilt in me.
When approached by a gang of youths in town at night.
When I was told that I had no right to control my lover.
Failure to complete medical course as a result of failing fourthyear twice.
When I met my girlfriend - I had not counted on that.
I was given a gift by my sister. There were many pleasant thingsin this parcel.
When I entered the wound intensive care at the Central Hospitalin Blantyre which was stinking.
I met a certain lady at Mchesi and I proposed a word of love toher and at the same time she accepted my proposal.
When I recently managed to get my first consulting assignment\myself\" i.e on my own initiative."
A younger brother of a good friend of mine died (asthma).
Some time ago I slapped my son without trying to understand whothe real culprit of a damage was. After that I felt guilty andbad but it was too late.
I wanted to go to a friend of mine who had a party; at the momentI wanted to leave, my father said I couldn't go because he neededme for some work in the afternoon.
Angry when our team (small boys) lost the county championshipfootball final.
When I red a report in the magazine VESA about an Iranian tellingwhat she had lived in the prisons in Iran. I felt disgust aboutthat people.
I felt joy when I heard over the radio that I had been successfulin my Primary School Leaving Certificate Examination and wasselected for Secondary School.
The begining of my relations with my current girlfriend.

I felt guilty when I spent a night at my boyfriend's place,particularly because I had been harsh and spiteful when I hadleft home.The reason was that I feared a possible discussion onthe subject and I wanted to leave defiantly.
