Hearing about a friend back home that had to have his stomachpumped because he had overdosed on pills.
At the hypocrisy of some of my friends.
[ No response.]
Someone spread rumours about me.

After my graduation exams I was waiting to get admitted to a postgraduation course, however the situation was not very favourablefor me and I was upset.Suddenly, Bombay university offered me aseat and I landed up in Bombay for my post graduation studies. This happened last year and was very pleasant for me.
Having had a very heated argument with my sister - I beganhitting her about the head with a newspaper I was holding.
Following heavy stirring / ridiculing a close friend who wasvery vulnerable to such attack - inspiring fierce, defensivecounter-attack.
My girlfriend mentioned a certain girl's name who was my girlsome time back and she is no longer mine that she said she wasstill mine.
I felt it today when the bus driver shouted rather indecent wordsat a man without any reason whatsoever.
Someone who was speeding was forced to slow down when I pulledout onto the road and proceeded to abuse me at the next set oftraffic lights.
I was jerking me off in my bedroom, when suddenly, my mother camein. She looked at me and immediately left the room.
When I almost ran over a small boy who suddenly was in front ofmy car.
When somebody made me touch human faeces.
I felt guilty when I \stole\" the boyfriend of a friend of mine."
I was skiing alone and the mountain became covered with mist andI thought I was lost and was going to panic.
In a very crowded shop I was distracted and missed my turn in thequeue.A woman who was behind me began to shout at me asking meeither to pay more attention or to leave.
When a close relative of mine passed away, it was the first timethat someone so close to me had died.
[ No response.]
When someone close to me is travelling by car and is delayed.

Our class had organized a picnic in November.I was the classrepresentative so I became the organizor.However the picnicwas postponed by one week and I had something else to do then.Initially I did not ponder on what to do and decided to go forthe picnic.When I had the time to think about it I thought thatmy decision was wrong.My classmates thought that I would go asI had signed my name but I did not go.I told another classrepresentative that I was not going but he did not know thereason behind my not going.After the picnic my classmates askedme why I had not gone to the picnic and everytime someonementioned it I was apologetic.I should have decided right inthe begining that I would not go and then they would not see meas irresponsible i.e promising to go and changing my mindafterwards.
When a colleague failed to contact me at the arranged time.
I was very happy when I received the year end results as I wasworried about how well I had done.I was very happy to know that Ihad passed.
When I saw parents punishing their little child for something hehad not done.In my opinion, even if he had done it he shouldnot have been punished for it.

After being told that an ex-boyfriend had been hurt by my wearingsomething he had given me when I was with another guy. I wasunaware of my actions really, as I had not considered the factthat he had given it to me, and might see me. I still respectedhis opinions of me.
I felt ashamed of myself the first time I drank as nobody in thefamily drinks.I felt that I had let down my parents and myfriends.
I spoke with a friend on the phone who I haven't seen in manyyears. It was a joyful event to talk to him.
I felt happy when I received the letter telling me that I hadbeen admitted to the university.
When I was on a cave excursion with friends, I suddenly lost themand was afraid of losing my way in the cave.
I thought that I was going to fail a subject and so I began tostudy for the final exam, then my friend told me that I hadpassed it.That meant that I could go home, as I do not study inmy hometown.
I forgot to zip up my trousers, this was not noticed by anyone.

I used to pinch change from my father's mantlepiece (never mymother - she didn't get enough housekeeping) and then I'd feelwhen we went to church as a family I'd felt awkward cos I feltI'm expected to go to communion and I would but I was afraid andguilty 'cos I committed a mortal sin.
I was going around with a girl without loving her.Not only didI go around with her, but we did many more things.In the end Iwas not very sincere to her.
T.V features showing the violation of defenceless people.
When I learnt that I was selected for form I.
I felt glad to live again when I went to a meeting about the\Knowledge\". There are 4 techniques of meditation that connect you with the essence of the human being."
Someone called me a disgusting nickname.
I read a book whose plot and expressions were obscene and in verybad taste.
When I heard that I had passed my end of first year exams and Iwas ready to enter 2nd year because I felt I had failed as they werevery hard.
When my father passed away.
When I was reading a book.It had nothing to do with the bookitself but with the disagreable smell of the pages of the book.
After a courtship of three months I made an end to it. The boywas very sad about this.

I've a situation of responsibility an employee who had a habit ofbeing late, came late again after promising to say he would be atwork in a few minutes, then arrived 3 hours later. He had beendrinking.
Not speaking to my sister-in-law due to lack of interest in arelationship on my side.
I was angry the other day because the teacher told me to sweepsome orange peels. It was my friends who were supposed to sweep,but the teacher told me to do it.
I thought that I had failed an examination, but when I wasinformed about the mark, I saw that I had passed it.
When my mother died in August 1978.
The breaking up of a long lasting relationship.
[ When some difference of opinion occurs in a silly situation.]
A film were a woman was attacked and raped.One did not see theworst but it had the desired effect - very strong.

I experience this emotion quite often but the day I was mostangry was the day I got pulled up for something I had not done. It happened during my school days, I had not spoken a word inclass but the monitor had written my name on the board.So Ihad a remark in my callender which I had to get signed by myparents.This remark resulted in me being spanked.
When I was caught sneaking back into the house at night afterhavinggone to a disco without permission.
I felt ashamed when I had not attended a class and the teacher askedme the reason for my absence.
While walking on the street with a good friend of mine, we met anacquaintance of hers.My friend started showing off and tellingfalse stories about herself and praising herself.
When I learnt that a boy I liked had been with a girl for threeyears.
When I noticed obvious marks of old age (in a negative sense) ona close relative of mine.
Years ago, on my way to school by the forest path I came acrossan exhibitionist.
When the paramilitary was sent to the UNZA and it started usingtear gas and started intimidating the students without anyprovocation.
When I won the first prize in a cross country race.
When diving deep into the sea to reach the floor I feltbreathless. I was cautious but I doubted I should be able to cometo the surface and inhale.
When one of my parents insinuates something about the other(they are divorced).
I \snapped\" very abruptly at my mother when she said somethingsilly and stupid, (in front of other people) she looked sodefenceless & hurt & told them that I'm always doing that."
Walking along with a dog barking at you and following you.
One evening, when I had gone fishing with my friends, we heardthe roar of a lion near by and had to run for our lives.
When I was forced to decline the invitation to my mother's 70thbirthday because of my work committments in another area.
When my boyfriend sat up half the night playing computer gameswith a friend.
One day, I was home and there was a phone call informing me thatsome of my relatives had died in an accident.
When I saw all the very drunk kids (13-14 years old) in town onWalpurgis night.

I was on my way back from the Inter Rail, on board the ferry fromStockholm when my father called me at 7 o'clock to tell me that myuncle had died and that I would be seeing him off on his finaljourney within four days.
When I saw our computer teacher.
I was watching T.V with my parents and some pornographic scenescame on, I felt uncomfortable and tried to distract my parentsattention by talking to them.
I was walking through a thick forest and there was a big snake ata distance of about four metres.
I got better marks in the examn than many arrogant people.

Because I was lazy and unthoughtful I did not get into contactwith a very close friend when she shifted from the Gold Coast toBrisbane, for a month, despite her efforts to contact me. I feltshamed when I finally confronted her again.
I felt some disgust for my boyfriend for a time, after he hadleft me.
My sister bkoke her leg.
Criticizing my mother when she refused to drive with the radio on.I told her that I thought she wasn't intelligent enough to copewith the radio.
My cut was run over by a car. After searching for a long time Ifound her lying in a kerb. I was rather shocked and angry withthe driver.

Some friends and I were crossing a street when one of my friendswas seized by a car and thrown aside. I had seen the car comingin our direction but I did not have enough time to react andprevent the accident.
My being admitted to UNZA.
During the Chinese lessons a student often showed off. Moreoverhe misbehaved and dressed very badly.So disgusting !
The stories about the way my grandmother treated my mother.
When I almost walked on a snake.
When I crashed my car and it had to be scrapped then.It was myfault and I feel depressed as I miss the car.
When I did poorly on a test and I knew that there wasn't anexcuse for not doing better. Made mistakes I could not believe Imade.
One camping night, I listened to the ghost stories told by myclassmates.
When I was a child my parents caught me with a pornographicmagazine.
My peers didn't want me to meet someone during rush for fear thatI would give her a bad outlook on our Sororoty house. I shouldn'thave seen this, but they blew and I did.

Fear is an emotion that I experience very often.Naturally thisis during exams and subsequently while waiting for the results. However there is one occassion when I was paralyzed with fear. This was when I was doing my M.A.-I, and we had a series of studentlectures.I was one of the participants and my lecture happenedto be the opening lecture.I had been confident all morning, abouttwenty minutes before the lecture, my confidence started failingme.I felt my heart go cold, my lips go dry and I was reallyparalyzed.This incident of fear is still fresh.
I do not like one of our neighbours as they are very selfish. Whenever they want something or need help they come to see us, otherwise they do not even bother about people who live next tothem.

When I still went to primary-school, I went on a ski-trip with myfamily. After skiing we went to a restaurant for lunch. Suddenlymy father said that he had forgotten something in the car. Hegave me the key and asked me to go and get it. I had difficultieswith the key which was already bent. I asked my mother to helpme. When she tried to turn the key it broke. We had no secondkey. My mother was blamed for all that and I did not say a word.
At a party, I started talking to a guy I had seen in one of myclasses. My boyfriend felt awkward and left to talk to a friendbut kept on looking at me as I talked.
Being unable to stop urinating on the bus.

My father had once again told me that I should be careful and try toseek admission to other places also apart from the faculty ofSocial Sciences at the university of Helsinki.I was not at allinterested in any other place and had no time to study for otherentrance exams.
At a prolonged separation with my family.
I felt fear when I fell down and broke my leg into pieces and Icould not feel it at all.
Did not read reference when other people read them.
My boyfriend told me that I had very high demands towards him. Inmy opinion this was wrong.
Once again, my life partner came back home drunk at midnight.
When I told a lie to a friend of my sister on April fool's day. She later came to see me and told me that it was a very foolishthing to do.
When my elder sister had a baby girl.She was the first girl inthe family after 19 years of baby boys.
Before the examn.
[ No response.]
I am ashamed of the way my father behaves with my mother andsister, and with me too.
I had an appointment downtown, and the person in question washalf an hour late.
On embarking on University life. I came from a different city anddid not know anybody at the Uni. I was frightened because my wellknown and loved friends, also all my security had been takenaway.
This monday I took a Math 1BS test and flunked for the secondtime.
I had promised to send something to a friend and it completelyslipped my mind.I felt guilty for having forgotten.
When I was a child: I had told my mother a lie and she found itout.
I had worries about a certain illness.

When I came back to my hostel, my bed was full of newspapers anddirty clothes.My room-mate asked me to wash the clothes for himas he had no time (this was his responsibility).The food weshared had been eaten up by him (I ate little).
My paternal grandmother had died. We weren't close but she wasblood. I didn't cry but I was sad, partly due to her death andpartly I think, due to the fact that I couldn't/didn't cry.

Whenever I am alone in a dark room, walk alone on the street,sleep alone in the room at night or see something which is onlypartly visible.This emotion was very strong when as an 8 yearold child I saw something horrible.
(1) My father died. (2) My natural father contacted me a yearafter my father died and this angered me more as I thought heshould be dead and not my father.

I had told my boyfriend that I did not want to go on with ourrelationship.I knew that I was important to him but I wanted tobe free.I saw that this was difficult for him but I remainedfirm and did not change my mind.
Getting back my Psych 140 midterm.
After hearing about the death of my grandfather.First I couldnot believe it, but later I wept and felt the situation washopeless.I felt lonely and wanted to be consolated.
When the relationship with my first girlfriend broke up and Irealized it too late.
When I was teasing a girl, who turned out to be my brother'sdame.
A sunny Autumn day, after a long rainy period.
When I felt lack of aid from close friends.

I had a girlfriend who lived several kilometers away from myhome. One day she wrote me that she'd visit me. On her way shehad a car accident and was badly injured. I was very sorry to seeher lying in a bed in the hospital.
My brother accused me undeservedly before my parents. I was notguilty. He was misled by his wife.
I was driving my car and it was very misty. It was in the nightand I was alone in my car. I felt totally insecure, nervous andoverstrained.
When I went home on holidays I found that my niece and nephew hadpassed away I was very sad for the children were not even sickbefore death but suddenly died.
My dog of 16 and 1/2 years - \Lord Grey\" died in his sleep - His death caused me more and deeper sadness than I thought."
Being involved in a car accident and having my thumb caught inthe glove compartment. My sister and I had a Fear of finallytelling my parents, since my sister was the driver.
Sometime ago I felt very angry when my mother wrote me telling methat my elder sister was messing up things at home by herinternalised aggressive attitude towards parents and her husband.
When I argue with my sister.It feels sometimes that I have theupper hand and I use it.I often argue better and this makes herterribly angry.
My grandfather's death.
Someone had to do a lot of efforts to make something work. Withmy help he would have finished much sooner, but I wasn't in themood to help him.
I borrowed a gold bracelet without the girl's knowledge. I had itfor so long I had to keep it. To this day I feel ashamed atmyself for having it. I never wear the thing anymore.
When I failed an exam.
I came across a woman in town who was very drunk.She wasswearing at everyone and carried on drinking even though shecould hardly stand.
I was given a wristwatch by my first girl and after two daysanother girl of mine also gave me a wristwatch.
One night I did not come home without telling my parents and Idid not want to speak about it afterwards. My mother cried. I hada bad conscience and felt guilty.
When our religion teacher presented shocking sectarian thoughtsand doom's day as official teaching.
The last time I felt it was when I was coming home late at night.
When I was charmed by my relatives.
A person that eat half of a cockroach in a cake without knowingit.
A terrible fight that I provoked with my friend.
I was afraid when I met my Uncle because this time I was with myboyfriend I thought I was not going to be given pocket money.
Once I went home totally drunk and roused all our neighbours fromsleep.
While watching the movie called \Deer hunter\" on TV, when itshowed how prisoners were treated."
Lecturers being unfair to me in reports.
My superior at the summer job swindled customers as much as hecould, and once put me in a difficult situation after which Icould not but detest him.
I had not seen my brother for five years as he was not in Spain.When he arrived at the airport, I felt great joy.
A friend asked to borrow my notes and I did not give them away(my notes too badly written)
I promised a friend that I would return a book to it's owner forhim , but I forgot to do it.
It was when a friend took me to a place and gave me as a gift myastrologycal map with the explanations of a psychologist.
A certain person whom I respect and esteem a lot pays me noattention.She keeps up appearances but shows almost no interestin me.
Staying alone in a dark place.
Saw a selfish person doing a selfish thing.

When I made the acquaintance of a certain person.

After I had managed to fail my first year at University I wasscared as to what I was going to do with my future. I didn't wanta mundane 9-5 job and yet I didn't know if I could pay my waythrough an unsubsidized year at university to settle down andcontinue my studies.
Being mistreated by other people.

My daughter was a baby and was crying to be taken on my lap. Ifelt very nervous and moved her away and went out. As soon as thefeeling of nervousness passed I was taken by an enormous feelingof guilt, for having rejected my daughter.
When I had been obviously unjustly treated and had no possibilityof elucidating this.
Railway station good-bye.
When I received the first year results as the first year hadinvolved a lot of work and I was very pleased when I got theresults.

In 1977 when my friend was caught by a crocodile.We wereswimming in a river on whose banks our primary school wassituated.When my friend was caught, he was on the banks of theriver and some of us were still in the middle of the river.Iwas very frightened.
I was on my way home by bus.A man who had drunk a fair amount ofalcohol started talking, trying to hug and pat a woman sittingnext to him.Fortunately it was not me.
After a weekend at a seminar I saw my husband again. I hurriedhome hoping he would be there. We embraced - I enjoyed feelinghis body.
A large german shepherd dog ran and barked at me (he didn't bitefortunately).
When I got separated from the man I loved so much.
Observing someone in the cafeteria noisily gulping in his food,having extremely bad manners.
When planning to marry.
Being insulted in public for the wrong reason.
When my father was ill.
When I heard that my girlfriend was talking behind my back andlooking down on me.
When I left my part-time job.
I received a letter from some friends, who do not live in Madrid,telling me that they would not come on holiday.I had arrangedeverythiing for them.
I felt ashamed to be Brazilian and to live under a militarydictatorship that despoiled the people, when during my militaryservice.
[ No response.]
When I complained to my mother about how untidy the kitchenloooked, she boxed my ears ( this had never happened before).
The day after the night I drank too much at a party.
A person I was attracted to walked me home in the rain and gotsick.
When I got really drunk on Norvegian Indipendence Day, and wasnot allowed to participate in football (soccer) games for twoweeks. That was very unpleasant.

When I forgot the birthday of my best friend and I innocentlycame to visit her one week later.
When I realized that I was directing the feelings of discontentwith myself at my partner and this way was trying to put the blameon him instead of sorting out my own feeliings.
When the mother of a good friend of mine died.
Finding out I am not good looking.

A certain friend evokes positive feelings, when I am with him butnegative feelings when he is not present. I feel the need toexpress those negative feelings. However, when I speak about him,I always think: Why do I like this, he does not deserve this, butstill I do so.
When my mother's new husband treated her and my brothers andsisters badly.
As we were going to Area 10 a dog chased me. I was afraid itmight bite me.
Looking for the toilet in a dark place.

One day during our clinical practices, we had a very ill patient.Unfortunately the patient passed away. I had seen him dying andit was the first experience. During the night I became afraidfearing the dead body.
When I was working as a nurse in a mental hospital, a patient ateup the contents of another patient's spitoon.
[ Sorry, I was never ashamed about anything in my life.]
After masturbation.

A friend suggested in a round-about way that the reason we werelate for something was because of me, and that I'm often late. Iknow this was partly true, but felt it unjustified thatparticular time and I felt I couldn't doanything about itanyway (i.e. being late).
When my boy-friend left me and I wanted to persuade him to stay.
I criticised an action of my mother and for the first time shegenuinely took notice of it. I felt shame that I was almosttaking the part of a husband, or at least an equal which I shouldnot.
On holiday, seeing the lanscape in Gerona.
I felt very frightened when a robber broke into our house andthreatened to shoot my father if he did not part with some money. I was looking at the man with his hand on the trigger.
My best frieend left school recently.The next day the weatherturned bad suddenly and the male class-mates turned off thelights.I remained on the table and was scared.
I never failed my examinations since Standard 1 but I experiencedsad moments when I sat for Standard 8 Examination and I was notselected for Secondary School education in 1978.
After an exam which I failed.
I am a Christian but I cannot find any meaning in life . Itseems that I am deceiving myself but I cannot find the way out.
When mother was very ill, I feared that she would die.
When my mother was tremendous on the phone and we talked forhours. She was in a good mood.
I was neglected undeservedly.
On a road trip with a group of sorority and fraternity people, Ibecame intoxicated and basically raped. I don't remember theactual event, but I know the feeling that I experienced later.
After having been told not to take the car, I took it anyway andfelt guilty about having taken it.
I was very angry one day when my husband ignored me and slept on a separate bed.He had no reasons to doubt me or to neglectme and I had never imagined that he could do such a thing.
When I feigned sick leave from work.
A month ago when one of my fellow workers got a promotion overme. It was just a small promotion but recognition was involved.
To have a friend who I didn't see for months, and under thecircumstances that I met him made me feel happy, and perhapsbecause it has been one of the good things that I learned withthis friend.
In a situation with my girlfriend I took a decision.Later whenI thought about it, I realized that it was an erroneous decision.
I worked together with another student on a computer-assignment.She didn't do her best and didn't prepare herself for it. Sheexpected me to explain it to her.

When my grandmother died - I wasn't sad so much that she'd diedbecause she was old, but because she lived in the last few yearsin an old people's home and had nothing very much that was hers -no chair, or private space, and when I went to visit she would besitting in the \lliving\" room the TV room. It was hopeless. And I felt awkward so I didn't go and I was sad 'cos how I couldn't."
Girl I was fond of did not initiate conversation as I expected intutorial.
My cat died from an illness.It had been with us for 7 years. It was a lovely cat.It had been ill for one or two weeks andthe veterinary surgeon had told us that it was dying.
A relationship in which I had put my trust, broke up.I was sadwhen I realized how easy it is to forget something that one hadonce regarded as great and significant.

I remember when I was a child of a storm that made me terriblyafraid. I thought that the house was coming down and that in thenext day I would be dead. Everybody was awake and I stayed allnight in bed without falling asleep.
The death of my father made me feel quite guilty, because myattitude towards him had been cold and indifferent.
Walking out from the biology building.
Stealing money from my parents when I was young.
My father began to say incoherant things concerning my brother's andmy own behaviour towards him.His biased (authoritarian) andridiculous point of view made us angry.
When I don't fulfill my obligations.
When I was dismissed from a job after having been accused of theft.
I caught a glimpse of a black-beetle.
I was once chatting with friends. Then some boys came and joinedus. These boys took all my 3 friends away and I was left alone inshame without knowing where to go from there.
Falling in love with a close friend.
When I was told that they had got tickets for me for a filmmarathon I wanted to see.
My cassmate laughed at me when I was being scolded by theteacher.
My 80 year old grandfather underwent three successive operationsduring a single year.The third operation was risky and I wasscared that he would die and feared that my grandmother would bevery sad.
When I had to go to reconciliation before converting toCatholicism but then once received - o.k.
When I tried to explain to a plumber, face to face, that thetoilet was broken and he did not believe it (it had been mendedten times).

In a tram, the ticket seller was commanding, taking the role of aleader, trying to emphasize her non-existent authority with unduestrictness towards a good-humoured drunk who could not find histicket at once.
When my children were born.
Finding out about Chinese money cannot buy foreign journals.
I felt guilty after getting really angry with a friend and havingan argument. I was being stubborn and proud, and selfish, becausemy friend let me down, through no fault of her own.
While having a discussion with a colleague of mine, I realized that herconception of man and work were similar to mine.
[ I have not felt this emotion in my life.]
When I went to see the result of an exam and saw that I hadfailed.
Got a present from my friend for my birthday.
I felt disgusted on seeing my boyfriend after our separation. One day he was begging at the mass transit railway station and atthat moment I hated him.
At the airport, eighty beer cans that I was carrying in abag spread all around while I was going through the metaldetector.
Pictures of Nazi extermination camps on a T.V program.
My mother's death.
I was subject to false accusations, and got very angry.
I was sleeping nicely until in the middle of the night when I becameawake because a friend called me for some (in my opinion)nonsens reason.
When I understood I was admitted to the Sofia University.
After lot of explanation, to fail in my work.
China not doing well in the Asian Olympic games.
When opened a box of biscuits and found worms inside.
Once I saw some children hunting a cat to death.
Being chosen to do this experiment.
I was alone at home and I could hear odd noises coming from aboveour bedroom.I knew that nobody lived there since it was anoffice.I got frightened (later I was given a \natural\"explanation)."
When I was 12 years old I frequently was pursued by others andgot sound thrashes.
When I was on holiday, walking back to where I was staying, atnight, and two men started closely following me. There was nobodyaround that I could run to.

I was looking after a dying patient at work one night, a youngwoman, my colleague was talking to her relatives and .... tooffer them any support emotionally, physically and then sent themdown to the coffee shop to have a dinner rather than offering thefacilities available for their use cause it involved her havingto do some work. Seeing them again I felt disgusted at herattitude.
A girl in our class was nicknamed \fatsy\". Later, I heard that she suffered from diabetes mellitus."
When I got a good grade for an exam in statistics.
Insulted by a teacher in front of the class.
When my dress and a few other things were stolen from mywardrobe.
Before an examn.
I felt extreme joy the day I was baptized. I was one with God.

Making an unexpected talk with a professor in the canteen. Thismade me shy.
I received a message that my elder brother was involved in a caraccident and was admitted in hospital.
NO RESPONSE.
I was camping with a friend of mine and we spent the night in theforest.I could not fall off to sleep and could clearly hearnoises from outside (steps ?) approaching our tent.
I met three drunk boys, almost children, they didn't look likenormal people.
It was when I injured a friend accidentally with a stone. It madea cut on the cheeks which resulted in suturing.
I saw a dead child which was not covered, it had been knockeddown by a car.
When I cancelled an appointment with an idle story. Afterwardsit appeared that the person had looked forward to it and reservedtime for it.
When my friends tried to discriminate against my friendship withcertain other friends which they thought was improper.
I heard part of a conversation in which one talked very low aboutwomen.
At school, I had acted against the will of the group, and thenext day they promised to take revenge on me.
A friend of mine had sex with someone of a different race on aWinnebago trip down to USC in front of everyone (all my friendsembarrassed my sorority house name).
When I got the midterm exam results, the results were belowaverage and were near the lowest.I was scared of the finalexam.
When an argument with a friend of mine over our behaviour towardsanother friend turned into a quarrel. I lost my temper and nearlyknocked him out.

Reported neighbour to police for taking to my daughter withbaseball ball - her counsellor rang me and after long talkconvinced me the woman was o.k. I felt guilty for ringing thepolice then guilty for feeling guilty about it.
The day I woke up to find that a kitten I had wanted to keep hadbeen eaten by the neighbour's dogs.It had been locked out by mywife who claimed that it had dirtied the sheets.
When I wasn't well prepared for a terminal exam and the teachertried to give me a three by asking me some very easy questions. Iburned with shame then.
When I slipped on a glazed frost road and a car almost ran intome.
This was when the girl I was in love with accepted my proposaland everything went smoothly, just as I had wanted it to.It wascontrary to my previous feelings of uncertainty about herresponse.
Some colleagues decided to go out on a Saturday not inviting meto decide either the place nor the time.
One night, walking along a park, I began to think that someroughnecks would appear suddenly with knives and things likethat.
At our Senior dinner - separated from school friends, nothingwill ever be the same again.
When one is unjustly accused of something one has not done.
When someone I trusted very much, disappointed me.
For about one year I had a rather bad relation with my father.Last Christmas Eve he invited me to stay withhim and I was veryglad about it. It was a fine evening.
When I failed my first biochemistry test.

I cannot remember a situation in which I felt ashamed. I waseating with some people and a little boy I took care of. I warnedhim often not to knock down his glass of mild. When I tookout his chair I knocked down my own glass.
Whenfell in love with my present girlfriend.
China winning the Asian Olympic games (TV).
My girlfriend was away visiting another city and I broughtanother girl home. Next morning when I started getting sober Ifelt quite ashamed of myself.
Accidentally seeing a friend in a compromising situation with astranger.
When I went to a sauna with my father for the first time (I was16). When I entered the sauna naked, I felt ashamed for a shorttime.
When someone told a secret I told them not to tell.
I slipped on butter one evening in the Dining Commons landed onmy rear causing my tray also to land on the floor.
The first time that I \played with myself\" despite being a Christian.I had read in the bible that it was wrong to make love to someone one is not married to."
When I promise to do something but I don't fulfill it.
Saw the film about Eight Nations Army conquering Beijing.
[ When friends and colleagues talk bad about me.]
Once by coincidence I clutched a stranger (in a rather intimateway), thinking it was my boyfriend. When by hindsight Ifeel ashamed when thinking about it.
I felt disgusted when my appointment to meet the E.N.T.specialist had been turned down. The specialist came from U.K.and went the same day and we do not have one.
When I heard that an acquaintance of mine was spreading rumoursabout my affair with a close friend.
When a close friend of mine collapsed and passed away and theillness was not known.

My classmate got a \B\" for his homework while I only got a \"C\".When we got the results he acted as if he did not merit this grade.I found that his humility was hypocritical and I found it disgusting."
When people next to me play the fool.

Sort of awkward. I'd introduced (a lover) but introduced as afriend to some members of my family, and my niece Yavanna who'ssix was home from school and at Mum's and Dad's and was reallysilly and at first it was ok, but it went on and on - yukky pooh!You eat your snot, etc. and I felt cross she wouldn't stop. Butshe had an audience and was in one of those moods. Once I'daccepted it was something everyone does at time I felt better -it was partly having my friend there.
I am disgusted with a nieghbour who is looking for all sorts ofquarrel with my parents and me. He feels we are hampering hisliving close to us. This has been going on for quite a long time.
When my father died.
At an examination I got a bad mark just because of a smallmistake. When I went to the lector and wanted to talk about that,he did not listen to me but sent me away.
I had thrown with the ashtray a still lighted cigarette in theplastic wastepaper basket. It had burnt out and my landlords mademe a row that I might had set their flat on fire.

I promised my friends that I would take care of something, but Ikept forgetting about it.When they asked me about it, Ipromised to do it immediately.However, I got started only aftera couple of months.I felt that I had betrayed my friends.
When they told me that I had been admitted to the faculty ofmedicine.
When my son omits to carry out certain duties at home that heknows needs doing.
Made a misjudgement in a football match.
Forgot to do some shopping that I had promised to do.
The sadistinc exacution of a student in the USA.
My brother had bowel obstruction, having heard that he was goingfor surgery, I was afraid he might not come back to life afterhearing of the General Anaesthesia.
When I found out my roommate had been talking behind my backabout very personal things.
Failing examn.
When in grade 3, late home from school every day for weeksbecause of harassment from a grade 7 boy I lied to mother aboutwhy I was home late.
A railways officer, when asked by the ticket checker to producehis tickets, got very aggressive and started abusing and usinghis authority in a very wrong way.
I feel disgusted at not having got aa \A\" in yesterday's practicals of G220."
[ When I see that the toilet is unclean.]

I was river rafting in Nev. and our boat tipped over and I wassucked under in to some rocks and got stuck and all I could thinkwas that I was going to die. And it was so quiet under the waterit seemed like no one would care or remember.
When I forgot a promise made to a friend of mine.
[ Can not think of anything.]
When I was a child, I was always afraid of my father. Just whenhe looked at me, I felt frightened.
My trouser's zipper was open when I was at a public wedding.
Being elected as class leader.
[ Never felt guilty, as I have never done anything which couldmake me feel guilty.]
I was looking after my cousin's little daughter; she fell down,was slightly injured and cried vociferously.
About a dozen girls laughed at me and I was sure that there wasnothing wrong with me.
When at school, I threw a duster at another child and hit him inthe head. The blow caused a flesh wound and I was afraid of whatwould happen to me when the teacher found out the circumstances.
Some time ago I promised to meet an acquaintance of mine and tocarry him some promised papers. I haven't done it until this day.Now I feel quite awkward when I meet him.
I had promised to help out with domestic chores and I forgotabout it.
I felt joy when my boyfriend proposed to me in marriage.
When I excreted on the mat instead of the potty.
Always when I meet the person I love.
When my friend who is close to me got engaged and did not inviteme.
I was very happy when I found out that I had passed with flyingcolours and that I had made it to the university.
When a very dirty class-mate farted in mypresence.There was aterrible smell.
When I go out with my friend with enough money and good sense toour favorite dancing.

I applied for a job of GALSO counselor and I made the strongestpossible application but was denied an interview. I feltdisgusted at the system which by promoting the cause ofminorities makes employing whites lowest priority.
After I had had a disappointment in my private life, my friend,who studies in Vienna, came to see me spontaneously.
When a colleague asked me for help at work, despite the factthat he had more time to do it than I had.
[ No response.]
When I heard that my father had passed away.
[ During my childhood when I could not get what I wanted from mybrother/sister and parents.]
Doing unexpectedly well in an examn.
When I realized that I had three more examinations to take.
One day I was busy day dreaming along the road and suddenly Iheard the sound of jamming car braked behind me. I woke up frommy dreams and it was about to crash me.

We had come back from a programme and we were all (three girls) staying over at another girls placce.One of them startedpassing very nasty and outright bitchy remarks at me.It wasbrought on by a male colleague's compliments to me, this girl washerself interested in this guy.Bitchiness and catty remarksmade by women never fail to disgust me.I can particularlyremember this incident as she knew that I had not encouraged the guy.
When the week for Exams came. I got afraid as to how I wouldtackle the questions.
I was pregnant and thought that by not having the baby I wouldhurt the father like he did me regardless of the life we hadcreated.

I woke up in the middle of the night as I had jumped and shoutedwith fear.I thought that someone's cold hand or somethingsimilar had touched my hand.I crept down under the covers andwent back to sleep.
When I fought with my friends.
I felt disgusted when a fellow student asked me to marry him.Ihad not expected this from him as he was a mere friend.
I felt this emotion when my name was announced on the radio thatI had been selected to come to Lilongwe School for HealthSciences to take a training course as a Medical Assistat.
Before getting back the results of a test in school, when I hadworked very hard and was worried about not succeeding.
A few days after I had finished the relationship with myboyfriend, we had a quarrel. Then he hit me. At that moment Ifound him disgusting.

I had fixed a meeting with my classmates and I missed it as I wastired.Besides everyone at the meeting was a stranger to me andI did not want to make friends with them.Whatever the reasons - I felt guilty.
Passing (by car) over a bridge where only one car could pass. Therewas a precipice on both sides, no protection grilles, and thebridge was completely muddled.
At a carneval-party I smooched with a man - some days later I wasrather ashamed for that.
When I got an unexpected letter froma guy, who had been my schoolmate.
I am the secretary of an association, and during the last meetingI forgot to take the minutes.
My friend got married and went abroad, this made me feel sad andlonely.
While he was drunk, my life partner tried to hit me.I feltscared and fled to the bathroom.
When a friend of mine told me that he was going to commitsuicide.
When I am alone at night after having read horror stories, andthen I heard unexplainable noises.
When I talked maliciously about a colleague at work to someoneelse.Immediately afterwards I felt ashamed.
I was in the Korean War. We were attacked with mortars, me andcompanion. We stopped the jeep and ran for cover. Fortunatelyneither of us was hit but we both came close to being killed.
I won a sport contest.
When the neighbour of a friend of mine was stabbed to death bythieves in Kabwe.They stole his van.
When I was in the canteen of the United college I mistook astranger for a classmate as I was not wearing my glasses.Irealized that I had made this mistake when I saw him againcarefully.
Finding out that a boy I do not like is in love with me.
My boyfriend's mother, whom I had not met earlier, made anunexpected visit.I was lying lazily on the bed, reading anewspaper and my boyfriend was studying.
After a quarrel with my mother in which matters were \inflated\" enormously."
Just before I started my study I had to move, I was very afraidto be left alone and that I could not manage it.

I had been living in an overseas city and made the decision toleave the city and come home about 12 months before I met a wholenew set of friends, leaving them at the airport was sad andtraumatic as they had helped me in many ways and I knew Iwouldn't see many of them again.

When my friend failed an exam by just one mark.During this examshe had asked me to show her my answer sheet and I had not doneit.When the results came out, I thought that had I shown her myanswer sheet she would have passed the exam.I felt guilty as Ihad failed her.

When I had achieved a goal indirectly. I work for CAL Footballand our 2nd win of the season was very gratifying and broughtour joy because of the hard work involved and the fact that noone expected we would win.
When I committed a sin mentioned in ANGER. A sin of sexualimmorality.
I passed an exam which I thought I had failed.
I was angry with a person who behaved terribly at a balloffending her relatives.
It was in 1983 September when MCE results were being announced onthe radio. When I heard my name that I had done well I just keptquiet. I was so happy that I couldn't even talk.
I don't remember about a situation when I have experienced thisfeeling. Maybe it was when I saw a drunkard in the street.
Not finishing homework in time.
The day that my boyfriend appeared at home with a pair of ringsfor our wedding.
I was working in a job in which I could not work quickly enough,and was told that my work was not up to standard.
When my grandparents moved to another part of the town.
I detested my father who was a drunkard.He would rave,threaten and blame my mother and me.He finally drove us awayfrom home.
Having failed to help with the 5th of March arrangements (Women'sDay), although I had previously promised to take part in thework.
My grandfather died thirteen years ago.
Guilt - because I had not written to my sister for months beforeshe died.
When I had to plunge in a swamp of fetid and stagnant water.
When my brother (5th in the family) passed away.
When I learned that several people had died in the street due to the cold weather.
Alone in the house (late 8pm) I heard noises. Sounded like someonewas trying to get in our back door.

When I first saw the state of a cafeteria in the grounds of theuniversity. Due to students own lack of concern for theenvironment in which they eat and drink. Rubbish and spilled teaand coffee left everywhere.

A friend of mine was drunk and having an argument on the streetwith a woman, appparently his girlfriend.I was walking on theother side of the street and thought that I was not supposed tointerfere.Later I heard that he had shot himself that evening.
When my daughter was born.
When my best friend started getting involved in my privateaffairs.
[ Generally, when I am late in attending to matters (for examplepaying bills).]
During the short period of my unemployment about six years back.
Mugged while on holiday in the U.S.A.
[ No response.]
I do not have accomodation on the campus so I stay with myextended family, one young man used bad words while asking me toleave their home.
I was out with a friend in a place where it was very, very busy.When we wanted to go I bumped a person, who dropped his glassbeer I offered a new one but he didn't accept it.
Before the department meeting my friend ate a dish that I hadprepared for this meeting.
Finding out that some students are getting good reports they donot deserve.
I was late meeting someone for an appointment.

Put down by my father - at a family outing at mutual familyfriends dinner. Told \Not to Speak\". The attitude by him was negative/I was in mid 20s, I had done many things - a wide range of experiences. Probably greater than he."
Not finishing my duty as a class leader.
The same for guilt would apply.
I overturned in a canoe a few years back and I didn't know how toswim. Although I had a life-jacket on I still panicked.
I tried my level best to care for my client, I took anappointment with a doctor and before meeting the doctor heexpired - a poor small boy from Uttar Pradesh.
One night,when I was in primary 5 or 6, I felt thirsty so Ifetched the thermos to pour a cup of water for myself.Then Isaw my brother lowering his head and I, jokingly, poured thewater on his head.
I stayed at home for a period because I felt depressive and Ineglected my study when people adked me, I told them that I hadfreeterm and studied hard. I felt ashamed for my behavior andlies.
Dead rat in the kitchen of the university.
While doing some calculation exercises, I neglected a part of it,though I had marked it as done.By chance, I was asked todemonstrate this very part on the blackboard.
Receiving notification that I had made a successful applicationto the Speech Therapy course at Uni, gave me a very good feeligof achievment and joy.
I live outside Graz - so I have to go by bus. One day I went homefrom the bus stop alone. It was dark, I had to go through aforest and there was a dark figure behind me. I was veryfrightened.
I called off a relationship with one girl so I could see another.
When my boyfriend told me that it would be difficult for him tomarry me.
When I began to read a thick book, which I had a limited time toread.Also when I have a lot of work to do and I cannot keep up.

I work at a day care centre, and one day when the children wereoutdoors a four-year old boy disappeared from the yard.I wasnot looking after them then, but as the manager it was me who wasresponsible.
I had never made a malicious joke in front of my boyfriend. Lastweek I did it I was funny, he loved it, and I died of shame.
When I lost my father on the 25th of September,1970.He died ofa sore on the leg.
When I was substituted in a play which was to be staged, after Ihad learnt all the lines.
Once, when I was ten, I could not remember why my mother was soangry.She fainted suddenly and I was very scared as I did notknow what to do .
Lost my girl-friend.
I have a fobic anxiety for elevators. This anxiety is worst atthe moment when the doors have to open. I have it often in theelevator at our university.
I went out dancing and found my boyfriend kissing another girl.
When a good friend of me told me one evening that she didn't wantto live anymore.
When I heard that my Uncle had passed away in a road trafficaccident.
When I was left alone at home one night by my brother.
We were riding in a friend's car.He was driving very fast andsuddenly a another car crossed the road in front of us.Myfriend had to turn the car rapidly.
Once I had to clean a lavatory which was obstructed.It was in afriend's country house and there was nobody there to help me.
[ No response.]
When I tried to put up a tent some years ago, I was teased andhindered by my cousin.
I told a lie about someone to someone else and they found outand questioned me about it.
I feel ashamed when I act dishonestly toward somebody.
I was dominated by a certain person and even though I knew it Icould not change my own reactions.
When I was hungry, I tried to take the money that my motherhad saved up for something else.
When I offended my parents without wanting it.
I got a very nasty electrical shock when I was tampering withsome electrical applainces.

One day I was chatting with children at home. Then I took a lumpof soap and gave to one of them pretending that it was a sweet. Ithought the child would realise that it was not. Unfortunately hedid not and he put it in his mouth.
When my girl and I decided to get back together after ourseparation.
The editor changed the heading of an article that I had written. He considered the heading to be derogatory towards the person I had writtenabout.
When my grandfather died.
I was going away, leaving a dear person behind.
When my grandfather was in a nursing home when I was young I neverwanted to go and sometimes didn't have to and later I feltguilty.
We were driving at night and I realized that a car was followingus.
This situation occurred when I entered into a smelling ward.
When I got a wedding ring of diamond from the boy I loved.

My mother and father had forbidden me to ride my scooter on theroad, and I had transgressed (together with the \wild\" kids fromacross the street) by riding my scooter down a steep hill nearour house. My mother sent the boy next door to collect me, and Iwas severely scolded."
When I deliberately engineered a situation to cause tensionbetween friends so as to bolster the impression one of them hadof me !

It was the first time I met him (my boyfriend Mr.W).It wasduring the first term Summer vacations.We met each other whilehanding in our homework.He invited me have a trip with him andwe were together till 8 P.M.

My mother and my grandmother were talking about one of mygrandmother's friends whom I hardly know. I gave some deprecatorycomments on him whereupon my grandmother told me that the man haddied recently.
Left alone in dark when young.
Small car accident. Black ice on the road - cars in front of usstarted zig-zagging and so did we. Car in front did a 180¦ turn wefollowed and ended up in a gully.
I was biking with my boyfriend, the sun shining after a longperiod of bad beather, afterwards we spent the evening and nighttogether.
I once stole a shirt from the Department Store in which I work. Ihave been promoted to work in a very privileged section of thestore. Their belief in my integrity makes me feel even guiltier.

When I was taking the 11th standard exam, my friend who was sittingbehind me asked me for some answers.The teacher looked at usjust then and scolded both of us.Everyone started looking at usand I felt very guilty.
I was angry this morning when I missed the train to university.
Reading literature on AIDS/homosexuality.
When bathing at surf beach & lost togs.

During a ski tour with a friend, we two had drunk too much. Whenwe went down the slope on ski, I lost my friend who had lost hisway. I thought that something must have happened to him (hefinally arrived but after a very long time).
I offended my mother.
When my ex-girlfriend and I discovered that there was a certain riskof her being pregnant.
When I had an argument with my grandfather the day my youngerbrother was born.
If a close relative's life is in danger.
I attended a ceremony in Denmark which is comparable to ourHalloween. They build a large bonfire and place a life size dummyof a witch. The crowd cheered when the dummy burst into flames.
When I saw all the starving people in Ethiopia on T.V.It feltawful to see such suffering.
When I could not attend the college picnic due to somedifficulties.
I was inside the car with my husband and we were assaulted with agun at 10 o'clock in the evening.
DO NOT REMEMBER.

I used to play with a group of classmates and I found out laterthat they were cheap in thought, behaviour and conduct - theywould smoke, fight and speak foul language.I thought that theydestroyed the image of college students.
Like guilt - the most ashamed I have ever felt was when I beganto feel guilty about having sex with my boyfriend when it wasonly \the thing to do\", and not really an act of love."

I was a passenger in a jumbo-jet which was accelerating down therunway and almost at the point of take-off, when the pilotsuddenly braked and put the engines into reverse thrust, in anobviously urgent attempt to stop the aircraft. The hostesses showsigns of concern and my first thought was that something was onthe runway in our path and that we were in danger of hitting it.

Before I went to the urologist's I was afraid for severalreasons: because it was for the first time, because the medicalcheck-up might be painful, because of the uncertainty and becausesomeone had informed me about it.
My grandfather died, I went to the mortuary and saw the corpse.
When I was walking on the street, I slipped on the dung of a dog.I did not fall down, but I felt disgusted by the bad smell on mysole.
I had to change a baby's clothes for the first time.
Recently, my sister-in-law's horse was poisoned by a plant anddied. The horse was very obedient and exceptional with children.
When my fellow classmates were involved in a quarrel.
When I got drunk at a party and made a fool of myself byvomitting all over the place and insulting the people who werethere with me.
When my grandfather was sick, and died I felt more sad, though,when he was sick.
I didn't do an important job and it had an adverse effect onother people.
Finding that a subordinate at work was still not willing tocooperate after discussions to try and resolve an attitudeproblem.
I realised that someone was insidiously attempting to shit me offI was disgusted with him for doing so, because I afforded himwith no excuse to do so.
At night when I was alone at home (all the family members usuallyget together at that time) someone knocked vigorously on thedoor.

When my grandmother, who has been living with us for 14 years,had a stroke and was left paralysed on one side. She has beenquite close to our family and to see her suffer in this way makesme feel really sad.
I was in a very small class and the professor said somethingabout me that made everyone look at me at the same time.
When my middle child became very difficult to handle after thebirth of his baby brother and I did not have any patience withhim.

My sister once stole my mother's money and made her very angry. After this my mother would beat her up for unreasonable reasons. One day my sister lent her book to a friend without telling mymother about it.When my mother learnt this she beat her up andeven threatened her with a pair of scissors.
When my son has a pain in his leg (for no apparent reason).
My best friend chosen for your English lectures.
When my father did not get back from Chipata on time, he was thusholding back progress as everything depended on him.I feltangry over his actions.
I had a habit of wetting my bed when I was young.One day, whenI was invited to my friend's place to stay for the night, ithappened again.I was ashamed of myself.
When I was little I lost control of my bike and started to gointo a buay intersection but my neighbor stopped me just in time.
When the whole family gets together for a one week holiday. Everybody feels free and the trip is well planned.It works outwell and we enjoy ourselves.
When I saw a film in which there was a scene where women were cutto pieces.Above all, it was the blood and the confusion whichimpressed me most.
My brother and I were driving to Brisbane when he drove back ontothe road, perhaps cutting off another car but not noticeable -this driver did his best to drive us off the road for about 1/2an hour.
A close friend travelled to another country. When I knew that hewould only come back after many years, I felt very sad.
When I received the acceptance form for the second year atuniversity.
My mother had just been teaching me how to crochet, which isthought highly improper for a boy in a town.Just when wefinished, a neighbour walked in.
Not getting the reference paper.
I once failed a test miserably and my friend did very well andsomeone made a nasty comment while comparing me to my friend.
I had not done my assignment seriously.I only pretended tofinish the work as the work did not have any meaning for me.Thewhole thing made me feel guilty.
Sometimes when I go to work my crazy boss (a hyper Jewish lawyer)insists I do things his way (filing, typing, etc.). He sometimesblames me for things I didn't do, and I can't yell back at him.
An invitation to spend 5 days at the seaside with all expensespaid.
Following an argument with my brother, he broke my golf clubs.
When I hurt a person's feelings.
My elder brother had been expelled from college and he was sofrustated that he attempted suicide - he drank bottle fragments. I was very sad when I learnt this.
When I decided not to out any longer with a girl whom I likedquite a lot.This made me feel low for a some time.
Someone told me we are not as good as the All English Class.
When my friend, as usual, forgot the tickets at home for aperformance.We missed it.
The last time I felt sad and disappointed was when I did not doas well as I had hoped in one of the final exams.As comparedwith the earlier exams, the questions, I think, were unjust.

One day, early morning my mother who is healthy fell ill.Therewas no doctor or compounder near by and for a few hours -8 A.M to6 P.M she did not speak a single sentence, nor did she drink waterormilk.There was no movement in her body and I felt reallyscared.I almost lost my confidence about her survival.
It was when I stepped on a python (snake) unknowingly while itwas sleeping near a baobab tree.
Found money on the road and returned it to the owner throughpolice.
I lost my purse that had money in it. I was sad until I found it.
China cannot give your lectures bigger place and sound system.
I felt fear when I sat for one of my exams. Though my fear wasnot quite justifiable, I still remember about it.
Finding myself alone in a public toilet block with a man known tohave had great psychological disturbances.
Had to tell people that my parents are divorced.
[ When my elders do not understand me in the right way.]
When biking and I felt very bad (problems with heart andrespiration).
At work being shifted to another area.

An item which belonged to a friend of mine was missing.I hadtaken it earlier and I thought that I had returnrd it so when heasked me for it I stubbornly refused having it.Later when Ilooked for it, I found it in my room.
Risk of being involved in a fight after a party.
When I fell in love.

When I was 4, we spent our holidays at the seaside. My sister andher friend wanted to go to a bay on an undangerous way. I wantedto arrive before them and went on a shorter, but more dangerousway. When I arrived, I found nobody there. I waited for a longtime, but nobody came. On my way back I met my mother who hadbeen searching for me desperatly. She did not scold me, but I sawhow much she had worried (herself).

I felt disgust about all my friends. After having done a greateffort to organize an evening together, and didn't work out, theyput the blame on me. After this, I feel disgust towards those thatblame me.
Before taking an exam.
I was very sad when I heard that my brother had failed thestandard 8 exams for the third time.
Watching the Asian Olympic game (China winning).
When I found out that I had passed the last two exams by amargin of three marks.
My mother caught me stealing some food when I was a youngboy.

During the Xmas holiday, I and my best friend at Secondary Schoolhad planned to meet at a Cultural afternoon at the Mt. SocheHotel after missing each other for such a long time. When I askedmy mother for permission, she told me not to go for no goodreason. I felt very angry with her.
I was with a group of people and everybody told me to do or saysomething.It was a confusing, strong and traumatic situationfor me.
I was together with my family one night, a few days after myfather had died, during that conversation I expressed mydispleasure because nobody understands me.
When I was accepted into the medical school.Medicine is aprofession that I have desired ever since my childhood.
I had a girlfriend which I used to call regularly. Then I didn'tphone her for a while. At a certain moment I felt a littletension which became worse.
My father and I had an argument because I do not help enough athome.
Adolescent guilt growing up feeling \bad, immoral\" sexual desires, some 10yrs ago."
In our flat the bath-tub is in the kitchen. At the beginning Ihad very intensive feelings of shame when I had a bath and peoplewere in the kitchen.
Forgot to collect post for a friend.
A boy I had been admiring so much asked me to go out with him.
Saw Chinese people flattering foreigners.
When I was beaten up by thieves on behalf of some friends of mineas they thought that I had a lot of money and would not partwith a few coins for their drinks.
My friend was so intoxicated that the police came and took himaway, and they later contacted his parents.
I felt disgust as a result of one of my midterms - I thought Ihad prepared well for it, but the end result wasn't what I hadexpected.
When my demand for accomodation on the campus was refused and therooms were allotted to first year students who were from \Rucher\" and came from influential families."
A party I went to last Christmas.
When my father found me in bed with a girl, we were deep in actioonwhen he entered the room.
When I witnessed an accident.
Quarrelled with my younger brother.
Once I was stopped by the police in Spain, when I had some\grass\" in my tobacco."
A boy I look after for the probation service deliberatelyoffended to provoke a reaction from the police.
I was joyful when I received a present (2 books and a pencil)from the headmaster in standard 6 because I had passed, I becameNo 1 and he said I was one of the pupils who had good behaviour.
I found a big black beetle in my coffee cup. It was alive big andit was moving its limbs.
Once I offended a friend, instead of her coming to me to ask anddiscuss the matter she was just telling other people about it andsay all she could about me.
I found I was pregnant and unmarried.
When my father revealed inconsistent morals.
I was in \Hainburg\" in December and I was angry about thepoliticians and the police."
Having to decide on a termination of a pregnancy, afterdiscussing it with friends, family and the man involved.
After the funeral of an acquaintance I felt very depressed. Thatfeeling turned into joy when I heard that I had achieved a goodgrade for an examination.

Before Christmas I got to know a girl but our relationshop couldnot consolidate before the holiday. Therefore it was a bigsurprise to get a carefully hand-made present from her. - Ourrelationship grew closer.
During a family discussion on my future and my prospects as astudent, they accused me of not bothering about looking for a job toassume my financial situation.
When I found out that I had failed to pass my exams during theterm by one point.The fact that exactly the same thing hadhappened last term did not help.

My parents are divorced, father pays alimony for me. Two yearsago my sister who lives with father, suddenly asked mother formoney. As she considered the amount of money my mother offeredher too small, she brought an action against mother. I wasterribly angry with my sister.
I had fear when I was left alone at the bus depot at night. I hadproblems of how to move to this place.
Last night I had a chat with a fellow student.I had known herfor about half a year, and for the first time we were speaking\the same language\"- meaning an inspiring discussion andencounter."
Running away from a fire.
At a party, on New Year's Eve, I met on old friend whom I had notseen for some time
When I feel helpless after having tried to help someone withoutany result.
When I went to the pub with a large group of friends, we drankand danced.
I met my friend and he gave me a wonderful present as it was mybirthday.I enjoyed having that present.
This situation happened when my friend me with a knife which Istole from him.
When I got divorced from my husband after ten years of marriage.
I haven't often felt this feeling. Once someone stole my garment.
My teacher reminded us not to do a Summer job, however I did itfor two months.Yesterday I was chatting with my teacher andwhen we talked of the Summer job, I felt ashamed.
Watching a violent movie.
Finding out that life span in China is shorter than in the West.
I got lost in a foreign town. I did not know the language of thatcountry and it took me hours to meet my friends again.
I was said to be responsible for my mother getting ill andgrowing thin. I did not realize that it really was my fault untilseveral weeks later.
My sister said I am not a stable person, and I think she isright.
Motorcyclistic accident where for some minutes I didn't know if Iwas alive or dead, I remained \cold levered\" during the situation but felt great fear."
Not finishing homework in time.
I was most disgusted when I had to make a nagging three dayjourney recently from Calcutta to Bombay.It was very boring andtiring.
When my parents complimented me very nicely on something.
When I thought for an instant that a very good relationship witha person had finished.

Going to Cowell Hospital and finding out tediously that I had astress fracture. The anger came when the senile doctors found out4 weeks later that I had 2 stress fractures in one foot andshould have had crutches. I was in distinct pain and barely couldwalk to classes. They said it would be better in 2 weeks.
On Christmas day a drunk man came to our house without a shirton, he dansed, spoke nonsense and behaved stupidly.
[ Laziness makes one sad.]
Last night, I dreamt that things that looked like monsters weretrying to kiss me.
Found out that my grandmother might have been misdiagnosed as apsychiatric patient because the doctor did not know aboutneurologism.
Did very, very well on a Physics midterm.
I moved to a flat. A friend who had lived there before, had leftthe flat in a terrible mess. I was very angry about thatsloppiness and impudence.
First public speaking.
When a boy I hated most in our classroom took my T Jersey from mydesk and put it on.
When a very close friend of mine went into hospital for a majoroperation and I couldn't see her for a while as I was not arelative she had no relatives in N.Z.
Not handing in homeworks in time.
My sweatheart were away on a trip, and then she got problems.
A meeting with the family and the friends I felt dear and loved,sharing the gladness of being together at a birthday.
Not quick enough to help the lectors to catty things for thelecture.
Left alone in the dining hall at night.
Losing my temper to my sister.
When I learned that a relative had been spreading rumours aboutme.
When they found out that I was absent from school, I had gone tothe girl's secondary school.
Not winning a medal in the swimming contest.
The acts of brutal violence in generally disgusts me. Fights,phisical aggrssion, etc.
Afraid of getting alone without friends, without anybody.
I felt disgusted when I was in a restaurant which didn't appearto be clean and orderly. (I do not like to be in uncleanenvironments).
When I got a letter offering me the Summer job that I had appliedfor.
I feel this feeling most often before me not before the others.My outside is iron but actually I'm wasting away.
I was in hospital, and then was visited by someone quiteunexpected.
[ No response.]
I told evil lies about a close friend of mine.I was evil inorder to sound jolly, to charm a person whom I wanted to impress. I sold my friend, I was despicable.

In the house where I live there is a new flatmate. His friendsunfortunately are the dirt of society, intelligent, fashonable,rich and bored. At a party recently they were doing things Ididn't like done in my house. I felt angry at them.
I went to spend a night with a relative of mine and there Ifound that the bed had been wet the previous night.
At a weekend's seminar my trousers suddenly burst, therefore I wasprevented from participating in several activities.
An exam where questions about very specific knowledge were asked.
Our boarder burping after meals !

A sudden doubt made me run for a long time in a rainy autumnnight. When I reached the intended place I saw my beloved inanother man's arms. A sudden blow, grief, I cannot qualify it, itis painful for me to remember about it.
I had written a \love-letter\" to a class-mate of mine, this was meant to be a joke.Unfortunately it fell in the wrong handsand I had to face the consequences."
I had to leave my girlfriend for 4 weeks because of my studies.This happens frequently. The last 24 hours before my departureare always very depressing.
NO RESPONSE.
When I wet my bed at boarding school.
I had a dream about my fiancTe leaving me and making an end toour relation.
One day in the intimity with my girlfriend I had an ejaculation.
When I was admitted to a certain school as a student.
I once watched the series called \Dynasty\" on TV, and I detestedit."

A similar feeling I felt quite recently while travelling in ataxi. The driver treated me roughly and dishonestly - he chosethe longest route, he overdrawed almost one lev more and he triedto be intimate with me.
I was very drunk at a certain wedding party and I got involved ina fight.
When I was accepted for my third year (G-10) at my formersecondary school.

We had promised, with a friend of mine, to take our friends to arestaurant and after having looked for a place for hours withoutfinding one, and not being helped by the others we had to give upthe idea.
When I have suffered a terrible fit of eating, that frequentlyoccurs. Then I eat everything, I act like a glutton I eat bigamounts of food, sometimes even half a loaf.
I was wearing slippery shoes and I tumbled down in a place wherethere were many people walking by.
after getting a fail notice for a math class, I realized I wasnot doing very well in school in any subject. I began to fearfailing a class or two.
One day in a clinic, the father of a child came in and assaulteda colleague for something that she had not done deliberately.

Some noisy guests arrived at the hotel.I had been slightlyirritated earlier.At night when I was trying to sleep they werehaving a party so I went and yelled at them.I wanted to sleepas I had to get up early the next day.
Being together with my best friend.

I was looking after my father's sheen in the forest. One daywhile playing with friends from neighbouring villages the flockescaped me and went into a far place. It became dark and I wasafraid of father. I went home and hid myself.
Someone being arrogant to me.
When I was told that my daughter, who is at a boarding school,was very ill and that they needed me there the same day.
When I failed the grade seven exams.
When I was denied my favourite dish at the dinning hall (shimawith roast chicken), I felt disgusted.
When I finished a love affair where I was responsible of the sadend.
A late Saturday night I found myself locked in the centralunderground station of Stockholm with a group of 50 hard rockerswho were drunk and equipped with various kinds of chains, etc.
Losing my temper and allowing myself to act childishly by yellingand screaming at a person who I felt had done me wrong - ineffect lowering myself to their level.

I am disgusted by people who spoil their identity because ofmisbehaviour.This morning when I was in a crowded bus, I founda seat on which a university student was sitting on one side andhe had put his bag and files next to him.There was very littlespace left and I sat down while he kept on reading.Even when Ileaned on him he did not put his bag away.He did not respond andI felt very angry.
When I learnt that I had been accepted at UNZA.
Someone stole a K10 note and the teacher thought that it was mewhen I was not responsible for the theft.
In a dark street at 4 o'clock in the night and there wascomplete silence.

Once after falling in love, I imagined that particular girl to beperfect and completely overshadowing my girlfriend. Afterwards Irealized that this image was not objective. I felt guilty againstboth girls.
[ Can not remember.]
I was sad when I saw that a beautiful girl was not attainable.

The day the results of the certificate exam came out.I went toschool and at first I did not feel frightened.By the time Ireached the fourth floor ( the results were being given on thefifth floor) I found it difficult to walk and felt that I woulddie.
I felt very sad when I was in Form three to notice that my friendBarley Jumbe, had lost very expensive new sports short trousers.
When I failed an exam last Summer.I had worked very hard for itand I was very disappointed thinking that it was hopeless tocontinue at college.I did overreact.
When the relationship with my girlfriend broke up.
The shame came when I was beaten by my teacher at school in frontof boys and girls some of whom were my friends and a girlfriendapart from being classmates.
When I was driving home afterseveral days of hard work, therewas a motorist ahead of me who was driving at 50 km/hour andrefused, despite his low speeed to let me overtake.

I feel shame every time I think of very dear friends of mineabroad who were family to me for a year, and now 2 years later, Ihave attempted, but have not actually gone through withcorresponding with them, to express my feelings and gratitude.
In traffic I often get relatively angry with other drivers.Several transgressions make me mad, especially not yielding topriority traffic (e.g. coming from the right).
I received a letter of acceptance from UNZA.
When a classmate of ours knocked on our door at 2 o'clock in themorning.I was disgusted at his behaviour.
When i was asked to be a child's godmother.
When I applied for a false travelling claim allowance and later Ithought that I would be found out.
Arriving in New Zealand as a teenager - first overseas trip -something \exhilarating\" about the change of scenery etc."
I had a quarrel with my father, because I was of the opinion thathe decided in an authoritarian way which TV program we shouldwatch. I became very angry and started throwing things throughthe room.
When I had to leave home to go to some other place to study.
When we forced a friend to chew a poisonous herb in primaryschool.His tongue was swollen and he told his mother about it. The mother reported it to the headmaster who threatened to expelus.
Finding out that China does not have enough foreign currency tobuy books.
At a party my best girlfriend got really drunk and went off witha guy she knows I really like.
Realizing that school will soon be over, and we will all godifferent ways, perhaps never meeting again our friends from thisyear.
I felt sad when I was despised by another person.
I was riding with a friend in his car. At a speed of 120 km/h onthe snow-covered motorway I would have liked to get out.
A quarrel with my mother because I thought she said veryunreasonable things about me, that hit me strongly.
I felt guilty when I lost K43 for my friend when he was arrested.
Getting drunk and creating a lot of trouble at a place I respect- my friend's home.
My younger brother destroyed and gave away some of the books thatI had intended to keep for as long as possible.
One evening, I was with a group of friends having a talk.Therewas a very trustful and joyful atmosphere.
I was caught doing something bad and I bribed the person whocaught me.Later I felt very bad, maybe I should have paid formy bad behaviour.
Cannot recall the emotion with any force.
When another person's mother died.

I was angered by a classmate who poured soup on to my clothes. Hewas trying to use a short-cut method in getting his supper.Coming behind my back, he wasn't noticed by me and as I wasretreating from a hungry congested people I knocked his platewith my head. He didn't accept being wrong but blamed me forpouring his soup.
My son was registered to get admission in grade one of theprimary school.The chances of him getting a place there was 1/10. Two weeks later I was informed that he had been enrolled.
When my mother met with a serious accident and there was dangerthat she would not survive and if she did she would looseher memory.
Hit a dog with my car, and didn't stop.
When I asked my classmate to teach me to do my homework, he askedme to study by myself first but I did not do it.When he asked me if I had studied, I felt very ashamed.
A friend who shares the room with me, opened the window in themorning and left the room the whole day. When I came home in theevening, the room was so cold that I couldn't stay there.
When my daughter began staying away from classes - at the age ofnine only.
When I was teaching a student started making silly remarks inclass.
When I wished secretly and lied to a friend of mine because Ididn't want her to stay in my house on the beach (as she alwaysdoes), and wouldn't stick on me.
I felt ashamed when my parents found out that I had deceivedthem.
Dog dirt which thaws in the spring.
The event which got me angry got also an aversion in me.
Out on a weekend with a group of people, everybody felt irritatedbecause at night the music didn't stop in time. And at breakfastmy boyfriend ran away because we didn't agree with him. I feltangry.
When I was in a Christian institution, sometimes the nuns wouldsend back the people who came to visit us when it was not thevisiting hours.This disgusted me.
Saw someone licking his dining bowl.
When I checked my examination paper and realized that I had beencareless, thoughtless, lazy and hasty so as to make unnecessarymistakes concerning things I know and understand.
A close friend of the family died.
When I realized that I was far behind the others in the languagecourse and I could no longer catch up with the others.
During the English lesson we were required to do a play.A fewdays after doing it the teacher asked us to do it again at a meeting and I forgot my part.
It happened when I still went to school: I got closer to a girlbut I considered it only as an \affair\". Only much later I realizedhow painful this must have been for the girl."
The dying of a close member of the family.
