I met a woman who was looking for our house. She stopped me but Iran away. When I arrived at home I found the same woman and shetold my parents what had happened so I felt ashamed.
When people/press analyze a particular newsworthy item (CALFootball team) which I am a member and can only see the situationin a bad light and always put the team down.
In an express bus I sat on a seat meant for senior citizens andinvalids.

A Maori language oral test, yeaterday - Although I had studiedintensely - once in the examiners room \I blew it\" -I was so nervous I couldn't reply easily - It was very important, but I got only blankness."
My parents scolded me a lot for something I had not done.It wasmy sister who had done it.
My boyfriend decided to make an end to our relationship.
Watching a horror film.
My friend told me in a fairly loud voice the blunders shecommitted last night.
When I could not find my 2 year old daughter.I ran and lookedfor her everywhere and could not find her.(I finally found her,she had gone to bed to sleep)
Meeting generally dominating persons in social occasions.
I was sad when my MCE grades were out. I had gone for a footballmatch a mile away from home. The mail found me there. I wasdisappointed and didn't play the other half of the match.
I broke my Uncle's Radio player accidentally and so I feared thathe was going to cut me off from going to his house as well asplaying it again.
Walking in the dark and thinking about ghost stories.
My father stayed abroad for one year. He does not like to writeletters because he makes ortographic mistakes. I never had a goodrelation to him. He wrote me a letter in which he said that heloved me.
My dog had been run over and died near the house.We had to pickhim up, cold and glassy eyed, to get rid of the corpse.
When I accepted a lunch invitation from a past male friend.
I once proposed my own niece whom I did not know but I discoveredafter she was my girlfriend.
When I was travelling at night.
When my affairs with the girl I love settled positively.
When my mother entered surgery for a quadruple heart bypass. Ifelt intense fear at the time she was actually wheeled away.
After having left the company of someone who gave me a lot ofsupport and made me laugh, found myself alone for days on end.
An inter-college basket-ball match.
When my beloved girlfriend got married to another person.
Being in love for the first time.
Getting into this university to do medicine.
To be kissed by soembody I didn't expect to.
That my brother and father are into alcohol, two men withpriviledge. Not using it positively.
I am not good enough for your experiment I am doing.
My 21st birthday celebration, when I cut the cake and receivedthe presents.
When my sister was very ill and was admitted to the hospital.
When a close friend, residing in the hostel, lost his father Ireally pittied him and the situation made me feel sad.
Not being able to hand in homework in time.
A mother who shouts at her child for nothing.

When I left my sister's house after staying there for a few days.She has two little boys, and they are very warm people (thefamily). At the time, I was in need of this sort of contact, andI grew very fond of children (no, I'm not a paedophiliac).
Attempted rape by 5 guys - held my arms behind my back andmolested me, constantly threatening to beat me. Penetration didnot occur as the driver of the car stopped that.

I had a discussion with my girl-friend. After some time westarted to quarrel and at least - to get the upper hand - I saidthat she was not as important to me as she might believe. Sometime later I apologized for that.
Day I received my T.E. score and acceptance into my chosen course.
First time going out with a boy and other people laughed at us.
When a girl said in my back that we were in love, and she hadactually refused me.When I confronted her she started insultingme.
Seeing persons spending money in a shopping center withcompletely indifference to the misery reigning in our country.
This was when my boyfriend told me that I was double-crossing himwith a certain boy.

I was spending my summer holidays in a village.My friend and Iwere coming back from a discotheque at night and we heard a noisefrom an alley.We were very scared and we got into my friend's house. A moment later, an unknown car picked up a person from thisalley.
A friend started to insult another person without reason and Ifelt ashamed of her behavior.
When I didn't meet an appointment I had made. The person phonedme but I thought of something (I told I was ill) so that I didn'thave to go.
My grandfather's funeral.
Can think of no time that I have felt fear.
When one of my friends started misbehaving.
Afraid of a dead body.
Being insulted in public.
I remember that my form 2 teacher was very fierce and dogmatic. My feet would tremble whenever I saw her but I had to face the fact thatI had to go for her class.
Once I had an argument with my friends and I knew that I wasright.My friends went on arguing with me even though they didnot know the right thing.
I bought an aquarium which made me much pleasure. I was watchingthe fish when my father came in and asked me how much I had payedfor it. He said he would not pay for the current that it wouldrequire.
Disappointed love. The girl made an end to our relationship whileI thought she was in love with me.
Out of sheer curiosity, I went to see a pornographic movie inCopenhagen.The room was full of men, who panted andmasturbated.Very disgusting.
I was very much ashamed after a friend beat me at school and Iwas defeated.
Despite my being affectionate, sincere, and helpful to close relatives of mine; they turned around and accused me of beinginconsiderate in my relationship with them.
When I was face to face with my deceived friend after sleepingwith his wife.
My mother had not come home at midnight.She had forgotten totell me about it.I was very young and all alone at home.
Losing a pet chick. Our family had just put the chick outside afew days before and then one morning it was gone.
In a hurry to get to lectures and the car would not start.
When I realized that I had a hole in my trousers after having gonefor a walk.
[ No response.]
Listening and watching a tape of someone with AIDS beingprejudiced against at a counselling course on AIDS with 20others.
I heard friends grumbling at me in an adjoining room, althoughthey had behaved in a friendly way when I was present.
Shame I feel when I am not properly dressed.
When I failed an exam unfairly.
When my friend and I were discussing the good looks of a guy werealized that he had been listening.
When I was cycling through the park late one night, two peoplejumped out of the woods and tried to stop me.There wereshouting something at the same time.
It was my turn to cook dinner.I forgot a dish (the favourite ofthe family) in the oven and it got burnt and was uneatable.

I remember the day my father died. I was 11 years old and mysadness was so great that until today I remember everythingabout that day, from the clothes I was wearing to the reactions of people,the despair of my mother and brother. It marked me a lot and wasthe greatest sadness I felt.
My first day to work in hospital, when I was dressing wounds Iwas disgusted when I came across one wound with a very bad smell.
The time I lost a badminton match, that I should have won at theZambia closed badminton championships.
When I made acquaintance with the parents of my boyfriend for thefirst time. They spoke Limburgian (a dutch dialect) and one of myfirst remarks was that I disliked Limburgian dialect.
When I got a stereo walkman from my father when he had finacialdifficulties. I thought that although he promised to give me thatpresent, he was not obliged to do so.
Breaking the left hand indicator box by moving too close tostructure.
I felt happy when I learnt that I had qualified for the gradeeight.
When I heard my sister got in a bad car accident.
Telling white lies.
My child passed away after a short illness when he was justeleven months old. I was only told about his death withoutknowing that he had been ill.
A drummer who had borrowed my drums destroyed both the drumskinand the sticks.He did not repair them nor did he tell me aboutit.
I was having an argument with my brother on his behavior, then we started fighting and I got annoyed at him because he startedteasing me.
Having an affair with my good friend's best friend. And every timeI see my best friend I feel guilt because we can't tell him.
When bicycling along, a courier van started to tail me very close- I sped up and moved over and he just did the same. I reactedviolently, much physical responding in the dangerous situation.
When I stole money from my mother and she asked me later if I wasresponsible.I never admitted it.
A friend whom I had gone out of my way to do something for didnot bother to acknowledge my efforts, and treated me badlythereafter.
Spit and vomit.

Two years back someone invited me to be the tutor of hergrand-daughter.The grand-daughter asked me some questions inmathematics so I taught her.However she did not listen to meand this made me feel unhappy.The second year it was the same. When I entered university the girl's parents suggested that I beemployed as their daghters tutor.They told me that at university there was no homework and I would have a lot of time so theymade a time-tablefor me which required me to be the tutor fivedays a week.They did not respect me and anyway I had anotherchild to teach.
[ I am joyfull to be alive every night.]

I borrowed my classmate's notebook one week before theexamination and I promised to give it back to her in two daystime.I was very busy at that time and forgot many things; as Iwas not very often at home she could not contact me.When Istarted my revision I realized that her notebook had been on mydesk for five days.I contacted her immediately and gave it backto her.Though she did not say anything I felt very guilty.
When I found out I had passed all of my university exams.
When my father was ill and was waiting for the results of his tests.
Equivocal situation when filling a security questionnaire onentering a government building with several people there.
Forgot to turn up on prescribed day for jury service.
My first feeling of falling in love.Coming across a person whomade me feel love, happiness, joy, giving me a new and beautifulfuture, who made me dream.
My mother unjustly became very angry with me and sent me to myroom while my father explained that the way she saw things wasnot correct. I had done things with the best intentions.
Finding out that I am not an as able student as I thought.
My brother caught a spider and let his frog eat it.
A person whom I thought to be honest took and spend the littlemoney that I had and I had no way of getting any money in thefew following months.
The first time that I saw a surgeon cut off a leg and put it in ablack rubbish bag.
Punished by a leader.
I went to see a movie and I went with a friend, it was reallyfrightening and it made me stop and think about the world aroundme and what it is really like out there. I was frightened allthat night.
When my library books were overdue and I did not have the moneyto pay for them.
Iqam chosen for your lecture and my best friend is not. Now he isangry with me and I cannot help him.
I wandered by mistake into the safety zone of a shooting range,and was shot at.
[ I do not remember any event when I felt guilty.]
When my uncle died of leukemia at age 35.
You may find out that I am stupid and not to let me do yourexperiment.
One day in class, the professor asked me a question concerning somethinghe had been explaining.He was very close to me (beside me) and Ihad no idea what to answer.
Being alone in the room at night.
I was wearing a slit tight dress at a disco and it burst open.
When I failed the S.S.C examination I felt very ashamed.
When I obtained good marks in a subject I had failed before.
Getting a phone call from a very old friend.
Travelling by coach on a rather narrow and wet road.
My father had bought too many goods for his shop, there was notenough space to store them.
I was raped once when I went through a dark alley at the back ofour house. The man pushed me in the bushes. I fought back andsucceeded to escape.
I was ashamed when a certain friend of mine I used to move withfailed to propose to a lady yet we always said to ourselves nolady can refuse our proposal.
When I splashed a child by not slowing down while drivingthrough a puddle of water.
I experienced this when one of my friends reported to theHeadmaster that I had gone out for beer, whilst the informationwas not true at all. So I had to fight the friend before theHeadmaster.
When I could neither measure up to the expectations of the teachernor to my own expectations in one of the assignments.
When I tripped while getting on a bus.
A lady I live with had not bothered to clean up before she wenton holiday (I live in a collective).
Soiled my short trousers with faeces.
After a serie of facts that occurred between a colleague and me Istarted to feel a certain necessity to get apart and I didn't wantto see her anymore.
A person misinterpreted what I had told her. I had told her thatI had failed to insert a NasoGastric tube but she went andscolded the patient that she was being uncooperative.
Doing something wrong at home, and then letting my (normally)more rampant brother take the blame.
When I was an exploration with my friends and almost got lost inan unfamiliar environment.It was getting dark and we did notknow how to get back home.

We had had a party the night before and we still had some liquorsleft the morning after. I went to the kitchen pretending toprepare some tea and was caught by my fiancee pouring some rumdown my throat.
[ When after a night of sleeping in another's arms, one wakesalone and knows that the lonely arms of the night are not thesame that one meets in the morning.]
When I was in F4 I led my class to a riot.However the formmaster said that my conduct was good and asked me to tell him thenames of those who had taken part in it. I replied that I didnot know.
In the army, my result at the shooting exercises gotme a three day furlough.
I experienced long ago when I was sightseeing Bulgarians in aforeign language.
I was wearing a short skirt one day and someone told me myunderwear was showing.
Moving to an unknown place, away from the familiar surroundingsand into a situation of loneliness.
When a student accused me of having stolen his textbookas hehad found a form bearing my name in his other books and all myexplanations fell on deaf ears.
I felt fear when one night my aunt and Uncle left me alone attheir house to look after the baby when they went to a party.
The first time I really fell in love with a girl.
When I lied to my girlfriend, telling her that I had passed anexam, when I actually did not even take it.
It was when we were beaten or lost the football match by 5-1 andthen I scored the third goal to my own side.
I was disgusted when our cricket team manager dropped me from theteam.
When I played in a chess championship, I was disturbed by otherpeople. I asked them to be quiet, but in vain.
When I won the best prize in the National science fair.
I felt afraid when I smoked maryhuana for the first time in mylife with a lot of friends in the middle of the street at daybrake.
When I unjustly accused a person of my family of something shedidn't really do.
When I had exams a relative of ours, who lives in another city, came to visit us and I felt disgusted at him.

When I saw a woman subjugated by money and not being able to hidehow she hated herself for not having the will power to get out ofsuch a situation because it was convenient, according to what shetold me.
One night, my boyfriend expressed his love for me in the canteen inthe presence of my friends by giving me a present.
When my cousin passed away.
During the Christmas holidays, I met some of my old friends,after not having seen them for six months.
I felt guilty about going out when I should have been studyingfor a presentation I had to give on Wednesday the next week.

I was walking along the passage to my room (very near the anatomylaboratory) and I heard something and felt that there was something behind me.I looked back and there was no one.I startedimagining that maybe it was a corpse.
When my mother found me in her bedroom \stealing\" sugar in her bedroom.According to our customs there comes a stage when a child stops using the parents bedroom and I was well past that age."
I stole a coconut cake from a reception table and when I putin my mouth I realized that the host was watching me.
When my girlfriend decided to finish our relation.
When I took a small boy's share of choclale.He was our guestand so had been given a larger share of the sweets.
I broke an egg, with which there was something wrong, into alittle cup. There was a thick white \wad\" in it. I tried to take it out and throw it in the sink."
When not fulfilling any of my obligations to a person whom Irespect.
My sister, whom I like very much, asked me for a favour which Irefused her for some flimsy reason. Some time later I felt sorryfor that and something like sadness.
When felt lonely about writing my family.
When I had come home drunk the day after a party, I felt veryashamed in front of my parents.
I got up late and I could not go to my lessons on time.When Ientered the class room the stare of the teacher and my classmatesmade me feel guilty.
On a social occasion, I noticed that I reacted on the basis of myautonomous nerve system (I could not help it).
My class winning against another class in a football match.
I was swimming in the river and I lost the top of my bikini.Idid not notice it and came out of water.There was adisagreeable classmate watching the scene.
Saw a father beating up his small child.
When I was walking in a field which had a lot of manure.
I do not have the time for other people's problems.Mymother-in-law is sometimes depressed and I do not have the time,the desire or the strength to help.
Going to a friend's wedding and seeing many of my old friendswhom I had known before I moved to a new district five yearspreviously.
There was an earthquake for several minutes and I was on theeight floor.
When I saw hundreds of snakes twisting over one another in amovie.
When I met a friend that I hadn't seen for some time.
When I failed the entrance exam of the medical school and wasstudying biochemistry which has no job prospects in Zambia.
On a boat trip to Denmark, 14 of us had a lot of fun and wespent SEK 10 each on one armed bandits and against all odds wewon the jackpot of SEK 1000.
I was angry at my boyfriend who had promised to come to see mebut did not because he spent the evening with his pals.
I ignored and offended my parents on the eve of the New Year.
When I contacted a sexually transmitted disease and thelecturer came to know about it as it was he who treated me forit.

I was taking place in an anti nuclear protest and was shoutingprotest loudly to some American sailors of the U.S. Texassubmarine. A guy came up to me and said that's your brotherscreaming at, I felt shame and I realized screaming at anotherperson isn't good protesting. Now I'm a silent protester.
My mother was always fastidious about my room, bed time, etc. She treated us strictly and punished us physically. Thesethings were intolerable.
When I saw a scene on T.V where a castration was shown.
The only event I can remember is having a nightmare when I wasvery young (3 years old) I dreamt about a machine which was goingto crush me.
Friends who torture animals.
On the scenic railway at the fairground.
When I left after the examination to enter the University, andeven though I had studied the whole year I made a bad exam.
When I was with someone I love.
Promising someone to do their job and then not being able to doit due to transport troubles.
We were at a hamburger bar and a man at a table nearby startedcoughing and spitting into his plate.
When I finished my C.S. Project I was overjoyed. I felt relievedbecause it was due the next day and I was tired of looking at it.
The behaviour of people spitting everywhere.

One day my elder brother badly scolded my father.This was thefirst time that I heard such abusive language from my brother.Irequested him humbly not to use this kind of language but he didnot care for what I was saying.Finally I picked up an axe to useagainst him, in the meanwhile people intervened.
I was moving in the graveyard at 6.00 pm one day and was gripedby fear because I was told that ghosts detain people moving thereat night.
When I was 10, I got busted for stealing a candy-bar.
Told by some people the class leader only choose his friends (nottrue).
When I beat up my brother so badly, for not having gone to school,that we had to take him to hospital.
I sent a book to a friend of mine.The book meant a lot to meand he lost it.
When I found a letter addressed \To Mum\" by my son, 6 months later, he begged me not to sell his new shoes which he messed up after wearing them for the first time."
When a boy who was drunk came into my room and misbehaved in thepresence of my boyfriend.
When my mother returned from a holiday, I told her a lie i.e myfather had brought another woman home while she was away.

Once our school class went skiing. On a steep slope a boystanding behind me lost his balance, fell down and drew me withhim. I slided down the whole slope. At about 1 m distance from atree I could stop.
Death of a parent.
I returned home late from a party last night and I felt afraidtrying to anticipate the reaction of my father.
I was a bit frightened when it was found that there was somethingwrong with my liver. However it turned out that it was notserious and I need not worry.
I felt guilty when I couldn't help a person.
When I made up with a girl-friend of mine after having been onunfriendly terms with her (my fault).I cried with joy thatevening.
Can't remember having had this feeling.
I met a girlfriend again after not seeing her for several months. I saw her in a discotheque.We do not like discotheques but wewent there because we knew we would meet there.
When one finds out that someone you know is not at all like onehad thought, for instance friends who steal and things like that,quite unwarranted.
Before an oral examination - which I did not take eventually.
I felt disgust when I received visitors at an odd hour. I wasseriously preparing for Examinations, so I did not appreciatetheir coming.
Yesterday in the elevator a man started smoking, this issomething I just can not tolerate.
When someone ignores what I am saying or doesn't let me have mypoint of view and they monopolise a conversation.
When someone made me a compliment after an examination just atthe moment I needed it. It was amicable, hearty and sincere.
While reading Olli Jalonen's new book, the distant, cold andselfish relationships between people (in the book) made me feeldisgusted.
Some weeks ago I experienced a day that everything went wrong Ibroke several things I felt very ashamed for I am not a sloven.
There were old people in a crowded bus and I did not have thecourage to give them my seat.I closed my eyes to sleep and thenopened my book to read.In my heart I wanted to give them theseat.
When the Real Madrid team of basket ball qualified for the finalof the Europe Cup at Athens.
When I saw a dog which had been knocked down by a car.
Seeing maltreated, dead animals.

I stayed at the Coast for a weekend with friends. My brother cameto drive me home, but was rude, and in a hurry to rejoin hisfriends. I was embarrassed because the family involved wasextremely nice, and hospitable to him.
When someone I had had a relationship (purely sexual) with cameup to me after I had used her and acted as if nothing hadchanged.
Being aggressive against members of my family.
The parents of a friend of mine surprised us and another couplesleeping in thier place.
A friend of mine felt bad because of something I had done tosomething that belonged to him.

At secondary school, one of my classmates lost her locker key. During a class I saw two other classmates holding a key andtalking secretly.I do not know why I suspected them, alsoanother classmate supported me.He remembers that these peoplehad only one key in the key-ring, this had seemed strange to him. Besides another classmate said that he had seen them sellingbooks at a book-shop and they should not have had such books.Itold the teacher and the person was caught.He had sold thebooks and was forced to quit school.I found that I had nothelped him as he stole later on also.I felt guilty
I didn't tell my parents exacly what had made me so late ingetting home one night. I left out some details and somehow, Ifelt I had lied to them.
When I was a child I often quarrelled with my younger sister.Once I became so angry that I slapped her in the face. She criedand shouted so that my mother came in and scolded me.

During an informal talk with a friend when we talk about the lifeof another person, a common friend, that is in a situation of notbeing able to assume certain problems that he decided to solve,that is, she herself suggested the problems and decided to solvethem but didn't get it until the moment.
When the bus driver failed to stop and pick me up at a bus stop.
When a close friend drowned in the American River.
When I was chased by a big dog near my house.

I told someone that I still had a relationship with a boyalthough it was finished already 3 months before. That personseriously discussed several things relating that issue. Then Ifelt very miserable because I had told lies.

I had studied for almost one week for my physics-examination.With difficulty I passed the examn. I was angry about the teacherand also about myself because I had not remembered enough duringthe examn and because the time that I spent studying was wasted.
One day I was going through the street door of my house, when aman asked me for a doctor.He then showed me his genitals andasked me to cure him myself.
I was on a class excursion, by boat to Stockholm.At night myclass mates prepared to clebrate their motive in life which was\life is merriment\".I felt depressed about the way they soughthappiness."
When I got the first compound through column.
When I knew that there were, at last, no problems in making ajourney that I had been wanting to make for a long time.
I put on a lot of weight in a few months and every time I metsomeone I knew would avoid them, usually by hiding because myself image was low and I was ashamed of what I had done tomyself.
My boyfriend finished our relationship when I started studyingpsychology in Nijegen, because then we would not be able to meetfrequently anymore.

In form three we were taking our mock exams and someone else (afriend) was making noise when the examinateur picked on me andsaid that he would tear up my answer sheet.I got very angrywith the girls involved.
When my grandmother passed away.We had been waiting for it asshe had been sick for years, but when it happened I found it hardto accept.
Had started a relationship and did nothing to keep it up, partlythe use of another person.

My mother left my father for his best friend, and he moved toPapua New Guinea. Despite the fact that I am closer to my fatherthan to anyone else in my family, I had to move in with mymother, and say good-bye to my father, not knowing when I wouldsee him again.

When I saw a picture, in the Gothenburg Post, of a totallydemolished car with two fatally injured passengers.The car wasso badly damaged that they couldn't get the bodies out at thescene of the accident.
It was when my father was taken into detention by the CIDS fortwo years for a reason I don't know up to now.
I failed to show up at an agreed date.
After joining my M.A in Social Sciences, I appeared for the firstsemester exam.I failed one of the exams, and when I looked atmy results I felt disgusted and then I got angry.
When my mother was angry with me over my friends and boyfriend.
Once I arrived two hours late to my work place (a bank) and I wasstill feeling feeble and tired.
When my friend had a child out of wedlock.
I felt sad when my boyfriend and I were apart for some time.
When my husband discovered I was having an affair with anotherman.
At the beginning of the year I moved to a new city - I felt sadas I had to leave many friends and family members behind.
In the tram there was a fat, sickly looking woman in front of mewho was asking for directions in a thick voice.When she got up togo a disgusting smell of urine came from her.I felt that Iwould choke.
When my friends did not ask me to go to a New Year's partywith them.
When I heard a lion roar for the first time.
I insulted my friend for a small reason and after time I realisedthat I was wrong and felt ashamed; everytime I meet her I feelashamed.
When I was caught with my girlfriend in the house at night.
At an undeserved attitude toward a man, when human personality isnot treated decently.
Finding out that the girl I like does not like me.
A father of 4 children killed in an accident.
That I would do bad in a class and not get into Bus school.
When I qualified for form I.
I refused to lend my homework to a friend.
When an old schoolfriend phoned me to arrange an appointment totalk about old memories. I hadn't seen him for 8 years.
I had this feeling when I met a girl, not that she was dirty butshe was to \fresh\", dump and childish."
I felt angry when I saw on T.V the last slaughter of negroes inSouth Africa.
[ No response.]
When I was deputy manager during the Summer, certain deputiestook liberties, more than what was normal.
When a girl did not answer a question, concerning my love forher, put forward to her.
When I failed one of the first year's courses.
I had gone home for a week-end and when I came back I found thatmy clothes and my bedding had been stolen.
My employer took too many aspirins for a bad back and also drankan enormous amount of spirit.This was dangerousand he didnot understand that he had done anything wrong.
When I was walking around all alone at night.
I was so sad when I heard that my Uncle had passed away. He wasthe only man who was supporting my parents as well as myself.
My mother carried on using mental pressure concerning somethingwhich was serious and a real burden to me.
My boat running into another boat.
When an unpleasant person tried to make friends with me.Asubtle, small, insignificant, grey being whose helplessness andneutrality evoked the feeling of disgust in me.

My friend had been telling me about a certain bird which when itcries at night it's the sign that someone will die. So one night Iwas alone in the house and I heard the cry of the bird and I wasafraid.

When I decided to leave my steady, secure employment to come touniversity. Because I didn't know if I could cope with all therequirements of study and also being older I didn't know if Iwould enjoy mixing with younger people, also financialinsecurity.
When I was six years old, my favourite cat died.
I was afraid that I would fail an examination.

I was travelling from Delhi to Bombay.I had booked a seat onemonth back and I had also got a telegram confirming this. However, in the train my name had been omitted from thereservation sheet, and the one seat that was still vacant wasalloted to another person who paid for it despite my requests for theseat.I was allowed to stay in the reserved compartment when Ipaid money.
When I got a message that I was employed as a nurse at akindergarten.

At a cash desk where I had gone to buy 16 rolls of kitchen paperat a reduced price.After queuing with screaming children; itturned out that I had taken two 8 roll packets instead of the one16 roll packet to which the rebate applied.The assistant said\You will have to get it another time.\""
I unfairly got a low mark on an exam and I failed to win a grant,since then I don't have much confidence in myself at an exam.
Talking to my close friend.

I escaped from communicating with God for a long time.I did notread the scriptures and I did not pray.I felt that I wasgetting further and further away from God.I felt guilty as thiswas because of my laziness.
I told Mr Winter of Downtown Fashion to go to - when he did notaccept my Visa !
I broke a cup and put it back without telling anyone about it andsomeone almost got blamed for it, then it was discovered that itwas me who had broken it.
[ No reponse.]

I share my small flat with my friend. On her birthday we couldnot see each other until evening because we had to stay at theUniversity all day. In the evening I left a lecture before itfinished to be able to buy flowers for her. When I was at homeshe called me to tell me that she would stay the night with herboyfriend.
My joy was the joy of meeting again.My husband came home afterhaving been away for weeks (for work).I was on the railwaystation to meet him.
I was very angry when one day I went to see my girlfriend Italked to her and could not answer back. She was depressed forreasons which were not known to me.
As a result of breaking the indicator light as mentionedfor guilt.
When I made an excuse to get out of participating in an importantfamily occasion that I should not have missed.
When one of my closest friends died unexpectantly.
When someone tried to bewitch me and my friends at night.
When I nearly walked on a blindworm and then saw it crawl away.
[ Whenever I put myself in other's shoes and try to make theperson happy, comfort him or make friends and I am misunderstoodand rejected, especially when this person is a family member or a friend.]
I was disgusted at the existing red-tape in the governmentoffices.I accquired my passport three months after having applied forit and I had to go back five times to them to correct a minorerror.
Unjust accusations directed at me and my way of acting, bysomeone close to me.
I was about to share lunch with my aunt's husband when she toldme that I would have to wait and eat with my cousins.
I was embarassed at the exam in microbiology. I was ashamed withmyself - how little I knew and how good was the examinor. Irarely become ashamed.
I had called a boy who had dated me, and told him that I was ill,while, actually, I didn't want to go out with him, later on, he askedme if I was feeling better, then I felt ashamed.
Death of a relative.
When I met an old schhol friend (school love) who works inSk+vde.
One day I addressed my husband in an abusive manner in front ofhis friends.Later on I realized this myself and felt ashamed ofmyself.
When I felt alone and without love.
I was awakened by a dream in the middle of the night. I dreamtthat a stranger was in my house.
Before a hospital visit prior to a D&C under anasthesia for anexpected miscarriage.
Waking up from a bad dream in a dark night with noone elsearound.
When I heard of the death of my mother.
When my mother caught me masturbating.
I slapped my sister's daughter and after several hours, she had ahigh temperature and she ended up being admitted in hospital.
When I shot a bird in the head with a shotgun.
Seeing this badly made questionnaire.
I lost a close friend.
After the loss of a close relative.
When I received the result slip of the higher level examination(an university entrance exam) and saw that I had a very goodpossibility of being accepted into the university, I felt veryexcited.
I do not study enough as I do not understand it properly.

My roommate got married and invited me to share a flat with them.But with a young couple there should not be a third person. I amto blame for not following the advise of the others, but it isnot late still.
I felt guilty because of the pain I caused to a very closefriend. But over the feeling of guilt, my conviction of beingright dominated.
I learnt from the newspaper that I had been accepted at theChinese university of H.K.It was 7 o'clock in the morning. Later I told my family and relatives about it and had tea withthem very joyfully.
I was watching television. It was about midnight when a very dearfriend called saying that his father had died in an accident.
Some times I was ashamed of presenting seminaries or even tospeak in class.
When I had to assume a position which I didn't expect.
When I was in P3 I was always punished as I would forget to do myhomework.The first time that I was punished and not allowed toleave school, I slipped out of school.
When two of my children were critically ill with measles.

I met my present boyfriend on a boat trip to England.We hadsaid that we would call each other when we got back to Sweden (wewere not going to the same town in England).As soon as I walkedin he called from England as he could not wait till he camehome.

My failure to provide the appropriate emotional/spiritual levelto a sexual relationship that had a large physical content. Bornout of inconsistency with my personal beliefs and value shame atlargely using this sexual partner.
Climbing a mountain where the rocks were very loose. When werealized the danger, we were very high up, but still had a longclimb ahead.
I borrowed a piece of music of someone and I always forgot togive it back. That person wrote me a letter asking me to give itback. I did so and I told him an idle story why I kept it for solong.
When I was accused of \bitching\" about best friend."
When I beat up my son for having beaten up his sister.
Right now I volunteer at a hospital. Yesterday, Halloween, Idressed up as a doctor and went to work. The volunteercoordinator told me after my shift that it was dangerous to havedone what I did.
Had a nice letter from my close friend.
Heard some ghost-like noise at night.
Not being able to argue against class leaders.
One day my colleague misbehaved with me.I felt disgusted andthought to myself that he could only do this because I was awoman.
My boyfriend didn't turn up after promising that he was coming.
I was admitted to the University and a niece was born to me.
When my father's home was to be broken into by thieves who hadguns.
I felt fear when my friend and I broke into an abandoned militarybase in Los Angeles this summer. I feared because I didn't wantto be caught.

Anger I felt when my boyfriend told me he didn't mind breaking itoff with me, i.e. each of us to take his own road. Because untilthat moment, he deliberately restricted our dates. The motiveswere brought to my knowledge later.
When a very near person got into an awkward situation but showedonly helplessness and indecision.

I was on a concert-tour and therefor seperated from myboy-friend. But I needed warmth which was given by a male memberof the orchestra. My feelings towards him were not very deep, buthis feelings were. I felt guilty when he said \I am not aradiator\".
When I dreamt that my family was in trouble and was facing manydifficulties.
From the cigarette smoke. Usually I feel disgust from it when Iam in a restaurant.
One of the greatest joiy was when I succeded in acquiring amotorcycle through my own efforts.
It was when I dreamt that I had encountered Satan, he wanted to grab meand take me to his kingdom.He was very repulsive and I havenever seen anything like that before.
The time I drove my uncle's car, without having asked for hispermission.It was the first time that I was driving a car.
When I was selected for higher education, i.e grade 7 to formI.
Staying in a relative's house which was broken in before.
I was driving and a deer suddenly appeared in front of thecar when there was a lot of traffic behind me.
When I was caught with another man's wife.I had taken theopportuinty as this man was abroad but he returned that night.
Before an accident, my aunt offered me the front seat of the car,next to the driver. I declined, she took that seat and was killedthere when the car crashed.
Not getting a job.
When I saw a person I had not seen for a long time.
I can not think of any incident when I have felt very ashamed. There are small incidents that I am ashamed of, for instance,not sending money to the children in Ethiopia.
My elder brother and I have not always had a good relationshipand I feel ashamed of myself as I do not call him to talk to himnowadays.
By mistake I took a book from the library which was not supposedto be loaned out.
I took some money from my parent's house without asking them forit, and I was caught red handed.
When going out I am threatened regularly by two punk-girls.
I felt so afraid when dad fell ill, he had never suffered fromthat disease since and I had never seen him as he was.
Two little children (5/6 years old) begging for money, and noonegave them money.
After my car accident, when I woke up in a heap of stones.
I had found out that I was pregnant. I talked it over with myboyfriend and he was unsupportive - yet encouraged an abortion -I did.
I met some nice people during my holdidays. When they left I knewthat I would never see them again.
My boy-friend told me that he would take me to the training ofthe life-saving dogs.
I felt disgust of my father when I knew he had a lover.
Watching a TV documentary on seal clubbing.
Getting a part-time job.
When I have to leave the baby in the carriage and go shopping, Ifear that something will happen to the baby.
I saw a man who had had a heart-attack and who was beingtreated for it.I feared that my own father could have beenthere.
I went shopping with my parents - my father payed everything forme, I was very glad.
Being on view in a meat-factory. Pigs being cut open, pigs beingsuspended from nods, blood everywhere, decompsition.
When I asked my girlfriend to marry me.
When I was going home, I saw somathing which looked like a snakeon the road but later I found out that it was only a stick.
I saw a man falling on the walkway. He seemed half dead, and wasimmobile. I felt disgust for the people who passed by withoutdoing anything to help.
Yesterday my friend gave me a gift and had dinner with me.
I had an implicit agreement with my sister about meeting her,however she had not understood the situation the same way so shedid not turn up.
A four year girl ran away from her father straight in front of mycar.I was forced to use the emergency brakes.
When I see people who have no sentiments.

A friend started to shout at me. He called me an old frump.
A friend of mine said in a group that she felt lonely andwithdrawn from everyone because of mental deficiency.

When I overtook a car on the mainroad, misjudging the distance ofan oncoming car and this resulted in tooting and flashing fromthe other driver (we could have collided), and I had anacquaintance in the car with me.
A sense of guilt I felt once when I couldn't defend theconfidence my teacher had in me and thus discrediting him at aconcert.
I felt ashamed when in a certain occasion I had to read a textand didn't stop stuttering.

When I dined with my new friends, one of them kept reminding usthat he was superior.
When a friend wouldn't speak to me and wouldn't tell me why.

I don't use to lie to my parets about what I do, and the twotimes that I felt anger were when they doubted me I said that Iwas going to the club, and they didn't believe me because the daybefore they had met me at FLIPERAMA. I had the wish to kill them.
When Dad went to a Sports Day and was the only parent there, andhe was cheering for us.
Death in the close family.
When I found out the CIA was mining Nicaraguan harbors.
When my friends left without waiting for me, after we had arrangedto go out together.
Seeing my sister after about 2 years of not seeing her. Onlyspent 1 hour or so before she was off overseas with her husbandfor 3 months.
When you betray the trust you have been given. This is connectedwith copying at a class-work at school.
When I was subjected to a very nasty joke by a group of friends.

[ Meeting some new (unpleasant) people or some new, demandingsituation.]
I feel ashamed every time that someone makes me a positive ornegative critic.
Due to a misunderstanding on my part, two of my best friendsquarelled.
When I fell crazily in love with a beautiful girl and she returnedmy love.

The long lasting illness of my grand-mother, and the changes infamily relationships caused by it.
My parents attitude towards each other when they should becomereconciled, despite my father's long-time addiction.
My lovely girlfriend double-crossed me and so that I found herchatting with another guy.
I got to know about the death of a close friend.
A dark night when I had to go to the outdoor lavatory.
I had lied to a person because I had thought that I could nottell him the truth. When he found out he was not angry butunderstanding. We talked the whole thing over.
The man who threw me out of the flat disgusted me.
Unexpectedly I met some persons who I like very much.Spontaneously they invited me and integrated me within theirgroup, although it was late in the evening.
The day I heard that I passed the high school exam.
I was really pissed when the Russians boycotted the '84 Olympics.I had anger towards them and Jimmy Crter. I was very anxious tosee it.
Finding out that my best friend could not go to university.
One day I was really angry when all my food was eaten by a dog.My anger was against my mother because she was careless. Shedidn't keep the food in a hidden and proper place.
When I deeply felt that I could lose the person I love bestbecause of my foolishness.
When I told off a computer teacher who did not want to teach mebeacause of prejudice.
I felt glad when I took the rather difficult organic chemistryexamination.
A few days back, I walked on a heap of faeces while walking onthe road.I got goose flesh because of this.
I was angry when I had not been granted a leave out pass duringthe last weekend.
Thinking that I had been seen smoking at school by a teacher -waiting to be summoned to the headmaster's office.
When I was accused of having refused to do some hostel work whileI was at school.Actually I had not been allocated any work.
While tramping on a narrow path two of us were confronted by awoman with two snarling dogs, demanding we get off the property -via a flooded river !

Some time ago we had a tournament in our tennis-club. Fortactical reasons I was chosen to play against a much weakerplayer than I am. Although it would have been enough simply towin the game, I defeated him extremely. This would not have beennecessary.

I lived in a student-house, where you shared the lavatory andshower with a fellow student. the shower cubicle formed theconnection between both appartments. My neighbour very often wasdrunk and aggressive. One night, I was afraid that he would entermy room.
[ No response.]
When, after drinking a glass of water, I found a cockroach walkingout of the glass.
In the classroom we discussed with the teacher. He told me thingsthat affected directly in a negative way my job and my behaviorin the classroom in front of the other pupils.
We were on the road in a car when a lorry bypassed us.We had toswerve and we almost got run over.
A fear of lack of personal powers.
My sister came back home and reproached me for not having tidiedup the house, although I had been working all morning and she haddone nothing.
[ When someone tells me something that hurts me, I feel bad aboutit and also feel sad.]
I felt anger when I saw that I was being misleaded by myboyfriend, he went out with other girls. I felt anger for hisfalsity.
When one has neglected or been unjust to a good friend.
I felt disgust of dirty.
Being sexually assulted and told my friends about it (we criedtogether).
Someone drove into my car and then denied that it had happened.
Climbing a mountain to see a view, towards the top we suddenlycame across a ledge with a nearly sheer drop on either side,which I had to cross.
I've had three midterms in the past two weeks and I hardlystudied for any of them (like 1 or 2 days) I feel guilty that Ihadn't studied and I got C's on all of them.
During carnaval I danced for a few minutes normally I don't dancebecause I am rigid in my moving around during a dance, I stoppedvery soon.
I confronted with this feeling at the Institute quite recently,the pedology lecturer was the cause.

I was using my sister's stereo while everyone was out. I know shewouldn't want me to and I would get into trouble if she foundout. But she was only partly justified in forbidding me to useit. She never found out.
The breakup of a relationship. After the event I was upset/sadthen angry maybe 2/3 weeks later.
When a boy had continued to use foul language and swearing infront of a group of my friends.
Finding out my name on the list for English lectures.
Being away from a very close friend, I was away from Finlandfor a year as an exchange student.
In our class we had a test on Nursing, so a friend from the Armywas caught peeping, by using a paper which had already answerswhich was written by him. So all of us from the Army got ashamed.
While working as a domestic helper, one day I had not cleaned upvery well and they made a remark about it.
When my room-mate locked me out deliberately, before an exam dueat 1400 hours.
A break-up with someone I really liked.
A close friend took part in a racist violent action.
After 10 days of hard work and having suffered many changes Ipassed my last exam.
When I had to leave my mother and my sister after a week's visit.
Emptied a bucket of water in a hospital.
I was very sadwhen I got the XIIth standard results, when I gotlow marks as compared to my friend and I could not get admissionto courses like medicine.
When during Winter the water pipes froze and we did not have anywater for two days.
I lied to my best friend and I wouldn't reform what I had done.
I quarreled with my boy-friend. He said it was unfair that Ialways started crying so that he had to give in.

A girl, who is a friend of mine was having an affair with a boywho is also a friend of mine.I got to know that this girl wasalso seeing another guy.Later on, she just broke off with this friendof mine without giving any explanations.This made him sad anddepressed, and I felt disgust for this girl.
I wanted something in particular and did not get it, also therewas no possibility of getting it.
It was when my Instructor awoke me late at night to get preparedfor the training at Military college when he was coming back fromhis personal social activities.

While skiing in Squaw Valley, I was riding up a chair lift andright when the chair was above a sheer cliff of rocks, the chairlift stopped and all the chairs sagged and everything seemed tocreak loudly.
Exaggerating certain circumstances, wrong attitude and evaluationof these circumstances.
When one has been unjust, stupid towards someone else.

Failed to be elected to be a class leader.
Getting terrible meals, but paying heaps for them.
When a \friend\" dropped a frog down my neck, and I didn't knowwhat it was."
The smell of garlic in rush-hour bus.
When I broke off with my boyfriend after three years.It wasquite unexpected for him and there was no particular reason forthe break up, such as someone else.
Tripped on a busy street.
When I was going home alone one night in Paris and a man came upbehind me and asked me if I was not afraid to be out alone solate at night.
This is difficult, since I don't remember feeling disgust towardsanyone.
When I was afraid to tell my sports teacher at secondary schoolthat I had not participated in the sports activities the previousday.

My cousin asked me to be a bridesmaid for her. This made reallyhappy because I was adopted into the family and her asking memade me realise that she saw me as a cousin and not just anotherperson. There were other cousins she could have asked but sheasked me.
When I was going downhill on skis, and fell down twice the firsttime.
Deception from a person I loved very much.
From the fact that my husband and I are not in good terms.
When I attended the concert of a pop singer.

I was sitting at a rock concert, listening to an extremely loudband. A tiny baby in a crawler had been left by his young mother,right out in the sun next to a speaker, and was screaming -probably in pain.
A neighbour's girl had disappeared and many people were lookingfor her.Someone had gone to notify the police.Something hadcertainly happened to her.
This was when I found out that a cousin of mine had taken away mytrousers without my consent.
I insulted the girl to whom I had proposed when she turned medown.
I deliberately avoided a person who I wanted to hurt, and whowanted to talk to me.
When I did not speak the truth.
Unable to help my mother to cook.
When I was attending an authorized demonstrationand the policerushed brutally at the demonstrators, without any warning.
I felt ashamed one day when my teacher shouted at me in thepresence of my boyfriend.
When a close friend of mine maintained a relationship with metill she needed me and broke it off when she did not need me. She behaved life a really selfish person.
I was doing an experiment and was not getting the appropriateresult despite the fact that I had repeated the procedure 4-5times.Then finally I got it right by a stroke of luck.
After sitting for the Standard 8 Exams for the second time in1979, I had great joy when I heard that I was successful in theExamination when the results were out.
[ No answer as I see very little difference between shame andguilt.Therefore see answer for \shame\".]"
4-letter words on a TV programme (Roche) while we wereentertaining \conservative\" relations who wanted to see the first episode."
When people without my permission pry in my belongings and takethings out of it.
My husband had gone to drive a strange, broken car.At theagreed time, he had not returned, and I feared that he had had anaccident.
I have experienced disgust with some people - usually doubledealers.
When my ex-boyfriend didn't want to sleep with me anymore and Iinsisted. We made love but he felt very badly and I felt guilty.
I was disgusted with the hypocrisy of my colleagues from thegroup.
When I woke up at night to find a fire spreading towards the bed-rooms.I was very frightened as I realized that I faced death.
When being made look a fool by the teacher in front of the classduring a turn.
When I received a letter telling me that my mother was very ill.
I was amongst a group of people talking about how the Maoripeople were stirrers and causing trouble in our country. I feltshame to be a pakeha when other pakehas had such narrowconservative views.

When I was 12 years old, some friends of our family had come towatch TV. I lay on the floor and moved my pelvis. When the otherpeople had gone, my mother told me that it had looked as if I hadwanted to make sex.
At a friend's party there were several allusions to my sexual adventures.

We had gone to our native village and I went to visit a tribalgroup which believes in Goddess Kali.As it was a festival day theyhad to offer a hen to the Goddess so they cut the head off a henright in front of my eyes.I felt disgusted and evenb gave upeating meat after this incident.
I was in a hopeless situation in a dirty place. No study, nowork, only loneliness.
I feel guilty when when I realize that I consider material thingsmore important than caring for my relatives.I feel veryself-centered.
When I had to finish those big amounts of homework in time.
I was very disgusted the first day I went to put a dead body inthe Mortuary. There were many dead bodies and some were uncoveredso we had to put on top of the other bodies.
Doing this pointless questionnaire.
One day I shouted at my brother who didn't do any wrong to meonly that I had a disappointment from a friend and projected iton to him. He cried and I felt guilty after sometime.
My girlfriend let me down badly 3 times in one week. Theseinstances summed up all the negative aspects of our relationshipwhich at the time seemed doomed to fail.
A friend of mine was hurt as he thought that our relationship wasnot the same as before and something had gone wrong.
When a close friend died.

I was examined by a teacher I greatly respected. I was wellprepared on the subjects but he put some side-issues to me and Icouldn't answer.
I kicked the dog outside on a cold night because he was annoyingme. The next day he came down with the flu and we thought he wasgoing to die.
I was on a walk with my child when I met a drunk woman.
An argument that grew out of an ordinary conversation with aperson very close to me, when we should have been having a goodtime together.
One night, after having decided to finish our relationship, Itook my girlfriend home.While driving back home, I felt that Ihad not handled the whole thing very well.

This feeling of guilt really applies to moral/religious views. I(being Catholic) went against what I was brought up to believe inand had a sexual relationship with my boyfriend. Many monthslater, when I was doing some deeper self analysis I began to feelguilty and realized that I had gone against what I wanted formyself and my future.
When I see dead dogs on the road.
When I heard about the advances an acquaintance of mine had madeto my friends, who did not approve of them.
At a school dance when my supposed \best friend\" kept walkingaway from me whenever I came near her."
The morning after a wild party.
I was sitting on an electric swing, suddenly the machine wentout of order while I was still in the upward position.
The lift of Stockholm central station stank of vomit and urine.
With a Manager who insists on making crude innuendos pertainingto sex.
When I got 21/30 points in an exam of statistics. The result wasunexpected and it made me realize that statistics do notsurpass my abilities, as I have sometimes thought.

I made the college entrance examinations for P.U.C. It was what Iwanted more. When the first list came out I got frustrated. Iwasn't in. When the second list came out without hopes I startedto read the newspaper and my name was thre. I was in the bus andfelt like crying so that everybody could hear me. The cry was hold,and 1982 became forever a mask in my life.
Getting separated from my family for a week caused me a sense ofsadness.

I heard that a friend had died in an accident; group situation:suddenly a friend came in and said \Have you already heardthat...\"; there was a terrible consternation, silence, theneverybody shouted excitedly \"How could that happen...\"."
This feeling I sensed quite recently. It was arisen by theterrific thought that I might lose the man I loved !
On the train a drunk person touched my baby and I reacted verydisapprovingly.I felt ashamed later as the person had not beenaggressive though he could have been.
On my way to a concert I went with a man who tried to molest me.At that moment I did not care much but now the impression fillsme with disgust.
I received the results of the test paper of my major subject andI found that my result was not as good as a classmate who hadrecently changed his major subject.I felt very ashamed.
When I received my U.E. accredited as I was totally unexpectingit and I was so happy.

I sensed such a feeling when I understood I was admitted to theUniversity. I was at home, the atmosphere was still, though Imyself was full of suspense. I tried to do different things. Whenthe telephone rang and...! Yes, of course there were othersituations when I felt a similar feeling but I was unmindful ofthem.

I was alone in my parents' house, having made plans to spend theafternoon with a lover (plans which the lover cancelled),watching a movie and considering my life and circumstances -pressures of examinations in particular.
When I was detained one day in school, by the vice-principal, forindiscipline.
When I entered a toilet in a bar and it stank.

In the past I used to think that my mother was a very naggingperson.When I started living at the hostel we had little timeto meet each other.Whenever I went home she would take careof me.I gradually realized that what she had done was for myown good.So very time I saw her I felt guilty.
When I was young I felt ashamed when our relatives visited us andI hid myself.
When I was told that I had passed the exams.
Our only elder sister got married and started having pains in herabdomen and she was told that she could not have children. To oursuprise she had a baby 2 months back.
Succeeding in helping others.
After a pleasant evening with friends in my flat, one of them didnot want to leave, because he wanted to sleep with me. He saidthat he had fallen in love with me, that he felt alone and so on.
On a trip to Santander a child sitting beside me fell ill andstarted to vomit, seeing this made me feel very bad.
I was totally unprepared for a seminar conducted by an assistantprofessor whom I highly respect.
When I happen to witness some sadistic acts.
I learned that a class-mate had given a list, of peolpe who helpeach other in exams, to the professor.
Fighting with my father while drunk.
Once, late at night, I was biking home and overtook a man. Hesaid to me \Hello darling\" I was terrified and imagined the wildest scenes."
A friend wanted to give me a surprise into my room and I thoughtshe was stealing from the room.
Before the examn.
I was disgusted to see a person vomitting and I was told to cleanthe place where the vomit was.
One of my flatmates and I came back to the flat Monday morning,to find a real Mess, left by the guy we share with.
It was when I failed standard 8 exams while all my friendspassed and went to secondary school. In class I was alwaysgetting more marks than they did.
When a person is privileged in account of situations that areunjust, and disloyal to colleagues and friends.

My mother read a letter that a friend of mine had written to metelling me how she had got drunk the last time.
My father called me (behind my mother's back) and told me that mymother disapproved my behavior in the weekend. However, he didn'ttell me the details and left me with unanswered questions.
When the church choir came one Sunday after being away for someweeks.

A few days back I had a tutorial class and the teacher randomlyassigned one person in each group to make a presentation.Thediscussion in our group had been confused and the presentationwas not very well prepared.Unfortunately I was selected topresent and I could not keep calm, was confused and result wasvery poor.I really felt ashamed.
The sadness came to me when I heard that my girlfriend whom Iloved so much got married to another man before a rebuff fromher.
When the dean of UNZA asked me to vacate a big flat I wasoccupying and take up a smaller one as I was becoming a full timestudent at UNZA.
Once in my homes yard, I was plaing football with my cousin andin a certain quick the ball went on uncontrolled putting down abird-cage, killing it.

My sister marrying a bad man. He is cruel to her.
On the way back from Denmark with a friend on a small yatch,there was a storm and my friend was blown overboard;I was veryscared till I managed to get him back onboard.
I didn't attend lectures.
To say goodbye to dear friends after the holidays.
When the coach of our team degraded me to the second team.

One Saturday afternoon, I deliberately dressed up nicely (I hadbeen in a bad mood of late).I hoped to go for a walk in thesoft sunlight to try and uplift my spirits.When I was havinglunch in the canteen, two of my male classmates asked me as towhy I was dressed so nicely (they had seldom joked with mebefore).One of them said that he had a lounge suit and we wouldlook very nice if we wore them together.
One day, when I was twelve years old, my brother took some slimysubstance swimming on the surface of a pot of vinegar made ofcider and threatened to throw it at me.
When I met a girl and asked her for a date and she agreed, (Ithought this girl would never like me), this was an emotion ofjoy.
Father said: If you are pregnant, you will have to procureabortion. I was filled with disgust against my father.
A person died (not really a friend).
I typed up a letter for this physician at work. She didn't carefor my style, even though she was not using correct English. Itold her it was her letter and we would do it her way.
When I was offered a place in the university as a full timestudent.
Being asked to go out by someone I care.
I have always felt ashamed for some people's behavior to theirtoo old parents. I have felt hurt and shy when they have leftthem to the mercy of fate.
When I was on holiday with my former boyfriend, he hit me andbehaved in a very evil and ugly manner in front of the hotelpersonnel.

I most joyous moment was the day I got my marks.I was veryhappy when I came to know about my marks at the M.Sc (part I)examination where I got 71.5%.This was the highest marks I haveever scored in my life.
A class-mate died after being two months in coma, after a caraccident.
When I found out that my good friend and roommate did not pay thephone bill and electric bill like he promised and let me down.

After the interview for admission to the university and beforethe admission list was disclosed.I was scared that I would notbe admitted and my fear lasted for quite some time.My feardisappeared only after the list was disclosed.
I allowed my little brother to clean the bathroom in his own way.My mother came and saw the floor overflowed with water, slappedmy brother in the face and told him to go to bed immediately.

I was on the Inter Rail in Naples alone. After an evening in arestaurant I was going back to the hotel when a prostituteapproached me to sell herself. I refused but as I carried onwalking I felt that I was being followed by someone.
It was when my friend had stolen my money (K10) and haddisappeared.
When my grandmother died after a long illness.
At the dentist's, waiting for my turn to come.
When a friend of mine visited me and my house was in a mess.
I had reacted angrily at a friend for no fault of his.I hadraised my voice and had not cared for his opinion.
I could not do the questions on my math midterm.
Whenever I think of enrolling in Organic Chemistry.
At the end of my senior yr. in high school I found out that afriend of mine I knew had cancer had been diagnosed as terminallyill.
I had gone for a medical check-up at the U.T.H and failed to makeit back on time for the C119 practical sessions at 1400 hourslast academic year.
When I had not been accepted to a college which I dreamed ofgoing to. I felt that I had let myself and my parents down.
The same as in \shame\"."

A gathering of a social sports club at which they proceeded toshow pornographic videos and then afterwards (when most peoplehad had quite a bit to drink) carried on in a very degrading,unmoral manner - especially females exposing and flauntingthemselves with no shame or embarassment.
[ I have felt shame but am unable to remember any particularincident.]
I found a human \treasure\" that I desired and got immediately. I didn't think about anything. When I touched him I imploded but I am whole."
I was very startled when, at night at 2.00 am, a boy approachedme and yelled \I fuck you\", then however he stopped and laughed at me."
When finally I found a place to live, I felt relieved, predictingchanges in my life, and I became happy.
I had a discussion with my wife about an over-weight acquaintance ofour's, about her eating habits and the scars caused by herpregnancy.
When I caused much pain and sorrow to my boyfriend by finishingour relationship.
I was crossing the street together with some colleagues of minewhen I suddenly found myself almost under the wheels of a truck.
My father died unexpectedly at the age of 53 years. He certainlywould have liked to live longer. I was also said because I wasconfronted with the fact that I would die one day too.

I went to visit Montrose home for crippled children to interviewa handicapped child. I interviewed two boys and it went reallywell. I promised I would visit them, but never got the time. Now Ihope they've forgotten me, but I feel ashamed of letting themdown.
I studied medicine for several semesters. I was always disgustedwhen we had the dissecting-course. I cannot understand why somepersons like this course.

After a footballmatch I went home by car, a friend drove. I didnot realize that he was drunk until we were in the car. He wasmadly racing. Several times we were in dangerous situations and Itold him to be cautious, but he did not care.
When I climbed up a tree to pick apples.The angle of the ladderI was on did not enable me to get high enough.This impliedthat the ladder was not very stable.

Sometime back I was coming from the wards and lice were all overmy uniform since patient's blankets have a lot of lice. Ithappened that my boyfriend picked some lice from my white uniform.I was so ashamed.
I read a newspaper article about dogs being stolen in order touse them for fighting purposes.
A friend and a girlfriend went to Rome for 10 days with theirclass. When they were back home I heard people tell \strange\" stories about my friend and that girlfriend."
Waiting for my girlfriend to come from her apt. to mine. She wasvery late and I thought something awful had happened.
Had fear of losing husband.
When I was confronted by a policeman one night around 11 o'clock. I was afraid when they threatened to take me and my girl to thegallows.
A friend was assaulted by a young man on her way home.

That afternoon I rushed home to look at the result slip of thehigher level as fast as possible.I opened the envelope verycarefully and found that my results were much better than Ihad expected and thus I could enter the Chinese university.Mydiligence had paid and I was very happy.
Being stopped by the police for a traffic offence which I don'tthink I committed.
\Boy, you have been admitted to the medicine school and your uncle is coming back fron Canada next week,\" my father told me and it was a happy moment."
When I failed the twelveth standard exams I was ashamed athaving to see my parents later.

I felt anger against a colleague of mine during a rehearsal inacting. He hadn't learnt the text of an opera act in the course ofseveral months and thus making difficulties for the rest of mycolleagues.

The fact that my mother is getting married again (my mother andfather divorced about 15 years ago) means that she will probablymove to Turku, and our home, which is a one family house, will besold (I myself have not been living at home for the past sixyears).
When my husband lied to me, tricked me and when I had to leave myhome.
When I saw several people washing their car with water from adrain.
Not being able to have a party at home with friends.
When I heard about the death of Frantois Truffaut, the French motion picture director, on the radio.I had planned to go and see hislast film.
Once I had to visit a rather special person.
When I passed the university entrance exam.
In the holiday cottage of our association, two of my pals came towake me up early one morning by bringing a radio played at thehighest volume into my room - it was the morning service at itsloudest.
Selling the appartment after my divorce.
When I saw a big spider from very close.
When I watched a film about the problems of abandoned children(PIXOTE).
I felt guilty after stealing a cookery book from my colleagues.
When I saw a woman who had been run over by a train, just offKafue.The woman had been cut to bits, there was blood and splinters of bone every where.
A fellow player, quite unexpectedly, scores a goal, which means adraw.
When I was accused of having impregnated someone's daughter, itwas the girl's cousin who had done it.
A woman I know is slowly dying from cancer. Observing thisprocess makes me sad.
When I came home late one day. I was afraid I would be shouted atby my parents.
I was on this amusement park ride at Marriots Great America. Itwent way up in the air and then around and around. Heights arenot my favorite spots in life.
On a dark night I felt that there were several people near meand I did not know who they were.
Walking on a dark street with noone around.
I removed an article of clothing belonging to my employer whilein a position of trust.
A close person lied to me.
My grandfather had lung-cancer and was being nursed athome.I felt fear when I was alone with him and he almost chokedon mucus secretions.
When I was robbed in a bus.
It was in March 1985 when one of my fellow students borrowed mywristwatch and after sometime he broke a glass of that watch Igot angry when he was telling me but the anger didn't take longto fade.
I was very angry at my father when he didn't give me as muchmoney as my brother to use for studying. Once again my brotherwas better off then me.
My little brother was arrested by the police at the railway station afterhe had drunk some beer.
When I found out that a set task (i.e. 2 essays and a test), thethought of which had oppressed me, were not on the date I hadthought.
When I passed the grade 7 exam.
When my grandmother died very suddenly without warning.

Years ago I fell in love for the first time. as natural for everyschool-girl I was day-dreaming. Later (after 3 years) we lefteach other. No one was to blame but I felt deep sadness. Even nowI remember about it quite often.
I was walking in the wood at night with my boyfriend. Veryromantic. Suddenly I heard a car driving very slowly with thelights out, it looked as if they were looking for something.
A man in a car was following me when I went running early onemorning in a fairly secluded area.
When I had to walk along a dark road alone.
An argument among several friends because of the irrationalbehavior of one of them who fell out with us for no reason andsaid that we were to blame.
The moment I got the news that I had been selected for the U.G.Cjunior national research fellowship.It was a dream come true.
When I saw a male engineer one year and came back to find he wasnow a female (I don't know it/them personally).
Being mistreated by my former primary school teacher, Mr Zalu.
At work, when an elderly man complained unjustifiably about me anddistrusted me.
Before I moved away from home, I feared leaving.

I was happy when at difficult times I could find support in myfriend and my fiancT, I was happy because of their spiritual andmoral help which gave me new power to struggle. I was happy then,I felt it in my soul.
Being miserable in a party when other people are friendly andhappy.
When I travelled all the way to my former school to collect mycertificate, only to be told that I owed them some money, I knewnothing about this.
When I was talking to a person who is a hypocrite, I feltdisgusted at his reaction.
[ No response.]
A colleague asked me for some advice and as he did not haveenough confidence in me he asked a third person.
When I was a child, one day while playing, I fell up to my waistin mud.
When my little sister was sick at home and I thought that shewould die.
The sense of guilt came over me too, when I interrupted mystudies. Why ? Because I felt guilty before my parents ! Theybelieved in me though this event did not make them disbelieve me.
The day the results of the university entrance exam waspublished, I found my canditate number and I was very excited.
After an event in which I felt that I had acted unfairly.
Getting slightly intoxicated at the 1984 I.C.C. Ball.
I walked in on a teenage patient of mine (I work in a hospital)as he was going through my office drawers and he had removedmoney from my purse.
When I get home late my father scolds me and this makes me angry.
Getting sent on a company expense trip to another state to workfor a week at that plan.
Haven't felt shame for ages.

Talkiing about the past happy hours with two friends at night ina camp a few months ago.We shared our feelings, notions andevery hidden anxiety.I thought that they cared for me and Iwas very happy and satified.
When I took a car which was not mine, and suddenly it stoppedworking.
When I was 8 years old my tonsils had to be operated on. This isnot a complicated operation, but just before it started I wasvery afraid so that I will never forget it.

In 1983 a sadist provoked my sister in my presence.He triedto force my sister into accompanying him to his place, but mysister did not agree and so she was kicked and she fell down. There was a fight.
After passing my Malawi Certificate of Education Exam and beingselected to Kamuzu College of Nursing.
One evening, in the tramway, I was afraid of two drunk menmolesting my girlfriend and me.

A friend told me about his cousin who is my girlfriend. He saidshe had treated him in a mean and nasty way. I was surprisedbecause in front of other people she had always treated him in afriendly way. I am very sad about it.
I saw a film about the nazi concentration camps during the war.After the film I felt disgust.
My father won't be so pleased with me as if I was elected \Three Good\"."
I feel shame when I have made a promise, I can't keep it and thishas negative effects which are caused by my behavior.
Caught cheating on a diet.
When my boyfriend and I experience something nice or when we havemade a nice walk together.
When I knew that a person who I didn't like, had about me otherfeelings.
When money was stolen from my pocket.

A friend told me how he managed to win the sympathy of as manypeople as possible. He said he first listened to what they saidand then he tried to only say things they would like to hear.He would never express his own opinion. I felt really disgustedwhen he told that.
Not being chosen for the English lectures (my girl-friendchosen).
While watching a movie, someone who was drunk started vomitinghelplessly.

When I was doing my last year at Secondary School I was robbed ofmy clothes, wristwatch and my pair of shoes. After investigationsit was found that all the things were stolen by one of the boysin our hostel.

I stormed into the room, hoping to cool myself with some softmusic from my three band radio cassette.There was only youngKaley there and he explained, \ Your aunt has sold it as she wanted to buy clothes.\""
When I decided not to out any longer with a girl whom I likedquite a lot.This made me feel low for a some time.
When I had stayed abroad for a long time and I had rememberedabout my friends and relatives. I felt sad and I wanted to seethem as soon as possible.
Winning a game after a long time of losing.
I had arranged to meet my friends at a certain place, and I waswith other people.My friends did not arrive and the people whowere with me began to get tired.My friends were one hour late.
My friend had trouble and I was not able to help him.

A few years ago my mother suffered from canccer and died withintwo years.We had not finished our studies then and could notbear our responsibilities as her children.My mother had triedher best to take care of us but she lived in pain these twoyears.Neither the doctor nor we could do anything for her ascancer is incurable.I was very eager to replace her insuffernig , even die instead of her.
When I stepped on a snake at home, it was dark but there wasmoonlight.
When I accused unjustly a person of robbery, who proved me thecontrary, almost caused a public fight.
When I walked out of my room with only my pants on and found mygirlfriend and her female friend looking for me outside.
When I found one of my new pullovers wrinkled inside thewardrobe.My brother had done it.
When I imitated a teacher behind his back - walking very silly.
When I was dismissed unjustly from the firm where I worked,because there where persons that didn't have problems, andwouldn't miss in the jobs they occupied if they were dismissed.

A friend told me it would be better for me not to be on familiarterms with another friend, although, in my opinion he had noreason to say such things. He only said so hoping that Iwould search support from him (that, however, was not necessary).
