One day, I discussed a very important question with A.Asuddenly declared that he would not accept my position andthought that he himself was right.Moreover, he attacked strongly, not my opinion but me personally.
During the PY 102 film session on Tuesday, one of the films shown was of an experiment on a live cat involving strapping it into amachine for possibly days, and doing things to its brain.
I thought him a good friend but he tried to lie to me several times.Last time was the height of impudence. He promised he would comehome but he didn't. I felt a sense of anger and insult.
I was very happy when my scholarship to continue studying at UNZAwas approved after it had been cancelled.
When I was 15 my mother discovered various items in my room which15 year olds aren't usually expected to have - mainly alcohol,marijuana and contraceptives !
When I got the scholarship I was very happy as the finacialburden of the family was reduced.
After one year of searching, my friend and I have found a flat weare able to pay for.
When I failed Psychology examination when most of the studentspassed.
My dear hamster (called Hannes) died at the age of 2 and 1/2 years.His shape forced me to mercy killing (an injection).
I had an interview for entry into college. The results were to beannounced on radio. After a long period of waiting the resultswere released. I had succeded - tension was relieved by joy.
The same event described under FEAR - in the bus a man sat besideme, with his trousers open and holding his penis.
I was unaware that I had walked the streets in torn trousers.
When I got to know that my father had passed away.
When my uncle found me having sexual intercourse with a distantrelative of mine in the sitting room, on the couch.I failed tostop and get up, I carried on.
I was supposed to fetch some friends at the bus stop, but I didnot do it because my father was in a bad mood and I was afraidthat he would grumble.
Stranded in the north of Fraser Island with a submerged 4 WD hirevehicle.

When I was involved in a car accident last November, after thefirst fall of snow.I lost control of the car and it spun roundand landed on the opposite side of the road, on the hardshoulder.It was stopped by a pole on top of a bank sloping downto a stream.
When I saw my niece (5 yrs) crying in the hallway for her motherwho had passed away about a month ago.
That day I was alone at home after coming home from school.I didnot know where everyone else had gone, I kept waiting for them tocome back and nobody came.It was getting very late and I wasterrified.
When I saw the list of books to read for an acccouting course, Ithought \ Oh God how will I ever manaage it!\""
Failing an examn because I did not work hard enough.
I was disgusted to find out that the water isn't filtered orpurified before it leaves Latimer Hall from the drains.
Somebody told her friend that she would hit me wherever we wouldmeet.
At a moment of affect I offended a person very close to me. Hehad given me ground for that but it was a trifling in comparisonwith the way I insulted him. A moment later I felt a sense ofguilt.
When I finally managed to get a specific sound from my guitar,after baving tried for a long time.

After waiting impatiently for the results of the form 5examinations for almost a year, at last I received a letter ofacceptance from the Senate of the university of Zambia tellingme that I had made it to the first year course at UNZA.
I came home and discovered that someone had broken in. Then Irealized that they probably were still there.
My friends and I were sitting at a restaurant. We were talkingand a few of them said awful things about women. I becamedisgusted by their narrow-mindedness.
It was when I was selected to go to a Secondary school to startform I.
A party with friends on New Year's Eve.
A drunken friend of mine was beating up another friend, who wasalso drunk.
Being sexually assulted on a bus and noone helped (people onlylaughed).

When I was in a bus on my way to the examination centre, a man sitting opposite me kept looking at me continously. I did not know what was wrong.When I reached the centre I started strolling around as I still had a little time.Suddenly a man came and whispered \You have forgotten to zip up your trousers.\"I was at a loss to say anything and I felt very embarrassed.When I thought of the bus incident I felt even more ashamed."
I lied to a friend.
Some days ago I had a slight car accident through my fault.
When the parents of my girlfriend gave permission to spend ourholiday together.
After having watched a crime show on the TV, I was about to takethe dog for a walk. Then, suddenly, there was a man on theporch... (We live some distance away from other people).
Accidentally dropped a friends camera flash, so that it wasbroken.
Teacher suspected me stealing money.

People who came to our home - and requested \Put out your smoke\". That we should not smoke in our house... and asked not even politely. It disgusted me because I think people need to adapt to the situation."
Finding out my grades at the end of my Sophomore year.

My got my mathematics test's marks and could not believe that itwas true.In the past I would have at least 80% marks.Was Igetting weaker at studies ?This made me feel that I should notexpect too much from going to the university.

Motor failure on a boat outside Gottenburg when we were in heavy seas and the wind was strong.As we could not steer the boat wedrifted towards the rocks.We did not succeed in attracting theattention of any passerby until 4 hours had elapsed.
First time in anatomy.
When I understood that my marriage was falling apart, and wedecided to be legally separated.
Failed to do what I had promised.
When I came to know that my feelings for someone were notreciprocated.
When I was in the puberty I smashed the favourite toy of mylittle brother because of a fit of rage.

Someone told me a story of Amnesty International: a boy waskilled and his head was put in the litter of his girlfriend. Itlooked as if she was pregnant, then she died. It is disgusting, Ican hardly write it down.
This summer I got into a fight with one of our patrons (at atheatre). He hit me and I hit him and her friend, he hit my friendand we all hit eachother.
When I think about my parents getting old.
A drunk man had fallen in the street and he was shouting obscenewords.
When I was refused a transfer from my school to another, simplybecause it was far away from my house.

I experienced this feeling when I was accepted as a student.Because everything turned out different from my expectations.Although I passed the exam successfully I was accepted as astudent only when I didn't expect it at all, namely at thebeginning of September.
I was furious when the teacher pointed out in class that Iwas the quietest girl in class.
At a social event when none of the guests would help to servefood or clear tables. It was all beneath them.
A few days ago I saw two dandy girls of my age. I disliked theirclothes and their way of doing.
Close friends talking badly of other friends.
One day I went for a bath. I took off my clothes and as soon as Ihad finished my brother came in. I felt sad and I found no reasonwhy he came in.
When, for example, I left for the first time my parents and Iwent to live in Sofia.
Once I did not have enough money to pay for a coffee.
When my nephew asked me to tell him a story and I simply did nothave the energy or the will.When I saw his disappointment I wasterribly guilty and read a story to him after all.
When I arrived home late at night.I know that my mother getsworried and this made me feel angry.
I felt it at the same time when I felt disgust.
When I forgot the lyrics during a song contest.

When I meet old past pupils of mine - and find they are all doingwell - I feel joy. Yesterday I met a young woman (20 yrs) I'dtaught her at 6 yrs, then at 12 yrs and hadn't seen her for last3-4 yrs; she was no longer a waitress but a meter maid forCouncil.
My mother died of cancer after a 4 year illness - I think themost pregnant moment of sadness was the next morning, just as thesun rose.
When I was in the army, a room mate of mine came back fromfurlough and threatened another fellow with a knife.
When my brother gave me a watch.
When I think of death - not my own but that of my parents,brothers and sisters.
I was playing a sport in an advanced PE class and many of thepeople were not advanced.
When my kid brother broke my reading spectacles.
One morning I was standing at the bus-stop and the bus passed bywithout stopping, even though there were only 8-10 passengersinside.I felt angry at the rude behaviour of the bus driver and conductor.
When I came back from my holidays.
I once caught a letter in my girlfriend's handbag from a certainman. I felt anger.
When I was the South Koreans on the TV.
I drink wine too often.
When my father failed to send me transport money after theclosure of the school.
When in the end of a semester I got the approval in a matter thatI judged very difficult.
When I as a child of 9 or 10 I was playing doctor with theneighbours boys their mother caught us.
Introducing myself at a first tutorial this year at University.
When I thought the house was on fire at night.

I studied medicine for several semesters and at that time Ideveloped a great fear of examinations. I was most afraid of myexamination of anatomy. While other students were examined, I wasdissecting. I was able to hear everything and was waiting withfear until it was my turn.
Not thanking relatives for a favor done.
When after 10 months of national service I was \downgraded\" anddid not have to do the remaining 5 months."
I was annoyed when a person higher up asked me why a particularjob was not done, it was not my job to do it.
When I saw my family after a separation of one year.

I mangled the side of my dad's van on a fence. I did not realizethe extent of the damage until he showed it to me the next day.The shock on my face was genuine so a friend interceded with agood excuse which I did not deny. I never clarified thesituation.
My mother wants to talk very often about her life. I dislike thisbecause she always talks negatively about the same peoplewhatever I do it doesn't help.
Insulted by the class leader.
My mother accused me of not visiting her enough when she was inhospital for an eye operation.
When we stayed in Vienna with our class, my friend and I behavedincorrectly. Our teacher threatened us with exclusion fromschool.
I passed an exam that I was absolutely certain that I had failed.
I was very angry at someone.
When I heard my grandfather's wife had leukemia I was very sad.
I was playing in a football tournament and saw the rules openlydisregarded.
When somebody stole my brother's disco machine.
Waiting for a bus not coming for a long time, and the bus driverswere having a long lunch.

I spent a weekend in San Diego visiting my boyfriend Rob. We wereat the airport and my plane was just about so leave. After sayinggoodbye, I boarded the plane. It was the hardest thing to do andit was a sad trip home.
When I wanted to go into a house, there was suddenly a big dogstanding beside me. It was hardly moving, but I did not know howit would react later on.
Cheating in a minor geography exam at school.
When my father suffered with dizziness. He had to behospitalized, because the physician didn't know what was wrong.Because his stools were black, I thought it could be cancer.
I felt happy when I saw my brother at the bus depot after 3months without seing each other.
When I learned that my parents were going abroad and leaving mealone for a few years.
When a thief broke into my house at night.
When my natural parents name would show up on papers and not my,what I call real name.
When I have sometimes been unfair to my parents, when I havehappened to deceive them over some trifling things.
My son lives with my parents in the country and I feel thisfeeling always when leaving for Sofia, but the last time it wasquite strong.
In March I was busy studying during the night I could only sleeptwo or three hours only for fear that I would be weeded and sentback.
My last genetices midterm - a decent grade.

Last year my freshman yr. It was a day in March I did well onsome tests. I seemed to finally adjust to college, it was hot andsunny. I was walking in front of a frat. when I heard Beach Boys\Surfin'USA\". I had this overwhelming feeling that to be at CAL was good. I still have it somewhat."
When I heard the news that my grandfather had died.
When my roommate's moped was stolen I was very angry.
Someone acting stupid in public.
Death of my grandmother.
A classmate told me I must have bribed the class leader to let mego to your English lecture.
Saw a real party leader.
New year's eve 1983/1984, I met my girlfriend.We stood on thesteps outside her parents home and I kissed her for thefirst time.
This morning I spent a lot of time on my toilet and missed thetrain to the university.My mother told me that I spent moretime than a woman on my toilet.I felt a mixed emotion of shameand anger.
One day before Christmas, I went shopping with my brother and hisfriend. We had a good time. But on the way home we were almost inan accident because the weather was bad.
I stayed alone in the dark at night in the mountain, waiting formy uncle.I remember that I took a big stone and it calmed me.
When I was weeding the garden I found a lizard in my hand.
I do not help out enough at home.
Going to a concert.
A situation of overt unfairness, manipulation of people and itsconsequences.
Finding out that my best friend was deceiving me.
Yesterday, when the final whistle blew at the final match betweenOIS and IFK and it was certain that OIS had won the Swedishtitle.
I thought that the guy I had been associating with for over ayear went out 2 or 3 times with a high school girl whom he claimednot to like.
My father was very angry with another man in the presence of myfriends.
When I heard the last regulation of the socialist govrenmentconcerning pensions.
I saw a cripple in rags with small children in Italy.He wasprobably an imposter.
My boyfriend hinted over the phone about wanting to \be free\". He thus did not say it point blank, silence followed."
Finding out that I was deceived by my friend.
On one occasion whilst engaging in horseplay with my girlfriend,I caused her to be physically harmed.
After confronting the person who stood me up, I blew up and saidall the wrong things.
Prolonged \niggling\" of friend on a single theme which I considered of no consequence."
Failing an examination.
When I was appointed to position of trust in a group set up tochange the working environment.
I work part-time as a shop-assistant and a customer spoke to mevery loudly about an Indian man & white woman with children - howhorrible that was and would I want to have little dark children.
I had lunch with my ex-boyfriend and did not mention it to myfiancee.I felt guilty despite the fact that I felt nothing formy ex-boyfriend.
I was disgusted at myself when I dropped a vital catch, whileplaying a cricket match, and we lost the match; though the catchwas difficult.
When I gave birth to a child and saw that it was normal when itwas put against my breast.
The computer at school had left out my name along with fourothers and I had no rights for one year.So I was happy to findmy name on the medical schhol list.
A friend of mine often had difficulties with her parents. Onceshe had a child she had a better relationship with them.
When I had broken a piece of glass of the refrigerator by puttinga hot pan in it.

After having finished my B.Sc, I was struggling hard to continuemy studies and had taken the M.SC exam.I was not sure that Iwould be selected in the written exam.When I saw my name in theselected candidates list I was overjoyed.
The fear about my future : work, making ends meet and health.Coping.
A friend of mine, who had repeated a year at school once before,did not pass the final examination and had to take it again halfa year later.
Always, and this happens often when I do not keep my word.
When I failed the grade seven examination.
Recently I felt very sad without any reason. It lasted for a fewdays. There was nothing I liked in that period.
When my sister lost my favourite jumper at a party and failed totell me for several days after it happened.
Not chosen for all English classes.
When I got to know that I had passed the university entranceexam.I thought that I had done one of the exams badly.
No specific instances - perhaps having lied as a child resultingin someone else being blamed for the event.
I fear before each exam.
Movement in bush late at night while camping.
During a family reunion, they started talking about me wearing anear-ring.
The loss of the woman who loved me most till today.
When I boarded Yanu Yanu bus I sat near a man who was smokingtobacco.
One day, at an important place I met a group of girls and whilewe were waiting for a bus these girls started smoking andcommanded me to smoke; I felt very disgusted.
Having unwanted attention paid to me in my place of work -harrassment (and sexual harrassment) by another worker -disgusted by his implications.
When I went to the library three weeks after it had opened andfound that everyone was busy.
When I heard that I had achieved a place in form I.
When my father and I worked on the house just after he hadrecovered from illness, I was rather lazy.This meant that hehad to work hard and was not very well later.
While cycling in the country, I came across a large herd ofcows.
When I was a child, I had a medical check-up. I had to undressmyself and was examined by several doctors.
I was almost caught in the girls hostel by the security men, Iwould have been expelled from school had I been caught.
When I forgot about a meeting at work.
My boyfriend promised to take me to see a game of tennis and rangsaying he was going to the pub with some of his friends instead.
When my grandmother died.
Fear overwhelmed me when right against the car I was in I sawanother one, as if out of control of the driver.
When I saw a fight I had a physical reaction of disgust and ofdeep perturbation.
My friend was badly hurt.
Political and military trnsgressions around the world, generallyspeaking. This cannot be described through this questionaire.
When I passed a very important exam.
When I had to represent my boss at a meeting.
I feel disgust with some people when I see what they are capableof, including lack of any dignity, when trying to find a seat inthe tram.

The teacher of one course gave me 10 questions with sub-questionsgoing from a to e for each question.She asked me to do all thisin one and a half hours.It involved a lot of describing andexplaining and even though I knew all the answers, I could notfinish the work.

When I was in lower six I joined an interview group tointerview the general public.One of my friends in the grouplost her purse and she was very nervous.Five of us had to goanother place so we left her, and planned to see her later.ThenI heard her describing how her purse looked.I realized that Ihad seen her purse on the floor and had not wanted to do anything about it.
The night before my wife had given birth to our twins. I feltfear in the hospital yard, I feared if everything was going to bein order.
Saw on TV China winning the gold medals.
A friend came to visit me late one night. He promised to stayonly a quarter of an hour, but he stayed 5 hours !! He didn'tleave and I was very angry.
It was not long ago when I and two of friends of mine got quite drunkand one of them began to rave under the influence of the alcohol.I felt fear of what could have happened.
My parents told me that they do not like my friend.
When I sit for examinations.

After seeing a horror film - Omen.I could not sleep at night even though I closed my eyes.The last scene of the film keptcoming back to me, I seemed to hear the girls in the filmshouting at the devil.The devil did not have any expression onhis face and I thought that he would choose me.
I went home late one evening and saw that the security lightswere off.I got inside the gate and just then I realized thatthe dogs may be outside.
My neighbour was not able to set his car in motion because it hadsnowed heavily. I helped him - he was thankful and invited me.
A close married friend has just had his first child.
When I passed the B.A exams with first class results.
It was in the evening when I heard that my girl went to Zambiaand that she would never come back.
When I went to the sauna for the first time and there were menand women.
One day while we were strolling along the road one of myfriends suggested that we go and watch a blue film.I wascurious so I went along but I felt quite guilty later.
Finding out that the university will give first priority toqualified practioners and clinical years to go to your Englishlectures.
I felt disgust with a man I had trusted and respected, to whoseproblems I had always shown deep understanding.

I had got a bad cold. My father said I must be crazy to go bymotorbike at those temperatures. When I answered him that I didnot care about a cold, he said that if I did not care foranything I could leave him (it was for the second time he saidsomething like that).
A sudden end to the relationship with my first girlfriend.

I am left-handed. When I attended the first form, we learned towrite with pens. I smeared everything I had written. All myfriends had written well and wanted to know why the teacher waslooking at my note-book. I was ashamed.
Forgetting a close friend's birthday.
I read about a monk who had been murdered and put into a barrelwhich was filled with blood of pigs.
My roommate was rude to me.
I feel sad about an event I can not influence.
I sensed a strong feeling of joy when in the plant, at my workingplace, I got a message that I was admitted as full time student atthe Higher Agricultural Institute.
My grandfather's funeral.
I felt the above condition when I took my brother's bicycle to amarket and unfortunately the bicycle was stolen and I didn't knowhow I could tell the owner about the stolen bicycle.
When I was house-hunting: Another person got a flat that I wouldhave liked, too, because he heaped a floot of words on theletter.
I was at the table at a French friend's house.They served me abig dish with roast cauliflower and sauce.I had to eat it.
Angry with my brother, who was making fun of me, teasing me.
I was really hoping that I would pass the examination, but Ifailed and so I felt very sad.
When I was told that the form five results were out.
I got into a bad fight in a bar and my friend received a bad cutabove his left eye while trying to separate us.
At a party I met a girl who drew me to her, told me some nonsenseand always wanted to kiss me.
When the teacher asked me a question in class, concerningsomething I had read earlier, and I did not know the answer, so Ifelt ashamed in front of the whole class.
I was walking one day and I met a man who wanted to ask me aboutmy brother but I didn't stop to hear what he was saying. I wasashamed when I found him at home and he told my brother what hadhappened.

I had to tell someone that I was interested in remaining celibateand alone. And that my spiritual master strictly prohibitedsexual relations outside of marriage. This caused great fearthrough lack of conviction afraid to hurt someone's feelingsdespite my own being hurt in the process.
A member of a religious sect tried to convert me, using reallyevil tricks to persuade me.After he had left, I was anxious andangry for a long time. After the event, I was alone.
When I lost my study grant without having attended any exam inthe career I had started, and it was too late to cancel my registration.
Despite our good performance and excellent results the managementrefused to meet our demands.
Boyfriend doing cleaning in situation where it was my job to doit. Later snapped at him over trivial thing. He looked downcast.I felt guilty - \he's just done all that work for me\"."
When I first passed a job interview.
I experienced joy when I got the results - I had made it to thesecond year.

A close relative of mine died in a serious car accident.I wasone of the first two people to see the corpse and I had to do it. Before going in to see it I was afraid as it was the first timethat I was seeing a corpse.
The housing council asked the city to cut 40 linden trees so thatthe inhabitants of the lower floors would have a view to the sea.
Fear of sexual overtures from a close relative in the family.
A certain person started to say dreadful things very calmly, Ifelt hurt and disgusted.
I behaved in a nasty manner towards a friend, I said things whichI could have said in a more friendly way. After that I feltguilty.
This was what I felt when my boyfriend went to Bourgas to studythere. I had the feeling I would lose him. Anyway the distancePlovdiv-Bourgas seemed to me so great.
When my father died I felt myself alone and the fear possessed me.I was a child and all my sisters and brothers (8) were young.
When I found my baby whipped by my Auntie. I was really sad andup to this moment my sadness is still on.
On the last day of my school life I was very sad, specially onthe farewell party day.I felt sad to leave behind my belovedteachers and friends.
To talk in a meeting - expound my thoughts on a subject. Feardelayed me acting to do this.
When I knew I had to go out with my mother on some errands.

Immediately after the New Year holidays I happened to visit aparty where there was a lot of alcohol and I became drunk. On thenext day I felt sort of ashamed when I remembered what I had saidand done on the night before.
I was driving near my girlfriend's house and I decided to keepgoing because it was late and I would be back in the next fewdays anyway. The next day she was killed in a road accident.
Vertigo - standing on a ladder and painting the house.
I was filled with joy when I heard that I had been selected for aUniversity course.
Describing to mother how a hole in the wall had appeared while Iwas babysitting.
When I got my results - I had passed the form III exams.I hadnot expected to do so well.
Same situation as before - having my car stolen.
Being insulted by my roommate.
Joy of giving birth, and of sharing that joy with my husband.Moments of complete happiness and feelings of so much love.
The day I decided to get out of my house I saw in my brother'seyes that they blamed me for the situaiton.
Two timing - going out with 2 guys at once (secretly).
My dog died of a cerebral tumor.
Saw my brother-in-law insulting my sister.
I felt fear when I was young and left in my big house all alone.
A dear friend was removed from the division whre I work.

I had been having a heated argument with a lover - whoseintention was that we should marry in the near future - and wasrejected by her when I started to cry. When I stopped crying fora moment she said \There, have you got it all out now ?\"."
I got a present from a great friend (a dog).
In a social situation I became interested in a woman. We talked,we laughed, we enjoyed each other. She desappeared for a fewminutes, and a little after appeared with an other man.
I was walking home late at night from lectures and someonedeliberately started following me. It was dark and I was scared.
To buy a car and didn't like the business and the car.
When a begggar approached me for money, I felt disgusted.
A friend of mine ridiculed me, telling me that I would neveraccomplish anything. I felt that he had interfered with my life.
[ After an examine I had been satisfied with.]
Thinking about death when walking alone at night.
The time I first saw my cousin who is living in Tanzania.
At one of my close friends saying she didn't like the way I amnice to people I don't know, or who have been nasty to me.
[ The same as in guilt.]
When I got through the first day here at the department.
Death of the family dog.
The patient whom I expected to get well suddenly passed awayafter he showed had his meals.
When I started a relation with a girl, with whom I have fallen inlove already some time ago.
Someone vomited on the street.
I get angry when people disbelieve me or misunderstand me.
I insulted a couple of good friends of mine and even tried to hitthem when I was drunk.The next day, I was ashamed of course.
On New Year's Eve I went in a disco with friends. I amused myselfand got to know many other people.
When I got caught in the pouring rain last Thursday and did nothave a raincoat on me.
[ No response.]
Long illness.
My father accused my brother of having bumped his car, and it waswrong.
I went to buy a bicycle with my father. When I wanted to pay, myfather took his purse and payed.
I have an adopted Aboriginal sister I felt disgust due to theracism she has been subjected to.
I am going steady with a boy, but I had sexual intercourse withanother one, and I felt guilty about it afterwards.
When armed robbers broke into our house at night.

A certain woman had asked me to make something for her and I keptputting it off.When I finally made it, I did not see her fordays only to be told one day that she had collapsed and died.Ifelt quite guilty as she had jokingly said that I might not dowhat she had requested me to do.
Parents finding out I smoked.

In autumn I had to move to another lodging. My landlords, quiteintelligent people, warned me I had to move in the nearestfuture. But I had difficulties in moving my luggage because Icouldn't wait for a car to come. How amazed I was to hear themthreatening me they would throw our my things. And at that myluggage was well packed and did not stand in their way. I wasquitedisappointed and disgusted.
When they broke the artistic work of several weeks.Changes weremade and it was broken without permission, they had no right todo this.
Stopped at a Fast Food shop with friends and a few locals wantedto fight us for no apparent reason. They hit and picked on one ofmy friends.
I felt ashamed when I fought with my mother on some issue, andcaused her trouble.
I won the first prize at the science fair, the first of the kindat school and I was only in form II then.
My grandmother died suddenly last summer.
I had had a farewell party at the place where I had been workingfor a year.That night I could not fall off to sleep.I was sadthinking that I would not see my nice fellow workers again.
They asked me to throw the rubbish into a dustbin which had someawful liquid accumulated at the bottom.
Whhen the front tyre of the car burst.
I saw some images of a decapitation in a horror film.
Falling in love.
When I look at people around and know that people who are stupidlook stupid.
Attitude to a related family.
When, to my surprise, I got to know about having got \very good\"high school graduation marks."

I suffered from a gynaecological illness. I was quite displeasedto hear that my roommates had talked about it and they hadmisrepresented the truth. I felt deeply hurt when I learned thatit was done by a \good\" acquaintance of mine."
The loss of a close relative who was ill with cancer.
The day my fiancee told me that it was bad that I could not writemy mother tongue.

When my sister had the opportunity to do some modelling work. AndI was quite jealous - later on the photographer decided not totake her photograph, and she was very upset - I felt guilty as aresult, almost as if I had caused her to lose her opportunity, bynot being genuinely happy for her in the first place.
When I was baby-sitting at my cousin's place, I tried to have apleasant time and did not really take care of the child.I donot care very much about children.
When my boyfriend said he did not want to see me anymore (whichturned out to be untrue).
The time that I had to put my dog to sleep.
Standing in a crowed shop or in a closed room with too muchpeople in it. This gives me a fearful experience.
I lied to someone and some time later this person found out thatI had not told him the truth.
During a demonstration I climbed up the closed central door of abus.When the bus stopped I had to go back to the same place,afraid that the police would see me.
[ No response.]
This is one feeling I never betray, but I must confess that thelast time I slighty felt happy was when I passed my M.A with ahigh rank.This was a few years ago when my friend told me aboutthe result.
Breaking an implicit promise.
One of my colleagues accused me of having stolen his iron and Iwas sure that I had done no such thing.

When I realised that I was forgiven by the God who is there, whenI realised how much God loves me and that my acceptance with himis not based on my performance - that he loves me unconditionallyand showed that love in Christ who died because I do needforgiveness.
When my brother promised me money but he failed to fulfill thepromise.
The carterer refused to give me sugar to add to my tea sayingthat there was no sugar whilst it was there, so I left the cafedisgusted without taking the tea.
When I recently thought about the hard work it takes to study, and how one wants to try something else.When I read a theoreticalbook in English that I did not understand.
Ignoring my parents'wishes.
I went to a lecture and once again it had been cancelled, thiswas the second time.One had a negative attitude towards thelecturer.
I felt guilt when I betrayed the person whom I loved.
When my mother quarrelled with my aunt over me.
I received a letter from my grandmother. She has obviuslysuffered a lot from my grandfather's suffering health. Shementioned things she had gotten him and he would never use.
When friends found out that I had been lying about where I hadbeen on a particular occasion.
I was with my colleagues and we met an elderly man who was verydrunk, as he approached us he started to undress.
I did not do well in one of the subjects last term. I wasafraid that I would fail.My result was a grade D, though it wasnot good I still passed.I felt more comfortable then.
I had a very horrible dream one night, I dreamt that I had fallenoff a very crowded train.

One day I was the leader of the weekly meeting of the Churchfellowship.That day I had been preparing for the exams and didnot estimate the time to travel to the church right and I wastwenty minutes late.As I had not prepared well I led themeeting badly.I was ashamed of myself.

When I was forced to call the telephone company about a billconcerning a disconnected phone belonging to my landlord.Thebill was four months overdue and in the meanwhile he had beenusing my phone, he seemed to have no intention of having his ownphone reconnected.
When I made love with a girl, which I don't really love. HoweverI know that she loves me.
I was appreciated by others, especially my family members and myfriends.
[ No response.]
On my birthday I got a present that I had desired for a longtime.

My fiancee and I were at my parent's place watching TV. Therewereonly two TV-chairs and we were sitting on them when mydrunken brother came in and rudely chased my fiancee off thechair she was sitting on.
Heard about someone telling lies about me to my best friend.
I was in the cafeteria at the university and a class-mate told methat a friend of hers had had all her teeth taken out because ofan infection caused by her eating a rat's nail in her hamburger.
I was ashamed one day when we were found stealing and roastingmaize cobs from Agricultural experimental projects.
When I was doing research a few months ago, I had asked theInstitute to sponsor me for a computer course which was held inTISS.However, because of the administrative officer I could notget the money.
While playing I urinated on grandma's floor and did not go to thelavatory.My cousin told grandma and she came.
When I attended my cousin's 31st birthday.
When my uncle gave me my first year's results.I opened theenvelope and my eyes ran into two \B+\" - in EC110 and M160, this meant that I had qualified for a major in economics."

When we still attended school, my brother and I usually went tosee our aunt and to show her our term's report. She rewarded uswith money. Although my reports were as good as my brother's, hegot more money.
When I had lied, saying that I never take bread from the dinninghall and a friend of mine caught me doing it.He thus proved tome that I did in fact take the bread.
At the seaside, when a wave suddenly came and took off my bikini.
When I could not do anything because of a bad back.
A teacher gave me lower grades than I was entitled to, and washoping for.
I was living with my brother and one day he went away on businessand I was left alone to look after the house and the property. Atnight thieves came and wanted to break into the house.
When a professor caught me absent-minded and not paying attentionto what he was saying.
I was disappointed by a girlfriend when I visited her at her homein Woodlands.
When my dad passed away.
A certain man went to my parents and told them that I was marriedhere, when I am here at school. When I went home for holidays myparents asked me about it and I was angry with that man.
A friend giving me an expensive Christmas gift while I gave her acheap one.
When I stood first in the B.A exams.Earlier I had heard ofthese boys and girls who were toppers, but when I first heard ofme having topped I could not believe it.
When I am angry at someone without a good reason. Later on itproves that he didn't do anything wrong.
[ Do not remember any incident.]
My grandmother died.

I felt guilty last year during the winter term exams. A colleagueof mine asked me to give him my lecture notes (I had very goodnotes and I had passed my exam in advance) but I still don't knowwhy I didn't give them to him. That colleague failed and he wason the verge of not passing it at the supplementary examinations.
My parents do not like my friend and told me to stay away fromhim.
Seeing for the first time pictures about the so called\treatment\" of Jewish people in Nazi-Germany during World War II."

I was talking to a friend of mine about our parents andeducation.I said something and then realized that I did notknow my friend's parents, their motives and education.I feltashamed at having talked about something I did not know anythingabout.
When my mother kept me in leading-strings.
I had an accident with damage to the car body.
When my dog was stolen.
When my friends died one after the other.The first died in acar accident and the second one recently, due to an illness.

I received a phone call from a high school friend whose youngersister studied with me at the University and gave me a lift everymoning. She was going to get married to a guy whom I knew too andwho had died when he fell from a building, I was afraid to losesomebody since I had already lost a brother in an accident.
Once I answered my father rudely.
When I received the acceptance letter from UNZA.I had justcome home from work when my kind sister handed me an enveloppewhich I opened and was overcome with joy.
When I realized that the person I was courting hadn't been reallyby my side for a long time already. He had deceived me and I lethim deceive me.
Meddlesomeness of my mother about the way I live. She thinks I amto free in my behavior for instance when a boyfriend stays thenight.
In the army, an acquaintance of mine tended to use his positionto advance his own interests.
When I pulled a chair from under someone at kindergarten and hehit his head.
Doing poorly on an exam that I thought I should do well.
Some months ago my wife gave birth to twin sisters. She had noidea of looking after babies and she felt quite oppressed. Thefact that I couldn't help her caused grief to me.
Close relative is dying of cancer - found out last week.
Mad at my dad.
I peeped into Maurine's bedroom and saw two people - Maurine anbdmy step-dad.I thought, \ Why did she break her promises ? Why had she invited me ? Why do old men go for young girls ? \""
When the class leader read out the names of those chosen for theEnglish lecture and I was not on the list.
When somebody despised a friend of mine.
When people would tell me that my ex-girlfriend was playingaround on me.

I was on a trip to Phillipines during Summer and I was staying ina hotel.The room I was staying in was very silent and had verydim lights.The last night I felt frightened and lay awake - Icould hear some sounds around me and dared not open my eyes - Iwaited for dawn.
I work for a journal. Once the lay-out came to nothing, due tothoughtlessness of some colleagues.
Saw a mate bribing the leader.
When I am in an environment or with a person much worse off thanme, I realize how privileged I am.
Criticized in front of the class.
The sudden death of one of my parents.
When my mother got a terrible beating from my father.It was sobad that she fainted and it was only then that my dad realizedhow bad it was.
When I did not succeed in finding a job after having finished anonacademic degree.
I was very angry with a girlfriend for interferring a little toomuch with my personal affairs. I told her so rather strongly andshe started crying.
When I was small, I would always fight with my younger sister andone time I hit her and knocked the wind out of her. I felt realbad about it.
Some students trying to please the lecturer.
My roommate being unconsiderate.

When I worked as an \au-pair-girl\" in London, I received a callfrom a good friend who told me that she was in London too andwanted to see me. I was very glad - after that call andespecially when I saw her."
My companion admired me when I did some work voluntarily.
When a friend of mine was trying to make a fool out of me.
When I had to act alone a character for a public (40 people).
One time at the hospital I passed near the intensive care room.The offensive smell that came out disgusted me in such a way thatI didn't even dare to enter the room.
When I was younger I often saw my father come home drunk (he hadbig problems at that time). Once he woke me up in the middle ofthe night and shouted at me.
When somebody broke into our home one night when my mother wasout, and my sister and I had just gone to bed.
When I passed the driving test already on the first try, althoughI felt more and more uncertain as the day came near.
When I went to the clinic for a medical check-up and saw the waythe lecturer was conducting the lecture and the kind of responseshe got from the patients.
I stroke a person undeservedly.
When the bank let me borrow some money this winter, after mygrant was spent.
I felt angry when my friend told me that I had stolen her money.

Once in primary five, I had forgotten to take a book to class andthe teacher punished me by asking me to stand at the back of theclass.I thought about the way my mother would react if she sawme being punished.My mother was very good to me and though shedid not see me punished, I felt sorry for her.
One night I was called and told that the father of a close frienddied. When I visited my friend at home and when attending thefuneral I felt very sad.
When I miss the train and I am late, and I have to wait half anhour for the next one.
Hear my name on the list attending the English lectures.
When I tell someone no. In other words when I refuse to dosomething although I could have helped him.
Always when I am well succeded.
Not keeping a promise of delivering materials of great importanceto the receiver.
I experienced this emotion when my friend committed suicide afterwe had spent the afternoon playing and discussing life and it'sproblems.
While quarreling with my brother I broke the glass door of thecupboard and a china doll.We were scolded by my father forbreaking the door but we did not tell him about the door.
I told a friend that I was going to a party and he would notenjoy himself if he came along.He understoodthat he would nothave fitted in and there was something in that.
When I was at a party I met an old friend from an adulteducation course.We had not met for 2 years but had both thoughta lot about each other.A wonderful experience.
The headmistress at a secondary school accused me of banging theclassroom door when I didn't in front of the whole class.

At school I was bad in mathematics. Although my teacher hadadmonished me to do my homework, one day I had forgotten to doit. When my teacher noticed it, I blushed and was ashamed to berebuked in front of the other pupils.
I was disgusted with my girlfriend's behaviour. She was going outwith other boys who were also my friends.
When I did not buy what I had promised to.
When I received my report card in C.O.U.I was afraid of obtaininglow marks, but they were much higher than expected.
A girl I do not like kept coming to me and talking to me.
I entered the wrong room, and got into a bed where someonealready was sleeping.
When I first heard that Tage Dannielsson had died.
When there was a possibility of getting on better in professionallife. I valorized very much this aspect. People showed me thispossibility, not the real fact (even because until now ...)
When my sister became pregnant at UNZA last year.
I feel afraid of the way a great friend looks at me, and also alittle afraid of the directions that it's going.
I was very joyful when I heard that I had passed the standard 8exams. The day I heard the news was the day I celebrated mybirthday.
My relationship with a boyfriend was finished and I didn'tsucceed a years-course.
I forgot my mother's and sister's birthdays (they fall on thesame day).
Being alone in Europe and having to catch a train and bus to theairport, then board the plane alone.

I had been away all night without having told my parents aboutit.In the morning when I came home, my mother looked tired. She said that she had been awake all night because of me and thatshe was angry and disappointed.
After I had cheated my parents that I had lost my textbooks sothey had to send me money.
When I get an exam back with a grade that I did not desire. ThenI get mad at myself and say that I could have done better.
I had been on friendship with a certain girl for sometime and thelove was going on well, but it happened that I made thefriendship come to an end suddenly without good reasons.
My girlfriend left the house in which we lived together a fewmonths ago. This made me very sad.
Walking at friday night through Nijmegen, going to a pub or adisco.
It was my father's birthday party when I was asked to bring atray of tea and other drinks.
When the gear broke on my car.

One day I came across a certain boy who was intruding myfriendship as lovers with my girlfriend and I was very sadbecause I didn't expect that girl to disappoint me I regarded heras being very faithful.

I quarrelled with my younger sister because I had said somethingagainst her boyfriend.Consequently she looked through me whenshe saw me as she thought that I was trying to separate them. She had misunderstood me.
You told me psychology can help people to be happier.
Made a wonderful driend who understands me.
When my cat vomited and a worm came out which was still alive.Iwas forced to wipe it up.
I had shown anger toward my dog and he was killed later that day.
I was keeping a friend's Library book which went overdue. Myfriend was charged for the delay in returning the book to theLibrary. I felt guilty when I realised I was responsible.
Relating to my closest family.
Lost my purse, the money in the purse belonged to my parents.
When I failed the grade 7 twice and only passed it the thirdtime.
I was angry at a University tutorial when an ignorant loudmouthpersisted in trying to dominate the conversation.
My uncle died in the Vietnam War.
Once I spent a night with a friend at the secondary school. Wetold each other horror stories and suddenly we heard uncannynoises. I was terribly frightened.
My girl-friend left me.
Once again my parents distroyed a relationship.
When I was caught in an elevator and it got stuck between floors.

Together with a little brother I biked on a lonely road in thePolder. Then we were annoyed by a boy on a motorbike: hetook over, stopped, took over, etc. Then we saw he had somethingin his hand, we turned until we came across a man, whoaccompanied us.
Some time ago a close relative of mine got off cheap with theworst.
I worked in a harbour and emptied latrine containers from theback of the lorries.
I realized the girl liked to be with me.
When I was accused of neglecting work for the wrong reasons.

A friend of mine lent me his apartment for holidays and besidesthis he was a fine person. Months later I knew that he diedtragically in a moto accident. He was very young, and I felt sadand couldn't believe it (until today).
Finding out that my grandfather had died. He lived in England andI had not seen him for 10 years.
My boyfriend breaking up with me about 7 months after I had anabortion. Just the fact that he was ignoring me and continued todo so.
When I was responsible for getting my friend run-out in a vitalcricket match.
When I succeded in establishing a contact with a girl (who is nowmy girlfriend).
At my grandfather's death.
NO RESPONSE
I felt shame when I had to talk with a person that I hadn't seen formany years. Shame that he wouldn't recognize me or that Iwouldn't know what to say.
When I was a child, my beloved cat gave birth to four beautifullittle kittens. Before she had them, she came up to me and Ifollowed her out, then witnessed them being born.
One day when I came back home, I found my favourite dish broken. I blamed the servant for it, later I found out that it was notthe servant but my daughter who had broken it.
Lack of respect for my parents.
When I took the car of someone without saying it to him.
At my sister's wedding.
The same fact about the girl (22 years, married - guilt -disgust), the fear was the main factor in our relationship.
When my parents fight lots of time, when I'm the reason of thefight, I feel guilty.
I bought a Christmas present for my girl-friend. On my way home Iwas really glad about having found such a suitable thing.
Korean judges cheating.

I don't know why suddenly I thought that what I was feeling formy boyfriend was not really love. After almost three years beingtogether, this matter of fact shaked me and I felt a great sorrowthat I can call sadness.
When I found out some family friends were embezzelling thecompany they worked for - using company petrol and food suppliesand claiming furniture and crockery.

I went to a friend's baptism as she became a Christian after meand I realized that she was more enthusiastic about her spirituallife than I was.When I was with my brothers and sisters ofChrist I had a guilty feeling which could not be dismissedeasily.When pepole asked me as to when I would be baptised myguilt feeling deepened.
This last August when my parents dropped me off and moved me intocollege I didn't know anybody here; I was 17 and Berkeley reallyscared me.
I was with my girlfriend when some guys that I don't like madefuss at my girl.

I was walking down a little village at night.There was nobodyin the steet.A dog began to bark, I felt that it was followingme.Then I began to run, the other dogs started barking too.Atlast I arrived home.
Meeting with two of my friends I had not seen for 15 years. Theywere special people to me.
In class I had to say something aloud and people reactedbylaughing.
One day I heard from a friend that the boy I loved had gone outwith her and not with me.

I read about the national and social spirit and self-disciplineof the people of developed coutries like U.S.A, England, France,Germany etc.Comparing this to the Indian people I felt guiltyas they have no national spirit or self-discipline.
A TV program on whale-hunting.
The death of my mother-in-law after a long sick-bed. at themoment of dying I was with her.
I felt ashamed when my lecturer said in class that Ihappened to be the dullest of all.
My roommate refused to walk with me to the English lectures. Ihave to walk alone in the dark. Lectures are in the biologybuilding.
Years ago on Christmas Eve I felt very sad because I realized forthe first time how I missed my father who had died at ChristmasYears ago.
One day I got on the bus without any money or season ticket andthe driver threw me out.
When I got home from a pleasant trip abroad, I got to know that Ihad been accepted at university.
Relatives visiting me.
I once got a phone call stating \one of your friend is in jail, please come and see him\".When I went to the jail and saw him, I was disgusted."

I had arranged with a friend to go with him to Carinthia by car.We had arranged a place where to meet. I was a bit late and myfriend had left already. I had no money to go by train. I nearlystarted to cry because I was so angry - it was very important forme to go to Carinthia.
When my brother who has been out of New Zealand for 10 years cameto visit with his wife which none of our family had previouslymet.
Relative's death.
People having a football match outside the window during thelecture.
When I shoplifted a pair of earrings from Coles and my Mum caughtme with them in my bag.
When I insulted an elderly person for no reason.
When I became aware that an acquaintance had stolen from friends.
A male, Honduran acquaintance of mine despised my opinions.
Football was a very big deal at my high school, so I was joyouswhen my school's team won the conference championship last year.
One day I went to the cinema to see a film in which I wasinterested.On arriving there I saw a long queue (which I hadnot expected) and went back home without seeing the film.
When my boyfriend was away, I flirted with his best friend; Ifelt guilty the next day.
I felt disgust after watching a picture on television abouttorturing political prisoners in India (this happened in theIndia of Indira Ghandi).
When I received the letter informing that I had been accepted tobe a Chinese university student, I was excited as I had longedfor it.
It was at Malawi Army, Dormer Squadron, when some of my workmatesgot promoted to Seargents (sgts); we were having similarRanks.
I may not be clever enough to understand your English lectures.
First time in anatomy.
I was called and invited to have a talk about a job I wanted to have.
I was asked to stop studying economics, a field which interestedme, by my employers.
After the car accident in GUILT.
My roommate being nice to a party leader in order to get into theparty.

Right before I went to a concert with my last boyfriend he toldme that although he told me he was going to take me to theconcert, he didn't want to see me anymore. After that we stayedovernight and I said \well, when he leaves me I will be ruined for awhile, but for now we're together.\" I woke up in his arms and it was the happiest moment of my life."
When I failed at the first entrance exam.
When I did not get the salary increase that I had been expectingand understood how little one's work was appreciated.
The end of a relationship (after 4 years) by doing this I hurtthe other person very much.
When I saw my name in the newspaper and I knew that I entered atthe University.
One night I saw a man being knocked down by two other men. Thevictim was kicked against his head.
A children's film in which I played a clown, with spotlights,cameras and the director who demanded jumps and guffaws.
Fights that I see in the middle of the street, robberies, fear ofdarkness when going home.
When I was called for an Interview at Kamuzu College of Nursing.
In the 12/83 my boyfriend asked me to forget him, as it would beeasy.

My mother did not come home till late at night (Ages ago). Anywayif I don't know where my parents are and when they'll be back Istart thinking that perhaps they have had an accident and areperhaps dead.
Hear a very nice joke made by a friend.
When I entered in the University after a year of struggles.
When I got home I found that the electrical supply had beendisconnected despite my having paid ZESCO the full bill a few days earlier.
When a few girls were talking rubbish about me.
When I saw that the mark I had obtained in an exam was a goodone.
When I heard that there is teasing and bulling at SecondarySchool.
I was very angry when I heard that my brother was beaten by hisfriends.
A child, 9 years old, died in a stupid way.He fell from a placewhich was 1 metre high.
When an employer of my younger sister (17 yrs) made a \pass\" at her."
I said something especially stupid which I did not mean at all.
When I dated a close girlfriend's boyfriend a few times. He toldme that it was over between them and I accepted it.When shefound out she finished our friendship.
I wrote a bad letter to someone concerning our relationship whichwe created ourselves.
I felt angry when I was told that I had not been selected to goto the University.
I went to a pub with a group of friends (not very close) andI was with one girl most of the time, while the other girls in thegroup wanted to be with me.They stopped talking to the girl Iwas with.
Not having owned up to the responsibility an incident wherefamily car received minor damage.
All my friends arranged to go for an afternoon snack and they didnot tell me.They told me that they did not have my phone numberbut I do not think that this was true.
I have a horror of spiders and snakes. On a walk through the woodI saw the body of a slow-worm (without the head).
My husband suddenly fell ill seriously and during the medicalexaminations we did not know what would follow.
When I am made to do things in which I see no sense and I wastemy time. Some time ago I had to participate in a sociologicalinvestigation and then I got really angry.
When a person I did not know hurt a friend of mine.
When I forgot to cook something that my mother had told me to,and at supper time the food that I was supposed to have preparedwas not there.
I was at the seaside and my brother disappeared for a couple ofhours.
When I was in a car with my parents and friends and we had toback up (reverse) pass a river which when I recall it (I was onlyabout 5 yrs) seemed we were going to fall in and drown.

Whenever my father smokes the smell makes me feel veryuncomfortable.He never listens to my complaints and I curse himfuriously in my mind.I cannot solve this problem by violencebecause of traditional moral values.
I got to know that I had been accepted at university.
When stupid people push me during rush time in the city.
I felt guilty when I said bad things to my sister, I had notintended to do so.She cried a lot and later she fell ill and Ifelt responsible for her illness.
When my sister lost her only son, who was sixteen years old.Ifelt very bad about it as this was the first death in my familyand then I learned slowly to understand to life.
[ One day I arrived home rather tired and found the house..... Inaddition I was asked many questions which I did not want toanswer.]
When I take a look into a slaughter-house and when listening tostories about torturing people or animals.
A few days back I had to ask a professor a ridiculous questionbecause I had lost at a game of cards and had to pay a forfeit.
When I had beaten my auntie.
Being told that I have not got a personality.
I was looking for an object when I came across a rotten corpse ofa rat.
When a person the same age as me insisted that I call him\Mister\".I refused to succumb, but he persisted and I got angry as he had belittled me."
When I was told by the doctor, after many months of coughing,that I had tuberculosis.
When my relationship with my family is very poor I often fearbeing excluded from the group, a fear which is stronger insituations when an argument is on hand.
While intoxicated I invaded someone's (a girl's) personal spaceto a large extent.
On the way down a ski slope which was difficult and steep.
One of my friends came to know through some other friends that Ihad applied for some course in an institute.He asked me \why did not you tell me, I would also have applied.\"At that I felt guilty."
Slept with someone close to my girlfriend and myself.
As a child, one evening I had read a novel about ghosts and I hadthus spent a sleepless night as I kept feeling that there wereghosts dancing around me.
[ No response.]

I feared that I was pregnant.It was not planned and I wouldhave been compelled to have an abortion, which I would not haveliked at all.Fortunately, after a week's anxiety, I got to knowthat I was not pregnant.
Managed to run 30 Km on skis fairly simply.
I had stayed for months without seeing mother because ourholidays were short and my home is far. Some times, mother came tosee me at school, I was very joyful, and I didn't want her to go.
Having suffered a not very pretty sight, I reacted by utteringsome very cruel and sharp words.
When I first came to the campus.
Fear of thief.

That was soon after the results of the interview which nearly9,000 people attended in all the three regions of Malawi. My joycame after hearing on the radio that I was one of the peopleselected to undergo the Medical Assistant training at theL.S.H.S.
I was alone in a cottage I often stay in.I was woken up by arustling sound in the middle of the night.
My grand father caught me eating his private jelly bean supply.
Your prejudice against psychology students and education students(not allowing us to go to the medical university lectures).
Being misunderstood by friends.
Discovering that Lillehammer provided no musical environment thatsuits my taste, even though I had been told so.

I vividly remember having feelings of disgust toward some of myjr. high classmates who didn't work at all on their schoolworkand who would coplain and take my tax money when I was older andmore successful than they were. At the time I pictured someadults like this that I knew in the complaining situation.
When I first saw a person begging.
I went to visit friends and it was very companionable.
I got my driving licence after they had frightened me with it'sdifficulty.
When I wore a grotesque figure hanging down my back.
One of my fellow students used questionable and unfair means toadvance her studies faster than others.I detested her.
I should have given a test lesson to get a job. I had no courage.I didn't make the test.
I caught a close relative with the servant of the house.

I couldn't fulfill a request of a girlfriend of mine, though Icategorically promised her and I believed there wouldn't be anyhindrance. It was partly for objective reasons but also becauseI couldn't organize myself.

After my vacations, one day after a lecture it occured to me tobuy a rose for my mother.We went together to a pub and mymother told me that she would be getting married next Spring.Idid not known about it and so was all the more glad.
My parents didn't allow me to go to a social function that all myfriends were attending.
When I passed the first year and so I could come back for mysecond year.
When I left a carnaval ball at 4 o'clock a.m. I was alone in aforeign city and I had to go back home, when a guy appeared andtried to \catch me\"."
I put in two years of hard work and it was neither looked at norappreciated.
Some people were unfairly treated, because of theirnationality/colour.
While having a discussion with my mother, I realized that shedoes not for a moment doubt the justification of her making thedecisions concerning my life.
When my grandfather died I was extremely sad.However my familymembers did not have any special feelings, they said that he wasalready 80 years old.
When my mother found a leaf of my diary where I had written aboutmy mother's lack of education, especially her poor arithmeticalinsight.
When I come home late at night.
When I noticed that a nice person was being exploitedeconomically.
During my birthday party a friend drank too much alcohol. So muchthat he had to throw up. Worst of all was that he couldn't leavemy friend alone and that he was molesting her.
Family member survived an operation.
In the traffic I insulted a man who crossed my way. Afterwards Ipaired with him, and felt shame because of mine lack of pacienceand ridiculous attitude.
Death of a close friend.
When I passed successive exams to enter the school of medicine.
At the pre-university, I was appreciated as an examplarystudent by our pricipal.This is something which made me feelvery happy.
Not handing in homework in time.
A great friend of mine travelled with the intention to change hislife. He didn't succeed and returned depressed. I had not powerto support his frustration and his behavioral change.
Did not do what I promised to do for a friend.
When fired unjustly from a job as casual bar-person. Charged withgiving away free drinks. Not done so and had witnesses to proveit - both patrons and bar staff. Other staff were supportive.
One day I was in the countryside with several friends, and webegan to eat figs, after we were all full we noticed that all thefigs were full of worms.
An unjust refree decision at a sports event when I was the teamleader.
Leaving a friend of mine alone at a dance - I felt I should havekept her company.
[ I have never felt this emotion.]
In a certain occasion I saw a dog in the street eating somethingso strange gooey that I wasn't able to eat lunch because Iremembered the scene all the time.
My parents were out and I was the eldest at home.At midnight amale stranger phoned us and spoke to me in a rough language.Ihung up and heard someone walking outside our door.
When I ate a rotten apple.
About the girl (22 years, married) I felt guilty of therelationship.
Saw my unfair report.
[ I can not remember anything in particular.What I can rememberis feelings of having done or said something which then hadnegative consequences.]
I saw a report on T.V news on apartheid in South Africa.

On my birthday, my closest friends were here at Berkeley pithchedin a lot of money each and bought me ten records to replace someof my records that were stolen. They threw a small surprise partyfor me too.
Doing well in the examn.
When my brother did not send me the transport money to resume my studies in time at UNZA.
A horse which I had liked very much was taken away.
In a fight with my girlfriend in a luncheonette where everybodystared at me in such a way that I had to leave it.
At school - being whipped by the teacher in front of the class.
After taking a difficult midterm for one of my classes, I feltshame for not studying as much as I should have. I was ashamed ofthe results of the midterm.
Passed the last exam.
When my girlfriend's nephew passed away.
I feel sad when I see things done against men and nothing couldstop it - at least I think so.
When I received a letter from a woman I thought had not evercared for me.This was when I needed her and I was overjoyed tolearn that it was me who was delaying things.
When my younger sister visited me during the school holidays andtold me that she would not go back to school because she waspregnant.
When I met a good friend after a long time. We had had a quarrelbut after two weeks I was really glad to see him again.
When I stand at the bus stop for one hour waiting for the bus toarrive.
Went to a lecture about Chinese history and hear about the OpiumWar.
When a certain drunk man slapped my buttocks when I was quietlystanding waiting for a bus.
I put an end to a friendship with a girl - I had only pretendedlove and affection to be able to sleep with her.
It was more that fear - anguish -that I felt before my last exam.
When it was discovered that I had done the assignment at my workplace, this caused a lot of embarrassment for me.
I can't remember being truly angry. Usually it's justdisappointment that I feel. One situation would be with mybrother. He and I used to be close but now he seems to beavoiding me.
A sister broke a cup and when mother asked I was reported to havebeen responsible.
When my friend let my personal matters be publicaly known.
[ I am quite shameless, not applicable.]
In a sexual experience with an unknown woman where after thesexual act I only could go away without looking backwards.
Because of the examination I had to study night and day.
When, for example, someone is calumnating.
My girl-friend and I live in one flat with another couple. We getalong very well and usually we share everything. Once we two weresitting in our room and eating a cake when the others came in.
I feel sadness from the fact that I was not born with a betterappearance.

I quarrelled with my brothers (twins) at home on saturday.Oneof them studies in a private school and the other one isrepeating his form five.They do not know what they are doing. They follow every word of their teachers, books and systems. They always try to rationalize their bad acts by some game andthey are satisfied with their awkward life.I have tried topersuade them very often but have failed.This time I had afight as they have no voluntary spirit (they did not polish thefloor).
Saw people quarreling in a bus.
When I passed the university entrance exam.
Spoilt, smashed and molded potatoes in the fridge, and having toclean up the dish later.
When I began dansing, the teacher came and told me that I wasvery good and would soon get into the ballet academy.
A man kept a seat taken by putting his coat on it after a whilethe chair was still empty, I asked him if I could use the chair,he didn't agree for the chair was for his coat.
My father suddenly fell ill and died.
I read a book about the situation in South-Africa, about theterrible violations of human rights. I was disgusted with thewhite population.

After a jogging session I had severe abdominal cramps and thislead to my wanting to empty my bladder.My friends gatheredaround me and two of them had to help me to the toilet.I wasashamed at having to go to the toilet in the presence of myfriends.
Once my presentation was the worst among my classmates as I hadnot prepared it well and had not seen it as important.Mypresentation was so confused that it clearly showed my poorpreparation.

When I was studying in the library - preparing for a test, twopeople sitting next to me talked to each other for 20 minutes. There were no other seats so I could not go elsewhere and I didnot want to interrupt them, so I could only be angry in my heart.

My girlfriend came home after a business dinner at the mostexpensive place in town drunk as a skunk. Whats more she drovehome and couldn't remember doing so. I was disgusted by her stateand her actions.
A film on zombies.
Sitting on the bus seats supposed for disabled people, childrenand old people (by mistake)
When a little brother of mine damaged a cassette.
I was on a farm with a few friends and during the talk Idiscovered that a friend of mine, was being betrayed by herboyfriend and a 3rd friend of ours.
When I think about my family (parents, brothers, sisters) guiltis a part of my feelings.

For the above: guilt at not living up to my own moralexpectation, guilt for not being the type of person my patentswanted, guilt for just about bloody everything, just realisingthat I have failed drastically in my own eyes.
A pig in the well from which we drink.
Saw a scene in a movie implying incest as humorous.
Family discord and uneasiness due to something I did notcommunicate on time.
It was on January 1st 1985 when I accidentally broke a Fantabottle in a certain bottle store in Zomba.
I experienced fear when I was not prepared for the final yeardegree exams.
A girl I love does not love me.
[ I have always been very scared and tense before an exam andbefore the declaration of the results.]
When I was able to buy my new car, after lots of problems.
I was overwhelmed with joy when I received the acceptance letterto UNZA.This happened again when I passed all my first yearcourses.

A relative of mine had come to see my husband to talk to himabout a problem concerning his sister and me.I was angrybecause this relative of mine did not dare to speak to me andinstead spoke to my husband.I got to know about it later thesame day.
Someone told me I was chosen for the English lectures because Iam good looking.
I was told I shouldn't visit my sister because the holiday wasshort.
Few days ago I really experienced fear. It was connected withunexpected actions on the part of a group of people. This evokedin me many negative emotions.

When I was selected to start Form I at Chilumba Secondary Schoolout of the 100 pupils I was among the 4 who were successful.Family History showed that I had done better than all my brotherswho had passed after repeating for several times.
Speaking in front of a large group of people.
Doing anatomy alone for the first time.

When I got into a bus I found that my wallet had been stolen.It was not a great loss from the monetary point of view but Ilost some documents - identity papers.As a result I had tospend several days in order to get a new one.I will alwaysremember all the work I had to do and the bad treatment Isuffered because of the bureaucratic behaviour of the civilservant.I had already had bad luck and they treated me like acriminal. At one point of time I really wanted to quarrel withthem.
When before the last exam I have taken, I went out instead ofstudying.
When I had drunk too much and nearly got an alcohol poisoning.
[ No response.]
When I saw that I had passed an exam.It was the last chance andthere was a lot at stake.
At an irrevocable loss (with respect to human relations).
When my girlfriend told me that she wanted to leave me.
When my brother's visa for the U.S.A got cancelled.
My brother told me that a person (whom I know) had insulted him. I am very fond of my brother, and as he himself can not get angryor hurt, my protectiveness was aroused and I got angry.
The fact that I hadn't been informed about something and I had thegreatest trust in this person.
Not getting an airplane ticket fot my mother.
I was selected to do a rest for a foreign ballet but I did nothave the money to do it.
I feel unbelievably happy about the relationship between myboyfriend and me, it is a reoccurring feeling.
Attitude to some manners of dealing and some \sanctioned\" relations."
I hit my little sisiter on the head with a stone while we werefighting.
When my last relation broke up.
When my father came into the bathroom and saw me standing therenaked.
I wanted to take something from under my bed. While doing this Ifelt a dead bird laying under my bed.
When they put the blame on me when I scored the third goal at thematch.
[ Whenever I do something prohibited or wrong I feel guilty.]
I slandered a person behind his back and he got to know about it.
There was a time when I did not get on well with my sister. Ialways grumbled at her and said bad things about her to mymother. So my mother always scolded her.

When I was curious about it and went to a spiritism session with afriend. I had already been there other times (many times when Iwas younger) but that day, even if I don't believe inspiritism I was terribly afraid that something would happen to me(sort of incorporation !).
When I was late for work and told my boss that it was due totransport problem, whereas the truth was that I had woken uplate.I thus cheated my boss.

When I told my boy-friend, who loved me very much, that I wantedto put an end to our relationship. a long time before I told himthat and also a long time after that I felt guilty, because I hadhurt him so much.
I talk too much, cannot keep things secret. I promised a friendnot to tell something to anybody. Neverthless, I did, and she gotinformed about it. I felt very ashamed.
When I received my TE Score and my acceptance from University -it had been a goal since I left the bank a year earlier.

One of my best friends'fiancT broke off the relationship becausehis feelings for me were stronger than for her. I felt the samefor him, but did not really encourage him to leave her or staywith her - still felt shame.
My girlfriend gave me some feed-back and I understood that itmeant that our relationship was about to turn even closer.
When I failed my S.S.C exam.
Disgust for a person who treated me badly, and has treated otherpeople similarly - including lying, hiding facts, beingdeceitful, unfair, etc.
When after a storm in the country, I left my shelter and saw abig, fat, slimy green toad by my side.
When a person whom I do not want to see is continously present.

When I was a child I had a grass-parakeet I liked very much. Hislegs were crippled so that he could not move very fast. Once Icame into the room, did not notice him and stepped on him. A fewdays later he died.
When my dog ran out on thin ice last spring.
Late for a lecture and therefore missed it.

One night, when I got out from the University I saw two strangepeople near my car. When I got near, they moved away, and thencame close again. I had a feeling that they were assaulters.After I left I discovered that the windshield was broken.

I'm afraid of driving on the special seat of a mororcycle, mainlywith certain colleagues who by exces of self-confidence drivebeyond limits or measure in the traffic and the main victim isalways the person who sits behind the driver.
When my lover and I felt like we had gone full circle. And ourrelationship was new, fresh, vital etc. once again.
I got back too late after a Sunday going out without havingcalled up home to tell where I was. my mother hadn't slept thewhole night.

We were at school, in the room for audiovisual classes.We werewatching a film, and just behind me two classmates were botheringme with their mocking and shoves.I reacted angrily (I suppose) by hitting one of them.
South Korea cheating for gold medals.
When I failed a test at my primary school.I was then in grade 7and we were about to take the main exam.
When my love for a guy was returned.
When my room-mate was making noise deliberately, by playing aflute early in the morning while I was trying to study.
I didn't tell my parents that I was going to Sofia. I told themthat I was going to a seminar. My mother knew that I was lying butshe didn't stop me.
Passing my driver's examination (after two failures).
When I reproached my friend because I was myself low-spirited anddisappointed.
A friend forgot his appointment with me.
When I was travelling by tram, I tripped and fell against thedoor.I thought that I was going to fall out.

After a meeting ended we started talking about when we wouldhave the next discussion ( I had many tests the coming week andcould not have a meeting in between, I thought that they wouldunderstand this as they had always done).They did notunderstand my problem and thought that I should not have so manyother activities.Their reaction made me burst into tears.
That was what I felt when I told my first lie and then wascought.
Because of a conflict with my parents there was a possibility tointerrupt my studies.
When I am with friends and I do what pleases me this oftenhappenes.
When I went to see the dead body of my uncle.This was a verydramatic expreience as it was the first time that I entered amortuary.
Anger towards my lover for being late.
I happened to see the video-tape movie \This is America - Partone\" at my friend's place."
Failed to recagnize a friend on the street.
I stopped working (had a boring job).
When an acquaintance of mine beat up another person for no justreason, and thus showed off his power.
[ When I am, in my opinion, not understood correctly. ]
When I failed the M.S.C exams.
During the first year in university I had bad results in boththe terms, especially the first term.I was afraid thatI wouldnot be promoted to the next year and that the others would goahead of me.
When they threatened me with a knife to take my money.
The behaviour of a colleague of mine, which doesn't correspond tomy norms of behaviour.
