My sister and I were fighting as usual. She's older tham I am,bigger built and stronger I couldn't win in a physical battle andin a verbal battle I couldn't seem to get through to her toreally hurt her.

When parents of a certain girl refused to let me marry theirdaughter because I was not fit to do so yet the girl acceptedeverything and later she followed what her parents insisted andshe told me never to talk to her again.
Jealous of my husband's old girlfriend.We met her with herhusband and there was a lot of reminiscing.
I could not take care of my mother when she was admitted to a hospital for surgery, I continued my studies as I could not get leave.
Coming to this lecture and listen to you talking about feelings,I am so happy that foreigners have the same feelings as Chinese.
I was afraid when my first boyfriend threatened to make an end toour relationship because he didn't love me enough while I lovedhim very much.
Noisy people in the library.
I borrowed $ 20.00 from a friend and paid him back much laterthan I had originally intended.
A drunk walked out in front of a car at night. Both lower legswere broken. His shoe was thrown about 50 yards after theaccident.
When I was selected for the university.
Bus conductor insulted me for not buying a ticket (I forgot).
I lost a conference because I hadn't got in touch with a certainperson to inform her that I would go with her. I thought she knewwhat I wanted.
When I try to get closer at a person and she misinterpreted me.

I was involved in a ... attempt on a man I had developed a closewarming relationship with. Although I knew I had done everythingI could and that his progress of a \normal\" life was poor I felt guilty as if I could have done more."
[ No response.]

After moving out of my apt. I took all the furniture and dishesand everything. It was mine but I took it all just to spite myroomies. We had a few (a lot) of disagreements. I felt guilt formoving out for the bad reasons.
When I saw my father coming out of the bathroom. He thought thathe was alone at home and came out without his clothes.

When my boss cut off my vacations saying that in that month itwouldn't be possible, and after some time he let another girltake vacations that month. The anger was because of theresentment. Resulting from our bad relationship.
I was in my village when a bull jumped over a fence and startedchasing my friends and me.We were very frightened till weclimbed up a tree.
The fridge we had at home had a lock.One day when I wantedsomething, I unscrewed the door but unfortunately I was caught inthe act.
It made me very sad to hear that some construction company wasgoing to build houses on the beautiful hills by my house.
Sleeping with a girl on a Saturday night and then not contactingher in later days.
[ I do not remember when I last felf ashamed.I do not usuallyfeel ashamed of what I do.]
An old woman was violently thrown down the stairs of the tube bya group of louts.
I had enough time to do my assignment, and I did not do it well. When the lecturer scolded me, I had this feeling.
A class-mate urged me to carry out a particular protest alongwith him, and when the time came this fellow drew back while Ihad to face the situation.
A friend of mine gave birth to a child. Very dangerous delivery.I was afraid for her and for the baby.
Watching a horror movie with friends.
The last time I had sex.

I live by myself and a few weeks ago was woke by a man on the endof my bed coming up my bed at me. I was really angry, told him toget out. He was surprised, hesitated; I started to move towardshim and he backed off - kept telling him - loudly, but firmly togo. Because I'd got the initiative, I succeeded. A very powerfulmessage.
Losing my girlfriend who made an end to our relationship. By thisI lost an important source of support, certainty and joyfulmoments. I cried very intensly when that happened.
When I met with friends that I hadn't seen for a long time.
I did not go to the exercises, without any adequate reason.
People not cueing in the dining hall.
A child beaten up by his mother.
When I went to meet the family of my boyfriend in a party in hishouse. His mother was eager to know me and all his friends readyto make jokes about the situation.
I felt disgusted when my cousin decided that she would stopgoing to school saying she wanted to get married. She was only 14years by then and she didn't understand what she was thinking.
When I realized the burden it was for my mother to look after allof us, all by herself.
When I won an unexpected sum of money.
At my father, when he yelled and accused my sister's friend (overthe phone) of doing something he didn't do, or know anythingabout.
When coming up for trial because of shop lifting.
I was with my family and we found some abandoned puppies.Iwanted to help them but everyone said no.We then left.
My anger is with men, their inability to be human (not all men).
When I had to talk with an important person about a job.
When I saw a man who hadn't the lower .... in a carexhibition. He was passing a handkerchief from inside to outsideof his mouth.
When I was pointed out as a problem child in primary school andmy mother took the teacher's point of view.
Getting ill.
At the butcher's I saw an animal which had just been slaughtered;blood was dripping on the floor.
I wanted to be pregnant and did not succeed, so I was depressed at every menstruation.
When I read about or think about environmental pollution, thearmor race, starvation, etc. Then one realizes that mankind isbad, most important is power and money, at the cost of nature andmankind.
When I met friends I had not seen for the last 2-4 years.
When my brother went to shoot wild ducks, I feared that theboat would overturn and he would drown or that the gun wouldaccidentally go off.

When my brother came back home after staying in hospital. He hadundergone an operation which had been a matter of life or death.When he came home I could see him smile for the first time aftermay weeks.
I experienced anger most recently when I had committed a sinwhich I had gone a week and a half without doing. I had made avow to God and had blown it. Now I had to start all over.
I was drinking a glass of wine and eating something when theresuddenly appeared pictures about the famine in some parts ofAfrica.
[ Never.]
When my brother bought me a nice pair of shoes from South Africa.
I was once this week angry when soemone trying to compress mymind due to his nonsense speech which himself could not tolerateat all.
I liked a boy and I would feel shy and then blush.The more Iwanted to avoid it the more I blushed.
When I insulted my young sister for a very little misconduct ofputting on my shoes. She wrote me an apology letter and themessage she included made me feel guilty.
Walking home in the dark from college.
Zhu Jianhau did not break the world record for China.
I was double crossing my fiancee and one day she caught me redhanded.She forgave me later.I was very ashamed of what I haddone.
Quarreling with my father, when he made false assertions.
[ No response.]
When I first suffered from syphilis.
When my rights to use a shared house had been usurped byco-owners out of pure selfishness.
When I was young I stole something from a shop and got caught,then I was taken to the police station and my parents had to comeand get me.

In the underground's escalator, a youngish bum asked me formoney.Although I did not give him anything, the fellow told methat I was really good-looking.A man who was in front of mealso turned to look at me.
When I gave birth to my son and saw that he was alive and that Ihad managed it well.He was born a month too early with amalfunctioning lung.This happened a year ago.
I felt guilty when I skipped a two hour practical class I knew Iwould miss out on more information which I did not know, but Icouldn't cope with going.
Some time ago I was disgusted with the \cleanness\" of the refectory of our institute."
The funeral of a friend who was killed in a car accident. She wasof my own age, there were many of my own friends present, as wellas her family etc.
Slept in a chapel and in the middle of the night I realized thatthere was someeone else in the chapel.I never discovered whoit was and why he was there.
When I had a little accident with my boss'car.
My friend did not do well in the examn because I did not helphim.
When I hit my young sister without a valid reason.
When my father made my mother go through really terriblesituations, I felt furious, impotent, nervous, upset, ........
I found a big, black spider near a bag of food.

After completing high-school, I wanted to go abroad for aholiday.I had never been abroad before and neither had I takena holiday for a long time.When finally my parents agreed and wegot the airplane tickets I was over joyed.
I was afraid of moving away from home and moving to Helsinki formy studies.
When I don't succeed to fulfill a promise.

I was angry when my sister began to talk nonsense and to laugh atthe way I swept the room.My anger grew (I tried to controlmyself).After telling her to leave me alone, I vented my angeron her as she did not obey me.

When I was transferred from Chichiri Secondary School to St.Mary's Sec. School. I was happy at Chichiri as a day scholer andhad made a lot of friends. I was going to a boarding and thatmeant parting with my friends as well as my boyfriend for thefirst time.
Watching suffering in Third World country.
When I realized that my closest friend had said bad things aboutme when I was not around and had betrayed me by making friendswith my boyfriend's other girl.
A lecturer in great detail spoke about his sexual experiences.
I have felt this feeling when a person whom I believe and respect,lied to me.
When I was insulted by a fellow student.
NO RESPONSE
When I knew that a person that I liked very much didn't react theway I would like to, even that I knew about his feelings for me.

I tried to talk to my parents over the phone, as I wanted to gohome for the week-end and I knew that I would not be able to bearit.I tried to reduce the gulf and the conflict between us bytalking in order to unite our worlds.Result : hysterical mess,blinding and blaming.
I was walking to my car at night and thought that I was beingfollowed.
My girlfriend had started going around with another boy.Hercousin, also a friend of mine, asked her as to who she preferred. Both of us were present and she chose the other guy.
When I was a child I had to recite a poem in a show at the end ofthe term.
I last really felt sad when I left home for I was leaving all mylong time, pre-kindergarten relationships behind.
When I found out that my father had lung cancer and they did notknow how long he would live.
When I was caught by the police and was kept with a group ofdelinquents, which added to my fear of being shut up.I wasafraid of the people near me and the future consequences.
I argued with my father on matters concerning marriage.Traditionally speaking, I was not supposed to, so I felt guiltyof violating my traditions which I must hold in esteem.
When I see that my mother forces my little brother (15 years) towork very hard for school. I don't agree that she constantly putshim to work, but I don't tell it to her, so nothing changes.
When I failed the grade 7.
When my boyfriend was leaving to go home one night, I had a verydeep sense of uneasiness and an unwarranted fear that I wouldn'tsee him again.
I was within a hair's breadth of knocking down a drunkard whosuddenly ran into the street.The fear came later when Irealized what could have happened.
I reproached my mother's cooking and criticised herpersonality, and she felt hurt and depressed.
After going through a glass door, I sustained a number of seriouscuts which were gaping open.
I was walking alone along the place where people fear that thereare always thieves there and the people who kill their friendsduring the night two months ago.
Being slandered by friends.
As in sadness (A), relating to this slaghter of fur-seals.
A person I trusted a lot gave me many false explanations tojustify a wrong action.
Last course, when I passed with good marks three subjects which I hadpreviously failed.
After my boy-friend had beaten me for the first time, I alwaystrembled when somebody knocked on my door or when I heard stepscoming nearer.
I bought a new bed for my apt. and it squeaks when you move onit. I tried to fix it but could not.
I guess I have often been ashamed after having talked badly ofother people.
[ Can not think of anything.]
When I was caught going out with another girl by my girlfriend.
My boyfriend with whom I had a longlasting relationship, fell inlove with another girl, then he asked me something which impliedthat he loved that girl more than he loved me.
When my parents behave very \witty\" towards me, they make insipid jokes about which they laugh. Or my mother who treats me like a little child."
Finding out that the class leader can go to your lectures, andhis English is worse than mine.
My mother's death.
I felt sad after having had an argument with my boyfriend.I feltthat he did not understand me and that there was no point incarrying on with the relationship.
When I heard that my step-mother had treated my mother in a wrongmanner.
When I learnt that I had been accepted at the medical school.
The day I got a letter from the U.G.C informing me that I hadbeen awarded the junior research fellowship.
Practicing wind-surf my body was caught under the sail. On tryingto get out my leg was caught in the lashing. I was afraid ofdying by asphixia.
When I forgot my mother's birthday.
I saw a drunk man tottering behind his wife and insulting herawfully.
My boyfriend is a soldier. He was on a leave. I felt sad when wehad to get separated again.
When my best friend promised to come at my house and I had toprepare so many expensive things for her but only to learn atlast that she would not turn up.
Many times, when my father used to come home drunk and maltreatedphysically me and my mother.
Saw a blue film in a cinema.
When I almost fell down from some rocks because I had been actingfoolishly and playing dangerously.
That if ever I was really naughty I would be sent away from myMum and Dad to another family. I was fostered from age 5 anddidn't get to Mum and Dad until I was 6 and then legally adoptedat 14.
I had some sort of a stomach virus last week andI vomited incollege in the morning, then in the cake shop, three times duringthe trip home and again when I got home.
When a relative, who had come to our place, created untidynessand dirtyness.
Celebrations on the graduation day with the orchestra playing inthe garden ( I am a part of this orchestra).
I travelled on a bus and I forgot to punch the ticket. A ticketcollector came in and I had to pay the fine. I did it with a feelingof shame.
When a friend died.
I read about a murderer who brutalized his victims by cuttingopen their stomaches and taking out their bowels.
When I was treated improperly by someone.
At an important moment in a volleyball game we made a point andby this we won a set from a much stronger competitor.
When my dog died.
When my father took away my cherised diaries to burn them (I wasalso very sad) \Oh, how I hated him\"."
One night going downstairs, and hearing a strong stirring ofbrances, which was not the wind.
When I was seven years old, I stole a chewing-gum from a bigglass bowl on the counter of a nearby shop, and I got caught.
I was asked to join my friend in a boat at Mangochi Lake Malawiand when making a turn, it seemed as if the boat would sink onthe side.
Disgust of drunkers and of blood.
While watching TV (a war movie), I felt a strong fear of death,threat and fear of loosing people close to me.
I was stopped from entering a party while I was at School but Ihad an Invitation card with me. This was done because they said Iwas too young to join elderly people.
I think that the only time I really felt shame was when I wasvery young and I had to defecate on the street.I was veryworried in case someone should see me.
I was ashamed of the way I deceived that I could not help afriend, although it was absolutely possible for me. Nothing wasrevealed but I haven't called up this person since then.

A child was admitted in hospital with Meningitis. I was asked todo lumber puncture to obtain Celebral Spinal fluid for diagnosticpurposes. Since the condition was already bad, the child died assoon as I finished the procedure.
Not being accepted by classmates in university.
When my mother and father separated (it was a brief separationand they are together now).
While attending some affairs, which were taking some time, witha bank officer, I felt that my clothes and appearance were out of place, tooraggy.
Someone asked me to do something and I made up an excuse and saidno. I then went and didn't the same thing with someone else andhoped the first person never found out.
My best friend betrayed me and told other people my secrets.
Some students have been calling lecturers nicknames and I was notable to find out who they were to stop them.
My teacher asked me a question which I failed to answer and I wastold to stay behind after the class and give the answer afterstudying it from a book.
A mishap suffered on misinterpreting a girl's proposition.
When a cousin of mine took my bottle of T.B tablets, put water init and threw it in the dust-bin.
My mother developed hipertonia and I think I too am to blamebacause with her it is a stress disease.
Falling over.
A student who lives in the same house where I live is an alcoholic. Hetries to manipulate other people with his money when he has drunktoo much.

The day that the results of the college entrance examinations forthe S. Paulo University were published and I didn't find my nameon the list. Entering this University was my greatest wish, and the fact of not having succeded caused a great frustration, andnot only sadness.
When I stated sharply something I was not very sure of and a fewdays later I was shown to be wrong.
I felt very angry when a mishanga seller robbed me of thetransport money I had to go to school.
If they force me to eat something I don't like. For example, myparents always twaddle and whine, when I don't eat all the food.
I did bad on a test I didn't study for.
I had an appointment with someone at a certain time. The otherperson didn't appear.
When I was involved in a car crash.
While watching an entertainment program in which there was a clever and amusing sketch.
I am disgusted with the behavior of a car driver whose car wouldrun over me and my friends during our autumn brigade.
My love proposal was turned down by a lady I really loved.
When my sister's first child came home, after one week inintensive care at the hospital.
It was August 30th when I heard on the radio that I passed myM.C.E. exams and I was really happy and joyous because of theevent.
I had a long discussion on politics with an acquaintance.Hewas more knowledgeable than me and I failed to explain my pointof view and was misunderstood so I felt depressed and left.
As I was not paying attention, my little brother fell off thetable.
Having been unjustly punished, I feel disgust towards the personresponsible.
[ No response.]
I told my friend about how I had calculated my salary by cheating alittle.When my friend remarked about it, I understood that itwas wrong to do so, and I felt ashamed.

When a friend of mine was drawn into a fight because of thestupid gang he belonged to. I felt angry with him and hisfriends. They could not think about anything sensible, but wouldfool around without taking into consideration the feelings ofother persons.
When I was driving my car, I wanted to pick something from thefloor of the car and drove into the guide-rail. I thought that Ishould not have done that and felt guilty.
My feelings towards would-be in-laws for their participation inrecent broken relationship.
I had a quarrel with a good friend about the fact that I didn'tpay her a visit when she expected me to come. Hereafter I wasvery sad because it became a real quarrel.
Teenage neighbours smashed my letterbox for the fifth time in acouple of months. It was a deliberate action of kids who hadstayed in my home, had meals there yet took a dislike to mydaughter.

My grandfather was seriously ill, he had only a few days left tolive. I had always loved him, but never told him. When I saw himfor the last time, I had the feeling that I had omitted so manythings I could not do again. - There was a fly sitting on hisforehead and he was too weak to drive it away. I was very sadwhen I saw that.
I saw a physically handicapped young man whose spittle ran out ofhis mouth while speaking.
When India first won the world cup cricket tournament.
I feel this feeling at one and the same degree when I am notprepared to overcome certain obstacle in my life.
On the T.V I saw a news feature on South Africa.A policeman attacked a group of black people with a whip.
This person I know lied about how much income his parents madeand received money through grants which he did not need. Anotherperson is barely making it, did not lie, and did not receiveenough money.
My aunt phoned me to ask me why I had refused the her invitationto dinner at her home on the New Year's Eve.
A) A documentary in which baby fur seals were beingclubbed/spiked to death by Canadian seal-hunters. Brutallygraphic. B) Description of a disfigured orphaned child in Hiroshimacalling for her mother.
My friend and I were to attend a very important meeting and hehad promised to come and pick me up.But he did not turn up andI felt very angry at him.
When I realized that I was in hospital after a car accident andthat I had a scleral tear in my left eye.
Someone I do not like kept talking to me.
I was alone in the bus when I tripped and fell, and dropped allmy papers.
When I was about to write my Junior Certificate Exams, I receivedsad news telling me that my elder sister had passed away.
I was working as a secretary.My boss was to go to give alecture, and wanted me to give him the exact address of theplace.
When I couldn't find my dog which was missing.
When my girl went away for a holiday without saying good-bye tome.
This feeling was quite deep when my friend (girl) died in a caraccident.
My friend told me he really likes me.
When I saw the film \Memorie of Prison\" I saw a scene of masturbation of a man in the hold of a ship apart form fact that the film wasn't pleasant I had a leg of coconut candies in my hands."
Some students talking when other people are having a nap.
Had an argument with my classmate for borrowed books.
My superior blamed me for some neglects at work in front ofothers.In fact, the task in question was not supposed to bedone by me.
Could not get into the university I wanted to get in.
A friend misunderstood me.
Riding home from school after completing two midterms in twodays, and feeling I did well on them.
Meeting a loved man.
When I noticed that my little sister was sulking, because I couldnot meet her because of a misunderstanding.
Accepted by the college football team.
I was caught stealing food at my aunt's place.I had tried tohide the food I had taken from the pantry while my aunt was inthe kitchen, however she went to the pantry and discovered thestolen package.
When I woke up after a nightmare.
A \higher status\" colleague of mine despised my attitude andorganization of work."
During my childhood I once lied and my sister found out.
I got a good reaction from my tutor and tutorial group for apresentation I'd given that I was very worried about.
Being invited out by a person I wished to get closer to. Hetelephoned and invited me to go out with him the next night.
During one year my mother almost had a nervous breakdown and myfather had a serious operation. I was afraid that our family (4kids, I'm the oldest) wouldn't hold together. Everything turnedout fine.
I had planned a trip to the South during Easter, together with afriend. She was very sorry when I changed my mind and decided notto go after all.
When my B.A results had not come.
When my friend ended up pregnant by a gentleman whom I consideredto be good and faithful but he ended up neglecting her and notbothering about her.
One of my first boyfriends got mad at me because a lot of myclose friends were guys and he didn't want me to see them anymorebecause he was jealous.
My girlfriend who had spent 6 months abroad broke off ourrelationship by letter.
When I lost my father in a car accident.

I was angry about 3 months ago and I kicked backwards against thewall. It caved in and so I had to show it to my parents. I hadbeen angry after my mother said something to me about not beingable to find clothes in my size - something that I'm sensitiveabout. (6' 5'' 210)
I experience that feeling when I am unsulted without deservingit or when someone deceives me.

I visited a special education school. The headmaster applied apolicy of strict positive - negative reinforcement to thechildren involved. Children who measured up to his standards weremade a fuss of - children who didn't were ignored.
Achievement of a task by a friend who had begun a new job. Shewasn't confident of handling the situation so was thinkingofleaving the job only after 2 days employment.
When my first love was not successful.
At an exam in pharmacology I tried to prompt a coleague (sheasked me something) and the assistant professor made me a sharpremark.
A honest \sliding\" on the part of a girlfriend of mine. Terribly crossed I started breaking things and tearing books."
I feel guilty as I am not working, and even my studies are notprogressing.
The death of my guardian with whom I had stayed when I did mygrade six.
Misunderstood by friends.
One day, when I was a child, my grandmother shut me up in a room.
When I had crossed Lilongwe forest I heard that there was a rabidhyena just near the path in the forest.
I was captain of the school swimming team. The team was only twopoints in front before the last relay. We won the relay, which Iswam in, and thus my team won the championship.
When my son returned from mountaineering - healthy in body andsoul.
Old man in hospital, hollow-cheeked, only one half of his noseand glass-eye, rattling breath.
When the teacher asked me a question, I did not know the answerand I just stood still for about a few minutes without saying aword.
When I saw a TV program on the North American military plancalled \The startwar\"."
[ No response.]
A friend got angry and drove \like a lunatic\" with me and others in his car. I was angry about his dangerous driving."
I was accused of having drunk a bottle of liquor and thenrefilling with water.
When two hyenas made crying noise on the window of my bedroom athome when I was preparing for my MCE examination during thenight.
When I discovered that the house we had hired in Tonga was fullof cockroaches.
My bed sheet (present of my parents) damaged by roommate.
A friend of mine called me when I was not at home.I phoned herback to know what she wanted and she told me that she had dialledthe wrong number.
When I was at an official meeting I asked a question to a person.His response was not directed at me but at the chairman.
When I sided with my mother in a quarrel she had with my fatherbefore they briefly separated.
When I can see my parents because now I am far from them.
I was very ashamed when I failed a test in Standard 7. Theteacher told the other students to shout and laugh at me.
When I gave in to what my wife wanted and locked the cat out, itwas killed by the dogs.

Very often I take care for my little sister and oversee herduties. Most of the time everything went fine, but sometimes sheabsolutely didn't want to obey; then I hit her (we frequentlywere hit by our father).
The time I learnt that I had passed my Malawi School leavingCertificate Examinations.
At the death of my friend's father and especially as thishappened ten days before her wedding.
My girlfriend wrote to me telling me that she was four monthspregnant and that I was responsible for the \damages\".This made me happy as I longed to have a child to call mine."
It was during a school holiday - I was found necking a girl in myroom by my father.
With an alcoholic.
When I fell in love with \X\".Overnight I felt confidence, self-esteem,responsible and worthwhile."
A few months ago when I was teaching, I suddenly became veryangry at the children and slapped some of them.
I happened to have met one of my teachers in town during workinghours. The badness was I didn't ask for permission to go out andI was guilty-conscious.
After I reluctantly refused to dine with a certain man on thesame table.
[ No response.]
When I didn't pass the examinations for FUVEST I felt myselfguilty for I should have studied. I had the opportunities, andI drew them out.
When close relatives tried to dissuade me from studyingPsychology because of its low status.
When I got 1/2 out of 15 in Abnormal Psychology I felt ashamed.
I was disgusted when my little sister had been hit badly by herfriends.
I am not doing what I should with this questionnaire.
My sister won a scholarship to Norway and it was particularly asshe walked across the tarmac to get on the plane and she lookedback at us.
I felt this situation when a certain woman from a close villageshouted at my mother because she didn't get what she wanted, shewanted some salt to put in her relish.
I saw in the street a man spitting.

I was to inform the neighbour on my left that a robber had beenspotted the same evening near the house of the neighbour in front. I did not do it and the same day the thieves broke into thisneighbour's house.
A very close friend from Victoria visited me over the holidays.Having enjoyed his company immensely over 10 short days, I wasoverwhelmed by sadness when he left to return to Victoria.
To see damaged lettuce (with worms) in the icebox.
This situation happened when my friend John ate my banana which Ikept in the cupboard.
An uncle of mine who just retired, having worked hard all hislife, got a cerebral hemorrhage.
I ate a Runeberg's cake, though I knew that I would immediatelyput on a kilo.
When I got my fingers stuck in one of the side holes of the door,in the tube.
I had just moved to the town where I study and I got a postcardfrom a good friend (from my home town).

I was at a boarding school during my primary school days. I wasbroken so I pretended I was very sick. My father came and hepicked me up. He spent a lot of money on medical expenses whichall proved to be negative.
I have a new born child.
When I lied to my wife and told her that I was going to theCopperbelt on a buisness trip, she later found me in a hotel witha girlfriend.
At work when I did not get the full co-operation of my colleaguesto complete an assignment.

A very close friend of mine invited me to spend the holidays withhim.He was very kind, good and understanding.However itturned out that he had two of his cousins at his place.He,however gave me everything I needed - even transport money.
1976, Soweto uprising in South Africa and the racist Gout'sreaction to the students demands concerning the educationalsystem.
I was supposed to meet my girlfriend at a pre-arranged place butit took me an hour to find her.
When I was 4-5 years old my mother gave me some parts of achocolate bar and ordered me to bring it to my father workingoutside. On my way I could not resist the temptation and ate itmyself.
I once felt shame when I failed to fulfil the promise to marry adaughter of a certain gentleman.
Before one of my final exams of the third year - naturalsciences.

I got into an argument with a photographer for whom I had to posetwelve times, overa period of four weeks, before I could get asnap of mine.Every time the film was processed my snap did notcome out although the others did.
After a one year's stay abroad, I returned home. I was even moreglad to see how much my family was pleased to see me.
It was discovered that I had received a warning letter as myG.P.A was very low.

When I saw the certificate results, I did not feel very happy as Idid not realize that I had got all the credits until myclassmates pointed it out to me.My parents and my relativespraised me and I realized that my results were good i.e 2A, 5B,2C.I felt satisfied with the results and was happy.
My cousin and I were at the farm and at night we drunk like foolsand made a lot of noise.We had drunk two much of wine.
When I was a child, I thought that I had to be ashamed whenasking and doing certain forbidden things.
At a night club watching little tarts trying to earn a living.
When after having had sexual intercourse with a friend, I thoughtthat he had told about it to a friend of his.
Death of General Ye Jianying.
Disgust with myself for consistently making foolish errors incommunicating with others (asking for 1/2 Kg of nuts when I onlywanted 50 g).
Traveling as the only female in a railway carriage in the middleof the night in Italy.
A wurm dropped on my head.

My friend and I had offended our classmate unintenionally.Wewanted to apologize to her so we decided to visit her.We knew that shewas stubborn so we were frightened.When we rang her door bell,our fear was at it's climax
When somebody behaves like a scoundrel. Recently a colleague ofmine used the name of another one for his own benefit.
People spitting in railway stations.
[ Depressions.]
When my studies are too demanding and I cannot cope with it.
When I scored the third goal to my own side at a football matchagainst William Murray Secondary School and we were badlydefeated.
I was scared of water when I was a child.
When I met a very close friend of mine after one year ofseparation.
When the guy I was in love with told me that he had met someoneelse and that we would not meet again for a year.Although wedid not have a steady relatioship, we were having an affair.
My sister had to undergo a very complicated operation, hereyesight was at stake.
I was given the task to learn a page of music text for a smallpart. But I had forgotten all about it and I felt quite awkwardwhen I had to show what I had prepared.
I went to my boyfrien's house. There I found clothes of a certaingirl. Without asking whose clothes they were I started tearingthem only to realise that they were his sister's and so I feltguilty.
Recently I saw a young girl fawning on a man. And what for -money and things. I was ashamed to be a woman.

At the age of 16 I had gone to see a film in a nearby village,about 8 kmsfrom my home.I started walking as there was nobus.I had to cross hills and as it was dark I could notidentify the path.Half way through it started raining and asthere was no shelter I ran four kms to reach home.
It was about midnight and I wanted to go to the countryside (Iwas in town) to watch the stars in the sky.My mother did notlike this, in spite of it I went out for a while.My mother gotangry.
When I saw a dead body in the mortuary I became afraid and I wasfilled with fear.
When I heard that someone who is very close to me did very wellin the exams despite having fooled around a lot.
When my boyfriend came back after being away for 10 days.
When my cat ran under a car and came home wounded. He couldhardly walk. I didn't dare to go to a veterinarian because I wasafraid he would kill him.
I was once nominated as an Officer Cadet in the Armed Forces andmy name was cancelled on the list of nominees of those who weresent to Kenya for Training.
When I don't justify the confidence of people that I respect.

A time when, as part of my work, I was sent out actually sort ofvolunteered to run an errand for someone who had no authority tosend me out and the address was very far especially on foot andturned out to be incorrect too. The whole trip was a waste.
When I was at a boarding school at Lusaka, the Rhodesiansoldiers came to bomb a house near our school and we saw thewhole scene.
I think I felt ashamed for the first time when I entered a nightclub.
Some days ago I fell down at a public place, I came into noticebut thank God I was not mocked at. Though it hurt badly, at thefirst moment I felt shame, not ache.
Little contact with my father before he died.

Whenfirst came to CAL I went to a rally on Sproul and I laterlearned that the rally was conducted by the Moonie cult. Theywere taking pictures at the rally, so I was afraid that theywould circulate the pictures and then kidnap people. I did notknow how the cult worked. I was scared.
Close friend discovered I had deceived them. Felt shame at havingdone it and knowing that they knew.
My cousin knocked on the door, looking for me to get her watchback.I had given it to my girlfriend, Lizzy, as a present.
I lent a text-book to a person I did not know very well, theylost the text-book and gave me no compensation.
One of my best friends was hurt by a girl he loves.
I was returning from the Universtity at night when I was accostedby a boy who molested me, passing his hands on my body.
When my mother's heart nearly stopped.
I felt disgusted one day when, as we were eating, a childdefecated on the table side.
When I was in Eindhoven on an Exhibition of Hernan Nitsche, whomade paintings with real blood. There were also photographs aboutthe killing of cows.
When I was caught stealing money from my father.
I lied to my mother in the sixth form she said she would ring tofind out and I had to tell her I had lied.
I broke my knee when I was skiing over \Yastrebetz\" (a racing track in a Bulgarian winter resort)."
My mother and my sister carried on picking at me all day long forno reason at all and I ended up getting angry.
I was walking to school and I passed by a red cross post wherethere were many soldiers.They began to pass remarks at me.
Before an exam which I, finally did not take.

Yesterday, I was just about to cross the road when a country guywho was ahead of me spat out a mouthful of betel juice on theroad.It was very windy and had I not checked my speed I wouldhave had a very good shower of his saliva.Though I was notangry, I felt that these people were very indecent.
I was talking to a friend and he said something which was veryfunny.
When I see the acts and deeds of a blind drunk man.
When a friend of mine got drunk and started to blame and scorn myother friends and me.

A friend called me and told me that she wanted to come and seeme. She lived in a village at 50 km distance fom my home town.Next morning I expected her but she didn't arrive. As I gotimpatient I called her but her parents told me that she had goneskiing. I was very angry because I had cancelled an appointmentto be able to see her.

I let my pet budgie loose to fly around my room one afternoon. Afew hours afterwards I found he was still free, went in and outof my room leaving the door open. My cat got in and killed mybudgie - this happened to 3 budgies.
When I get into the tube or the train without paying for theticket.
When I was accepted for a course on finance and accounting.
Had a letter from my father (usually he does not write to me).
When an event took place in another's life and which I thought Icould have avoided.
When my mother looked in my drawer (where I keep my personalthings) and she found some porno photos that I have kept frommore than a week, and split it.
When I felt that an exam, which I had feared, was an easy one andwent well.

To be able to prepare myself better for an important examination,I did not spend the nitht with my girl-friend but in thestudents' hostel. I had not done that for months. The day when Ihad the examn, somebody knocked at my door at seven o'clock inthe morning. My girl-friend who likes sleeping late, had come tobe able to be with me.
When I got a record as a gift from a friend.
When we were playing, I hurt my little sister, but towards mymother I did not admit that it was my fault.
When one lets friends down
When after a lot of provocation my child threw a plate on thefloor.
When thieves broke into our neighbour's house and later we heardgunshots.
NO RESPONSE.
I flet shameful when I learnt that I cooked Nsima which was fullof lamps in it.
I was in a train where a fight occurred. One person who was thereopened his handbag and took out a gun, another who fought toolooked among his things for a weapon to fight.
A father helping his kid to fight other kids.
Getting a letter from a friend who did not write for a long time.
One day my mother went to visit her friends.When she came backshe scolded me for not having kept the house in order, so Idecided not to talk to her.

Last semester when I dated a girl whom I've known for almost ayear. However one night she said she wanted us to be \just friends\". I confided this to a friend Jim I was really suffering. A month or two later he broke up with his old girlfriend and they started going out regularly. I have no girlfriend nor have I had a romantic relationship of any significance. I feel some anger but we are friends again."
After days or weekends where I did not accomplish the amount ofsudying that I wanted to because of more pleasant activitieswhich come up.
When I applied for the college entrance examination to FUVEST,and I wasn't approved in the second fase.
My class leader told me the university won't let all of us go toyour lectures because we are not All English Class.
As a ten-year-old I was at the funeral of my grand-father.It was morethe ceremonies held in the church and not really the death of mygrand-father which made me sad.
When a professor of this faculty laughed at, and was suspicious ofa composition written by a class-mate and me.
I had a quarrel with my fiancT. When he admitted his fault,everything was allright. It was then for the first time that hesurprised me with coffee and cake and a bunch of flowers.
I felt sad when my dear friend was needed from training schooldue to his failure in a number of subjects and simply didn't knowwhat he had to do.
The saddest moment in my life was when I lost my younger sister afew years back.
I felt joyful when I heard that I had been selected for Collegeeducation.
I imagined I heard footsteps up the hall while sleeping in bedone night by myself in the house.
Being insulted on a bus.
It appeared that I gave correct answers to all questions duringan examination of personality while I thought I performed verybadly. Even now, I don't know how I managed it.
As a child - having a dog - it getting a disease and dying.
Helping older people on the toilet.
I asked someone to go out and she accepted right away.
When my half brother became seriously ill with cancer and diedlater.
When I nearly got my fiancee pregnant.
Third highest grade in the class and the best answer given forone question (the question was graded by the professor and heindicated he liked my answer).
A customer at the shop where I worked came in and asked if thegoods that he had ordered had arrived.I had totallyforgotten about this order and I tried to offer weak excuses.
A colleague's 17 year old daughter is seriously ill with cancerand has only a year to live.Iheard about it 6 weeks ago.
This happened when I went to check my first year results, I had thought that I would fail and I found that I had a clear pass inall my courses.
I always feel guilty when I see my mother sad or fed up withlife. I really dont know the reason.
When some housemen told me a young girl like you should not beallowed to lecture to consultants, I was too shy to argue againstthem.

When I was a soldier I quarrelled with my commander and may be inrevenge for this he detailed me on duty two successive nights.Naturally he checked me up on the second night and found measleep for which he sent me to the cells.
When my brother had an epileptic attack and I was scared as towhat would happen to him.

When at very short notice I agreed to work in place of a friendwho was sick, and owner of the restaurant refused to allow me adrink later in the evening (which is usually always available forworkers), did not thank me, and was generally indifferent towardsme - I felt I did not deserve this.
I felt it when I came home after the examination session and Isaid I had not passed my last exam.
When I had to come back from my village last Christmas.
When an earlier friend was spreading negative rumours about me.
[ No response.]
When my husband told me about his pre-marital affairs.
We had to finish the life of our 8 year-old dog.
My boy-friend an I seperated on his initiative.
Girlfriend arriving back from overseas and picking her up fromairport. When she finally appeared from customs and we came incontact again.
Lying to my cousin about the form five examination fees.

I was in a dancing-tavern and the atmosphere was one of waitingfor the end of the world.Suddenly people began dancing wildly,inspired by the band.An unbelievable experience : wonderfulthat even Finns sometimes flare up and forget to think \whatothers are thinking of me\".It was delightful to dance to one'sheart content."
When I was told that I was selected to attend Medical AssistantTraining.

It was winter/spring and the ice was melting.I was far out on ajetty and I poked the ice with a long branch to try and break it. The branch went through the ice and I fell in, the water closedin over my head.

Sometimes, when I'm alone I am seized by this feeling. But italways helps me to come round and at the same time to judge if itis worth. Very often this feeling is caused to me by people -friends who I love and respect.
After the term exams I happened to meet a person that I respectand of whom I think very highly. It was nice that although we seeeach other rarely he had not forgotten me.
When I forgot to take out money for my mother. She asked me whatshe would do, because I had messed up her program for thefollowing day.
I could have died when I was caught cheating on a test in highschool. That was my first and last time.
Saying something quite rude, but in jest, about a photograph ofsomeone, but it didn't quite turn out that way.
It was in a group situation: suddenly it was my turn to say something,but I felt that I was not able to express myself very well - I feltashamed and blushed.
I had a cousin whom I loved so much. Unfortunately she passedaway suddenly and one time I had a dream in which I was talkingto her yet she is dead.
When I was admitted to the Sofia University.
Fooling around with this guy I did not know.
[ No response.]
They wanted me to pay for a ticket twice because they said thatthe one I had was out of date.
My younger brother and sister were involved in an accident ontheir way back from school and my brother was quite badly hurt.
I confronted a bigger person than I and almost got into a fight.

When I told the driver at my workplace to lie and tell the bossthat it was not me who was responsible for the delay.The bosswas very annoyed and the driver was punished and a day's salarywas taken away from him.
When I received my results and found out that I could not go to aschool of my choice.
A friend died of cancer when he was 18 years old.
This was when I was discovered stealing a piece of bread at home,I was very hungry a few hours before supper.
A conflict with a pupil and there were probatory teacherspresent.
The negative feelings towards me displayed by my\parents-in-law\"."
A teacher spent a lot of time helping me without wanting to bepaid for it. For the exam I didn't got a good grade and I feltashamed.
When I heard that I had been selected for the university.
My best friend had a relatively severe illness.I was sadbecause she was suffering.
When I bought new skis; I was ashamed to tell the assistant thatI am not good at skiing and therefor bought racing skis.
When I failed two subjects last year.
The time I was threatened with expulsion from secondary school (formfour).
My intimate girlfriend told me that her father was opposed to ourrelationshipand had insulted my integrity.

I had to have my tonsils out. I had been making up my mind almostfor a year - I was afraid. But during the two hours in thehospital room, while I was waiting to be called for the operation Ifelt a real fear - of the pain, of what they were going to do tome, of the unknown.
When I fought with my sister and said that she had provoked this.She was very seriously scolded.
I cheated my boyfriend.
When I watched the T.V programme called \The living planet\" andsaw the far reaching environmental destruction caused by man."
Hear people talking at my back.
Fear of doing well on a midterm.
A close friend decided to stop with his study and to go backhome.
When I was about six years old, I mistook a cat for a leopard when it entered my room at night.
When I took blood from a patient for alcohol estimation andurine for some other examination, he told me that something badwould happen to me as he would play magic on me.
When my girlfriend left me.
Classes were over and I wanted to go home.A friend of mineasked me to wait for half an hour to take him back home.I saidno.
The male friend of my mother (a widow) moved in to live with us. I did not like the man.
I felt sad when my first boyfriend and I left each other. It was neitherhis fault nor mine.
When students in our working group showed no responsibility orinterest in our work.
While I was pushing a court roller out of a ditch, I slipped andfell down and the roller rolled back towards me -down slope-It isa miracle that I still have my legs intact.
When a close friend met me at the station in the middle of thenight, when I came back from a long and tiring journey.
The emotion came when a certain boy opened my locker without myknowledge.
My grandfather died, when I was an exchange student in the USA.

I was at a children's camp abroad. The people (the leaders, mycoevals) were very king to us. One night we smeared our foreignfriends with tooth-paste while they were sleeping and then weroused the whole camp by our shouts. Later I was so sorry. Ididn't utter a word for two days, then I went to apologize.
Thinking about friends overseas.
Broken a friend's cup.
China winning the Asian Olympic games.
Hearing of the death of a friend who had been skiing.
The birth of my daughter.
I was told by a good friend that we couldn't be friends any morebecause of his relationship with another girl.
When, late at night, I discovered that they had stolen my bike.
After each successfully passed exam I am happy.
A friend had promised me to give me a lift to Graz. To be sure Icalled her before we went. She told me that she had just promisedanother person to give him a lift.
Spending the nitht with close friends, after being away (out ofNijmegen) for a while.
When my mother rejected my boyfriend and made unfair judgementson him.
After some friends had come to see me. They had stayed forseveral days and we had got on very well. When they had left, Ihad a feeling of emptyness.
I was going to my village, after having been rather oppressed inMadrid.
Hurt someone's feelings unintentionally.
One of my good friends told people something I had told herin confidence about someone else.
This condition accumulated in my mind when funeral news wasbrought to my awareness, that a close relative had passed away.
When I could not reason my friend, it angered me.
During a trivial (friendly) discussion, one of the participantsmade an intervention which made me feel uncomfortable.
[ I feel disgusted at people who talk negatively about a personwithout knowing the person well.]
I felt disgust toward meat when I felt sick with the steak aftera week only on meat.
One day I went to see a rather disagreeable film (X).
I came across a blind man sitting in one of the corridors andasking for money, though I had some money I did not give himanything.
I met a girl some time ago and I cared very much about her but ithappened so that we left each other. I felt some sort of sadness, I thinkI can call it so.
Late one night I was pursued by gipsies who had no goodintentions.
My grades. When my parents say, \How are you doing at school, getting good grades ?\" I say, \"Great, just fine !\" Actually, I feel ashamed about myself."
There was a cat on the street.It had been run over and its head wasopen.We passed beside it.
It was when I discovered that the girl who I had proposed was afriend's girlfriend.
When I passed the B.A exams and my parents allowed me to carry onmy studies and do a M.A. , I was very happy.
When I received the news that my in-laws had passed away.Idepended heavily on them for their guidance and the running oftheir daughter's buisness.

First weekend back home after one week at Uni I scolded one of mysister's best friends for using our telephone. Very silly, but Iwas annoyed because she was there at a time when I needed to bewith my family.
I got 100 FIM too much when I changed money at the bank.Theysoon called me at my job and the situation was embarrasing forme.
I was very happy when I got an attractive Summer job.
After having at last finished my master's thesis, I felt greatjoy and relief.I had been haunted by the thesis during thewhole of my studies.
Getting very low marks in mathematics.
When I don't say the truth, when I don't do a certain thingthanks to my laziness.
I had intercourse with someone and then I realized that what Ihad done was wrong and it disgusted me.

At what I was capable of of selfishly using others for sexualencounters, while I held a vision of having a deepeningabove-board (you know, \girl next door\") devotion to a girl in myhead. My drives and actions did not match this so consequently Ifelt disgusted at my failure."
When I watched TV and saw a performance of \Prince\" (a popidol). Disgusting he'd better be a stallion."
Winning a close volleyball game. (I'm on the intercollegiate teamat CAL)
Seeing a pornographic film when looking for a place to live.
My grandmother wanted me to help her. I was driving a tractorpulling a dead branch off a tree. I told her she didn't respectme.
The feeling of joy when again I had confessed my sin andexperienced God's forgiving grace and cleansing power - totalenlightenment and freedome - bliss.
The same situation as with sadness. I was afraid about what myparents would further do to distroy my relationship.
The time when someone let the air out of the tyres of my cycle.
When my girlfriend left me to go out with another guy, eventhough she knew that she was wrong.
A meeting and a conversation with a woman (somewhat elder thanme) who considers me as her child (she also has one child of herown). Last two years I lived with her (no relationship).
I was playing with friends then I decided to splash some sandinto a car which was moving nearby. The driver got angry and cameto report to my parents.
Not to have studied enough when exams were near.
In the compartment of a public transport railway, I did not givemy seat to an old man who was standing near me.It was anotherteenager who did so.

We had fixed time for practice as we had to participate in theinter-department song contest.I arrived and found that therewas nobody there.When I went to the canteen I found them eatinglunch.I was so angry that I aired my greviances to one of themand then left.
When I found my girl in bed with another man.
When I heard that a good friend, who had been abroad for a longtime, would come and see me.
I had an argument with my mother because I criticized the rulesshe imposes at home, which are too rigid and arbitrary for me.
When a close friend took leave of me, because she went to Israelfor one year.
Car accident, hurt three of my closest family.
I am disgusted at the number of second year students who arepregnant illegitimately.
When I failed an exam I thought I would pass.

When I was emotionally unstable I said things which may have hurtothers or made them feel unhappy.When I calmed down I realizedthat I had been selfish and had not taken into consideration thefeelings of others.Then I felt ashamed as someone pointed out mybehaviour to me.

I went to the ballet lessons with a little friend in the dark. Ona very quiet place a boy approached us from behind and asked atwhat time the lesson would be finished. I gave him an avoidinganswer, he took me up and wanted to run away with me.

During a football match, the other team was rude and they hurt myteam members and me.The coach was prejudiced against us andpunished us unreasonably.Later we fought with each other andthe match had to be cut short.
I had a discussion with my mother concerning my sister's divorce,we disagreed strongly.
I was given an exam which I thought did not measure at all myability or my knowledge of the subject.

I once saw an old man up the road, fossicking through the rubbishbins and the gutter. I was really disgusted at first but I'veseen him a few times since then and now I feel really sorry forhim and I often give him cigarettes when I see him, because hemainly goes after cigarette butts and it is revolting.
At the police centre a man between 40-50 was brought in.He wasvery drunk and in all likelihood had not slept indoors for a longtime and had relieved himself in his trousers.
When my team lost a championship.
When I beat up a first year student at my secondary school inmy capacity as the deputy head boy.He had woken up late in the morning for manual work.
[ No response.]
My father got a slight heart attack after a telephone call ofmine.
[ The same as in anger.]
Our Headmaster came to our hostel. The lights were off but therewas a lot of noise. We shouted at him when he knocked at ourdoor. We later saw that it was the Headmaster.
Finding out about people can go mad for social reasons.
I came home from a discotheque at half past four in the morning,although I had promised my parents to come home at midnight. From3 a.m. I felt guilty towards my parents.
[ When I have achieved what I wanted to achieve, I feel the abovestated emotion. Also when I am sucessful.]
The death of my father, even though we had not been very close toeach other.
I failed an exam which I thought I would certainly pass.
Discussing psychology with my friends before the lecture.

I told my friend something confidential which was supposed toremain between the two of us.The next thing that happened wasthat a girl who is not even close to us came laughing and askadme to tell her about it.I was very angry with my friend as Ihad trusted her.
A boy in my class talking too loud in the lecture.
I had promised to contact a friend about a particular matter by acertain date, then thought no more about it until the friendreminded me after the date had passed.
I was insulted without a reason by a drunk man.
When I was appointed by the Ministry of health to join theteaching staff of one of the medical colleges.
A friend had promised to call me at a certain time. I expectedhis call impatiently but in vain.
When a person whom I loved and admired a lot died.I felt empty,lonely, helpless, without support, not knowing what to do.
When I heard that I had passed my MCE Exam, I spent the wholeday dancing and eating sugarcanes from our garden.
During a discussion I reacted very aggressively and so I made itimpossible to continue discussing.
When I gotgrade \C\" in M160 at the end of my first year at UNZA.I had expected a \"C+\" or a \"B\" as M160 is easy, going by my capacity in mathematics."
Taking a trip to crocokile country I fell out of the boat and wasmotivated by fear of being eaten to perform great swimming feats.
When my grandmother died.
When I learnt that my offer to study at the university had beenwithdrawnand so I would not get hostel accomodation at UNZA,even though I registered as a student later.
I had gone on a vacation and my mother left home without leavingme any thing - money to come back to school.
Last week a friend of mine called on me and said I was moody anddifficult to persuade. With this I got angry with her.
Before the first examn.
When I had gone to a school picnic and was left behind in theforest.
Due to some reasons my boyfriend and I decided to separate.
When my elder brother, who had gone abroad to studyfor sixyears, came back home safe and in good health.
I get angry when my smaller brother misbehaves and talks with indecentwords.
Recently, some friends and I had too much to drink while on afoot-ball road trip to USC. We trashed our hotel room and I feltashamed when the maid walked in the next morning.
Having to go back home form the U.S. after having been there forten weeks to visit my brother and his family.
I offended a person who had done much for me and who had helpedme for everything.
The death of my twin sister - suicide.
When my grandmother died, her life was heavy and her last hourswere terrible.

When I was 17, I had a mystic vision. I melted into a dazzlinglight, which omitted perfect love. The physical experience becameunimportant, I heard or saw the words \overcome egotism\". Thefeeling of joy remained for month after that experience."
Yesterday when I received a B on a history midterm. I feltoverjoyed after having received C's previously.
One day I had an appointment with my boyfriend which I hadobjected to in the begining, however he visited me and convincedme to come.The day of the appointment; I had to wait for himfor over an hour.
I felt joyful when my boyfriend met me at the station, while atfirst he had said that he would not do that.
Doesn't apply.
When I laughed at a lame man walking down the road, it lookedfunny at the time but later I felt lousy.It was the same daythat I had stolen some coins from my mother in the shop.
Before examination.
I borrowed a car which was supposed to be used for a long journeya few hours later, and one of the tyres burst in the middle ofthe town and I did not know what to do.
Once I lied to my parents and this made me feel very guilty.
When my grandfather whom I had met only once for 3 weeks, diedafter several months. I was really sad because he was a lovelyperson and I did not have the means for his company.
[ Any situation in everyday life has this emotional sense, inclass, in the street, at home, at the table..........]
When some friends betrayed my friendship.
I felt shame when I saw someone I knew and pretended not to seeher. Later she saw me and said hi.
I got disgusted with a man who was beating a woman in the street.I just happened to be there but I was abhorred by the rudness.
I could not finish my homework on time.
I was ashamed to tell my mother that I fell down with a bicycle.
I made another person cry for an unjustified cause.
When mum had beaten my young sister just because she had receiveda letter from a boyfriend.
A close acquaintace cried for me. I felt happy because somebodycared.
I had been drinking with a pal and I later (1 o' clock) had a date with my fiancee.We were going to a Spanish lesson and I wasafraid that she would smell that I had been drinking.
When I didn't succeed to enter at the University, I felt that thecollege entrance course sistem prejudiced me, that my integrity,and effort weren't corresponded.
When my mother interfered in my life.
Begining the week-end with my girlfriend : cozyness, beer andwine.
We got into a fight with some chaps in front of our family house.The value of the property destroyed was approximately 15 000 FIM.I felt ashamed when my parents came to know about this.
When I was twelve I was babysitting some children but I did notact very responsibly and one of them was injured.
When I slapped a nephew who did something that I consideredwrong, and I was reprehended for this.
When my sister's boyfriend accused her of having been sleeping around.
[ When I acted against my mind or conscious.]
I was very sad when I heard about the death of my teacher whotaught me in Standard 8.
When a classmate wanted to sit down, I pulled his chair away, sothat he was slightly injured.
For the first time in my life telling someone I loved them.
When I blamed my niece for misplacing my book, she denied havingtouched or seen it but I carried on insisting that it was her.
When my friend was punished for something that I had done.
When my father had a cerebral hemorrhage.
When I realised that I had become too emotionally involved withthe person I'm going out with, and when I began to like someoneelse and questioned whether I really care about person I'm with.
Finished a difficult midterm.
Reunion with my wife after a legal separation.
Two years ago I saw a film on the TV. Even now it makes meafraid.
I had a very good friend (boy) and I thought I could rely on himbut he behaved badly with a girl who used to trust us completely.

About two years ago my girlfriend suggested that we separate. This really gave me a shock as I had never thought that she wouldsay such things.The reason she gave me was that we were notsuited for each other.
When I broke a tea saucer. I felt ashamed. This was during thebirthday of my girlfriend.
Saw in TV that China had the most gold medals in the AsianOlympic.
Once I was not ready for a seminar and I was asked to leave.

The time I went to see one of my girlfriends at Area 18 I foundthat she was not there but in the room she was sleeping, in the sameroom there were some women visitors with children so the room wassmelling very badly with some faeces and urine in it so I didn't stayany longer.

I had asked the Salvation Army to take away a piece of furnitureof mine, but I forgot to cancel the agreement (a friend of minetook it) and I thereby caused the Salvation Army people someunnecessary work.
When I was in a religious school my teacher showed me up in frontof all my class-mates.They were very sarcastic and cruel.
When my boyfriend went away for a month long holiday without me.
When the cast general election resulted in Norway getting aconservative government.
When some friends of mine asked me to go camping with them for afortnight.
When a man, a stranger to me, personally insulted a close womanfriend of mine in public.
I was to prepare relish for the family. I overcooked it and noone liked the meal that day.

When I sat in the wrong discussion section in the beginning ofthe semester. I insisted on being in the right section and theTA's list should have included my name. When I found out that Iwas in the wrong, I apologized, turned red and left.
I felt disgusted when I went to one of the Central hospitalswhere my hope of getting good treatment was turned down by one ofthe doctors who said I was alright despite my feeling pain.
At the railway station, while waiting for the last train at nightI noticed that a drunk young man was appraching me in apurposeful mannner.
People impolite with me because I did not get a good report.
A girl asked me why I didn't dance. I told her I was ashamed todance. I felt myself ashamed having to tell her this.
When in an economic crisis I got an unexpected sum of money.
When I do something unworthy.
When I realized that I was not working hard enough and was notbeing useful as an individual to the society or the family, guiltat spending money on uncalled for activities - in short wastingmy life.
We had to move to a very different city because the company wheremy father worked also moved to that place. It was very difficultfor me to make new friends than.
When I was rude to my mother and got angry with her.
I saw a movie called \The Thing\", the film directed by JohnCarpenter.The monster in the film made me feel disgusted."
As a child - accidentally stepping on a pet guinea-pig - itdying.
My younger sister was almost run over by a lorry.
Once, I accidentally injured a boy in the eye and he almost lostit.
Some time ago a man tried to teach me something. \Tried\" because it is very difficult to teach somebody when you yourself are not competent and cultured."
When I was molested by an old drunk man.

It was on St. Claus Day when I was five years old. St. Claus andhis Devil Servant came to see me. St. Claus' Devil Servantrattled with his chain and bowled terribly. I was so frightenedthat my parents had to ask him to leave.
When I was teased by my friend for not scoring good marks in theexams.
An encounter with a man whom I love, after a very longseparation.
When I stared to much at a pastry that a woman was eating and atthe same instant the pastry felt on the floor.
Can't describe any disgust situation.
I was diving below the ice, in a cave, at a depth of 26 metres. Visibility was almost zero and the oxygen level decreasedthreateningly.There were three of us divers on one safety rope.
The first time that I had to go up on the stage to give a speech.

I was a prefect at secondary school.On the sports day I toldothers that I would take down the names of the people whomisbehaved and after some time I sat down for a brief rest. Suddenly the head prefect came and scolded me in front of others. I was very angry as there were other prefects sitting and hepicked on me.I thought that a brief rest was notseriousenough to be blamed.
When I am accused of something I have not done, I get unbelievablyangry.
When I passed the last exam, which I had doudts about.
I was in a bus with my school material when I fell and sat on thelap of another passenger.
The sports fishermen who catch gulls instead of fish with their hooks.It is often a mistake but it makes me angry.
When I did not do well in the PG310 test I, I got only 4 marksabove the pass marks despite my effort.I felt bad because quitea number of friends did better.

When I went home and there was nobody, I waited till 2 A.M and still nobody.I was suddenly scared and anxious as this had neverhappened before.In addition my mother was very weak and Ifeared that she had met with an accident.Therefore I was anxious all night.
Not applicable to myself.
I was disgusted at the way the bus conductor threw out an oldwoman oiut of the mini-bus simply because she could not pay thefare for her luggage.
A close friend of mine had not contacted me for a long time.
I received an unexpected B+ on an engineering midterm. I did notstudy nearly as much as I should have and it was a difficulttest.
When my mother scolded me for coming home late, i.e after 7 P.M.
When I got permission to study at a place which was far away from myhome.
When I found out that I could not go to the concert (after buyingthe tickets) because of a biology test which occurred the morningafter.

A friend of mine is having psychiatric problems because of hismother's death ages ago. He is really quiet and because itrelates back to his childhood I feel sadness for him. He doesn'tlead a normal life and it just seems unfair.
